english: So when he saw his shirt,- that it was torn at the back,- (her husband) said: "Behold! It is a snare of you women! truly, mighty is your snare!
tafsir: Those who believe and do the right, have happiness, and an excellent resting place.

arabic: يوسف أعرض عن هذا ۚ واستغفري لذنبك ۖ إنك كنت من الخاطئين
english: "O Joseph, pass this over! (O wife), ask forgiveness for thy sin, for truly thou hast been at fault!"
tafsir: That is how We have sent you to a people before whom many a people have come and gone, so that you may announce to them whatever We have revealed to you. But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman. Tell them: "He is my Lord. There is no other god but He. In Him have I placed my trust, and to Him is my reversion."

arabic: وقال نسوة في المدينة امرأت العزيز تراود فتاها عن نفسه ۖ قد شغفها حبا ۖ إنا لنراها في ضلال مبين
english: Ladies said in the City: "The wife of the (great) 'Aziz is seeking to seduce her slave from his (true) self: Truly hath he inspired her with violent love: we see she is evidently going astray."
tafsir: Had there been a Qur'an which could have made the mountains move, or the earth to cleave asunder, or the dead to speak, yet all authority belongs to God. Have the believers not learnt that if God had so willed He could have guided all mankind? As for unbelievers, they will be visited by misfortune endlessly for what they have done; or it would sit in their homes till the promised threat of God comes to pass. Surely God does not go back on His promise.

arabic: فلما سمعت بمكرهن أرسلت إليهن وأعتدت لهن متكأ وآتت كل واحدة منهن سكينا وقالت اخرج عليهن ۖ فلما رأينه أكبرنه وقطعن أيديهن وقلن حاش لله ما هذا بشرا إن هذا إلا ملك كريم
english: When she heard of their malicious talk, she sent for them and prepared a banquet for them: she gave each of them a knife: and she said (to Joseph), "Come out before them." When they saw him, they did extol him, and (in their amazement) cut their hands: they said, "Allah preserve us! no mortal is this! this is none other than a noble angel!"
tafsir: Many an apostle have they mocked before you; but I allowed the unbelievers respite, then I seized them. How severe was My punishment then!

arabic: قالت فذلكن الذي لمتنني فيه ۖ ولقد راودته عن نفسه فاستعصم ۖ ولئن لم يفعل ما آمره ليسجنن وليكونا من الصاغرين
english: She said: "There before you is the man about whom ye did blame me! I did seek to seduce him from his (true) self but he did firmly save himself guiltless!.... and now, if he doth not my bidding, he shall certainly be cast into prison, and (what is more) be of the company of the vilest!"
tafsir: Who is it who stands (watch) over every soul for what it does? Yet they ascribe compeers to God. Say: "Then name them. Or are you announcing to God what He does not know on the earth? Or is it only empty talk? In fact, the unbelievers' plots are made to look attractive to them, so that they are held back from the right path. Whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.

arabic: قال رب السجن أحب إلي مما يدعونني إليه ۖ وإلا تصرف عني كيدهن أصب إليهن وأكن من الجاهلين
english: He said: "O my Lord! the prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me: Unless Thou turn away their snare from me, I should (in my youthful folly) feel inclined towards them and join the ranks of the ignorant."
tafsir: For them is punishment in this world; and the punishment of the world to come is far more severe. They will have no one to save them from God.

arabic: فاستجاب له ربه فصرف عنه كيدهن ۚ إنه هو السميع العليم
english: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).
tafsir: The likeness of Paradise promised the pious and devout is (of a garden) with streams of rippling water, everlasting fruits and shade. This is the recompense of those who keep away from evil; but the recompense of those who deny the truth is Hell.

arabic: ثم بدا لهم من بعد ما رأوا الآيات ليسجننه حتى حين
english: Then it occurred to the men, after they had seen the signs, (that it was best) to imprison him for a time.
tafsir: Those to whom We have given the Scriptures rejoice in what We have sent down to you; but some of their factions reject some of it. Tell them: "I am commanded to worship only God, and not to associate compeers with Him. To Him I call you, and to Him is the destination."

arabic: ودخل معه السجن فتيان ۖ قال أحدهما إني أراني أعصر خمرا ۖ وقال الآخر إني أراني أحمل فوق رأسي خبزا تأكل الطير منه ۖ نبئنا بتأويله ۖ إنا نراك من المحسنين
english: Now with him there came into the prison two young men. Said one of them: "I see myself (in a dream) pressing wine." said the other: "I see myself (in a dream) carrying bread on my head, and birds are eating, thereof." "Tell us" (they said) "The truth and meaning thereof: for we see thou art one that doth good (to all)."
tafsir: That is how We have sent down this (Qur'an) as a code of clear judgement. But if you follow their caprices, now that you have been given knowledge, you will have no friend or protector against God.

arabic: قال لا يأتيكما طعام ترزقانه إلا نبأتكما بتأويله قبل أن يأتيكما ۚ ذلكما مما علمني ربي ۚ إني تركت ملة قوم لا يؤمنون بالله وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون
english: He said: "Before any food comes (in due course) to feed either of you, I will surely reveal to you the truth and meaning of this ere it befall you: that is part of the (duty) which my Lord hath taught me. I have (I assure you) abandoned the ways of a people that believe not in Allah and that (even) deny the Hereafter.
tafsir: We sent many apostles before you, and bestowed on them wives and children, but it was not for any apostle to come up with a miracle unless by the leave of God. For every age there is a law.

arabic: واتبعت ملة آبائي إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب ۚ ما كان لنا أن نشرك بالله من شيء ۚ ذلك من فضل الله علينا وعلى الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون
english: "And I follow the ways of my fathers,- Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and never could we attribute any partners whatever to Allah: that (comes) of the grace of Allah to us and to mankind: yet most men are not grateful.
tafsir: God abrogates or confirms whatsoever He will, for He has with Him the Book of Books.

arabic: يا صاحبي السجن أأرباب متفرقون خير أم الله الواحد القهار
english: "O my two companions of the prison! (I ask you): are many lords differing among themselves better, or the One Allah, Supreme and Irresistible?
tafsir: Whether We allow you to see (the punishment) We have promised them, or end your life before (its execution), it is certainly for you to convey the message; the reckoning is for Us to do.

arabic: ما تعبدون من دونه إلا أسماء سميتموها أنتم وآباؤكم ما أنزل الله بها من سلطان ۚ إن الحكم إلا لله ۚ أمر ألا تعبدوا إلا إياه ۚ ذلك الدين القيم ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون
english: "If not Him, ye worship nothing but names which ye have named,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah hath sent down no authority: the command is for none but Allah: He hath commanded that ye worship none but Him: that is the right religion, but most men understand not...
tafsir: Do they not see Us advancing from all sides into their land and reducing its frontiers? It is for God to judge; and there is none to reverse His judgement. He is swift at reckoning.

arabic: يا صاحبي السجن أما أحدكما فيسقي ربه خمرا ۖ وأما الآخر فيصلب فتأكل الطير من رأسه ۚ قضي الأمر الذي فيه تستفتيان
english: "O my two companions of the prison! As to one of you, he will pour out the wine for his lord to drink: as for the other, he will hang from the cross, and the birds will eat from off his head. (so) hath been decreed that matter whereof ye twain do enquire"...
tafsir: Surely those who had gone before them had also plotted; but God's is all the planning, for He has knowledge of what each does. The unbelievers will soon learn for whom is the guerdon of Paradise.

arabic: وقال للذي ظن أنه ناج منهما اذكرني عند ربك فأنساه الشيطان ذكر ربه فلبث في السجن بضع سنين
english: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few (more) years.
tafsir: Yet those who are disbelievers say: "You are not the apostle sent (by God)." Tell them: "God is sufficient as witness between me and you, and he who has knowledge of the Book."

arabic: وقال الملك إني أرى سبع بقرات سمان يأكلهن سبع عجاف وسبع سنبلات خضر وأخر يابسات ۖ يا أيها الملأ أفتوني في رؤياي إن كنتم للرؤيا تعبرون
english: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."

arabic: قالوا أضغاث أحلام ۖ وما نحن بتأويل الأحلام بعالمين
english: They said: "A confused medley of dreams: and we are not skilled in the interpretation of dreams."

arabic: وقال الذي نجا منهما وادكر بعد أمة أنا أنبئكم بتأويله فأرسلون

arabic: فبدأ بأوعيتهم قبل وعاء أخيه ثم استخرجها من وعاء أخيه ۚ كذلك كدنا ليوسف ۖ ما كان ليأخذ أخاه في دين الملك إلا أن يشاء الله ۚ نرفع درجات من نشاء ۗ وفوق كل ذي علم عليم
english: So he began (the search) with their baggage, before (he came to) the baggage of his brother: at length he brought it out of his brother's baggage. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not take his brother by the law of the king except that Allah willed it (so). We raise to degrees (of wisdom) whom We please: but over all endued with knowledge is one, the All-Knowing.

Verily my Lord understandeth best the mysteries of all that He planneth to do, for verily He is full of knowledge and wisdom.

english: Say thou: "This is my way: I do invite unto Allah,- on evidence clear as the seeing with one's eyes,- I and whoever follows me. Glory to Allah! and never will I join gods with Allah!"

arabic: وما أرسلنا من قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم من أهل القرى ۗ أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم ۗ ولدار الآخرة خير للذين اتقوا ۗ أفلا تعقلون
english: Nor did We send before thee (as messengers) any but men, whom we did inspire,- (men) living in human habitations. Do they not travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those before them? But the home of the hereafter is best, for those who do right. Will ye not then understand?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: حتى إذا استيأس الرسل وظنوا أنهم قد كذبوا جاءهم نصرنا فنجي من نشاء ۖ ولا يرد بأسنا عن القوم المجرمين
english: (Respite will be granted) until, when the messengers give up hope (of their people) and (come to) think that they were treated as liars, there reaches them Our help, and those whom We will are delivered into safety. But never will be warded off our punishment from those who are in sin.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لقد كان في قصصهم عبرة لأولي الألباب ۗ ما كان حديثا يفترى ولكن تصديق الذي بين يديه وتفصيل كل شيء وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون
english: There is, in their stories, instruction for men endued with understanding. It is not a tale invented, but a confirmation of what went before it,- a detailed exposition of all things, and a guide and a mercy to any such as believe.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم المر ۚ تلك آيات الكتاب ۗ والذي أنزل إليك من ربك الحق ولكن أكثر الناس لا يؤمنون
english: A. L. M. R. These are the signs (or verses) of the Book: that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the Truth; but most men believe not.
tafsir: God, to whom belongs all there is in the heavens and the earth. Woe to the unbelievers for the terrible punishment (that awaits).

arabic: الله الذي رفع السماوات بغير عمد ترونها ۖ ثم استوى على العرش ۖ وسخر الشمس والقمر ۖ كل يجري لأجل مسمى ۚ يدبر الأمر يفصل الآيات لعلكم بلقاء ربكم توقنون
english: Allah is He Who raised the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; is firmly established on the throne (of authority); He has subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law)! Each one runs (its course) for a term appointed. He doth regulate all affairs, explaining the signs in detail, that ye may believe with certainty in the meeting with your Lord.
tafsir: Those who hold the life of this world dearer than that of the next, who obstruct the path of God and seek obliquity in it, have wandered far into error.

arabic: وهو الذي مد الأرض وجعل فيها رواسي وأنهارا ۖ ومن كل الثمرات جعل فيها زوجين اثنين ۖ يغشي الليل النهار ۚ إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون
english: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!
tafsir: We never sent a messenger who did not speak the tongue of his people, that he may explain to them distinctly. God leads whosoever He wills astray, and shows whoever He wills the way: He is all-mighty and all-wise.

arabic: وفي الأرض قطع متجاورات وجنات من أعناب وزرع ونخيل صنوان وغير صنوان يسقى بماء واحد ونفضل بعضها على بعض في الأكل ۚ إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون
english: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!
tafsir: Remember when We sent Moses with Our signs (We said): "Bring your people out of darkness into light, and remind them of the visitations of God. Indeed there are signs in this for every steadfast, thankful soul"

arabic: وإن تعجب فعجب قولهم أإذا كنا ترابا أإنا لفي خلق جديد ۗ أولئك الذين كفروا بربهم ۖ وأولئك الأغلال في أعناقهم ۖ وأولئك أصحاب النار ۖ هم فيها خالدون
english: If thou dost marvel (at their want of faith), strange is their saying: "When we are (actually) dust, shall we indeed then be in a creation renewed?" They are those who deny their Lord! They are those round whose necks will be yokes (of servitude): they will be Companions of the Fire, to dwell therein (for aye)!
tafsir: So Moses said to his people: "Remember the favours of God when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who afflicted you with oppression, slaying your sons but keeping alive your women, which was a great trial from your Lord."

arabic: ويستعجلونك بالسيئة قبل الحسنة وقد خلت من قبلهم المثلات ۗ وإن ربك لذو مغفرة للناس على ظلمهم ۖ وإن ربك لشديد العقاب
english: They ask thee to hasten on the evil in preference to the good: Yet have come to pass, before them, (many) exemplary punishments! But verily thy Lord is full of forgiveness for mankind for their wrong-doing, and verily thy Lord is (also) strict in punishment.
tafsir: Remember, your Lord proclaimed: "I shall give you more if you are grateful; but if you are thankless then surely My punishment is very great."

arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لولا أنزل عليه آية من ربه ۗ إنما أنت منذر ۖ ولكل قوم هاد
english: And the Unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" But thou art truly a warner, and to every people a guide.
tafsir: And Moses said: "What if you and all the people of the world deny, God is unconcerned and worthy of praise."

arabic: الله يعلم ما تحمل كل أنثى وما تغيض الأرحام وما تزداد ۖ وكل شيء عنده بمقدار
english: Allah doth know what every female (womb) doth bear, by how much the wombs fall short (of their time or number) or do exceed. Every single thing is before His sight, in (due) proportion.
tafsir: Has not the news of those before you, the people of Noah and 'Ad and Thamud, and those who came after them, come to you? None knows (about) them except God. Their apostles came to them with clear proofs, but they tried to silence them and said: "We do not believe in what you have been sent with, and we are in doubt of what you call us to, about which we are in disquiet.'

arabic: عالم الغيب والشهادة الكبير المتعال
english: He knoweth the unseen and that which is open: He is the Great, the Most High.
tafsir: Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth? He calls you to forgive some of your sins, and give you respite for a time ordained." They said: "You are only men like us, and yet you wish to turn us away from what our fathers worshipped. Bring to us then a clear proof."

arabic: سواء منكم من أسر القول ومن جهر به ومن هو مستخف بالليل وسارب بالنهار
english: It is the same (to Him) whether any of you conceal his speech or declare it openly; whether he lie hid by night or walk forth freely by day.
tafsir: Their apostles said to them: "Indeed we are men like you, but God bestows His favours on whomsoever He wills among His creatures. It is not in our power to bring a miracle for you without the leave of God. The believers should only place their trust in God.

arabic: له معقبات من بين يديه ومن خلفه يحفظونه من أمر الله ۗ إن الله لا يغير ما بقوم حتى يغيروا ما بأنفسهم ۗ وإذا أراد الله بقوم سوءا فلا مرد له ۚ وما لهم من دونه من وال
english: For each (such person) there are (angels) in succession, before and behind him: They guard him by command of Allah. Allah does not change a people's lot unless they change what is in their hearts. But when (once) Allah willeth a people's punishment, there can be no turning it back, nor will they find, besides Him, any to protect.
tafsir: And why should we not repose our trust in God when He has shown us our paths of duty to Him? We shall bear with fortitude the hardships you inflict upon us. The trusting place their trust in God."

arabic: هو الذي يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينشئ السحاب الثقال
english: It is He Who doth show you the lightning, by way both of fear and of hope: It is He Who doth raise up the clouds, heavy with (fertilising) rain!
tafsir: The unbelievers said to their apostles: "We shall drive you out of our land, or else you come back to our fold." Their Lord then communicated to them: "We shall annihilate these wicked people,

arabic: ويسبح الرعد بحمده والملائكة من خيفته ويرسل الصواعق فيصيب بها من يشاء وهم يجادلون في الله وهو شديد المحال
english: Nay, thunder repeateth His praises, and so do the angels, with awe: He flingeth the loud-voiced thunder-bolts, and therewith He striketh whomsoever He will.. yet these (are the men) who (dare to) dispute about Allah, with the strength of His power (supreme)!
tafsir: And establish you in their place. This is for him who fears My station, and dreads My commination."

arabic: له دعوة الحق ۖ والذين يدعون من دونه لا يستجيبون لهم بشيء إلا كباسط كفيه إلى الماء ليبلغ فاه وما هو ببالغه ۚ وما دعاء الكافرين إلا في ضلال
english: For Him (alone) is prayer in Truth: any others that they call upon besides Him hear them no more than if they were to stretch forth their hands for water to reach their mouths but it reaches them not: for the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile) wandering (in the mind).
tafsir: Then (the apostles) asked of God's assistance, and every arrogant tyrant was frustrated:

arabic: ولله يسجد من في السماوات والأرض طوعا وكرها وظلالهم بالغدو والآصال ۩
english: Whatever beings there are in the heavens and the earth do prostrate themselves to Allah (Acknowledging subjection),- with good-will or in spite of themselves: so do their shadows in the morning and evenings.
tafsir: Before him is Hell, and he will get putrid liquid to drink.

arabic: قل من رب السماوات والأرض قل الله ۚ قل أفاتخذتم من دونه أولياء لا يملكون لأنفسهم نفعا ولا ضرا ۚ قل هل يستوي الأعمى والبصير أم هل تستوي الظلمات والنور ۗ أم جعلوا لله شركاء خلقوا كخلقه فتشابه الخلق عليهم ۚ قل الله خالق كل شيء وهو الواحد القهار
english: Say: "Who is the Lord and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth?" Say: "(It is) Allah." Say: "Do ye then take (for worship) protectors other than Him, such as have no power either for good or for harm to themselves?" Say: "Are the blind equal with those who see? Or the depths of darkness equal with light?" Or do they assign to Allah partners who have created (anything) as He has created, so that the creation seemed to them similar? Say: "Allah is the Creator of all things: He is the One, the Supreme and Irresistible."
tafsir: He will sip it, yet will not be able to gulp it down. Death will crowd in upon him from every side, but die he will not. A terrible torment trails him.

arabic: أنزل من السماء ماء فسالت أودية بقدرها فاحتمل السيل زبدا رابيا ۚ ومما يوقدون عليه في النار ابتغاء حلية أو متاع زبد مثله ۚ كذلك يضرب الله الحق والباطل ۚ فأما الزبد فيذهب جفاء ۖ وأما ما ينفع الناس فيمكث في الأرض ۚ كذلك يضرب الله الأمثال
english: He sends down water from the skies, and the channels flow, each according to its measure: But the torrent bears away to foam that mounts up to the surface. Even so, from that (ore) which they heat in the fire, to make ornaments or utensils therewith, there is a scum likewise. Thus doth Allah (by parables) show forth Truth and Vanity. For the scum disappears like forth cast out; while that which is for the good of mankind remains on the earth. Thus doth Allah set forth parables.
tafsir: Like ashes are the deeds of those who deny their Lord, which the wind blows away on a windy day. They shall have no power over what they earned. This is the farthest limit of going astray.

arabic: للذين استجابوا لربهم الحسنى ۚ والذين لم يستجيبوا له لو أن لهم ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به ۚ أولئك لهم سوء الحساب ومأواهم جهنم ۖ وبئس المهاد
english: For those who respond to their Lord, are (all) good things. But those who respond not to Him,- Even if they had all that is in the heavens and on earth, and as much more, (in vain) would they offer it for ransom. For them will the reckoning be terrible: their abode will be Hell,- what a bed of misery!
tafsir: Do you not see that God has created the heavens and the earth with ultimate reason? If He so wills He could take you away from the earth and raise a new creation (in your place).

arabic: أفمن يعلم أنما أنزل إليك من ربك الحق كمن هو أعمى ۚ إنما يتذكر أولو الألباب
english: Is then one who doth know that that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the Truth, like one who is blind? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition;-
tafsir: This is well within the power of God.

arabic: الذين يوفون بعهد الله ولا ينقضون الميثاق
english: Those who fulfil the covenant of Allah and fail not in their plighted word;
tafsir: When they will all appear before God together, the weak will say to those who were arrogant: "We were your followers, so can you now save us a little from God's punishment?" They will say: "If we had been guided by God we would surely have shown you the way. To lament or endure is all the same to us now. No getting away is there for us."

arabic: والذين يصلون ما أمر الله به أن يوصل ويخشون ربهم ويخافون سوء الحساب
english: Those who join together those things which Allah hath commanded to be joined, hold their Lord in awe, and fear the terrible reckoning;
tafsir: When the reckoning is over Satan will say: "The promise that was made to you by God was indeed a true promise; but I went back on the promise I had made, for I had no power over you except to call you; and you responded to my call. So blame me not, but blame yourselves. Neither can I help you nor can you give me help. I disavow your having associated me earlier (with God). The punishment for those who are wicked is painful indeed."

arabic: والذين صبروا ابتغاء وجه ربهم وأقاموا الصلاة وأنفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية ويدرءون بالحسنة السيئة أولئك لهم عقبى الدار
english: Those who patiently persevere, seeking the countenance of their Lord; Establish regular prayers; spend, out of (the gifts) We have bestowed for their sustenance, secretly and openly; and turn off Evil with good: for such there is the final attainment of the (eternal) home,-
tafsir: Those who believed and did the right, will be admitted to gardens with rivers flowing by, where they will abide by the leave of their Lord, with 'Peace' as their salutation.

arabic: جنات عدن يدخلونها ومن صلح من آبائهم وأزواجهم وذرياتهم ۖ والملائكة يدخلون عليهم من كل باب
english: Gardens of perpetual bliss: they shall enter there, as well as the righteous among their fathers, their spouses, and their offspring: and angels shall enter unto them from every gate (with the salutation):
tafsir: Do you not see how God compares a noble act to a healthy tree whose roots are firm and branches in the sky, which yields

arabic: سلام عليكم بما صبرتم ۚ فنعم عقبى الدار
english: "Peace unto you for that ye persevered in patience! Now how excellent is the final home!"
tafsir: By the leave of its Lord its fruit in all seasons, God presents words of wisdom to men that they might reflect.

arabic: والذين ينقضون عهد الله من بعد ميثاقه ويقطعون ما أمر الله به أن يوصل ويفسدون في الأرض ۙ أولئك لهم اللعنة ولهم سوء الدار
english: But those who break the Covenant of Allah, after having plighted their word thereto, and cut asunder those things which Allah has commanded to be joined, and work mischief in the land;- on them is the curse; for them is the terrible home!
tafsir: An evil act is like a rotten tree torn out of the earth with no (base or) firmness.

arabic: الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر ۚ وفرحوا بالحياة الدنيا وما الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا متاع
english: Allah doth enlarge, or grant by (strict) measure, the sustenance (which He giveth) to whomso He pleaseth. (The wordly) rejoice in the life of this world: But the life of this world is but little comfort in the Hereafter.
tafsir: With immutuble words God makes the faithful dauntless in the life of the world and the life to come, but leads the unjust into error, for God does as He pleases.

arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لولا أنزل عليه آية من ربه ۗ قل إن الله يضل من يشاء ويهدي إليه من أناب
english: The Unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Truly Allah leaveth, to stray, whom He will; But He guideth to Himself those who turn to Him in penitence,-
tafsir: Have you not looked at those who repaid God's favours with ingratitude; who pulled their people down to ruin,

arabic: الذين آمنوا وتطمئن قلوبهم بذكر الله ۗ ألا بذكر الله تطمئن القلوب
english: "Those who believe, and whose hearts find satisfaction in the remembrance of Allah: for without doubt in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find satisfaction.
tafsir: Hell, where they will roast in the fire? And what an evil repository!

arabic: الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات طوبى لهم وحسن مآب
english: "For those who believe and work righteousness, is (every) blessedness, and a beautiful place of (final) return."
tafsir: They have appointed equals of God to mislead people from His path. Tell them: "Enjoy yourselves (so long as you may). In the end you have to go to Hell."

arabic: كذلك أرسلناك في أمة قد خلت من قبلها أمم لتتلو عليهم الذي أوحينا إليك وهم يكفرون بالرحمن ۚ قل هو ربي لا إله إلا هو عليه توكلت وإليه متاب
english: Thus have we sent thee amongst a People before whom (long since) have (other) Peoples (gone and) passed away; in order that thou mightest rehearse unto them what We send down unto thee by inspiration; yet do they reject (Him), the Most Gracious! Say: "He is my Lord! There is no god but He! On Him is my trust, and to Him do I turn!"
tafsir: Tell those of My creatures who believe: "Observe your devotional obligations and give of what We have given you in charity, secretly or openly, before the Day arrives when there will be no buying or selling or befriending."

arabic: ولو أن قرآنا سيرت به الجبال أو قطعت به الأرض أو كلم به الموتى ۗ بل لله الأمر جميعا ۗ أفلم ييأس الذين آمنوا أن لو يشاء الله لهدى الناس جميعا ۗ ولا يزال الذين كفروا تصيبهم بما صنعوا قارعة أو تحل قريبا من دارهم حتى يأتي وعد الله ۚ إن الله لا يخلف الميعاد
english: If there were a Qur'an with which mountains were moved, or the earth were cloven asunder, or the dead were made to speak, (this would be the one!) But, truly, the command is with Allah in all things! Do not the Believers know, that, had Allah (so) willed, He could have guided all mankind (to the right)? But the Unbelievers,- never will disaster cease to seize them for their (ill) deeds, or to settle close to their homes, until the promise of Allah come to pass, for, verily, Allah will not fail in His promise.
tafsir: It is God who created the heavens and the earth, and sent down rain from the sky producing fruits for your food thereby, and made you master of the ships that ply in the oceans by His command, subjected the rivers to your control,

arabic: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فأمليت للذين كفروا ثم أخذتهم ۖ فكيف كان عقاب
english: Mocked were (many) messengers before thee: but I granted respite to the unbelievers, and finally I punished them: Then how (terrible) was my requital!
tafsir: And subjugated the sun and moon for you so that they perform their tasks diligently; and subdued the night and day for your service.

arabic: أفمن هو قائم على كل نفس بما كسبت ۗ وجعلوا لله شركاء قل سموهم ۚ أم تنبئونه بما لا يعلم في الأرض أم بظاهر من القول ۗ بل زين للذين كفروا مكرهم وصدوا عن السبيل ۗ ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد
english: Is then He who standeth over every soul (and knoweth) all that it doth, (like any others)? And yet they ascribe partners to Allah. Say: "But name them! is it that ye will inform Him of something he knoweth not on earth, or is it (just) a show of words?" Nay! to those who believe not, their pretence seems pleasing, but they are kept back (thereby) from the path. And those whom Allah leaves to stray, no one can guide.
tafsir: He gave you whatsoever you asked. If you try to count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Man is most unjust indeed, full of ingratitude.

arabic: لهم عذاب في الحياة الدنيا ۖ ولعذاب الآخرة أشق ۖ وما لهم من الله من واق
english: For them is a penalty in the life of this world, but harder, truly, is the penalty of the Hereafter: and defender have they none against Allah.
tafsir: Remember when Abraham prayed: "O Lord, make this a city of peace, and preserve me and my progeny from worshipping idols:

arabic: مثل الجنة التي وعد المتقون ۖ تجري من تحتها الأنهار ۖ أكلها دائم وظلها ۚ تلك عقبى الذين اتقوا ۖ وعقبى الكافرين النار
english: The parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised!- beneath it flow rivers: perpetual is the enjoyment thereof and the shade therein: such is the end of the Righteous; and the end of Unbelievers in the Fire.
tafsir: Many a man have they led astray, O Lord. So he who follows me is truly of me; but as for him who disobeys me, surely You are forgiving and kind.

arabic: والذين آتيناهم الكتاب يفرحون بما أنزل إليك ۖ ومن الأحزاب من ينكر بعضه ۚ قل إنما أمرت أن أعبد الله ولا أشرك به ۚ إليه أدعو وإليه مآب
english: Those to whom We have given the Book rejoice at what hath been revealed unto thee: but there are among the clans those who reject a part thereof. Say: "I am commanded to worship Allah, and not to join partners with Him. Unto Him do I call, and unto Him is my return."
tafsir: I have settled some of my children, O Lord, in a barren valley near Your sacred House, so that, O our Lord, they may be constant in devotion. So put in the hearts of men some kindness for them, and provide fruits for them: They may haply be grateful.

arabic: وكذلك أنزلناه حكما عربيا ۚ ولئن اتبعت أهواءهم بعد ما جاءك من العلم ما لك من الله من ولي ولا واق
english: Thus have We revealed it to be a judgment of authority in Arabic. Wert thou to follow their (vain) desires after the knowledge which hath reached thee, then wouldst thou find neither protector nor defender against Allah.
tafsir: O Lord, You have knowledge of what we hide and what we reveal, for nothing on the earth or in the skies is hidden from God.

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا رسلا من قبلك وجعلنا لهم أزواجا وذرية ۚ وما كان لرسول أن يأتي بآية إلا بإذن الله ۗ لكل أجل كتاب
english: We did send messengers before thee, and appointed for them wives and children: and it was never the part of a messenger to bring a sign except as Allah permitted (or commanded). For each period is a Book (revealed).
tafsir: All praise be to God who bestowed on me Ishmael and Isaac in old age. Verily my Lord listens to prayer.

arabic: يمحو الله ما يشاء ويثبت ۖ وعنده أم الكتاب
english: Allah doth blot out or confirm what He pleaseth: with Him is the Mother of the Book.
tafsir: Grant, O Lord, that I and my offspring may remain constant in devotion. Grant, O Lord, my supplication.

arabic: وإن ما نرينك بعض الذي نعدهم أو نتوفينك فإنما عليك البلاغ وعلينا الحساب
english: Whether We shall show thee (within thy life-time) part of what we promised them or take to ourselves thy soul (before it is all accomplished),- thy duty is to make (the Message) reach them: it is our part to call them to account.
tafsir: O Lord, forgive me, my parents and the faithful on the Day the reckoning is done."

arabic: أولم يروا أنا نأتي الأرض ننقصها من أطرافها ۚ والله يحكم لا معقب لحكمه ۚ وهو سريع الحساب
english: See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? (Where) Allah commands, there is none to put back His Command: and He is swift in calling to account.
tafsir: Think not God is oblivious of the deeds of the wicked. He has only allowed them respite till the Day on which all eyes would stare aghast,

arabic: وقد مكر الذين من قبلهم فلله المكر جميعا ۖ يعلم ما تكسب كل نفس ۗ وسيعلم الكفار لمن عقبى الدار
english: Those before them did (also) devise plots; but in all things the master-planning is Allah's He knoweth the doings of every soul: and soon will the Unbelievers know who gets home in the end.
tafsir: (And) they would hasten forward, heads lifted upwards, gazes fixed, and emptied out their hearts.

arabic: ويقول الذين كفروا لست مرسلا ۚ قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم ومن عنده علم الكتاب
english: The Unbelievers say: "No messenger art thou." Say: "Enough for a witness between me and you is Allah, and such as have knowledge of the Book."
tafsir: Warn the people of that Day when the punishment would be inflicted upon them. Then will the wicked say: "O our Lord, give us respite a while more. We shall heed Your call and follow the apostles." (But they will be told,): "Are you not those who used to swear: 'There is no reverse for us?'

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الر ۚ كتاب أنزلناه إليك لتخرج الناس من الظلمات إلى النور بإذن ربهم إلى صراط العزيز الحميد
english: A. L. R. A Book which We have revealed unto thee, in order that thou mightest lead mankind out of the depths of darkness into light - by the leave of their Lord - to the Way of (Him) the Exalted in power, worthy of all praise!-
tafsir: The unbelievers would haply like to wish that they had submitted (and become Muslim).

arabic: الله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ۗ وويل للكافرين من عذاب شديد
english: Of Allah, to Whom do belong all things in the heavens and on earth! But alas for the Unbelievers for a terrible penalty (their Unfaith will bring them)!-
tafsir: Leave them to feast and revel, beguiled by hope; they will come to know soon.

arabic: الذين يستحبون الحياة الدنيا على الآخرة ويصدون عن سبيل الله ويبغونها عوجا ۚ أولئك في ضلال بعيد
english: Those who love the life of this world more than the Hereafter, who hinder (men) from the Path of Allah and seek therein something crooked: they are astray by a long distance.
tafsir: Not one habitation have We destroyed but at the time determined for it.

arabic: وما أرسلنا من رسول إلا بلسان قومه ليبين لهم ۖ فيضل الله من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء ۚ وهو العزيز الحكيم
english: We sent not a messenger except (to teach) in the language of his (own) people, in order to make (things) clear to them. Now Allah leaves straying those whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases: and He is Exalted in power, full of Wisdom.
tafsir: No people can hasten or delay the term already fixed for them.

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا أن أخرج قومك من الظلمات إلى النور وذكرهم بأيام الله ۚ إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور
english: We sent Moses with Our signs (and the command). "Bring out thy people from the depths of darkness into light, and teach them to remember the Days of Allah." Verily in this there are Signs for such as are firmly patient and constant,- grateful and appreciative.
tafsir: And yet they say: "You, to whom this Exposition has been sent are surely possessed of the Devil.

arabic: وإذ قال موسى لقومه اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ أنجاكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب ويذبحون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم ۚ وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم
english: Remember! Moses said to his people: "Call to mind the favour of Allah to you when He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh: they set you hard tasks and punishments, slaughtered your sons, and let your women-folk live: therein was a tremendous trial from your Lord."
tafsir: If you are a man of truth, why can't you bring the angels to us?"

arabic: وإذ تأذن ربكم لئن شكرتم لأزيدنكم ۖ ولئن كفرتم إن عذابي لشديد
english: And remember! your Lord caused to be declared (publicly): "If ye are grateful, I will add more (favours) unto you; But if ye show ingratitude, truly My punishment is terrible indeed."
tafsir: But then We never send the angels down save with the purpose (of enforcing their doom), after which they will not be given more respite.

arabic: وقال موسى إن تكفروا أنتم ومن في الأرض جميعا فإن الله لغني حميد
english: And Moses said: "If ye show ingratitude, ye and all on earth together, yet is Allah free of all wants, worthy of all praise.
tafsir: We have sent down this Exposition, and We will guard it.

arabic: ألم يأتكم نبأ الذين من قبلكم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود ۛ والذين من بعدهم ۛ لا يعلمهم إلا الله ۚ جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فردوا أيديهم في أفواههم وقالوا إنا كفرنا بما أرسلتم به وإنا لفي شك مما تدعوننا إليه مريب
english: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came messengers with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to their mouths, and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have been sent, and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which ye invite us."
tafsir: We had also sent apostles to people of earlier persuasions.

arabic: قالت رسلهم أفي الله شك فاطر السماوات والأرض ۖ يدعوكم ليغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم إلى أجل مسمى ۚ قالوا إن أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا تريدون أن تصدونا عما كان يعبد آباؤنا فأتونا بسلطان مبين
english: Their messengers said: "Is there a doubt about Allah, The Creator of the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you, in order that He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human, like ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers used to worship: then bring us some clear authority."
tafsir: But never once an apostle came to them at whom they did not scoff.

arabic: قالت لهم رسلهم إن نحن إلا بشر مثلكم ولكن الله يمن على من يشاء من عباده ۖ وما كان لنا أن نأتيكم بسلطان إلا بإذن الله ۚ وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون
english: Their messengers said to them: "True, we are human like yourselves, but Allah doth grant His grace to such of his servants as He pleases. It is not for us to bring you an authority except as Allah permits. And on Allah let all men of faith put their trust.
tafsir: We place in the hearts of sinners (disbelief).

arabic: وما لنا ألا نتوكل على الله وقد هدانا سبلنا ۚ ولنصبرن على ما آذيتمونا ۚ وعلى الله فليتوكل المتوكلون
english: "No reason have we why we should not put our trust on Allah. Indeed He Has guided us to the Ways we (follow). We shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us. For those who put their trust should put their trust on Allah."
tafsir: So, they will not believe in it: The example of former people is there.

arabic: وقال الذين كفروا لرسلهم لنخرجنكم من أرضنا أو لتعودن في ملتنا ۖ فأوحى إليهم ربهم لنهلكن الظالمين
english: And the Unbelievers said to their messengers: "Be sure we shall drive you out of our land, or ye shall return to our religion." But their Lord inspired (this Message) to them: "Verily We shall cause the wrong-doers to perish!
tafsir: Even if We open a door in the heavens and they ascend through it in broad daylight,

arabic: ولنسكننكم الأرض من بعدهم ۚ ذلك لمن خاف مقامي وخاف وعيد
english: "And verily We shall cause you to abide in the land, and succeed them. This for such as fear the Time when they shall stand before My tribunal,- such as fear the punishment denounced."
tafsir: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."

arabic: واستفتحوا وخاب كل جبار عنيد
english: But they sought victory and decision (there and then), and frustration was the lot of every powerful obstinate transgressor.
tafsir: We have placed the signs of the Zodiac in the sky, and decked it out for those who can see;

arabic: من ورائه جهنم ويسقى من ماء صديد
english: In front of such a one is Hell, and he is given, for drink, boiling fetid water.
tafsir: And We have preserved it from every accursed devil,

arabic: يتجرعه ولا يكاد يسيغه ويأتيه الموت من كل مكان وما هو بميت ۖ ومن ورائه عذاب غليظ
english: In gulps will he sip it, but never will he be near swallowing it down his throat: death will come to him from every quarter, yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelenting.
tafsir: Except the ones who listen on the sly, yet they are chased away by a shooting flame.

arabic: مثل الذين كفروا بربهم ۖ أعمالهم كرماد اشتدت به الريح في يوم عاصف ۖ لا يقدرون مما كسبوا على شيء ۚ ذلك هو الضلال البعيد
english: The parable of those who reject their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a tempestuous day: No power have they over aught that they have earned: that is the straying far, far (from the goal).
tafsir: We stretched the earth and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and made all things grow upon it balanced evenly.

arabic: ألم تر أن الله خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق ۚ إن يشأ يذهبكم ويأت بخلق جديد
english: Seest thou not that Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth? If He so will, He can remove you and put (in your place) a new creation?
tafsir: We have provided on it sustenance for you, and for those you cannot provide.

arabic: وما ذلك على الله بعزيز
english: Nor is that for Allah any great matter.
tafsir: Of all things there are We have the stores, and send them down in determined measure.

arabic: وبرزوا لله جميعا فقال الضعفاء للذين استكبروا إنا كنا لكم تبعا فهل أنتم مغنون عنا من عذاب الله من شيء ۚ قالوا لو هدانا الله لهديناكم ۖ سواء علينا أجزعنا أم صبرنا ما لنا من محيص
english: They will all be marshalled before Allah together: then will the weak say to those who were arrogant, "For us, we but followed you; can ye then avail us to all against the wrath of Allah?" They will reply, "If we had received the Guidance of Allah, we should have given it to you: to us it makes no difference (now) whether we rage, or bear (these torments) with patience: for ourselves there is no way of escape."
tafsir: We send rain-impregnated winds, and water from the sky which you drink, but you are not the keepers of its store.

arabic: وقال الشيطان لما قضي الأمر إن الله وعدكم وعد الحق ووعدتكم فأخلفتكم ۖ وما كان لي عليكم من سلطان إلا أن دعوتكم فاستجبتم لي ۖ فلا تلوموني ولوموا أنفسكم ۖ ما أنا بمصرخكم وما أنتم بمصرخي ۖ إني كفرت بما أشركتمون من قبل ۗ إن الظالمين لهم عذاب أليم
english: And Satan will say when the matter is decided: "It was Allah Who gave you a promise of Truth: I too promised, but I failed in my promise to you. I had no authority over you except to call you but ye listened to me: then reproach not me, but reproach your own souls. I cannot listen to your cries, nor can ye listen to mine. I reject your former act in associating me with Allah. For wrong-doers there must be a grievous penalty."
tafsir: It is We who give life and We who give death, and We are the One who will abide.

arabic: وأدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها بإذن ربهم ۖ تحيتهم فيها سلام
english: But those who believe and work righteousness will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow,- to dwell therein for aye with the leave of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be: "Peace!"
tafsir: We surely know those of you who go forward and those of you who lag behind.

arabic: ألم تر كيف ضرب الله مثلا كلمة طيبة كشجرة طيبة أصلها ثابت وفرعها في السماء
english: Seest thou not how Allah sets forth a parable? - A goodly word like a goodly tree, whose root is firmly fixed, and its branches (reach) to the heavens,- of its Lord. So Allah sets forth parables for men, in order that they may receive admonition.
tafsir: Your Lord will surely gather them together: Certainly He is all-wise and all-knowing.

arabic: تؤتي أكلها كل حين بإذن ربها ۗ ويضرب الله الأمثال للناس لعلهم يتذكرون
english: It brings forth its fruit at all times, by the leave of its Lord. So Allah sets forth parables for men, in order that they may receive admonition.
tafsir: Man We fashioned from fermented clay dried tingling hard,

arabic: ومثل كلمة خبيثة كشجرة خبيثة اجتثت من فوق الأرض ما لها من قرار
english: And the parable of an evil Word is that of an evil tree: It is torn up by the root from the surface of the earth: it has no stability.
tafsir: As We fashioned jinns before from intense radiated heat.

arabic: يثبت الله الذين آمنوا بالقول الثابت في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة ۖ ويضل الله الظالمين ۚ ويفعل الله ما يشاء
english: Allah will establish in strength those who believe, with the word that stands firm, in this world and in the Hereafter; but Allah will leave, to stray, those who do wrong: Allah doeth what He willeth.
tafsir: But when your Lord said to the angels: "I am verily going to create a human being from fermented clay dried tingling hard;

arabic: ألم تر إلى الذين بدلوا نعمت الله كفرا وأحلوا قومهم دار البوار
english: Hast thou not turned thy vision to those who have changed the favour of Allah. Into blasphemy and caused their people to descend to the House of Perdition?-
tafsir: And when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, bow before him in homage;"

arabic: جهنم يصلونها ۖ وبئس القرار
english: Into Hell? They will burn therein,- an evil place to stay in!
tafsir: The angels bowed in homage in a body

arabic: وجعلوا لله أندادا ليضلوا عن سبيله ۗ قل تمتعوا فإن مصيركم إلى النار
english: And they set up (idols) as equal to Allah, to mislead (men) from the Path! Say: "Enjoy (your brief power)! But verily ye are making straightway for Hell!"
tafsir: Except Iblis. He refused to bow with the adorers.

arabic: قل لعبادي الذين آمنوا يقيموا الصلاة وينفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا بيع فيه ولا خلال
english: Speak to my servants who have believed, that they may establish regular prayers, and spend (in charity) out of the sustenance we have given them, secretly and openly, before the coming of a Day in which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor befriending.
tafsir: "How is it, O Iblis," said (the Lord), "you did not join those who bowed in homage?"

arabic: الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرج به من الثمرات رزقا لكم ۖ وسخر لكم الفلك لتجري في البحر بأمره ۖ وسخر لكم الأنهار
english: It is Allah Who hath created the heavens and the earth and sendeth down rain from the skies, and with it bringeth out fruits wherewith to feed you; it is He Who hath made the ships subject to you, that they may sail through the sea by His command; and the rivers (also) hath He made subject to you.
tafsir: "How could I bow," said he, "before a mortal whom You created from fermented clay dried tingling hard?"

arabic: وسخر لكم الشمس والقمر دائبين ۖ وسخر لكم الليل والنهار
english: And He hath made subject to you the sun and the moon, both diligently pursuing their courses; and the night and the day hath he (also) made subject to you.
tafsir: "Go hence, execrable," (said the Lord), "from this place,

arabic: وآتاكم من كل ما سألتموه ۚ وإن تعدوا نعمت الله لا تحصوها ۗ إن الإنسان لظلوم كفار
english: And He giveth you of all that ye ask for. But if ye count the favours of Allah, never will ye be able to number them. Verily, man is given up to injustice and ingratitude.
tafsir: Condemned till the day of Doom!"

arabic: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب اجعل هذا البلد آمنا واجنبني وبني أن نعبد الأصنام
english: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.
tafsir: "O my Lord," said he, "give me respite till the day the dead are raised."

arabic: رب إنهن أضللن كثيرا من الناس ۖ فمن تبعني فإنه مني ۖ ومن عصاني فإنك غفور رحيم
english: "O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind; He then who follows my (ways) is of me, and he that disobeys me,- but Thou art indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: "You are among the reprieved," (said the Lord),

arabic: ربنا إني أسكنت من ذريتي بواد غير ذي زرع عند بيتك المحرم ربنا ليقيموا الصلاة فاجعل أفئدة من الناس تهوي إليهم وارزقهم من الثمرات لعلهم يشكرون
english: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.
tafsir: "Till the predetermined time."

arabic: ربنا إنك تعلم ما نخفي وما نعلن ۗ وما يخفى على الله من شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء
english: "O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we reveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from Allah, whether on earth or in heaven.
tafsir: "O my Lord," he said, "since You have led me into error I'll beguile them with the pleasures of the world and lead them astray,

arabic: الحمد لله الذي وهب لي على الكبر إسماعيل وإسحاق ۚ إن ربي لسميع الدعاء
english: "Praise be to Allah, Who hath granted unto me in old age Isma'il and Isaac: for truly my Lord is He, the Hearer of Prayer!
tafsir: Except the chosen ones among Your creatures."

arabic: رب اجعلني مقيم الصلاة ومن ذريتي ۚ ربنا وتقبل دعاء
english: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.
tafsir: (To which God) said: "This way is right by Me.

arabic: ربنا اغفر لي ولوالدي وللمؤمنين يوم يقوم الحساب
english: "O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness - me, my parents, and (all) Believers, on the Day that the Reckoning will be established!
tafsir: No power shall you have over (all) My creatures except those who fall into error and follow you,

arabic: ولا تحسبن الله غافلا عما يعمل الظالمون ۚ إنما يؤخرهم ليوم تشخص فيه الأبصار
english: Think not that Allah doth not heed the deeds of those who do wrong. He but giveth them respite against a Day when the eyes will fixedly stare in horror,-
tafsir: For whom the ordained place is surely Hell,

arabic: مهطعين مقنعي رءوسهم لا يرتد إليهم طرفهم ۖ وأفئدتهم هواء
english: They running forward with necks outstretched, their heads uplifted, their gaze returning not towards them, and their hearts a (gaping) void!
tafsir: Which has several gates, and each gate is marked for every section of them."

arabic: وأنذر الناس يوم يأتيهم العذاب فيقول الذين ظلموا ربنا أخرنا إلى أجل قريب نجب دعوتك ونتبع الرسل ۗ أولم تكونوا أقسمتم من قبل ما لكم من زوال
english: So warn mankind of the Day when the Wrath will reach them: then will the wrong-doers say: "Our Lord! respite us (if only) for a short term: we will answer Thy call, and follow the messengers!" "What! were ye not wont to swear aforetime that ye should suffer no decline?
tafsir: Verily those who keep away from evil and follow the straight path shall be in the midst of gardens and springs of water.

arabic: وسكنتم في مساكن الذين ظلموا أنفسهم وتبين لكم كيف فعلنا بهم وضربنا لكم الأمثال
english: "And ye dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged their own souls; ye were clearly shown how We dealt with them; and We put forth (many) parables in your behoof!"
tafsir: "Enter in peace and tranquility," (they will be told).

arabic: وقد مكروا مكرهم وعند الله مكرهم وإن كان مكرهم لتزول منه الجبال
english: Mighty indeed were the plots which they made, but their plots were (well) within the sight of Allah, even though they were such as to shake the hills!
tafsir: We shall cast out any grudge they may have in their hearts. (There) they will sit on couches face to face like brothers together.

arabic: فلا تحسبن الله مخلف وعده رسله ۗ إن الله عزيز ذو انتقام
english: Never think that Allah would fail his messengers in His promise: for Allah is Exalted in power, - the Lord of Retribution.
tafsir: No weariness will come upon them, nor will they be sent away from there.

arabic: يوم تبدل الأرض غير الأرض والسماوات ۖ وبرزوا لله الواحد القهار
english: One day the earth will be changed to a different earth, and so will be the heavens, and (men) will be marshalled forth, before Allah, the One, the Irresistible;
tafsir: Announce to My creatures that I am indeed forgiving and kind,

arabic: وترى المجرمين يومئذ مقرنين في الأصفاد
english: And thou wilt see the sinners that day bound together in fetters;-
tafsir: But My punishment is surely a painful one.

arabic: سرابيلهم من قطران وتغشى وجوههم النار
english: Their garments of liquid pitch, and their faces covered with Fire;
tafsir: Inform them about the matter of Abraham's guests.

arabic: ليجزي الله كل نفس ما كسبت ۚ إن الله سريع الحساب
english: That Allah may requite each soul according to its deserts; and verily Allah is swift in calling to account.
tafsir: When they came to him and said: "Peace," he answered: "Truly we are afraid of you."

arabic: هذا بلاغ للناس ولينذروا به وليعلموا أنما هو إله واحد وليذكر أولو الألباب
english: Here is a Message for mankind: Let them take warning therefrom, and let them know that He is (no other than) One Allah: let men of understanding take heed.
tafsir: "Have no fear," they said. "We bring you news of a son full of wisdom."

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الر ۚ تلك آيات الكتاب وقرآن مبين
english: A. L. R. These are the Ayats of Revelation,- of a Qur'an that makes things clear.
tafsir: He sends the angels with revelation by His command, to any of His creatures as He please, (saying): "Warn that there is no god but I, so fear Me."

arabic: ربما يود الذين كفروا لو كانوا مسلمين
english: Again and again will those who disbelieve, wish that they had bowed (to Allah's will) in Islam.
tafsir: He created the heavens and the earth with reason. Too glorious and high is He for what they associate with Him.

arabic: ذرهم يأكلوا ويتمتعوا ويلههم الأمل ۖ فسوف يعلمون
english: Leave them alone, to enjoy (the good things of this life) and to please themselves: let (false) hope amuse them: soon will knowledge (undeceive them).
tafsir: Man He created from a drop of semen; and still he becomes an open contender.

arabic: وما أهلكنا من قرية إلا ولها كتاب معلوم
english: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.
tafsir: He created the cattle from whom you get warm clothing and (other) advantages, and some you eat.

arabic: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون
english: Neither can a people anticipate its term, nor delay it.
tafsir: There is life and cheer for you as you drive them home in the evening, and lead them out in the morning to graze.

arabic: وقالوا يا أيها الذي نزل عليه الذكر إنك لمجنون
english: They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! truly thou art mad (or possessed)!
tafsir: They carry your burdens to lands so distant you could not have reached without much hardship. Indeed your Lord is compassionate and kind.

arabic: لو ما تأتينا بالملائكة إن كنت من الصادقين
english: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"
tafsir: He created horses, mules and donkeys for riding and for splendour. He created other things too which you do not know.

arabic: ما ننزل الملائكة إلا بالحق وما كانوا إذا منظرين
english: We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came (to the ungodly), behold! no respite would they have!
tafsir: To God leads the right path, though some deviate. If He willed He could guide you all to the right way.

arabic: إنا نحن نزلنا الذكر وإنا له لحافظون
english: We have, without doubt, sent down the Message; and We will assuredly guard it (from corruption).
tafsir: It is He who sends down water from the sky of which you drink, and which nourishes the plants you feed your cattle,

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك في شيع الأولين
english: We did send messengers before thee amongst the religious sects of old:
tafsir: With which He makes crops grow, and olives, dates and grapes and fruits of every kind for you. In this is a sign for those who think.

arabic: وما يأتيهم من رسول إلا كانوا به يستهزئون
english: But never came a messenger to them but they mocked him.
tafsir: He harnessed the day and night for you, as also the sun, the moon and the stars, by His command. In this are signs for men who understand.

arabic: كذلك نسلكه في قلوب المجرمين
english: Even so do we let it creep into the hearts of the sinners -
tafsir: And other things of different shades has He produced on the earth for you. In this are signs for those who reflect.

arabic: لا يؤمنون به ۖ وقد خلت سنة الأولين
english: That they should not believe in the (Message); but the ways of the ancients have passed away.
tafsir: It is He who has subdued the sea that you may eat fresh meat from it, and obtain ornaments to wear. You see the ships plough through it that you may seek of His bounties and, perhaps, be grateful.

arabic: ولو فتحنا عليهم بابا من السماء فظلوا فيه يعرجون
english: Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven, and they were to continue (all day) ascending therein,
tafsir: He placed stablisers in the earth so that while it revolves you live undisturbed, and rivers and tracks so that you may find your way;

arabic: لقالوا إنما سكرت أبصارنا بل نحن قوم مسحورون
english: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
tafsir: As well as many other signs, as by the stars (you) find direction.

arabic: ولقد جعلنا في السماء بروجا وزيناها للناظرين
english: It is We Who have set out the zodiacal signs in the heavens, and made them fair-seeming to (all) beholders;
tafsir: So, could one who creates be like one who cannot? Will you not then contemplate?

arabic: وحفظناها من كل شيطان رجيم
english: And (moreover) We have guarded them from every cursed devil:
tafsir: If you count the favours of God you will not be able to calculate. Assuredly God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: إلا من استرق السمع فأتبعه شهاب مبين
english: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).
tafsir: God knows what you hide and disclose.

arabic: والأرض مددناها وألقينا فيها رواسي وأنبتنا فيها من كل شيء موزون
english: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.
tafsir: , As for those they call besides God, they cannot create a thing, and have themselves been created.

arabic: وجعلنا لكم فيها معايش ومن لستم له برازقين
english: And We have provided therein means of subsistence,- for you and for those for whose sustenance ye are not responsible.
tafsir: Dead, without life they are, and do not know when they will be raised.

arabic: وإن من شيء إلا عندنا خزائنه وما ننزله إلا بقدر معلوم
english: And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures (inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due and ascertainable measures.
tafsir: Your God is one God. But the hearts of those who believe not in the life to come are filled with denial, and they are puffed up with pride.

arabic: وأرسلنا الرياح لواقح فأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأسقيناكموه وما أنتم له بخازنين
english: And We send the fecundating winds, then cause the rain to descend from the sky, therewith providing you with water (in abundance), though ye are not the guardians of its stores.
tafsir: Surely God knows what they hide and what they disclose. He certainly does not love the proud.

arabic: وإنا لنحن نحيي ونميت ونحن الوارثون
english: And verily, it is We Who give life, and Who give death: it is We Who remain inheritors (after all else passes away).
tafsir: For when they are asked: "What has your Lord sent down?" they say: "Tales of long ago."

arabic: ولقد علمنا المستقدمين منكم ولقد علمنا المستأخرين
english: To Us are known those of you who hasten forward, and those who lag behind.
tafsir: On the Day of Resurrection they will carry their own burden and some of the load of those they have led astray without any knowledge. Oh, how evil a burden they will carry!

arabic: وإن ربك هو يحشرهم ۚ إنه حكيم عليم
english: Assuredly it is thy Lord Who will gather them together: for He is perfect in Wisdom and Knowledge.
tafsir: Those who have gone before them had also conspired; then God uprooted their structure from its foundation; the roof fell over them from above, and punishment came upon them from somewhere they did not suspect.

arabic: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من صلصال من حمإ مسنون
english: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;
tafsir: On the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and ask: "Where are My compeers for whom you contended?" Those endowed with knowledge will say: "Shame and evil surely are for unbelievers today."

arabic: والجان خلقناه من قبل من نار السموم
english: And the Jinn race, We had created before, from the fire of a scorching wind.
tafsir: They whose souls are drawn out by the angels while they are sinning, shall offer submission: "We did no evil." But God knows well what you did.

arabic: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من صلصال من حمإ مسنون
english: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;
tafsir: So enter the gates of Hell, and dwell there for ever. How dreadful a dwelling for the haughty!

arabic: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين
english: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
tafsir: When those who took heed for themselves would be asked: "What did your Lord send down?" They will answer: "The best." For those who do good there is good in the world, but certainly the abode of the next is better. How excellent the home of the virtuous!

arabic: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون
english: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
tafsir: They will enter perennial gardens with streams of water and all they wish. Thus will the pious and devout be rewarded.

arabic: إلا إبليس أبى أن يكون مع الساجدين
english: Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
tafsir: When the angels receive the souls of those who are blameless they will say: "Peace on you. Enter Paradise as recompense for what you did."

arabic: قال يا إبليس ما لك ألا تكون مع الساجدين
english: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among those who prostrated themselves?"
tafsir: What! Do the (unbelievers) expect that the angels should descend, or the sentence of your Lord come to pass? So had the people done before them; yet God did not wrong them, they wronged themselves.

arabic: قال لم أكن لأسجد لبشر خلقته من صلصال من حمإ مسنون
english: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
tafsir: The evil they perpetrated overtook them, and what they mocked has turned upon them.

arabic: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم
english: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected, accursed.
tafsir: The idolaters say: "If God had willed we would not have worshipped anything apart from Him, nor would our fathers have done, nor would we have forbidden any thing without His (leave)." So had the people done before them. Therefore it is binding on the prophets to convey the message in clearest terms.

arabic: وإن عليك اللعنة إلى يوم الدين
english: "And the curse shall be on thee till the day of Judgment."
tafsir: To every community We have sent an apostle. (saying:) "Worship God, and keep away from all other deities." Thus some of them were guided by God, and ruin was justified on some. Travel over the earth and see what befell those who accused (the apostles) of lies.

arabic: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون
english: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
tafsir: Even if you are eager to guide them, God does not surely guide those who have gone astray: They will have no one to help them.

arabic: قال فإنك من المنظرين
english: (Allah) said: "Respite is granted thee
tafsir: They swear emphatically in the name of God that God will not raise the dead. On the contrary, it is a promise incumbent on Him, though most men do not understand,

arabic: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم
english: "Till the Day of the Time appointed."
tafsir: For (they fear) He might make what they differed about plain to them, and that the infidels may realise that they were liars.

arabic: قال رب بما أغويتني لأزينن لهم في الأرض ولأغوينهم أجمعين
english: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-
tafsir: Yet when We will a thing We have only to say: "Be", and it is.

arabic: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين
english: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
tafsir: Those who left their homes in the cause of God after having been oppressed, will be given by Us a better place in the world, and if they knew, the guerdon of the next would be greater

arabic: قال هذا صراط علي مستقيم
english: (Allah) said: "This (way of My sincere servants) is indeed a way that leads straight to Me.
tafsir: (For) those who persevere and place their trust in their Lord.

arabic: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان إلا من اتبعك من الغاوين
english: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
tafsir: We sent before you none (as apostles) but men, to whom We sent revelations. In case you are unaware, enquire of those who are keepers of the Oracles of God.

arabic: وإن جهنم لموعدهم أجمعين
english: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!
tafsir: We had Sent them with miracles and Books; and We have sent to you this Reminder so that you may explain distinctly to men what was sent down to them: They may haply reflect.

arabic: لها سبعة أبواب لكل باب منهم جزء مقسوم
english: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
tafsir: Have the plotters of mischief become unafraid that God will not split the earth to swallow them, or that punishment will not fall upon them from somewhere they do not (even) suspect?

arabic: إن المتقين في جنات وعيون
english: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).
tafsir: Or that He will not seize them as they move about, and they will not be able to elude (His grasp);

arabic: ادخلوها بسلام آمنين
english: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."
tafsir: Or He may seize them by diminishing their portion. Yet your Lord is compassionate and kind.

arabic: ونزعنا ما في صدورهم من غل إخوانا على سرر متقابلين
english: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).
tafsir: Do they not see the shadows of all things God has created incline to the right and the left, bowing in obeisance to God?

arabic: لا يمسهم فيها نصب وما هم منها بمخرجين
english: There no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave.
tafsir: All things that move on the earth and in the heavens, and the angels, bow in homage to God, and do not behave with pride.

arabic: نبئ عبادي أني أنا الغفور الرحيم
english: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;
tafsir: They have fear of God for His power over them, and act as commanded.

arabic: وأن عذابي هو العذاب الأليم
english: And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.
tafsir: God says: "Do not take to two gods, for there is only one God. So fear Me."

arabic: ونبئهم عن ضيف إبراهيم
english: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.
tafsir: Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him, and His the judgement for ever. So will you fear any other than God?

arabic: إذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلاما قال إنا منكم وجلون
english: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
tafsir: Whatsoever the blessings you enjoy are surely from God, and when in trouble you turn to Him in supplication.

arabic: قالوا لا توجل إنا نبشرك بغلام عليم
english: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
tafsir: Yet when He has delivered you from affliction, some of you ascribe companions to your Lord

arabic: قال أبشرتموني على أن مسني الكبر فبم تبشرون
english: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"
tafsir: So as to deny what We have bestowed on them. Well, enjoy yourselves, you will come to know soon.

arabic: قالوا بشرناك بالحق فلا تكن من القانطين
english: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"
tafsir: They set aside a portion of the food We have given them for those they do not know. By God, you will surely have to answer for all you contrive!

arabic: قال ومن يقنط من رحمة ربه إلا الضالون
english: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"
tafsir: They attribute daughters to God, the glorious, but for themselves whatsoever they please.

arabic: قال فما خطبكم أيها المرسلون
english: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"
tafsir: Yet when news of the birth of a daughter reaches one of them, his face is darkened, and he is overwhelmed with silent grief,

arabic: قالوا إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم مجرمين
english: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,
tafsir: And hides from people for shame at the news, (at a loss) whether he should keep her with shame, or bury her in the ground. How bad is the judgement that they make!

arabic: إلا آل لوط إنا لمنجوهم أجمعين
english: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -
tafsir: The semblance of those who believe not in the life to come is that of the meanest; but the semblance of God is the most sublime, for He is all-mighty and all-wise.

arabic: إلا امرأته قدرنا ۙ إنها لمن الغابرين
english: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."
tafsir: If God were to punish men for their inequity He would not leave a single moving thing on earth. Yet He gives them latitude for a time ordained. When that time is come, there will not be a moment's delay nor a moment's haste.

arabic: فلما جاء آل لوط المرسلون
english: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,
tafsir: Yet they attribute to God what they find detestable; and their tongues assert the lie that for them is only good. On the contrary, there is Fire for them, and they will be thrown into it.

arabic: قال إنكم قوم منكرون
english: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
tafsir: By God, We sent apostles to many a people before you, but Satan made their acts seem attractive to them, and he is their friend this day, and a painful torment awaits them.

arabic: قالوا بل جئناك بما كانوا فيه يمترون
english: They said: "Yea, we have come to thee to accomplish that of which they doubt.
tafsir: We have sent down this Book to you that you may explain to them what it is that they are differing about, and as guidance and a grace for those who believe.

arabic: وأتيناك بالحق وإنا لصادقون
english: "We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due, and assuredly we tell the truth.
tafsir: God sends down water from the skies and quickens the dead earth to a new birth. Here is a sign for those who listen.

arabic: فأسر بأهلك بقطع من الليل واتبع أدبارهم ولا يلتفت منكم أحد وامضوا حيث تؤمرون
english: "Then travel by night with thy household, when a portion of the night (yet remains), and do thou bring up the rear: let no one amongst you look back, but pass on whither ye are ordered."
tafsir: And surely in cattle there is a lesson for you: We give you a drink from the extract of food in their bellies and blood-purest milk so delicious to drink;

arabic: وقضينا إليه ذلك الأمر أن دابر هؤلاء مقطوع مصبحين
english: And We made known this decree to him, that the last remnants of those (sinners) should be cut off by the morning.
tafsir: And in fruits of the date-palm and the vine, from which you obtain inebriating drinks and excellent food. In this indeed are signs for those who understand.

arabic: وجاء أهل المدينة يستبشرون
english: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).
tafsir: Your Lord predisposed the bees to make their hives in mountains, trees and trellices,

arabic: قال إن هؤلاء ضيفي فلا تفضحون
english: Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:
tafsir: And suck from all fruits and flit about the unrestricted paths of their Lord. A drink of various hues comes out of their bellies which contains medicine for men. In this is a sign for those who reflect.

arabic: واتقوا الله ولا تخزون
english: "But fear Allah, and shame me not."
tafsir: It is God who creates you, then makes you die; and some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they had known before. God is indeed all-knowing and all-powerful.

arabic: قالوا أولم ننهك عن العالمين
english: They said: "Did we not forbid thee (to speak) for all and sundry?"
tafsir: God has favoured some of you over others in the means of subsistence. But those who have been favoured with more do not give of their means to their dependents so that they may become equal with them. Do they then deny God's beneficence?

arabic: قال هؤلاء بناتي إن كنتم فاعلين
english: He said: "There are my daughters (to marry), if ye must act (so)."
tafsir: God has provided mates for you of your own kind, and has bestowed on you sons and daughters from your mates, and has given you good things for food. Will they even then believe in the false and deny God's grace?

arabic: لعمرك إنهم لفي سكرتهم يعمهون
english: Verily, by thy life (O Prophet), in their wild intoxication, they wander in distraction, to and fro.
tafsir: Yet they worship those apart from God who cannot provide for them any sustenance from the heavens or the earth, nor will they have power to do so.

arabic: فأخذتهم الصيحة مشرقين
english: But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning,
tafsir: So do not invent similitudes for God. Indeed God knows, and you do not know.

arabic: فجعلنا عاليها سافلها وأمطرنا عليهم حجارة من سجيل
english: And We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay.
tafsir: God presents the example of a man who is a hired servant with no power over anything, and another on whom We have bestowed a handsome fortune, who spends from it in private and in public: Can they be equal? Praised be God! But most men do not understand.

arabic: إن في ذلك لآيات للمتوسمين
english: Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.
tafsir: God presents another example of two men, one dumb and unable to do a thing and is a burden on his master. Wherever he is sent he returns without any good (result). Could he be equal to one who enjoins what is just, and follows the right path?

arabic: وإنها لبسبيل مقيم
english: And the (cities were) right on the high-road.
tafsir: To God belong the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and the Hour of Doom is a matter of the winking of an eye, even less, for God has certainly power over all things.

arabic: إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين
english: Behold! in this is a sign for those who believed.
tafsir: God produced you from your mothers' wombs knowing nothing, but gave you ears and eyes and hearts so that you may be grateful.

arabic: وإن كان أصحاب الأيكة لظالمين
english: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;
tafsir: Do you not see the birds held high between the heavens and the earth? Nothing holds them (aloft) but God. There are verily signs in this for those who believe.

arabic: فانتقمنا منهم وإنهما لبإمام مبين
english: So We exacted retribution from them. They were both on an open highway, plain to see.
tafsir: God has given you homes to live in, and tents (made) from the hides of cattle convenient for days of travelling and halting; and from their wool and fur and hair you make domestic articles and goods that last a certain time.

arabic: ولقد كذب أصحاب الحجر المرسلين
english: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the messengers:
tafsir: God has given you of things created, shade, and places of shelter in the mountains, and clothes for protection against the heat, and coats (of mail) for defence during war. He thus bestows His favours on you so that you may be grateful to Him.

arabic: وآتيناهم آياتنا فكانوا عنها معرضين
english: We sent them Our Signs, but they persisted in turning away from them.
tafsir: If they still turn away, your duty is to warn them in clear terms.

arabic: وكانوا ينحتون من الجبال بيوتا آمنين
english: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.
tafsir: They do know the favours of God, and yet they deny them, for most of them are not grateful.

arabic: فأخذتهم الصيحة مصبحين
english: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,
tafsir: The day We shall call a witness from every people, the unbelievers will not be allowed to make excuses.

arabic: فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون
english: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!
tafsir: And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased, nor will they be reprieved.

arabic: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق ۗ وإن الساعة لآتية ۖ فاصفح الصفح الجميل
english: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, but for just ends. And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be manifest). So overlook (any human faults) with gracious forgiveness.
tafsir: When the idolaters see their partners they will call out: "O our Lord, these are the partners we invoked instead of You;" but they will retort: "You are liars."

arabic: إن ربك هو الخلاق العليم
english: For verily it is thy Lord who is the Master-Creator, knowing all things.
tafsir: They will offer submission to God that Day, and the lies they fabricated will not be of the least avail.

arabic: ولقد آتيناك سبعا من المثاني والقرآن العظيم
english: And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-repeated (verses) and the Grand Qur'an.
tafsir: For those who deny the truth and obstruct (others) from the way of God, We shall add torment to torment as they were perpetrating corruption.

arabic: لا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم ولا تحزن عليهم واخفض جناحك للمؤمنين
english: Strain not thine eyes. (Wistfully) at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them, nor grieve over them: but lower thy wing (in gentleness) to the believers.
tafsir: Remind them of the Day when We shall call from every people a witness against them, and make you a witness over them, for We have revealed to you the Book as an exposition of everything, and as guidance and grace and happy tidings for those who submit.

arabic: وقل إني أنا النذير المبين
english: And say: "I am indeed he that warneth openly and without ambiguity,"-
tafsir: Verily God has enjoined justice, the doing of good, and the giving of gifts to your relatives; and forbidden indecency, impropriety and oppression. He warns you so that you may remember.

arabic: كما أنزلنا على المقتسمين
english: (Of just such wrath) as We sent down on those who divided (Scripture into arbitrary parts),-
