tafsir: He said: "You see, I forgot the fish on the rock where we had stopped. Only Satan made me forget to mention this; but the wonder is the fish escaped to the sea."

arabic: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فإن جهنم جزاؤكم جزاء موفورا
english: (Allah) said: "Go thy way; if any of them follow thee, verily Hell will be the recompense of you (all)- an ample recompense.
tafsir: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps.

arabic: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك وأجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم في الأموال والأولاد وعدهم ۚ وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا
english: "Lead to destruction those whom thou canst among them, with thy (seductive) voice; make assaults on them with thy cavalry and thy infantry; mutually share with them wealth and children; and make promises to them." But Satan promises them nothing but deceit.
tafsir: Then they found one of Our votaries, whom We had blessed and given knowledge from Us.

arabic: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان ۚ وكفى بربك وكيلا
english: "As for My servants, no authority shalt thou have over them:" Enough is thy Lord for a Disposer of affairs.
tafsir: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"

arabic: ربكم الذي يزجي لكم الفلك في البحر لتبتغوا من فضله ۚ إنه كان بكم رحيما
english: Your Lord is He That maketh the Ship go smoothly for you through the sea, in order that ye may seek of his Bounty. For he is unto you most Merciful.
tafsir: He said: "You will not be able to bear with me.

arabic: وإذا مسكم الضر في البحر ضل من تدعون إلا إياه ۖ فلما نجاكم إلى البر أعرضتم ۚ وكان الإنسان كفورا
english: When distress seizes you at sea, those that ye call upon - besides Himself - leave you in the lurch! but when He brings you back safe to land, ye turn away (from Him). Most ungrateful is man!
tafsir: "How can you bear that which is beyond your comprehension?"

arabic: أفأمنتم أن يخسف بكم جانب البر أو يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا
english: Do ye then feel secure that He will not cause you to be swallowed up beneath the earth when ye are on land, or that He will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye shall find no one to carry out your affairs for you?
tafsir: "You will find me patient if God wills," said Moses; "and I will not disobey you in any thing."

arabic: أم أمنتم أن يعيدكم فيه تارة أخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ۙ ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا
english: Or do ye feel secure that He will not send you back a second time to sea and send against you a heavy gale to drown you because of your ingratitude, so that ye find no helper. Therein against Us?
tafsir: "If you must follow me," he said, "do not ask me any thing until I speak of it to you myself."

arabic: ولقد كرمنا بني آدم وحملناهم في البر والبحر ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا
english: We have honoured the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and conferred on them special favours, above a great part of our creation.
tafsir: So they set out till they (came to the quay) and went on board a ship in which he made a hole, (and Moses said:) "You have made a hole in the boat to drown its passengers? You have done a strange thing!"

arabic: يوم ندعو كل أناس بإمامهم ۖ فمن أوتي كتابه بيمينه فأولئك يقرءون كتابهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا
english: One day We shall call together all human beings with their (respective) Imams: those who are given their record in their right hand will read it (with pleasure), and they will not be dealt with unjustly in the least.
tafsir: "Did I not tell you," he replied, "that you will not be able to bear with me?"

arabic: ومن كان في هذه أعمى فهو في الآخرة أعمى وأضل سبيلا
english: But those who were blind in this world, will be blind in the hereafter, and most astray from the Path.
tafsir: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."

arabic: وإن كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذي أوحينا إليك لتفتري علينا غيره ۖ وإذا لاتخذوك خليلا
english: And their purpose was to tempt thee away from that which We had revealed unto thee, to substitute in our name something quite different; (in that case), behold! they would certainly have made thee (their) friend!
tafsir: The two went on till they came to a boy, whom he killed. Moses exclaimed: "You have killed an innocent soul who had taken no life. You have done a most abominable thing!"

arabic: ولولا أن ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن إليهم شيئا قليلا
english: And had We not given thee strength, thou wouldst nearly have inclined to them a little.
tafsir: He said: "Did I not tell you you will not be able to bear with me?"

arabic: إذا لأذقناك ضعف الحياة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا
english: In that case We should have made thee taste an equal portion (of punishment) in this life, and an equal portion in death: and moreover thou wouldst have found none to help thee against Us!
tafsir: Moses said: "If I ask you any thing again then do not keep me with you. You have my apology."

arabic: وإن كادوا ليستفزونك من الأرض ليخرجوك منها ۖ وإذا لا يلبثون خلافك إلا قليلا
english: Their purpose was to scare thee off the land, in order to expel thee; but in that case they would not have stayed (therein) after thee, except for a little while.
tafsir: The two went on till they came upon some villagers, and asked the people for food, but they refused to entertain them. There they found a wall that was crumbling, which he repaired. Moses remarked: "You could have demanded wages for it if you liked."

arabic: سنة من قد أرسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ۖ ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا
english: (This was Our) way with the messengers We sent before thee: thou wilt find no change in Our ways.
tafsir: "This is the parting of our "ways," he said. "But I will now explain the things you could not bear:

arabic: أقم الصلاة لدلوك الشمس إلى غسق الليل وقرآن الفجر ۖ إن قرآن الفجر كان مشهودا
english: Establish regular prayers - at the sun's decline till the darkness of the night, and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer and reading in the morning carry their testimony.
tafsir: That boat belonged to poor people who used to toil on the sea. I damaged it because there was a king after them who used to seize every ship by force.

arabic: ومن الليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى أن يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا
english: And pray in the small watches of the morning: (it would be) an additional prayer (or spiritual profit) for thee: soon will thy Lord raise thee to a Station of Praise and Glory!
tafsir: As for the boy, his parents were believers, but we feared that he would harass them with defiance and disbelief.

arabic: وقل رب أدخلني مدخل صدق وأخرجني مخرج صدق واجعل لي من لدنك سلطانا نصيرا
english: Say: "O my Lord! Let my entry be by the Gate of Truth and Honour, and likewise my exit by the Gate of Truth and Honour; and grant me from Thy Presence an authority to aid (me)."
tafsir: We hoped their Lord would give them a substitute better than him in virtue and goodness.

arabic: وقل جاء الحق وزهق الباطل ۚ إن الباطل كان زهوقا
english: And say: "Truth has (now) arrived, and Falsehood perished: for Falsehood is (by its nature) bound to perish."
tafsir: As for that wall, it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and their treasure was buried under it. Their father was an upright man. So your Lord willed that on reaching the age of maturity they should dig out their treasure as a favour from their Lord. So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."

arabic: وننزل من القرآن ما هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ۙ ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا
english: We send down (stage by stage) in the Qur'an that which is a healing and a mercy to those who believe: to the unjust it causes nothing but loss after loss.
tafsir: They ask you about Dhu'l-Qarnain.

arabic: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه ۖ وإذا مسه الشر كان يئوسا
english: Yet when We bestow Our favours on man, he turns away and becomes remote on his side (instead of coming to Us), and when evil seizes him he gives himself up to despair!
tafsir: Say: "I will cite before you his commemoration." We gave him authority in the land and means of accomplishing every end.

arabic: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلا
english: Say: "Everyone acts according to his own disposition: But your Lord knows best who it is that is best guided on the Way."
tafsir: So he followed a certain road

arabic: ويسألونك عن الروح ۖ قل الروح من أمر ربي وما أوتيتم من العلم إلا قليلا
english: They ask thee concerning the Spirit (of inspiration). Say: "The Spirit (cometh) by command of my Lord: of knowledge it is only a little that is communicated to you, (O men!)"
tafsir: Till he reached the point of the setting sun, and saw it set behind a muddy lake, and near it found a people. We said: "O Dhu'l-Qarnain, you may either punish them or treat them with kindness."

arabic: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي أوحينا إليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا
english: If it were Our Will, We could take away that which We have sent thee by inspiration: then wouldst thou find none to plead thy affair in that matter as against Us,-
tafsir: He said: "I shall punish whosoever is wicked. He will then be sent back to his Lord who will inflict on him a terrible punishment.

arabic: إلا رحمة من ربك ۚ إن فضله كان عليك كبيرا
english: Except for Mercy from thy Lord: for his bounty is to thee (indeed) great.
tafsir: But he who believes and does the right will have an excellent reward, and we shall make things easy for him."

arabic: قل لئن اجتمعت الإنس والجن على أن يأتوا بمثل هذا القرآن لا يأتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا
english: Say: "If the whole of mankind and Jinns were to gather together to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like thereof, even if they backed up each other with help and support.
tafsir: He then followed (another) road

arabic: ولقد صرفنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا
english: And We have explained to man, in this Qur'an, every kind of similitude: yet the greater part of men refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude!
tafsir: Till he reached the point of the rising sun, and saw it rise over a people for whom We had provided no shelter against it.

arabic: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الأرض ينبوعا
english: They say: "We shall not believe in thee, until thou cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth,
tafsir: It was so, for We were fully informed about him.

arabic: أو تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الأنهار خلالها تفجيرا
english: "Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines, and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst, carrying abundant water;
tafsir: He then followed (another) road

arabic: أو تسقط السماء كما زعمت علينا كسفا أو تأتي بالله والملائكة قبيلا
english: "Or thou cause the sky to fall in pieces, as thou sayest (will happen), against us; or thou bring Allah and the angels before (us) face to face:
tafsir: Till he reached a place between two mountains, and found this side of it a people who understood but little of what was spoken.

arabic: أو يكون لك بيت من زخرف أو ترقى في السماء ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتابا نقرؤه ۗ قل سبحان ربي هل كنت إلا بشرا رسولا
english: "Or thou have a house adorned with gold, or thou mount a ladder right into the skies. No, we shall not even believe in thy mounting until thou send down to us a book that we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord! Am I aught but a man,- a messenger?"
tafsir: They said: 'O Dhu'l-Qarnain, Gog and Magog are oppressing the land. May we pay you some tribute so that you could build a rampart between us and them?"

arabic: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى إلا أن قالوا أبعث الله بشرا رسولا
english: What kept men back from belief when Guidance came to them, was nothing but this: they said, "Has Allah sent a man (like us) to be (His) Messenger?"
tafsir: He said: "The ability my Lord has given me is better. So help me with your manual labour; I will build a wall between you and them.

arabic: قل لو كان في الأرض ملائكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السماء ملكا رسولا
english: Say, "If there were settled, on earth, angels walking about in peace and quiet, We should certainly have sent them down from the heavens an angel for a messenger."
tafsir: Bring me ingots of iron," (which they did) until the space between two mountain sides was filled up. "Blow your bellows," he said; (and they blew) until it was red hot. "Bring me molten brass," he said, "that I may pour over it."

arabic: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم ۚ إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا
english: Say: "Enough is Allah for a witness between me and you: for He is well acquainted with His servants, and He sees (all things).
tafsir: Thus (Gog and Magog) could neither climb over it nor dig a hole through (the rampart).

arabic: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ۖ ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم أولياء من دونه ۖ ونحشرهم يوم القيامة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما ۖ مأواهم جهنم ۖ كلما خبت زدناهم سعيرا
english: It is he whom Allah guides, that is on true Guidance; but he whom He leaves astray - for such wilt thou find no protector besides Him. On the Day of Judgment We shall gather, them together, prone on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf: their abode will be Hell: every time it shows abatement, We shall increase from them the fierceness of the Fire.
tafsir: "This is the benevolence of my Lord," he said; "but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will reduce it to a mound of dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."

arabic: ذلك جزاؤهم بأنهم كفروا بآياتنا وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا
english: That is their recompense, because they rejected Our signs, and said, "When we are reduced to bones and broken dust, should we really be raised up (to be) a new Creation?"
tafsir: We shall leave them on that day surging like waves pressing one against the other, and the trumpet blast will be sounded, when We shall gather them all together.

arabic: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض قادر على أن يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم أجلا لا ريب فيه فأبى الظالمون إلا كفورا
english: See they not that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, has power to create the like of them (anew)? Only He has decreed a term appointed, of which there is no doubt. But the unjust refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude.
tafsir: Then We shall bring Hell right before the infidels

arabic: قل لو أنتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي إذا لأمسكتم خشية الإنفاق ۚ وكان الإنسان قتورا
english: Say: "If ye had control of the Treasures of the Mercy of my Lord, behold, ye would keep them back, for fear of spending them: for man is (every) niggardly!"
tafsir: Whose eyes were veiled against My warning, and they could not hear.

arabic: ولقد آتينا موسى تسع آيات بينات ۖ فاسأل بني إسرائيل إذ جاءهم فقال له فرعون إني لأظنك يا موسى مسحورا
english: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Signs: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!
tafsir: Do the unbelievers think they can make My own creatures their protectors against Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of infidels.

arabic: قال لقد علمت ما أنزل هؤلاء إلا رب السماوات والأرض بصائر وإني لأظنك يا فرعون مثبورا
english: Moses said, "Thou knowest well that these things have been sent down by none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as eye-opening evidence: and I consider thee indeed, O Pharaoh, to be one doomed to destruction!"
tafsir: Say: "Shall I tell you whose labour will be wasted?

arabic: فأراد أن يستفزهم من الأرض فأغرقناه ومن معه جميعا
english: So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We did drown him and all who were with him.
tafsir: Theirs whose effort is misspent in pursuit of the pleasures of the world, even though they think they are doing good things."

arabic: وقلنا من بعده لبني إسرائيل اسكنوا الأرض فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا
english: And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel, "Dwell securely in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings came to pass, We gathered you together in a mingled crowd.
tafsir: They are those who reject the signs of their Lord, and the meeting with Him. So their good deeds will be fruitless, and on the Day of Judgement We shall not appoint any weighing for them.

arabic: وبالحق أنزلناه وبالحق نزل ۗ وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا
english: We sent down the (Qur'an) in Truth, and in Truth has it descended: and We sent thee but to give Glad Tidings and to warn (sinners).
tafsir: Their requital will be Hell, because they disbelieved and mocked My signs and messengers.

arabic: وقرآنا فرقناه لتقرأه على الناس على مكث ونزلناه تنزيلا
english: (It is) a Qur'an which We have divided (into parts from time to time), in order that thou mightest recite it to men at intervals: We have revealed it by stages.
tafsir: But surely those who believe and do the right will have gardens of Paradise as gift,

arabic: قل آمنوا به أو لا تؤمنوا ۚ إن الذين أوتوا العلم من قبله إذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للأذقان سجدا
english: Say: "Whether ye believe in it or not, it is true that those who were given knowledge beforehand, when it is recited to them, fall down on their faces in humble prostration,
tafsir: Where they will abide for ever, never wanting a change.

arabic: ويقولون سبحان ربنا إن كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا
english: "And they say: 'Glory to our Lord! Truly has the promise of our Lord been fulfilled!'"
tafsir: Say: "If the ocean turned to ink for writing down the colloquy of my Lord, the ocean itself would be exhausted ere the words (and wonders) of my Lord come to end, even if we brought another like it for replenishment."

arabic: ويخرون للأذقان يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا ۩
english: They fall down on their faces in tears, and it increases their (earnest) humility.
tafsir: Say: "I am only a man like you, but it has been communicated to me that your Lord is one and single God, and that whosoever hopes to meet his Lord should do what is right, and not associate any one in the worship of his Lord."

arabic: قل ادعوا الله أو ادعوا الرحمن ۖ أيا ما تدعوا فله الأسماء الحسنى ۚ ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا
english: Say: "Call upon Allah, or call upon Rahman: by whatever name ye call upon Him, (it is well): for to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names. Neither speak thy Prayer aloud, nor speak it in a low tone, but seek a middle course between."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وقل الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك ولم يكن له ولي من الذل ۖ وكبره تكبيرا
english: Say: "Praise be to Allah, who begets no son, and has no partner in (His) dominion: Nor (needs) He any to protect Him from humiliation: yea, magnify Him for His greatness and glory!"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الحمد لله الذي أنزل على عبده الكتاب ولم يجعل له عوجا ۜ
english: Praise be to Allah, Who hath sent to His Servant the Book, and hath allowed therein no Crookedness:
tafsir: Commemorate the beneficence of your Lord on Zachariah, His devotee,

arabic: قيما لينذر بأسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا حسنا
english: (He hath made it) Straight (and Clear) in order that He may warn (the godless) of a terrible Punishment from Him, and that He may give Glad Tidings to the Believers who work righteous deeds, that they shall have a goodly Reward,
tafsir: When he called to his Lord inwardly,

arabic: ماكثين فيه أبدا
english: Wherein they shall remain for ever:
tafsir: And said: "O my Lord, my bones decay, my head is white and hoary, yet in calling You, O Lord, I have never been deprived.

arabic: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا
english: Further, that He may warn those (also) who say, "Allah hath begotten a son":
tafsir: But I fear my relatives after me; and my wife is barren. So grant me a successor as a favour from You

arabic: ما لهم به من علم ولا لآبائهم ۚ كبرت كلمة تخرج من أفواههم ۚ إن يقولون إلا كذبا
english: No knowledge have they of such a thing, nor had their fathers. It is a grievous thing that issues from their mouths as a saying what they say is nothing but falsehood!
tafsir: Who will be heir to me, and heir to the house of Jacob; and make him obedient to You, O Lord."

arabic: فلعلك باخع نفسك على آثارهم إن لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث أسفا
english: Thou wouldst only, perchance, fret thyself to death, following after them, in grief, if they believe not in this Message.
tafsir: "O Zachariah," (it was) said, "We give you good news of a son by name of John.' To none have We attributed the name before."

arabic: إنا جعلنا ما على الأرض زينة لها لنبلوهم أيهم أحسن عملا
english: That which is on earth we have made but as a glittering show for the earth, in order that We may test them - as to which of them are best in conduct.
tafsir: "How can I have a son, O Lord" he said, "when my wife is barren and I am old and decrepit?"

arabic: وإنا لجاعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا
english: Verily what is on earth we shall make but as dust and dry soil (without growth or herbage).
tafsir: (The angel) answered: "Thus will it be. Your Lord said: 'This is easy for Me; for when I brought you into being you were nothing.'

arabic: أم حسبت أن أصحاب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من آياتنا عجبا
english: Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the Inscription were wonders among Our Sign?
tafsir: He said: "O Lord, give me a token." "Though sound," He answered, "you will not talk to any one for three nights running."

arabic: إذ أوى الفتية إلى الكهف فقالوا ربنا آتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من أمرنا رشدا
english: Behold, the youths betook themselves to the Cave: they said, "Our Lord! bestow on us Mercy from Thyself, and dispose of our affair for us in the right way!"
tafsir: So he came from the chamber to his people, and suggested to them (by signs) to sing the praises of the Lord morning and evening.

arabic: فضربنا على آذانهم في الكهف سنين عددا
english: Then We draw (a veil) over their ears, for a number of years, in the Cave, (so that they heard not):
tafsir: (We said:) "O John, hold fast to the Book;" and We gave him wisdom right from boyhood,

arabic: ثم بعثناهم لنعلم أي الحزبين أحصى لما لبثوا أمدا
english: Then We roused them, in order to test which of the two parties was best at calculating the term of years they had tarried!
tafsir: And compassion from Us, and goodness. So he was devout,

arabic: نحن نقص عليك نبأهم بالحق ۚ إنهم فتية آمنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى
english: We relate to thee their story in truth: they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We advanced them in guidance:
tafsir: And kind to his parents, neither arrogant nor disobedient.

arabic: وربطنا على قلوبهم إذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السماوات والأرض لن ندعو من دونه إلها ۖ لقد قلنا إذا شططا
english: We gave strength to their hearts: Behold, they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth: never shall we call upon any god other than Him: if we did, we should indeed have uttered an enormity!
tafsir: So peace on him the day he was born, the day he will die, and the day that he will be raised from the dead.

arabic: هؤلاء قومنا اتخذوا من دونه آلهة ۖ لولا يأتون عليهم بسلطان بين ۖ فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا
english: "These our people have taken for worship gods other than Him: why do they not bring forward an authority clear (and convincing) for what they do? Who doth more wrong than such as invent a falsehood against Allah?
tafsir: Commemorate Mary in the Book. When she withdrew from her family to a place in the East

arabic: وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا الله فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من أمركم مرفقا
english: "When ye turn away from them and the things they worship other than Allah, betake yourselves to the Cave: Your Lord will shower His mercies on you and disposes of your affair towards comfort and ease."
tafsir: And took cover from them, We sent a spirit of Ours to her who appeared before her in the concrete form of a man.

arabic: وترى الشمس إذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين وإذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم في فجوة منه ۚ ذلك من آيات الله ۗ من يهد الله فهو المهتد ۖ ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا
english: Thou wouldst have seen the sun, when it rose, declining to the right from their Cave, and when it set, turning away from them to the left, while they lay in the open space in the midst of the Cave. Such are among the Signs of Allah: He whom Allah, guides is rightly guided; but he whom Allah leaves to stray,- for him wilt thou find no protector to lead him to the Right Way.
tafsir: "I seek refuge in the Merciful from you, if you fear Him," she said.

arabic: وتحسبهم أيقاظا وهم رقود ۚ ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال ۖ وكلبهم باسط ذراعيه بالوصيد ۚ لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا
english: Thou wouldst have deemed them awake, whilst they were asleep, and We turned them on their right and on their left sides: their dog stretching forth his two fore-legs on the threshold: if thou hadst come up on to them, thou wouldst have certainly turned back from them in flight, and wouldst certainly have been filled with terror of them.
tafsir: He replied: "I am only a messenger from your Lord (sent) to bestow a good son on you."

arabic: وكذلك بعثناهم ليتساءلوا بينهم ۚ قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم ۖ قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم ۚ قالوا ربكم أعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا أحدكم بورقكم هذه إلى المدينة فلينظر أيها أزكى طعاما فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم أحدا
english: Such (being their state), we raised them up (from sleep), that they might question each other. Said one of them, "How long have ye stayed (here)?" They said, "We have stayed (perhaps) a day, or part of a day." (At length) they (all) said, "Allah (alone) knows best how long ye have stayed here.... Now send ye then one of you with this money of yours to the town: let him find out which is the best food (to be had) and bring some to you, that (ye may) satisfy your hunger therewith: And let him behave with care and courtesy, and let him not inform any one about you.
tafsir: "How can I have a son," she said, "when no man has touched me, nor am I sinful?"

arabic: إنهم إن يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم أو يعيدوكم في ملتهم ولن تفلحوا إذا أبدا
english: "For if they should come upon you, they would stone you or force you to return to their cult, and in that case ye would never attain prosperity."
tafsir: He said: "Thus will it be. Your Lord said: 'It is easy for Me,' and that: 'We shall make him a sign for men and a blessing from Us.' This is a thing already decreed."

arabic: وكذلك أعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا أن وعد الله حق وأن الساعة لا ريب فيها إذ يتنازعون بينهم أمرهم ۖ فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنيانا ۖ ربهم أعلم بهم ۚ قال الذين غلبوا على أمرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا
english: Thus did We make their case known to the people, that they might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that there can be no doubt about the Hour of Judgment. Behold, they dispute among themselves as to their affair. (Some) said, "Construct a building over them": Their Lord knows best about them: those who prevailed over their affair said, "Let us surely build a place of worship over them."
tafsir: When she conceived him she went away to a distant place.

arabic: سيقولون ثلاثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ۖ ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم ۚ قل ربي أعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم إلا قليل ۗ فلا تمار فيهم إلا مراء ظاهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم أحدا
english: (Some) say they were three, the dog being the fourth among them; (others) say they were five, the dog being the sixth,- doubtfully guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven, the dog being the eighth. Say thou: "My Lord knoweth best their number; It is but few that know their (real case)." Enter not, therefore, into controversies concerning them, except on a matter that is clear, nor consult any of them about (the affair of) the Sleepers.
tafsir: The birth pangs led her to the trunk of a date-palm tree. "Would that I had died before this," she said, "and become a thing forgotten, unremembered."

arabic: ولا تقولن لشيء إني فاعل ذلك غدا
english: Nor say of anything, "I shall be sure to do so and so tomorrow"-
tafsir: Then (a voice) called to her from below: "Grieve not; your Lord has made a rivulet gush forth right below you.

arabic: إلا أن يشاء الله ۚ واذكر ربك إذا نسيت وقل عسى أن يهدين ربي لأقرب من هذا رشدا
english: Without adding, "So please Allah!" and call thy Lord to mind when thou forgettest, and say, "I hope that my Lord will guide me ever closer (even) than this to the right road."
tafsir: Shake the trunk of the date-palm tree, and it will drop ripe dates for you.

arabic: ولبثوا في كهفهم ثلاث مائة سنين وازدادوا تسعا
english: So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years, and (some) add nine (more)
tafsir: Eat and drink, and be at peace. If you see any man, tell him: 'I have verily vowed a fast to Ar-Rahman and cannot speak to any one this day.'

arabic: قل الله أعلم بما لبثوا ۖ له غيب السماوات والأرض ۖ أبصر به وأسمع ۚ ما لهم من دونه من ولي ولا يشرك في حكمه أحدا
english: Say: "Allah knows best how long they stayed: with Him is (the knowledge of) the secrets of the heavens and the earth: how clearly He sees, how finely He hears (everything)! They have no protector other than Him; nor does He share His Command with any person whatsoever.
tafsir: Then she brought the child to her people. They exclaimed: "O Mary, you have done a most astonishing thing!

arabic: واتل ما أوحي إليك من كتاب ربك ۖ لا مبدل لكلماته ولن تجد من دونه ملتحدا
english: And recite (and teach) what has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord: none can change His Words, and none wilt thou find as a refuge other than Him.
tafsir: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a wicked person, nor your mother sinful!"

arabic: واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ۖ ولا تعد عيناك عنهم تريد زينة الحياة الدنيا ۖ ولا تطع من أغفلنا قلبه عن ذكرنا واتبع هواه وكان أمره فرطا
english: And keep thy soul content with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His Face; and let not thine eyes pass beyond them, seeking the pomp and glitter of this Life; no obey any whose heart We have permitted to neglect the remembrance of Us, one who follows his own desires, whose case has gone beyond all bounds.
tafsir: But she pointed towards him. "How can we talk to one," they said, "who is only an infant in the cradle?"

arabic: وقل الحق من ربكم ۖ فمن شاء فليؤمن ومن شاء فليكفر ۚ إنا أعتدنا للظالمين نارا أحاط بهم سرادقها ۚ وإن يستغيثوا يغاثوا بماء كالمهل يشوي الوجوه ۚ بئس الشراب وساءت مرتفقا
english: Say, "The truth is from your Lord": Let him who will believe, and let him who will, reject (it): for the wrong-doers We have prepared a Fire whose (smoke and flames), like the walls and roof of a tent, will hem them in: if they implore relief they will be granted water like melted brass, that will scald their faces, how dreadful the drink! How uncomfortable a couch to recline on!
tafsir: "I am a servant of God," he answered. "He has given me a Book and made me a prophet,

arabic: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات إنا لا نضيع أجر من أحسن عملا
english: As to those who believe and work righteousness, verily We shall not suffer to perish the reward of any who do a (single) righteous deed.
tafsir: And blessed me wherever I may be, and enjoined on me worship and zakat for as long as I live,

arabic: أولئك لهم جنات عدن تجري من تحتهم الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ويلبسون ثيابا خضرا من سندس وإستبرق متكئين فيها على الأرائك ۚ نعم الثواب وحسنت مرتفقا
english: For them will be Gardens of Eternity; beneath them rivers will flow; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade: They will recline therein on raised thrones. How good the recompense! How beautiful a couch to recline on!
tafsir: And be dutiful to my mother. He has not made me haughty or rebellious.

arabic: واضرب لهم مثلا رجلين جعلنا لأحدهما جنتين من أعناب وحففناهما بنخل وجعلنا بينهما زرعا
english: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.
tafsir: There was peace on me the day I was born, and will be the day I die, and on the day I will be raised from the dead."

arabic: كلتا الجنتين آتت أكلها ولم تظلم منه شيئا ۚ وفجرنا خلالهما نهرا
english: Each of those gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to flow.
tafsir: This was Jesus, son of Mary: A true account they contend about.

arabic: وكان له ثمر فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره أنا أكثر منك مالا وأعز نفرا
english: (Abundant) was the produce this man had: he said to his companion, in the course of a mutual argument: "more wealth have I than you, and more honour and power in (my following of) men."
tafsir: It does not behove God to have a son. Too immaculate is He! When He decrees a thing He has only to say: "Be", and it is.

arabic: ودخل جنته وهو ظالم لنفسه قال ما أظن أن تبيد هذه أبدا
english: He went into his garden in a state (of mind) unjust to his soul: He said, "I deem not that this will ever perish,
tafsir: (Jesus only said:) "Surely God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is the straight path."

arabic: وما أظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رددت إلى ربي لأجدن خيرا منها منقلبا
english: "Nor do I deem that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) come: Even if I am brought back to my Lord, I shall surely find (there) something better in exchange."
tafsir: Yet the sectarians differed among themselves. Alas for the unbelievers when they see the Terrible Day!

arabic: قال له صاحبه وهو يحاوره أكفرت بالذي خلقك من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم سواك رجلا
english: His companion said to him, in the course of the argument with him: "Dost thou deny Him Who created thee out of dust, then out of a sperm-drop, then fashioned thee into a man?
tafsir: How keenly would they hear and see when they come before Us then, even though today the evil-doers are lost in palpable error.

arabic: لكنا هو الله ربي ولا أشرك بربي أحدا
english: "But (I think) for my part that He is Allah, My Lord, and none shall I associate with my Lord.
tafsir: Warn them of that day of pining when all matters will have been settled, though they would still be unaware and unbelieving (of the truth).

arabic: ولولا إذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شاء الله لا قوة إلا بالله ۚ إن ترن أنا أقل منك مالا وولدا
english: "Why didst thou not, as thou wentest into thy garden, say: 'Allah's will (be done)! There is no power but with Allah!' If thou dost see me less than thee in wealth and sons,
tafsir: Verily We shall inherit the earth and whosoever is on it, and to Us they will return.

arabic: فعسى ربي أن يؤتين خيرا من جنتك ويرسل عليها حسبانا من السماء فتصبح صعيدا زلقا
english: "It may be that my Lord will give me something better than thy garden, and that He will send on thy garden thunderbolts (by way of reckoning) from heaven, making it (but) slippery sand!-
tafsir: Commemorate Abraham in the Book: He was upright, a prophet.

arabic: أو يصبح ماؤها غورا فلن تستطيع له طلبا
english: "Or the water of the garden will run off underground so that thou wilt never be able to find it."
tafsir: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least?

arabic: وأحيط بثمره فأصبح يقلب كفيه على ما أنفق فيها وهي خاوية على عروشها ويقول يا ليتني لم أشرك بربي أحدا
english: So his fruits (and enjoyment) were encompassed (with ruin), and he remained twisting and turning his hands over what he had spent on his property, which had (now) tumbled to pieces to its very foundations, and he could only say, "Woe is me! Would I had never ascribed partners to my Lord and Cherisher!"
tafsir: O my father, to me has come such knowledge as never came to you. So follow me that I may show you the right path.

arabic: ولم تكن له فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان منتصرا
english: Nor had he numbers to help him against Allah, nor was he able to deliver himself.
tafsir: Why do you worship Satan, O father? Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman.

arabic: هنالك الولاية لله الحق ۚ هو خير ثوابا وخير عقبا
english: There, the (only) protection comes from Allah, the True One. He is the Best to reward, and the Best to give success.
tafsir: O my father, I fear lest a punishment from Ar-Rahman should befall you, and you should become a friend of the Devil."

arabic: واضرب لهم مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء أنزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض فأصبح هشيما تذروه الرياح ۗ وكان الله على كل شيء مقتدرا
english: Set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world: It is like the rain which we send down from the skies: the earth's vegetation absorbs it, but soon it becomes dry stubble, which the winds do scatter: it is (only) Allah who prevails over all things.
tafsir: He said: "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I shall have you stoned to death. So go away for a while from me."

arabic: المال والبنون زينة الحياة الدنيا ۖ والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير أملا
english: Wealth and sons are allurements of the life of this world: But the things that endure, good deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best as (the foundation for) hopes.
tafsir: He answered: "Peace be on you. I will seek forgiveness of my Lord for you. He has been gracious to me.

arabic: ويوم نسير الجبال وترى الأرض بارزة وحشرناهم فلم نغادر منهم أحدا
english: One Day We shall remove the mountains, and thou wilt see the earth as a level stretch, and We shall gather them, all together, nor shall We leave out any one of them.
tafsir: I will leave you and those you invoke apart from God, and pray to my Lord. Haply in praying to my Lord I will not be deprived."

arabic: وعرضوا على ربك صفا لقد جئتمونا كما خلقناكم أول مرة ۚ بل زعمتم ألن نجعل لكم موعدا
english: And they will be marshalled before thy Lord in ranks, (with the announcement), "Now have ye come to Us (bare) as We created you first: aye, ye thought We shall not fulfil the appointment made to you to meet (Us)!":
tafsir: Thus, when he left them and the (idols) they worshipped, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet,

arabic: ووضع الكتاب فترى المجرمين مشفقين مما فيه ويقولون يا ويلتنا مال هذا الكتاب لا يغادر صغيرة ولا كبيرة إلا أحصاها ۚ ووجدوا ما عملوا حاضرا ۗ ولا يظلم ربك أحدا
english: And the Book (of Deeds) will be placed (before you); and thou wilt see the sinful in great terror because of what is (recorded) therein; they will say, "Ah! woe to us! what a Book is this! It leaves out nothing small or great, but takes account thereof!" They will find all that they did, placed before them: And not one will thy Lord treat with injustice.
tafsir: And bestowed on them some of Our blessings, and gave them high renown.

arabic: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس كان من الجن ففسق عن أمر ربه ۗ أفتتخذونه وذريته أولياء من دوني وهم لكم عدو ۚ بئس للظالمين بدلا
english: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!
tafsir: Commemorate Moses in the Book. He was a chosen one, both an apostle and a prophet.

arabic: ما أشهدتهم خلق السماوات والأرض ولا خلق أنفسهم وما كنت متخذ المضلين عضدا
english: I called them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor (even) their own creation: nor is it for helpers such as Me to take as lead (men) astray!
tafsir: We called him from the right side of the Mount, and brought him close for communion;

arabic: ويوم يقول نادوا شركائي الذين زعمتم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وجعلنا بينهم موبقا
english: One Day He will say, "Call on those whom ye thought to be My partners," and they will call on them, but they will not listen to them; and We shall make for them a place of common perdition.
tafsir: And bestowed on him his brother Aaron, a prophet, through Our benevolence.

arabic: ورأى المجرمون النار فظنوا أنهم مواقعوها ولم يجدوا عنها مصرفا
english: And the Sinful shall see the fire and apprehend that they have to fall therein: no means will they find to turn away therefrom.
tafsir: Commemorate Ishmael in the Book. He was true of his promise, and a messenger, a prophet.

arabic: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القرآن للناس من كل مثل ۚ وكان الإنسان أكثر شيء جدلا
english: We have explained in detail in this Qur'an, for the benefit of mankind, every kind of similitude: but man is, in most things, contentious.
tafsir: He enjoined on his household worship and zakat, and he was obedient to his Lord.

arabic: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى ويستغفروا ربهم إلا أن تأتيهم سنة الأولين أو يأتيهم العذاب قبلا
english: And what is there to keep back men from believing, now that Guidance has come to them, nor from praying for forgiveness from their Lord, but that (they ask that) the ways of the ancients be repeated with them, or the Wrath be brought to them face to face?
tafsir: Commemorate Enoch in the Book. He was a truthful person and a prophet,

arabic: وما نرسل المرسلين إلا مبشرين ومنذرين ۚ ويجادل الذين كفروا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق ۖ واتخذوا آياتي وما أنذروا هزوا
english: We only send the messengers to give Glad Tidings and to give warnings: But the unbelievers dispute with vain argument, in order therewith to weaken the truth, and they treat My Signs as a jest, as also the fact that they are warned!
tafsir: And We raised him to an exalted station.

arabic: ومن أظلم ممن ذكر بآيات ربه فأعرض عنها ونسي ما قدمت يداه ۚ إنا جعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا ۖ وإن تدعهم إلى الهدى فلن يهتدوا إذا أبدا
english: And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord, but turns away from them, forgetting the (deeds) which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this, and over their ears, deafness, if thou callest them to guidance, even then will they never accept guidance.
tafsir: These are (some of) those who were favoured by God among the prophets of the progeny of Adam, and of those We bore in the ark with Noah, and the offspring of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and We chose, for they bowed weeping in adoration when the revelations of Ar-Rahman were recited to them.

arabic: وربك الغفور ذو الرحمة ۖ لو يؤاخذهم بما كسبوا لعجل لهم العذاب ۚ بل لهم موعد لن يجدوا من دونه موئلا
english: But your Lord is Most forgiving, full of Mercy. If He were to call them (at once) to account for what they have earned, then surely He would have hastened their punishment: but they have their appointed time, beyond which they will find no refuge.
tafsir: But they are succeeded by a generation who neglect their devotional obligations and follow only earthly pleasures; but they will reach the wrong road and meet destruction,

arabic: وتلك القرى أهلكناهم لما ظلموا وجعلنا لمهلكهم موعدا
english: Such were the populations we destroyed when they committed iniquities; but we fixed an appointed time for their destruction.
tafsir: Except those who repent and come to believe and do the right. These will enter Paradise and will not be wronged the least

arabic: وإذ قال موسى لفتاه لا أبرح حتى أبلغ مجمع البحرين أو أمضي حقبا
english: Behold, Moses said to his attendant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and years in travel."
tafsir: In the gardens of Eden promised by Ar-Rahman to His creatures in the unknown (future). Verily His promise will come to pass.

arabic: فلما بلغا مجمع بينهما نسيا حوتهما فاتخذ سبيله في البحر سربا
english: But when they reached the Junction, they forgot (about) their Fish, which took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.
tafsir: They will hear no vain talk there, but only salutations of peace, and they will have their sustenance morning and evening."

arabic: فلما جاوزا قال لفتاه آتنا غداءنا لقد لقينا من سفرنا هذا نصبا
english: When they had passed on (some distance), Moses said to his attendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much fatigue at this (stage of) our journey."
tafsir: This is the Paradise those of Our creatures will inherit who take heed and fear the displeasure of God.

arabic: قال أرأيت إذ أوينا إلى الصخرة فإني نسيت الحوت وما أنسانيه إلا الشيطان أن أذكره ۚ واتخذ سبيله في البحر عجبا
english: He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through the sea in a marvellous way!"
tafsir: "We do not come down," (will the angels say) "but only by your Lord's command." To Him belongs whatever lies before us and behind us, and the space in between. Your Lord does not ever forget:

arabic: قال ذلك ما كنا نبغ ۚ فارتدا على آثارهما قصصا
english: Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after:" So they went back on their footsteps, following (the path they had come).
tafsir: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them. Therefore worship Him, and be constant in His worship. Do you know any namesake of His?

arabic: فوجدا عبدا من عبادنا آتيناه رحمة من عندنا وعلمناه من لدنا علما
english: So they found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed Mercy from Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own Presence.
tafsir: Yet man says: "When I am dead, will I come to life again?"

arabic: قال له موسى هل أتبعك على أن تعلمن مما علمت رشدا
english: Moses said to him: "May I follow thee, on the footing that thou teach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been taught?"
tafsir: Does man not remember that before We created him he was nothing?

arabic: قال إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
english: (The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience with me!"
tafsir: By your Lord, We shall gather them and the devils together, then bring them crawling on their knees around Hell.

arabic: وكيف تصبر على ما لم تحط به خبرا
english: "And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy understanding is not complete?"
tafsir: We shall pull out of every section those who were most perversely rebellious against Ar-Rahman.

arabic: قال ستجدني إن شاء الله صابرا ولا أعصي لك أمرا
english: Moses said: "Thou wilt find me, if Allah so will, (truly) patient: nor shall I disobey thee in aught."
tafsir: We know best who deserve to be burnt in (the Fire).

arabic: قال فإن اتبعتني فلا تسألني عن شيء حتى أحدث لك منه ذكرا
english: The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me, ask me no questions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning it."
tafsir: There is not one among you who will not reach it. Your Lord has made this incumbent on Himself.

arabic: فانطلقا حتى إذا ركبا في السفينة خرقها ۖ قال أخرقتها لتغرق أهلها لقد جئت شيئا إمرا
english: So they both proceeded: until, when they were in the boat, he scuttled it. Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!"
tafsir: We shall deliver those who took heed for themselves, and leave the evil-doers kneeling there.

arabic: قال ألم أقل إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
english: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
tafsir: When Our lucid revelations are read out to them, the infidels say to those who believe: "Which of the two groups is better in standing, and whose company is more excellent?"

arabic: قال لا تؤاخذني بما نسيت ولا ترهقني من أمري عسرا
english: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case."
tafsir: How many generations that had far more wealth and ostentation have We laid low before them!

arabic: فانطلقا حتى إذا لقيا غلاما فقتله قال أقتلت نفسا زكية بغير نفس لقد جئت شيئا نكرا
english: Then they proceeded: until, when they met a young man, he slew him. Moses said: "Hast thou slain an innocent person who had slain none? Truly a foul (unheard of) thing hast thou done!"
tafsir: Say: "Ar-Rahman extends the life of those who are astray until they come to realise what had been promised them was either (physical) affliction or (the terror) of Resurrection. Then will they know who is worse in position, and who is weak in supporters.

arabic: قال ألم أقل لك إنك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
english: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
tafsir: God gives greater guidance to those who are guided; and good deeds that endure are better with your Lord for reward, and better for consequence.

arabic: قال إن سألتك عن شيء بعدها فلا تصاحبني ۖ قد بلغت من لدني عذرا
english: (Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side."
tafsir: Have you seen him who denies Our revelations, and says: "I will certainly be given wealth and children."

arabic: فانطلقا حتى إذا أتيا أهل قرية استطعما أهلها فأبوا أن يضيفوهما فوجدا فيها جدارا يريد أن ينقض فأقامه ۖ قال لو شئت لاتخذت عليه أجرا
english: Then they proceeded: until, when they came to the inhabitants of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused them hospitality. They found there a wall on the point of falling down, but he set it up straight. (Moses) said: "If thou hadst wished, surely thou couldst have exacted some recompense for it!"
tafsir: Has he peeped into the Unknown, or obtained a promise from Ar-Rahman?

arabic: قال هذا فراق بيني وبينك ۚ سأنبئك بتأويل ما لم تستطع عليه صبرا
english: He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I tell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience.
tafsir: Never so. We shall certainly write down what he says, and prolong the extent of his punishment.

arabic: أما السفينة فكانت لمساكين يعملون في البحر فأردت أن أعيبها وكان وراءهم ملك يأخذ كل سفينة غصبا
english: "As for the boat, it belonged to certain men in dire want: they plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable, for there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by force.
tafsir: All that he claims will revert to Us, and he will come before Us all alone.

arabic: وأما الغلام فكان أبواه مؤمنين فخشينا أن يرهقهما طغيانا وكفرا
english: "As for the youth, his parents were people of Faith, and we feared that he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude (to Allah and man).
tafsir: They have taken other gods apart from God that they might be a strength to them.

arabic: فأردنا أن يبدلهما ربهما خيرا منه زكاة وأقرب رحما
english: "So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a son) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.
tafsir: Never. They will deny their devotion and become their adversaries.

arabic: وأما الجدار فكان لغلامين يتيمين في المدينة وكان تحته كنز لهما وكان أبوهما صالحا فأراد ربك أن يبلغا أشدهما ويستخرجا كنزهما رحمة من ربك ۚ وما فعلته عن أمري ۚ ذلك تأويل ما لم تسطع عليه صبرا
english: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."
tafsir: Do you not see that We have set the devils against the infidels to rouse and instigate them?

arabic: ويسألونك عن ذي القرنين ۖ قل سأتلو عليكم منه ذكرا
english: They ask thee concerning Zul-qarnain. Say, "I will rehearse to you something of his story."
tafsir: So, do not be hasty with them. We are counting their number (of days).

arabic: إنا مكنا له في الأرض وآتيناه من كل شيء سببا
english: Verily We established his power on earth, and We gave him the ways and the means to all ends.
tafsir: The day We shall usher the righteous before Ar-Rahman like envoys into the presence of a king,

arabic: فأتبع سببا
english: One (such) way he followed,
tafsir: And drive the wicked into Hell like cattle driven to water,

arabic: حتى إذا بلغ مغرب الشمس وجدها تغرب في عين حمئة ووجد عندها قوما ۗ قلنا يا ذا القرنين إما أن تعذب وإما أن تتخذ فيهم حسنا
english: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of murky water: Near it he found a People: We said: "O Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority,) either to punish them, or to treat them with kindness."
tafsir: None will have power to intercede for them except one who obtains a promise from Ar-Rahman.

arabic: قال أما من ظلم فسوف نعذبه ثم يرد إلى ربه فيعذبه عذابا نكرا
english: He said: "Whoever doth wrong, him shall we punish; then shall he be sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a punishment unheard-of (before).
tafsir: They say: "God has begotten a son."

arabic: وأما من آمن وعمل صالحا فله جزاء الحسنى ۖ وسنقول له من أمرنا يسرا
english: "But whoever believes, and works righteousness,- he shall have a goodly reward, and easy will be his task as We order it by our Command."
tafsir: You have uttered a grievous thing

arabic: ثم أتبع سببا
english: Then followed he (another) way,
tafsir: Which would cleave the skies asunder, rend the earth, and split the mountains,

arabic: حتى إذا بلغ مطلع الشمس وجدها تطلع على قوم لم نجعل لهم من دونها سترا
english: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no covering protection against the sun.
tafsir: For they have attributed a son to Ar-Rahman,

arabic: كذلك وقد أحطنا بما لديه خبرا
english: (He left them) as they were: We completely understood what was before him.
tafsir: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son.

arabic: ثم أتبع سببا
english: Then followed he (another) way,
tafsir: There is no one in the heavens and the earth but comes before Ar-Rahman in all obedience.

arabic: حتى إذا بلغ بين السدين وجد من دونهما قوما لا يكادون يفقهون قولا
english: Until, when he reached (a tract) between two mountains, he found, beneath them, a people who scarcely understood a word.
tafsir: He has counted them and calculated their number.

arabic: قالوا يا ذا القرنين إن يأجوج ومأجوج مفسدون في الأرض فهل نجعل لك خرجا على أن تجعل بيننا وبينهم سدا
english: They said: "O Zul-qarnain! the Gog and Magog (People) do great mischief on earth: shall we then render thee tribute in order that thou mightest erect a barrier between us and them?
tafsir: Every one of them will come before Him all alone on the Day of Resurrection.

arabic: قال ما مكني فيه ربي خير فأعينوني بقوة أجعل بينكم وبينهم ردما
english: He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is better (than tribute): Help me therefore with strength (and labour): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them:
tafsir: Surely Ar-Rahman will show love for those who believe and do the right.

arabic: آتوني زبر الحديد ۖ حتى إذا ساوى بين الصدفين قال انفخوا ۖ حتى إذا جعله نارا قال آتوني أفرغ عليه قطرا
english: "Bring me blocks of iron." At length, when he had filled up the space between the two steep mountain-sides, He said, "Blow (with your bellows)" Then, when he had made it (red) as fire, he said: "Bring me, that I may pour over it, molten lead."
tafsir: So We have made this (Qur'an) easy in your tongue that you may give good news to those who take heed, and warn the people who are contentious.

arabic: فما اسطاعوا أن يظهروه وما استطاعوا له نقبا
english: Thus were they made powerless to scale it or to dig through it.
tafsir: How many generations have We laid low before them. Do you see any sign of them, or hear the least whisper of them?

arabic: قال هذا رحمة من ربي ۖ فإذا جاء وعد ربي جعله دكاء ۖ وكان وعد ربي حقا
english: He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it into dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وتركنا بعضهم يومئذ يموج في بعض ۖ ونفخ في الصور فجمعناهم جمعا
english: On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another: the trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وعرضنا جهنم يومئذ للكافرين عرضا
english: And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see, all spread out,-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: الذين كانت أعينهم في غطاء عن ذكري وكانوا لا يستطيعون سمعا
english: (Unbelievers) whose eyes had been under a veil from remembrance of Me, and who had been unable even to hear.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أفحسب الذين كفروا أن يتخذوا عبادي من دوني أولياء ۚ إنا أعتدنا جهنم للكافرين نزلا
english: Do the Unbelievers think that they can take My servants as protectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the Unbelievers for (their) entertainment.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل هل ننبئكم بالأخسرين أعمالا
english: Say: "Shall we tell you of those who lose most in respect of their deeds?-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: الذين ضل سعيهم في الحياة الدنيا وهم يحسبون أنهم يحسنون صنعا
english: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life, while they thought that they were acquiring good by their works?"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أولئك الذين كفروا بآيات ربهم ولقائه فحبطت أعمالهم فلا نقيم لهم يوم القيامة وزنا
english: They are those who deny the Signs of their Lord and the fact of their having to meet Him (in the Hereafter): vain will be their works, nor shall We, on the Day of Judgment, give them any weight.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ذلك جزاؤهم جهنم بما كفروا واتخذوا آياتي ورسلي هزوا
english: That is their reward, Hell, because they rejected Faith, and took My Signs and My Messengers by way of jest.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات كانت لهم جنات الفردوس نزلا
english: As to those who believe and work righteous deeds, they have, for their entertainment, the Gardens of Paradise,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: خالدين فيها لا يبغون عنها حولا
english: Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for from them.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل لو كان البحر مدادا لكلمات ربي لنفد البحر قبل أن تنفد كلمات ربي ولو جئنا بمثله مددا
english: Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of my Lord, sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words of my Lord, even if we added another ocean like it, for its aid."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل إنما أنا بشر مثلكم يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد ۖ فمن كان يرجو لقاء ربه فليعمل عملا صالحا ولا يشرك بعبادة ربه أحدا
english: Say: "I am but a man like yourselves, (but) the inspiration has come to me, that your Allah is one Allah: whoever expects to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and, in the worship of his Lord, admit no one as partner.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم كهيعص
english: Kaf. Ha. Ya. 'Ain. Sad.
tafsir: We have not sent down the Qur'an to you that you should be burdened,

arabic: ذكر رحمت ربك عبده زكريا
english: (This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zakariya.
tafsir: But as admonition for him who fears --

arabic: إذ نادى ربه نداء خفيا
english: Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret,
tafsir: A revelation from Him who created the earth and the high ascending skies,

arabic: قال رب إني وهن العظم مني واشتعل الرأس شيبا ولم أكن بدعائك رب شقيا
english: Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones, and the hair of my head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest, O my Lord, in my prayer to Thee!
tafsir: The ever-merciful, established on the throne (of authority).

arabic: وإني خفت الموالي من ورائي وكانت امرأتي عاقرا فهب لي من لدنك وليا
english: "Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,-
tafsir: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth and in between them, belongs to Him, as whatever lies under the earth.

arabic: يرثني ويرث من آل يعقوب ۖ واجعله رب رضيا
english: "(One that) will (truly) represent me, and represent the posterity of Jacob; and make him, O my Lord! one with whom Thou art well-pleased!"
tafsir: Whether you say a thing aloud or inaudibly, He has knowledge of the secret and the hidden.

arabic: يا زكريا إنا نبشرك بغلام اسمه يحيى لم نجعل له من قبل سميا
english: (His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of a son: His name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We conferred distinction before."
tafsir: God: There is no god but He. To Him belong the attributes most beautiful.

arabic: قال رب أنى يكون لي غلام وكانت امرأتي عاقرا وقد بلغت من الكبر عتيا
english: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
tafsir: Has the story of Moses come to you?

arabic: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين وقد خلقتك من قبل ولم تك شيئا
english: He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!'"
tafsir: When he saw a fire he said to his family: "You wait here. I have seen a fire. I may haply be able to bring an ember from it, or find direction by the fire."

arabic: قال رب اجعل لي آية ۚ قال آيتك ألا تكلم الناس ثلاث ليال سويا
english: (Zakariya) said: "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights, although thou art not dumb."
tafsir: When he approached it, a voice called out:

arabic: فخرج على قومه من المحراب فأوحى إليهم أن سبحوا بكرة وعشيا
english: So Zakariya came out to his people from him chamber: He told them by signs to celebrate Allah's praises in the morning and in the evening.
tafsir: "O Moses, I am verily your Lord, so take off your shoes, for you are in the holy plain of Towa.

arabic: يا يحيى خذ الكتاب بقوة ۖ وآتيناه الحكم صبيا
english: (To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book with might": and We gave him Wisdom even as a youth,
tafsir: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed to you.

arabic: وحنانا من لدنا وزكاة ۖ وكان تقيا
english: And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout,
tafsir: I am God, and there is no god but I, so serve Me, and observe acts of prayer to remember Me.

arabic: وبرا بوالديه ولم يكن جبارا عصيا
english: And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
tafsir: Verily the Hour (of the great change) is about to come. I keep it secret that every soul may be rewarded for its endeavour.

arabic: وسلام عليه يوم ولد ويوم يموت ويوم يبعث حيا
english: So Peace on him the day he was born, the day that he dies, and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)!
tafsir: So do not let those who do not believe in it and follow their vain desires, turn you away from it.

arabic: واذكر في الكتاب مريم إذ انتبذت من أهلها مكانا شرقيا
english: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.
tafsir: What is that in your right band, O Moses?"

arabic: فاتخذت من دونهم حجابا فأرسلنا إليها روحنا فتمثل لها بشرا سويا
english: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.
tafsir: "It's my staff," he answered; "I lean on it, and fell leaves for my goats with it, and I have other uses for it."

arabic: قالت إني أعوذ بالرحمن منك إن كنت تقيا
english: She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."
tafsir: "Throw it down, O Moses," said (the Voice).

arabic: قال إنما أنا رسول ربك لأهب لك غلاما زكيا
english: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.
tafsir: So he threw it down, and lo, it became a running serpent.

arabic: قالت أنى يكون لي غلام ولم يمسسني بشر ولم أك بغيا
english: She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?"
tafsir: "Catch it," said He, "and have no fear; We shall revert it to its former state.

arabic: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين ۖ ولنجعله آية للناس ورحمة منا ۚ وكان أمرا مقضيا
english: He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us': It is a matter (so) decreed."
tafsir: And face what is to come with patience, your hand will not be tarnished with blame: Another sign

arabic: فحملته فانتبذت به مكانا قصيا
english: So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place.
tafsir: That We may go on showing you Our greater signs.

arabic: فأجاءها المخاض إلى جذع النخلة قالت يا ليتني مت قبل هذا وكنت نسيا منسيا
english: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: She cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!"
tafsir: Go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious."

arabic: فناداها من تحتها ألا تحزني قد جعل ربك تحتك سريا
english: But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
tafsir: Moses said: "O my Lord, enlarge my breast,

arabic: وهزي إليك بجذع النخلة تساقط عليك رطبا جنيا
english: "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.
tafsir: And make my mission easy.

arabic: فكلي واشربي وقري عينا ۖ فإما ترين من البشر أحدا فقولي إني نذرت للرحمن صوما فلن أكلم اليوم إنسيا
english: "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, 'I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being'"
tafsir: Remove the defect of my tongue

arabic: فأتت به قومها تحمله ۖ قالوا يا مريم لقد جئت شيئا فريا
english: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!
tafsir: That they may understand my speech,

arabic: يا أخت هارون ما كان أبوك امرأ سوء وما كانت أمك بغيا
english: "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!"
tafsir: And give me as assistant from my family

arabic: فأشارت إليه ۖ قالوا كيف نكلم من كان في المهد صبيا
english: But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"
tafsir: Aaron my brother

arabic: قال إني عبد الله آتاني الكتاب وجعلني نبيا
english: He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me revelation and made me a prophet;
tafsir: To strengthen me

arabic: وجعلني مباركا أين ما كنت وأوصاني بالصلاة والزكاة ما دمت حيا
english: "And He hath made me blessed wheresoever I be, and hath enjoined on me Prayer and Charity as long as I live;
tafsir: And share my task,

arabic: وبرا بوالدتي ولم يجعلني جبارا شقيا
english: "(He) hath made me kind to my mother, and not overbearing or miserable;
tafsir: That we may sing Your praises much,

arabic: والسلام علي يوم ولدت ويوم أموت ويوم أبعث حيا
english: "So peace is on me the day I was born, the day that I die, and the day that I shall be raised up to life (again)"!
tafsir: And remember you a great deal.

arabic: ذلك عيسى ابن مريم ۚ قول الحق الذي فيه يمترون
english: Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth, about which they (vainly) dispute.
tafsir: Surely You know us well."

arabic: ما كان لله أن يتخذ من ولد ۖ سبحانه ۚ إذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون
english: It is not befitting to (the majesty of) Allah that He should beget a son. Glory be to Him! when He determines a matter, He only says to it, "Be", and it is.
tafsir: He answered: "Granted is your prayer, O Moses.

arabic: وإن الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه ۚ هذا صراط مستقيم
english: Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye: this is a Way that is straight.
tafsir: We have bestowed Our favour on you before this

arabic: فاختلف الأحزاب من بينهم ۖ فويل للذين كفروا من مشهد يوم عظيم
english: But the sects differ among themselves: and woe to the unbelievers because of the (coming) Judgment of a Momentous Day!
tafsir: When We told your mother what We relate:

arabic: أسمع بهم وأبصر يوم يأتوننا ۖ لكن الظالمون اليوم في ضلال مبين
english: How plainly will they see and hear, the Day that they will appear before Us! but the unjust today are in error manifest!
tafsir: 'Put him in a wooden box and cast it in the river. The river will cast it on the bank. An enemy of Ours, and his, will retrieve it.' We bestowed Our love on you that you may be reared under Our eyes.

arabic: وأنذرهم يوم الحسرة إذ قضي الأمر وهم في غفلة وهم لا يؤمنون
english: But warn them of the Day of Distress, when the matter will be determined: for (behold,) they are negligent and they do not believe!
tafsir: Then your sister followed you, and said (to the people who had retrieved the child): 'Should I guide you to a person who can nurse him?' We thus brought you back to your mother that her heart may be cheered, and she may not grieve. (Remember) when you killed a man We saved you from anguish; and tested and steeled you (in other ways). Afterwards you sojourned for several years with the people of Midian; then you came up to the measure,

arabic: إنا نحن نرث الأرض ومن عليها وإلينا يرجعون
english: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.
tafsir: And I chose you for Myself.

arabic: واذكر في الكتاب إبراهيم ۚ إنه كان صديقا نبيا
english: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.
tafsir: Go with My signs, you and your brother, and do not be lax in remembering Me.

arabic: إذ قال لأبيه يا أبت لم تعبد ما لا يسمع ولا يبصر ولا يغني عنك شيئا
english: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?
tafsir: Then go to the Pharaoh as he has become exceedingly rebellious.

arabic: يا أبت إني قد جاءني من العلم ما لم يأتك فاتبعني أهدك صراطا سويا
english: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.
tafsir: Speak to him gently. He may possibly take heed or may come to have fear."

arabic: يا أبت لا تعبد الشيطان ۖ إن الشيطان كان للرحمن عصيا
english: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.
tafsir: They said: "O our Lord, we are really frightened lest he behave insolently with us or become violent."

arabic: يا أبت إني أخاف أن يمسك عذاب من الرحمن فتكون للشيطان وليا
english: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."
tafsir: (The Lord) said: "Be not afraid. I am verily with you, and I hear and see.

arabic: قال أراغب أنت عن آلهتي يا إبراهيم ۖ لئن لم تنته لأرجمنك ۖ واهجرني مليا
english: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
tafsir: So go to him and say: 'The two of us have indeed been sent by your Lord. So let the children of Israel come with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a token from your Lord. Peace on him who follows the way of guidance.

arabic: قال سلام عليك ۖ سأستغفر لك ربي ۖ إنه كان بي حفيا
english: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
tafsir: It has been revealed to us that punishment will befall him who denies and turns away.

arabic: وأعتزلكم وما تدعون من دون الله وأدعو ربي عسى ألا أكون بدعاء ربي شقيا
english: "And I will turn away from you (all) and from those whom ye invoke besides Allah: I will call on my Lord: perhaps, by my prayer to my Lord, I shall be not unblest."
tafsir: He asked: "Who then is that Lord of yours, O Moses?"

arabic: فلما اعتزلهم وما يعبدون من دون الله وهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب ۖ وكلا جعلنا نبيا
english: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.
tafsir: (Moses) said: "Our Lord is He who gave everything its natural form and directed it."

arabic: ووهبنا لهم من رحمتنا وجعلنا لهم لسان صدق عليا
english: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said: "And what about the former generations?"

arabic: واذكر في الكتاب موسى ۚ إنه كان مخلصا وكان رسولا نبيا
english: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
tafsir: (Moses) replied: "Knowledge of that is with my Lord (recorded) in the Book. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

arabic: وناديناه من جانب الطور الأيمن وقربناه نجيا
english: And we called him from the right side of Mount (Sinai), and made him draw near to Us, for mystic (converse).
tafsir: It is He who made the earth a bed for you, and traced for you paths upon it, and sends down water from the sky, and brings out through it every kind of vegetation

arabic: ووهبنا له من رحمتنا أخاه هارون نبيا
english: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.
tafsir: To eat and feed your cattle. Surely there are signs in these for those who are wise.

arabic: واذكر في الكتاب إسماعيل ۚ إنه كان صادق الوعد وكان رسولا نبيا
english: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
tafsir: We created you from the earth and will revert you back to it; and raise you up from it a second time.

arabic: وكان يأمر أهله بالصلاة والزكاة وكان عند ربه مرضيا
english: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
tafsir: So We showed him all Our signs, but he denied them and refused,

arabic: واذكر في الكتاب إدريس ۚ إنه كان صديقا نبيا
english: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:
tafsir: And said: "Have you come to us, O Moses, to drive us out of our land with your witchery?

arabic: ورفعناه مكانا عليا
english: And We raised him to a lofty station.
tafsir: We shall certainly meet you with like magic. So make an appointment when we and you could meet on common ground, which neither we nor you should fail to keep."

arabic: أولئك الذين أنعم الله عليهم من النبيين من ذرية آدم وممن حملنا مع نوح ومن ذرية إبراهيم وإسرائيل وممن هدينا واجتبينا ۚ إذا تتلى عليهم آيات الرحمن خروا سجدا وبكيا ۩
english: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.
tafsir: Said (Moses): "Let your meeting be on the day of the Feast, and let people assemble in broad daylight."

arabic: فخلف من بعدهم خلف أضاعوا الصلاة واتبعوا الشهوات ۖ فسوف يلقون غيا
english: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-
tafsir: After this the Pharaoh withdrew and settled his stratagem, then came back.

arabic: إلا من تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا فأولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون شيئا
english: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-
tafsir: Moses said to them: "Woe betide you. Do not fabricate a lie against God, or He will destroy you with some affliction. For he who fabricates lies is doomed to failure."

arabic: جنات عدن التي وعد الرحمن عباده بالغيب ۚ إنه كان وعده مأتيا
english: Gardens of Eternity, those which (Allah) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.
tafsir: So they discussed their strategy among themselves and conferred privately,

arabic: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا إلا سلاما ۖ ولهم رزقهم فيها بكرة وعشيا
english: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.
tafsir: (And) said: "These two are surely magicians. They want to deprive you of your land with their magic, and eradicate your distinct way (of life).

arabic: تلك الجنة التي نورث من عبادنا من كان تقيا
english: Such is the Garden which We give as an inheritance to those of Our servants who guard against Evil.
tafsir: So prepare your strategy and come forward. He alone shall win today who is superior."

arabic: وما نتنزل إلا بأمر ربك ۖ له ما بين أيدينا وما خلفنا وما بين ذلك ۚ وما كان ربك نسيا
english: (The angels say:) "We descend not but by command of thy Lord: to Him belongeth what is before us and what is behind us, and what is between: and thy Lord never doth forget,-
tafsir: They said: "Either you cast (your spell), O Moses, or we shall cast it first."

arabic: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما فاعبده واصطبر لعبادته ۚ هل تعلم له سميا
english: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
tafsir: Moses said: "No. You cast it first" Then it seemed to Moses that by their magic their cords and rods were flying;

arabic: ويقول الإنسان أإذا ما مت لسوف أخرج حيا
english: Man says: "What! When I am dead, shall I then be raised up alive?"
tafsir: And Moses felt afraid within himself.

arabic: أولا يذكر الإنسان أنا خلقناه من قبل ولم يك شيئا
english: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
tafsir: We said to him: "Fear not. You will certainly be victorious.

arabic: فوربك لنحشرنهم والشياطين ثم لنحضرنهم حول جهنم جثيا
english: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;
tafsir: Throw down what is in your right hand: It will swallow up what they have conjured. For what they have fashioned is only a trick of the sorcerer; and a sorcerer does not succeed wherever he may come."

arabic: ثم لننزعن من كل شيعة أيهم أشد على الرحمن عتيا
english: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
tafsir: The magicians, (seeing the miracle), fell down in prostration, saying: "We believe in the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

arabic: ثم لنحن أعلم بالذين هم أولى بها صليا
english: And certainly We know best those who are most worthy of being burned therein.
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said: "You have come to believe without my dispensation. Surely he is your chief who taught you magic. I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides and crucify you on the trunks of date-palm trees. You will come to know whose punishment is harder and protracted."

arabic: وإن منكم إلا واردها ۚ كان على ربك حتما مقضيا
english: Not one of you but will pass over it: this is, with thy Lord, a Decree which must be accomplished.
tafsir: They replied: "We cannot choose you in the face of the clear testimony we have received, and over Him who created us. So do what you are determined to do. All that you would do will only be confined to our life on earth.

arabic: ثم ننجي الذين اتقوا ونذر الظالمين فيها جثيا
english: But We shall save those who guarded against evil, and We shall leave the wrong-doers therein, (humbled) to their knees.
tafsir: We have certainly come to believe in our Lord that He may forgive our trespasses and the magic you have forced us to perform, for God is nobler and abiding."

arabic: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أي الفريقين خير مقاما وأحسن نديا
english: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, the Unbelievers say to those who believe, "Which of the two sides is best in point of position? Which makes the best show in council?"
tafsir: Surely for him who comes before his Lord a sinner shall be Hell, where he will neither die nor live.

arabic: وكم أهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم أحسن أثاثا ورئيا
