english: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
tafsir: But whoever comes before Him a believer having done good deeds, will be raised to higher stations --

arabic: قل من كان في الضلالة فليمدد له الرحمن مدا ۚ حتى إذا رأوا ما يوعدون إما العذاب وإما الساعة فسيعلمون من هو شر مكانا وأضعف جندا
english: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
tafsir: Gardens of Eden with rippling streams, where he will live for ever. This is the recompense of those who achieve integrity.

arabic: ويزيد الله الذين اهتدوا هدى ۗ والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير مردا
english: "And Allah doth advance in guidance those who seek guidance: and the things that endure, Good Deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best in respect of (their) eventual return."
tafsir: We commanded Moses: "Journey by night with Our creatures, and strike a dry path for them through the sea. Do not fear being overtaken, nor have dread of any thing."

arabic: أفرأيت الذي كفر بآياتنا وقال لأوتين مالا وولدا
english: Hast thou then seen the (sort of) man who rejects Our Signs, yet says: "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"
tafsir: Then the Pharaoh followed them with his army, but the sea overpowered and engulfed them.

arabic: أطلع الغيب أم اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
english: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
tafsir: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.

arabic: كلا ۚ سنكتب ما يقول ونمد له من العذاب مدا
english: Nay! We shall record what he says, and We shall add and add to his punishment.
tafsir: O children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and made a covenant with you on the right side of the Mount, and sent down for you manna and quails,

arabic: ونرثه ما يقول ويأتينا فردا
english: To Us shall return all that he talks of and he shall appear before Us bare and alone.
tafsir: (And said): "Eat of the good things We have given you for food, and do not exceed the bounds (of law) in this, or My wrath will surely fall upon you; and he who incurs My wrath will fall into the abyss.

arabic: واتخذوا من دون الله آلهة ليكونوا لهم عزا
english: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!
tafsir: Yet I am gracious to him who repents and believes, and does the right, and follows the straight path.

arabic: كلا ۚ سيكفرون بعبادتهم ويكونون عليهم ضدا
english: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
tafsir: What made you hurry away, O Moses, from your people?"

arabic: ألم تر أنا أرسلنا الشياطين على الكافرين تؤزهم أزا
english: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
tafsir: He said: "They are right behind me. I have hastened to You, O Lord, so that You may be pleased."

arabic: فلا تعجل عليهم ۖ إنما نعد لهم عدا
english: So make no haste against them, for We but count out to them a (limited) number (of days).
tafsir: He said: "We have put your people on trial in your absence; and Sameri has led them astray."

arabic: يوم نحشر المتقين إلى الرحمن وفدا
english: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
tafsir: So Moses returned to his people full of anger and regret. "O my people," he said, "did not your Lord make you a better promise? Did the time of covenant seem too long to you? Or did you wish the wrath of your Lord to fall upon you that you broke the promise you had made to me?"

arabic: ونسوق المجرمين إلى جهنم وردا
english: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
tafsir: They said: "We did not break our promise to you of our own will, but we were made to carry the loads of ornaments belonging to the people, which we threw (into the fire), and so did Sameri.

arabic: لا يملكون الشفاعة إلا من اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
english: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
tafsir: Then he produced the image of a calf which mooed like a cow. And they said: 'This is your god and the god of Moses (whom) he has neglected."

arabic: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا
english: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
tafsir: Did they not see that it did not give them any answer, nor had it power to do them harm or bring them gain?

arabic: لقد جئتم شيئا إدا
english: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
tafsir: Aaron had indeed told them earlier: "O my people, you are being only misled with this. Surely your Lord is Ar-Rahman. So follow me and obey my command."

arabic: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن منه وتنشق الأرض وتخر الجبال هدا
english: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
tafsir: They said "So long as Moses does not come back we are not going to give it up, and we will remain devoted to it."

arabic: أن دعوا للرحمن ولدا
english: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
tafsir: But (Moses) said: "O Aaron, when you saw that they had gone astray, what hindered you

arabic: وما ينبغي للرحمن أن يتخذ ولدا
english: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
tafsir: From coming after me? Did you not disobey my command?" (And Moses pulled him by the hair).

arabic: إن كل من في السماوات والأرض إلا آتي الرحمن عبدا
english: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
tafsir: "O son of my mother," (Aaron cried), do not pull me by my beard or my hair! I was really afraid you may say that I had created a rift among the children of Israel, and did not pay heed to your command."

arabic: لقد أحصاهم وعدهم عدا
english: He does take an account of them (all), and hath numbered them (all) exactly.
tafsir: Moses asked: "O Sameri, what was the matter?"

arabic: وكلهم آتيه يوم القيامة فردا
english: And everyone of them will come to Him singly on the Day of Judgment.
tafsir: He said: "I saw what they did not see. I picked up a handful of dust from the messenger's tracks and threw it in, for the idea seemed attractive to me."

arabic: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سيجعل لهم الرحمن ودا
english: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.
tafsir: (Moses) said: "Go hence! All your life you are (cursed) to say: 'Do not touch me; and a threat hangs over you which you will not be able to escape. Look at your god to whom you are so attached: We shall verily burn it, and disperse its ashes into the sea.

arabic: فإنما يسرناه بلسانك لتبشر به المتقين وتنذر به قوما لدا
english: So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
tafsir: Your god is only God. There is no other god but He. His knowledge extends over everything."

arabic: وكم أهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هل تحس منهم من أحد أو تسمع لهم ركزا
english: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?
tafsir: Thus do We narrate some account to you of what has gone before, and We have truly given you a Reminder of Our own.

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم طه
english: Ta-Ha.
tafsir: Never does a new reminder come to them from their Lord but they listen to it with dalliance.

arabic: ما أنزلنا عليك القرآن لتشقى
english: We have not sent down the Qur'an to thee to be (an occasion) for thy distress,
tafsir: Their minds are lost in frivolous pastimes; and the evil-doers discuss secretly: "Is he not but only a man like you? Then why are you taken in by magic seeingly?"

arabic: إلا تذكرة لمن يخشى
english: But only as an admonition to those who fear (Allah),-
tafsir: He said: "My Lord knows whatever is spoken in the heavens and the earth. He hears all and knows everything."

arabic: تنزيلا ممن خلق الأرض والسماوات العلى
english: A revelation from Him Who created the earth and the heavens on high.
tafsir: Yet they say: "These are only confused dreams," or rather: "He has invented them;" or: "He is only a poet. Let him therefore bring a miracle to us as the earlier (apostles) were sent with."

arabic: الرحمن على العرش استوى
english: (Allah) Most Gracious is firmly established on the throne (of authority).
tafsir: Not one habitation that We destroyed before them had believed. So how can they believe?

arabic: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وما بينهما وما تحت الثرى
english: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth, and all between them, and all beneath the soil.
tafsir: Never did We send a message before you but through a man, whom We inspired. If you do not know, then ask the keepers of the oracles of God.

arabic: وإن تجهر بالقول فإنه يعلم السر وأخفى
english: If thou pronounce the word aloud, (it is no matter): for verily He knoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden.
tafsir: We did not make their bodies immune to hunger, nor were they immortal.

arabic: الله لا إله إلا هو ۖ له الأسماء الحسنى
english: Allah! there is no god but He! To Him belong the most Beautiful Names.
tafsir: Then We made Our promise good to them and delivered whomsoever We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors.

arabic: وهل أتاك حديث موسى
english: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
tafsir: We have sent down to you a Book which has a reminder for you. Do you not understand?

arabic: إذ رأى نارا فقال لأهله امكثوا إني آنست نارا لعلي آتيكم منها بقبس أو أجد على النار هدى
english: Behold, he saw a fire: So he said to his family, "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; perhaps I can bring you some burning brand therefrom, or find some guidance at the fire."
tafsir: How many habitations that were sinful have We demolished utterly, and raised other people after them.

arabic: فلما أتاها نودي يا موسى
english: But when he came to the fire, a voice was heard: "O Moses!
tafsir: Whensoever they sensed Our punishment they fled from them.

arabic: إني أنا ربك فاخلع نعليك ۖ إنك بالواد المقدس طوى
english: "Verily I am thy Lord! therefore (in My presence) put off thy shoes: thou art in the sacred valley Tuwa.
tafsir: "Do not flee; go back to your halls of pleasure and your habitations, so that you may be interrogated."

arabic: وأنا اخترتك فاستمع لما يوحى
english: "I have chosen thee: listen, then, to the inspiration (sent to thee).
tafsir: "Woe, alas," they said, "we were really sinful."

arabic: إنني أنا الله لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدني وأقم الصلاة لذكري
english: "Verily, I am Allah: There is no god but I: So serve thou Me (only), and establish regular prayer for celebrating My praise.
tafsir: And this remained their lament till We mowed them down and made them extinct.

arabic: إن الساعة آتية أكاد أخفيها لتجزى كل نفس بما تسعى
english: "Verily the Hour is coming - My design is to keep it hidden - for every soul to receive its reward by the measure of its Endeavour.
tafsir: We have not created the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, out of fun.

arabic: فلا يصدنك عنها من لا يؤمن بها واتبع هواه فتردى
english: "Therefore let not such as believe not therein but follow their own lusts, divert thee therefrom, lest thou perish!"..
tafsir: If We had pleased to make a plaything We could have made it Ourself, if We had cared to do so.

arabic: وما تلك بيمينك يا موسى
english: "And what is that in the right hand, O Moses?"
tafsir: In fact We strike the truth against the false, which shatters it, and it disappears. Woe to you for what you attribute (to Him)!

arabic: قال هي عصاي أتوكأ عليها وأهش بها على غنمي ولي فيها مآرب أخرى
english: He said, "It is my rod: on it I lean; with it I beat down fodder for my flocks; and in it I find other uses."
tafsir: Whosoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him; and those who are near Him do not disdain to worship Him or weary (of His service),

arabic: قال ألقها يا موسى
english: (Allah) said, "Throw it, O Moses!"
tafsir: Nor cease to endeavour praising Him night and day.

arabic: فألقاها فإذا هي حية تسعى
english: He threw it, and behold! It was a snake, active in motion.
tafsir: Or have they taken gods from the earth who can raise the dead?

arabic: قال خذها ولا تخف ۖ سنعيدها سيرتها الأولى
english: (Allah) said, "Seize it, and fear not: We shall return it at once to its former condition"..
tafsir: Had there been gods apart from God, both (the heavens and the earth) would have been despoiled. Much too glorious is God, the Lord of the mighty throne, for things they assert!

arabic: واضمم يدك إلى جناحك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء آية أخرى
english: "Now draw thy hand close to thy side: It shall come forth white (and shining), without harm (or stain),- as another Sign,-
tafsir: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

arabic: لنريك من آياتنا الكبرى
english: "In order that We may show thee (two) of our Greater Signs.
tafsir: Have they taken gods besides God? Say: "Then bring your proof. Here is the Book of those who are with me, and the Book of those who have gone before me." But most men do not know the truth and turn away.

arabic: اذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى
english: "Go thou to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds."
tafsir: We have not sent an apostle before you without instructing him that there is no god but I, so worship Me.

arabic: قال رب اشرح لي صدري
english: (Moses) said: "O my Lord! expand me my breast;
tafsir: And yet they say: "Ar-Rahman has begotten a son." Too exalted is He! In fact, those (they call His sons) were His honoured votaries.

arabic: ويسر لي أمري
english: "Ease my task for me;
tafsir: They did not precede Him in their speech, and acted on His command.

arabic: واحلل عقدة من لساني
english: "And remove the impediment from my speech,
tafsir: He knows what was there before them and what came after them; and they did not intercede for any one but whom He willed, and they were filled with awe of Him.

arabic: يفقهوا قولي
english: "So they may understand what I say:
tafsir: If any one of them said: "I am God besides Him," We should award him Hell; for this is how We requite the evil-doers.

arabic: واجعل لي وزيرا من أهلي
english: "And give me a Minister from my family,
tafsir: Do not these unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were an integrated mass, then We split them and made every living thing from water? Will they not believe even then?

arabic: هارون أخي
english: "Aaron, my brother;
tafsir: We placed stabilisers in the earth so that as it revolved with them you lived undisturbed; and We provided passageways between them so that men may find their way;

arabic: اشدد به أزري
english: "Add to my strength through him,
tafsir: And We made the sky a well-protected roof. Still they turn away from His signs!

arabic: وأشركه في أمري
english: "And make him share my task:
tafsir: It is He who created night and day, the sun and the moon, revolving on its orbit.

arabic: كي نسبحك كثيرا
english: "That we may celebrate Thy praise without stint,
tafsir: We have given no man everlastingness before you. So then if you die, will they live ever after?

arabic: ونذكرك كثيرا
english: "And remember Thee without stint:
tafsir: Every soul will know the taste of death. We tempt you with evil and with good as a trial; and to Us you will return.

arabic: إنك كنت بنا بصيرا
english: "For Thou art He that (ever) regardeth us."
tafsir: But when the unbelievers see you they make fun of you (and say): "Is this the one who mentions your gods (deridingly)?" Yet in Ar-Rahman they disbelieve!

arabic: قال قد أوتيت سؤلك يا موسى
english: (Allah) said: "Granted is thy prayer, O Moses!"
tafsir: Man is made of inordinate haste. We will show you Our signs, then you will not desire to hasten (the punishment).

arabic: ولقد مننا عليك مرة أخرى
english: "And indeed We conferred a favour on thee another time (before).
tafsir: Yet they say: "When will the promised threat come to pass, if you speak the truth?"

arabic: إذ أوحينا إلى أمك ما يوحى
english: "Behold! We sent to thy mother, by inspiration, the message:
tafsir: If only the unbelievers could apprehend the moment when they would neither be able to ward off the fire from their faces and their backs, nor help reach them!

arabic: أن اقذفيه في التابوت فاقذفيه في اليم فليلقه اليم بالساحل يأخذه عدو لي وعدو له ۚ وألقيت عليك محبة مني ولتصنع على عيني
english: "'Throw (the child) into the chest, and throw (the chest) into the river: the river will cast him up on the bank, and he will be taken up by one who is an enemy to Me and an enemy to him': But I cast (the garment of) love over thee from Me: and (this) in order that thou mayest be reared under Mine eye.
tafsir: It will come upon them unawares confounding them, and they will not be able to keep it back, nor will they be given respite.

arabic: إذ تمشي أختك فتقول هل أدلكم على من يكفله ۖ فرجعناك إلى أمك كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن ۚ وقتلت نفسا فنجيناك من الغم وفتناك فتونا ۚ فلبثت سنين في أهل مدين ثم جئت على قدر يا موسى
english: "Behold! thy sister goeth forth and saith, 'shall I show you one who will nurse and rear the (child)?' So We brought thee back to thy mother, that her eye might be cooled and she should not grieve. Then thou didst slay a man, but We saved thee from trouble, and We tried thee in various ways. Then didst thou tarry a number of years with the people of Midian. Then didst thou come hither as ordained, O Moses!
tafsir: Many apostles have been scoffed before you; but they who scoffed were themselves caught by what they had ridiculed.

arabic: واصطنعتك لنفسي
english: "And I have prepared thee for Myself (for service)"..
tafsir: Say: "Who guards you from Ar-Rahman by night and by day?" Yet from a mention of their Lord they turn away.

arabic: اذهب أنت وأخوك بآياتي ولا تنيا في ذكري
english: "Go, thou and thy brother, with My Signs, and slacken not, either of you, in keeping Me in remembrance.
tafsir: Or do they have lords of their own besides Us who can defend them? But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us.

arabic: اذهبا إلى فرعون إنه طغى
english: "Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has indeed transgressed all bounds;
tafsir: We allowed them and their fathers time to enjoy till the very end of their lives. Do they not see Us advancing into the land, reducing its frontiers? Would they still prevail?

arabic: فقولا له قولا لينا لعله يتذكر أو يخشى
english: "But speak to him mildly; perchance he may take warning or fear (Allah)."
tafsir: Say: "I am warning you by God's command." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

arabic: قالا ربنا إننا نخاف أن يفرط علينا أو أن يطغى
english: They (Moses and Aaron) said: "Our Lord! We fear lest he hasten with insolence against us, or lest he transgress all bounds."
tafsir: Even if a whiff of the Lord's chastisement were to touch them they would surely say: "Ah woe, alas, we were surely sinful."

arabic: قال لا تخافا ۖ إنني معكما أسمع وأرى
english: He said: "Fear not: for I am with you: I hear and see (everything).
tafsir: We shall fix the scales of justice on the Day of Resurrection, so that none will be wronged in the least; and even if it were equal to a mustard seed in weight We shall take it (into account). We are sufficient for computation.

arabic: فأتياه فقولا إنا رسولا ربك فأرسل معنا بني إسرائيل ولا تعذبهم ۖ قد جئناك بآية من ربك ۖ والسلام على من اتبع الهدى
english: "So go ye both to him, and say, 'Verily we are messengers sent by thy Lord: Send forth, therefore, the Children of Israel with us, and afflict them not: with a Sign, indeed, have we come from thy Lord! and peace to all who follow guidance!
tafsir: We gave Moses and Aaron the Criterion, and a light and reminder for those who take heed for themselves,

arabic: إنا قد أوحي إلينا أن العذاب على من كذب وتولى
english: "'Verily it has been revealed to us that the Penalty (awaits) those who reject and turn away.'"
tafsir: Who are fearful of their Lord inwardly and dread the Hour.

arabic: قال فمن ربكما يا موسى
english: (When this message was delivered), (Pharaoh) said: "Who, then, O Moses, is the Lord of you two?"
tafsir: And this is a blessed reminder that We have sent down. Will you then deny it?

arabic: قال ربنا الذي أعطى كل شيء خلقه ثم هدى
english: He said: "Our Lord is He Who gave to each (created) thing its form and nature, and further, gave (it) guidance."
tafsir: We had earlier given Abraham true direction, for We knew him well.

arabic: قال فما بال القرون الأولى
english: (Pharaoh) said: "What then is the condition of previous generations?"
tafsir: When he said to his father and his people: "What are these idols to which you cling so passionately?"

arabic: قال علمها عند ربي في كتاب ۖ لا يضل ربي ولا ينسى
english: He replied: "The knowledge of that is with my Lord, duly recorded: my Lord never errs, nor forgets,-
tafsir: They replied: "We found our fathers worshipping them."

arabic: الذي جعل لكم الأرض مهدا وسلك لكم فيها سبلا وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به أزواجا من نبات شتى
english: "He Who has, made for you the earth like a carpet spread out; has enabled you to go about therein by roads (and channels); and has sent down water from the sky." With it have We produced diverse pairs of plants each separate from the others.
tafsir: He said: "You and your fathers were in clear error."

arabic: كلوا وارعوا أنعامكم ۗ إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى
english: Eat (for yourselves) and pasture your cattle: verily, in this are Signs for men endued with understanding.
tafsir: They said: "Are you speaking in earnest, or only jesting?"

arabic: منها خلقناكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة أخرى
english: From the (earth) did We create you, and into it shall We return you, and from it shall We bring you out once again.
tafsir: He said: "In fact it was your Lord, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them; and I bear witness to this.

arabic: ولقد أريناه آياتنا كلها فكذب وأبى
english: And We showed Pharaoh all Our Signs, but he did reject and refuse.
tafsir: I swear by God I will do something to your idols when you have turned your backs and gone."

arabic: قال أجئتنا لتخرجنا من أرضنا بسحرك يا موسى
english: He said: "Hast thou come to drive us out of our land with thy magic, O Moses?
tafsir: So he smashed them up to pieces with the exception of the biggest, so that they may turn to it.

arabic: فلنأتينك بسحر مثله فاجعل بيننا وبينك موعدا لا نخلفه نحن ولا أنت مكانا سوى
english: "But we can surely produce magic to match thine! So make a tryst between us and thee, which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor thou - in a place where both shall have even chances."
tafsir: They asked (on return): "Who has done this to our gods? He is surely a mischief-monger."

arabic: قال موعدكم يوم الزينة وأن يحشر الناس ضحى
english: Moses said: "Your tryst is the Day of the Festival, and let the people be assembled when the sun is well up."
tafsir: They said: "We heard a youth talk about them. He is called Abraham."

arabic: فتولى فرعون فجمع كيده ثم أتى
english: So Pharaoh withdrew: He concerted his plan, and then came (back).
tafsir: "Bring him before the people," they said, "that they may bear witness."

arabic: قال لهم موسى ويلكم لا تفتروا على الله كذبا فيسحتكم بعذاب ۖ وقد خاب من افترى
english: Moses said to him: Woe to you! Forge not ye a lie against Allah, lest He destroy you (at once) utterly by chastisement: the forger must suffer frustration!"
tafsir: "Did you do this to our gods, O Abraham?" they enquired.

arabic: فتنازعوا أمرهم بينهم وأسروا النجوى
english: So they disputed, one with another, over their affair, but they kept their talk secret.
tafsir: "No," he said. "It was done by that chief of theirs. Ask him in case they can speak."

arabic: قالوا إن هذان لساحران يريدان أن يخرجاكم من أرضكم بسحرهما ويذهبا بطريقتكم المثلى
english: They said: "These two are certainly (expert) magicians: their object is to drive you out from your land with their magic, and to do away with your most cherished institutions.
tafsir: Then they thought and observed: "Surely you are yourselves unjust."

arabic: فأجمعوا كيدكم ثم ائتوا صفا ۚ وقد أفلح اليوم من استعلى
english: "Therefore concert your plan, and then assemble in (serried) ranks: He wins (all along) today who gains the upper hand."
tafsir: Then crestfallen (they confessed): "Truly, as you know, they cannot speak."

arabic: قالوا يا موسى إما أن تلقي وإما أن نكون أول من ألقى
english: They said: "O Moses! whether wilt thou that thou throw (first) or that we be the first to throw?"
tafsir: (So Abraham) said: "Then why do you worship something apart from God that cannot profit you or do you harm?

arabic: قال بل ألقوا ۖ فإذا حبالهم وعصيهم يخيل إليه من سحرهم أنها تسعى
english: He said, "Nay, throw ye first!" Then behold their ropes and their rods-so it seemed to him on account of their magic - began to be in lively motion!
tafsir: Fie on you and those you worship besides God! Will you not understand?"

arabic: فأوجس في نفسه خيفة موسى
english: So Moses conceived in his mind a (sort of) fear.
tafsir: They said: "Burn him, and save your gods, if you are men of action."

arabic: قلنا لا تخف إنك أنت الأعلى
english: We said: "Fear not! for thou hast indeed the upper hand:
tafsir: "Turn cold, O fire," We said, "and give safety to Abraham."

arabic: وألق ما في يمينك تلقف ما صنعوا ۖ إنما صنعوا كيد ساحر ۖ ولا يفلح الساحر حيث أتى
english: "Throw that which is in thy right hand: Quickly will it swallow up that which they have faked what they have faked is but a magician's trick: and the magician thrives not, (no matter) where he goes."
tafsir: They wished to entrap him, but We made them greater losers.

arabic: فألقي السحرة سجدا قالوا آمنا برب هارون وموسى
english: So the magicians were thrown down to prostration: they said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses".
tafsir: So We delivered him and Lot, and brought them to the land We had blessed for all the people.

arabic: قال آمنتم له قبل أن آذن لكم ۖ إنه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر ۖ فلأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ولأصلبنكم في جذوع النخل ولتعلمن أينا أشد عذابا وأبقى
english: (Pharaoh) said: "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? Surely this must be your leader, who has taught you magic! be sure I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will have you crucified on trunks of palm-trees: so shall ye know for certain, which of us can give the more severe and the more lasting punishment!"
tafsir: And We bestowed on him Isaac, and Jacob as an additional gift, and made them righteous.

arabic: قالوا لن نؤثرك على ما جاءنا من البينات والذي فطرنا ۖ فاقض ما أنت قاض ۖ إنما تقضي هذه الحياة الدنيا
english: They said: "Never shall we regard thee as more than the Clear Signs that have come to us, or than Him Who created us! so decree whatever thou desirest to decree: for thou canst only decree (touching) the life of this world.
tafsir: And We made them leaders to guide (the people) by Our command; and We inspired them to perform good deeds and observe their moral obligations and pay the zakat; and they obeyed Us.

arabic: إنا آمنا بربنا ليغفر لنا خطايانا وما أكرهتنا عليه من السحر ۗ والله خير وأبقى
english: "For us, we have believed in our Lord: may He forgive us our faults, and the magic to which thou didst compel us: for Allah is Best and Most Abiding."
tafsir: To Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and saved him from a people who acted villainously and were certainly wicked and disobedient.

arabic: إنه من يأت ربه مجرما فإن له جهنم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى
english: Verily he who comes to his Lord as a sinner (at Judgment),- for him is Hell: therein shall he neither die nor live.
tafsir: Thus We admitted him to Our grace. He is surely one of the righteous.

arabic: ومن يأته مؤمنا قد عمل الصالحات فأولئك لهم الدرجات العلى
english: But such as come to Him as Believers who have worked righteous deeds,- for them are ranks exalted,-
tafsir: Remember Noah when he called to Us before this. We heard him and saved him and those with him from great distress;

arabic: جنات عدن تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ۚ وذلك جزاء من تزكى
english: Gardens of Eternity, beneath which flow rivers: they will dwell therein for aye: such is the reward of those who purify themselves (from evil).
tafsir: And We helped him against the people who rejected Our signs as lies. They were a wicked people indeed, so We drowned them one and all.

arabic: ولقد أوحينا إلى موسى أن أسر بعبادي فاضرب لهم طريقا في البحر يبسا لا تخاف دركا ولا تخشى
english: We sent an inspiration to Moses: "Travel by night with My servants, and strike a dry path for them through the sea, without fear of being overtaken (by Pharaoh) and without (any other) fear."
tafsir: (Remember) David and Solomon, when they pronounced judgement about the field which was eaten up at night by sheep belonging to certain people. We were witness to their judgement.

arabic: فأتبعهم فرعون بجنوده فغشيهم من اليم ما غشيهم
english: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his forces, but the waters completely overwhelmed them and covered them up.
tafsir: We made Solomon understand the case, and bestowed on each wisdom and knowledge, We subdued the al-jibal (mountains) with David to sing Our praises, and at-tair (birds). It is We who did it.

arabic: وأضل فرعون قومه وما هدى
english: Pharaoh led his people astray instead of leading them aright.
tafsir: And We taught him the art of making coats of mail to shield you from each other's violence. Will you not be grateful even then?

arabic: يا بني إسرائيل قد أنجيناكم من عدوكم وواعدناكم جانب الطور الأيمن ونزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى
english: O ye Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy, and We made a Covenant with you on the right side of Mount (Sinai), and We sent down to you Manna and quails:
tafsir: We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon which blew swiftly to sail at his bidding (with his ships) to the land We had blessed. We are cognisant of everything.

arabic: كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم ولا تطغوا فيه فيحل عليكم غضبي ۖ ومن يحلل عليه غضبي فقد هوى
english: (Saying): "Eat of the good things We have provided for your sustenance, but commit no excess therein, lest My Wrath should justly descend on you: and those on whom descends My Wrath do perish indeed!
tafsir: And many of the devils (We also made obedient to him) who dived for him, and did many other things; and We kept watch over them.

arabic: وإني لغفار لمن تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا ثم اهتدى
english: "But, without doubt, I am (also) He that forgives again and again, to those who repent, believe, and do right, who,- in fine, are ready to receive true guidance."
tafsir: (Remember) Job when he called to his Lord: "I am afflicted with distress, and You are the most compassionate of all."

arabic: وما أعجلك عن قومك يا موسى
english: (When Moses was up on the Mount, Allah said:) "What made thee hasten in advance of thy people, O Moses?"
tafsir: So We heard his cry and relieved him of the misery he was in. We restored his family to him, and along with them gave him others similar to them as a grace from Us and reminder for those who are obedient.

arabic: قال هم أولاء على أثري وعجلت إليك رب لترضى
english: He replied: "Behold, they are close on my footsteps: I hastened to thee, O my Lord, to please thee."
tafsir: (Remember) Ishmael, Edris and Dhu'l-Kifl. They were men of fortitude,

arabic: قال فإنا قد فتنا قومك من بعدك وأضلهم السامري
english: (Allah) said: "We have tested thy people in thy absence: the Samiri has led them astray."
tafsir: And they were admitted to Our grace. Verily they were among the doers of good.

arabic: فرجع موسى إلى قومه غضبان أسفا ۚ قال يا قوم ألم يعدكم ربكم وعدا حسنا ۚ أفطال عليكم العهد أم أردتم أن يحل عليكم غضب من ربكم فأخلفتم موعدي
english: So Moses returned to his people in a state of indignation and sorrow. He said: "O my people! did not your Lord make a handsome promise to you? Did then the promise seem to you long (in coming)? Or did ye desire that Wrath should descend from your Lord on you, and so ye broke your promise to me?"
tafsir: And (remember) Dhu'n-Noon (Jonah of the fish), when he went away in anger and imagined We will not test him (with distress). Then he called out from the darkness: "There is no god other than You. All glory to You; surely I was a sinner.

arabic: قالوا ما أخلفنا موعدك بملكنا ولكنا حملنا أوزارا من زينة القوم فقذفناها فكذلك ألقى السامري
english: They said: "We broke not the promise to thee, as far as lay in our power: but we were made to carry the weight of the ornaments of the (whole) people, and we threw them (into the fire), and that was what the Samiri suggested.
tafsir: We heard his cry, and saved him from the anguish. That is how We deliver those who believe.

arabic: فأخرج لهم عجلا جسدا له خوار فقالوا هذا إلهكم وإله موسى فنسي
english: "Then he brought out (of the fire) before the (people) the image of a calf: It seemed to low: so they said: This is your god, and the god of Moses, but (Moses) has forgotten!"
tafsir: (Remember) Zachariah when he called to his Lord: "Do not leave me alone (and childless), for you are the best of givers."

arabic: أفلا يرون ألا يرجع إليهم قولا ولا يملك لهم ضرا ولا نفعا
english: Could they not see that it could not return them a word (for answer), and that it had no power either to harm them or to do them good?
tafsir: So We heard him and gave him John, and cured his wife (of barrenness). These were men who vied in good deeds with one another, and prayed to Us with love and awe, and were meek before Us.

arabic: ولقد قال لهم هارون من قبل يا قوم إنما فتنتم به ۖ وإن ربكم الرحمن فاتبعوني وأطيعوا أمري
english: Aaron had already, before this said to them: "O my people! ye are being tested in this: for verily your Lord is (Allah) Most Gracious; so follow me and obey my command."
tafsir: (Remember) her who preserved her chastity, into whom We breathed a new life from Us, and made her and her son a token for mankind.

arabic: قالوا لن نبرح عليه عاكفين حتى يرجع إلينا موسى
english: They had said: "We will not abandon this cult, but we will devote ourselves to it until Moses returns to us."
tafsir: Verily this your order is one order, and I am your Lord; so worship Me.

arabic: قال يا هارون ما منعك إذ رأيتهم ضلوا
english: (Moses) said: "O Aaron! what kept thee back, when thou sawest them going wrong,
tafsir: But they split up the order among themselves; (yet) all of them have to come back to Me.

arabic: ألا تتبعن ۖ أفعصيت أمري
english: "From following me? Didst thou then disobey my order?"
tafsir: So he who does the right and is a believer, will not have his labour denied, for We are congnisant of it.

arabic: قال يا ابن أم لا تأخذ بلحيتي ولا برأسي ۖ إني خشيت أن تقول فرقت بين بني إسرائيل ولم ترقب قولي
english: (Aaron) replied: "O son of my mother! Seize (me) not by my beard nor by (the hair of) my head! Truly I feared lest thou shouldst say, 'Thou has caused a division among the children of Israel, and thou didst not respect my word!'"
tafsir: It is imperative that a habitation We have destroyed will not desist (from unbelief)

arabic: قال فما خطبك يا سامري
english: (Moses) said: "What then is thy case, O Samiri?"
tafsir: Until when the way is opened up for Gog and Magog and they press from every elevated place,

arabic: قال بصرت بما لم يبصروا به فقبضت قبضة من أثر الرسول فنبذتها وكذلك سولت لي نفسي
english: He replied: "I saw what they saw not: so I took a handful (of dust) from the footprint of the Messenger, and threw it (into the calf): thus did my soul suggest to me."
tafsir: And the certain promise (of Doom) comes near. Then the eyes of unbelievers will be fixed in horror, (and they will cry:) "Ah, woe betide, we were indeed heedless of this, and were oppressors and unjust."

arabic: قال فاذهب فإن لك في الحياة أن تقول لا مساس ۖ وإن لك موعدا لن تخلفه ۖ وانظر إلى إلهك الذي ظلت عليه عاكفا ۖ لنحرقنه ثم لننسفنه في اليم نسفا
english: (Moses) said: "Get thee gone! but thy (punishment) in this life will be that thou wilt say, 'touch me not'; and moreover (for a future penalty) thou hast a promise that will not fail: Now look at thy god, of whom thou hast become a devoted worshipper: We will certainly (melt) it in a blazing fire and scatter it broadcast in the sea!"
tafsir: Verily you and those you worship other than God will be faggots for Hell; and come to it you will.

arabic: إنما إلهكم الله الذي لا إله إلا هو ۚ وسع كل شيء علما
english: But the god of you all is the One Allah: there is no god but He: all things He comprehends in His knowledge.
tafsir: Had they really been gods they would not have entered it: They will all abide in it for ever.

arabic: كذلك نقص عليك من أنباء ما قد سبق ۚ وقد آتيناك من لدنا ذكرا
english: Thus do We relate to thee some stories of what happened before: for We have sent thee a Message from Our own Presence.
tafsir: There will only be groaning for them, and they will not hear any thing.

arabic: من أعرض عنه فإنه يحمل يوم القيامة وزرا
english: If any do turn away therefrom, verily they will bear a burden on the Day of judgment;
tafsir: But those for whom a good reward had been fore-ordained by Us, will be far removed from it,

arabic: خالدين فيه ۖ وساء لهم يوم القيامة حملا
english: They will abide in this (state): and grievous will the burden be to them on that Day,-
tafsir: And will not hear its hissing, and will live for ever in the midst of what their hearts desire.

arabic: يوم ينفخ في الصور ۚ ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا
english: The Day when the Trumpet will be sounded: that Day, We shall gather the sinful, blear-eyed (with terror).
tafsir: They will have safety from the mighty terror, and angels will receive them, (saying:) "This is your day which had been promised you."

arabic: يتخافتون بينهم إن لبثتم إلا عشرا
english: In whispers will they consult each other: "Yet tarried not longer than ten (Days);
tafsir: The day We shall roll up the heavens like a written scroll, We shall revert it (to nothing) as it was before We first created it. This is a promise incumbent on Us; We will certainly fulfil it.

arabic: نحن أعلم بما يقولون إذ يقول أمثلهم طريقة إن لبثتم إلا يوما
english: We know best what they will say, when their leader most eminent in conduct will say: "Ye tarried not longer than a day!"
tafsir: We had prescribed in the Book of Psalms after the reminder and admonition, that those of Our creatures who are good will in the end rule the earth.

arabic: ويسألونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربي نسفا
english: They ask thee concerning the Mountains: say, "My Lord will uproot them and scatter them as dust;
tafsir: Verily there is a message in this for people who are devout.

arabic: فيذرها قاعا صفصفا
english: "He will leave them as plains smooth and level;
tafsir: We have sent you as a benevolence to the creatures of the world.

arabic: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا أمتا
english: "Nothing crooked or curved wilt thou see in their place."
tafsir: Say: "This is what has been revealed to me: 'Your God is one and only God.' So will you bow in homage to Him?"

arabic: يومئذ يتبعون الداعي لا عوج له ۖ وخشعت الأصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع إلا همسا
english: On that Day will they follow the Caller (straight): no crookedness (can they show) him: all sounds shall humble themselves in the Presence of (Allah) Most Gracious: nothing shalt thou hear but the tramp of their feet (as they march).
tafsir: If they turn away, tell them: "I have warned you all alike. I do not know if what has been promised you is near or far away.

arabic: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفاعة إلا من أذن له الرحمن ورضي له قولا
english: On that Day shall no intercession avail except for those for whom permission has been granted by (Allah) Most Gracious and whose word is acceptable to Him.
tafsir: He knows surely what you say aloud, and what you hide within your breasts.

arabic: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما
english: He knows what (appears to His creatures as) before or after or behind them: but they shall not compass it with their knowledge.
tafsir: I do not know if this be a trial for you, or a little advantage for a while."

arabic: وعنت الوجوه للحي القيوم ۖ وقد خاب من حمل ظلما
english: (All) faces shall be humbled before (Him) - the Living, the Self-Subsisting, Eternal: hopeless indeed will be the man that carries iniquity (on his back).
tafsir: "Judge in truth (between us), O Lord," he said. "Our Lord is merciful, whose help we seek against what you attribute."

arabic: ومن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما
english: But he who works deeds of righteousness, and has faith, will have no fear of harm nor of any curtailment (of what is his due).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وكذلك أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون أو يحدث لهم ذكرا
english: Thus have We sent this down - an arabic Qur'an - and explained therein in detail some of the warnings, in order that they may fear Allah, or that it may cause their remembrance (of Him).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فتعالى الله الملك الحق ۗ ولا تعجل بالقرآن من قبل أن يقضى إليك وحيه ۖ وقل رب زدني علما
english: High above all is Allah, the King, the Truth! Be not in haste with the Qur'an before its revelation to thee is completed, but say, "O my Lord! advance me in knowledge."

arabic: ولقد عهدنا إلى آدم من قبل فنسي ولم نجد له عزما

arabic: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فأكلا منها فبدت لهما سوآتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة ۚ وعصى آدم ربه فغوى

arabic: قال اهبطا منها جميعا ۖ بعضكم لبعض عدو ۖ فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن اتبع هداي فلا يضل ولا يشقى

arabic: أفلم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم ۗ إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما وأجل مسمى

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ۖ ومن آناء الليل فسبح وأطراف النهار لعلك ترضى
english: Therefore be patient with what they say, and celebrate (constantly) the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun, and before its setting; yea, celebrate them for part of the hours of the night, and at the sides of the day: that thou mayest have (spiritual) joy.

arabic: ولا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم زهرة الحياة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ۚ ورزق ربك خير وأبقى

arabic: وأمر أهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها ۖ لا نسألك رزقا ۖ نحن نرزقك ۗ والعاقبة للتقوى

arabic: وقالوا لولا يأتينا بآية من ربه ۚ أولم تأتهم بينة ما في الصحف الأولى

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولو أنا أهلكناهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا أرسلت إلينا رسولا فنتبع آياتك من قبل أن نذل ونخزى
english: And if We had inflicted on them a penalty before this, they would have said: "Our Lord! If only Thou hadst sent us a messenger, we should certainly have followed Thy Signs before we were humbled and put to shame."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل كل متربص فتربصوا ۖ فستعلمون من أصحاب الصراط السوي ومن اهتدى
english: Say: "Each one (of us) is waiting: wait ye, therefore, and soon shall ye know who it is that is on the straight and even way, and who it is that has received Guidance."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون
english: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
tafsir: The day you see it every suckling female will forget her suckling, and every pregnant female will discharge her burden. You will see men drunk, yet it will not be intoxication. The torment of God will be severe.

arabic: ما يأتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث إلا استمعوه وهم يلعبون
english: Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord, but they listen to it as in jest,-
tafsir: And yet there are men who contend about God without understanding, and follow every wayward devil

arabic: لاهية قلوبهم ۗ وأسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا إلا بشر مثلكم ۖ أفتأتون السحر وأنتم تبصرون
english: Their hearts toying as with trifles. The wrong-doers conceal their private counsels, (saying), "Is this (one) more than a man like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?"
tafsir: Who, it is inscribed, will beguile whoever follows him, and lead him to the torment of Hell.

arabic: قال ربي يعلم القول في السماء والأرض ۖ وهو السميع العليم
english: Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."
tafsir: If you have any doubt, O men, about being raised to life again, (remember) that We created you from dust, then a drop of semen, then an embryo, then a chewed up lump of flesh shaped and shapeless, that We may reveal (the various steps) to you. We keep what We please in the womb for a certain time, then you come out as a child, then reach the prime of age. Some of you die, some reach the age of dotage when they forget what they knew, having known it once. You see the earth all withered, then We send down rain upon it, and it bestirs itself, swells, and brings forth every kind of beauteous verdure.

arabic: بل قالوا أضغاث أحلام بل افتراه بل هو شاعر فليأتنا بآية كما أرسل الأولون
english: "Nay," they say, "(these are) medleys of dream! - Nay, He forged it! - Nay, He is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!"
tafsir: That is so for God is the undeniable Reality. It is He who brings the dead to life, for He has power over everything.

arabic: ما آمنت قبلهم من قرية أهلكناها ۖ أفهم يؤمنون
english: (As to those) before them, not one of the populations which We destroyed believed: will these believe?
tafsir: The Hour will come without a doubt, and God will raise those who are dead.

arabic: وما أرسلنا قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم ۖ فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون
english: Before thee, also, the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
tafsir: Yet there are some who contend about God without any knowledge or guidance or enlightening Book,

arabic: وما جعلناهم جسدا لا يأكلون الطعام وما كانوا خالدين
english: Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they exempt from death.
tafsir: Turning their backs that they may lead away from the path of God. For such there is disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement We shall make them taste the torment of burning.

arabic: ثم صدقناهم الوعد فأنجيناهم ومن نشاء وأهلكنا المسرفين
english: In the end We fulfilled to them Our Promise, and We saved them and those whom We pleased, but We destroyed those who transgressed beyond bounds.
tafsir: That is on account of what you had done in the past; yet God is not unjust to His creatures.

arabic: لقد أنزلنا إليكم كتابا فيه ذكركم ۖ أفلا تعقلون
english: We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message for you: will ye not then understand?
tafsir: There are some men who worship God only from the margin. If there is some profit they are content; but if calamity befalls them they turn about, thus losing both this world and the next. This is indeed a palpable loss.

arabic: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وأنشأنا بعدها قوما آخرين
english: How many were the populations We utterly destroyed because of their iniquities, setting up in their places other peoples?
tafsir: Leaving God they pray to those who cannot harm or profit them. That is the limit of going astray.

arabic: فلما أحسوا بأسنا إذا هم منها يركضون
english: Yet, when they felt Our Punishment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
tafsir: They pray to him whose bane is more imminent than his boon: How bad the protector and how bad the associate!

arabic: لا تركضوا وارجعوا إلى ما أترفتم فيه ومساكنكم لعلكم تسألون
english: Flee not, but return to the good things of this life which were given you, and to your homes in order that ye may be called to account.
tafsir: God will admit those who believe and do the right to gardens full of rippling streams. Verily God does as He pleases.

arabic: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين
english: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
tafsir: He who thinks that God will not help him in this world and the next should stretch a rope to the sky then cut it off and see if his mind is relieved (of doubts) by this stratagem.

arabic: فما زالت تلك دعواهم حتى جعلناهم حصيدا خامدين
english: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
tafsir: That is why We have sent down these clear revelations, for God gives guidance whomsoever He please.

arabic: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين
english: Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and all that is between!
tafsir: God will judge between those who believe and the Jews, the Sabians, Christians and the Magians and the idolaters, on the Day of Judgement. Verily God is witness to everything.

arabic: لو أردنا أن نتخذ لهوا لاتخذناه من لدنا إن كنا فاعلين
english: If it had been Our wish to take (just) a pastime, We should surely have taken it from the things nearest to Us, if We would do (such a thing)!
tafsir: Do you see how all things in heavens and the earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, trees and beasts, and men in abundance, pay homage to God? Yet there are many who deserve the punishment. And whosoever God disgraces will have none to raise him up in honour. God does verily as He will.

arabic: بل نقذف بالحق على الباطل فيدمغه فإذا هو زاهق ۚ ولكم الويل مما تصفون
english: Nay, We hurl the Truth against falsehood, and it knocks out its brain, and behold, falsehood doth perish! Ah! woe be to you for the (false) things ye ascribe (to Us).
tafsir: These two (believers and unbelievers) are disputants, who contend about their Lord. But they who disbelieve will be fitted out with garments of flames. Boiling water will be poured down over their heads

arabic: وله من في السماوات والأرض ۚ ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون
english: To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: Even those who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they (ever) weary (of His service):
tafsir: Which will dissolve everything within their bellies, and their skins.

arabic: يسبحون الليل والنهار لا يفترون
english: They celebrate His praises night and day, nor do they ever flag or intermit.
tafsir: There are iron maces for them.

arabic: أم اتخذوا آلهة من الأرض هم ينشرون
english: Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can raise (the dead)?
tafsir: As often as they try to escape from its anguish they would be put back into (the fire), and taste the torment of burning.

arabic: لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا ۚ فسبحان الله رب العرش عما يصفون
english: If there were, in the heavens and the earth, other gods besides Allah, there would have been confusion in both! but glory to Allah, the Lord of the Throne: (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!
tafsir: God will surely admit those who believe and do the right to gardens with rivers running by, where they will be decked in bracelets of gold and of pearls; and of silk will be their garments.

arabic: لا يسأل عما يفعل وهم يسألون
english: He cannot be questioned for His acts, but they will be questioned (for theirs).
tafsir: They will be guided with gentle words, and guided to the commended path.

arabic: أم اتخذوا من دونه آلهة ۖ قل هاتوا برهانكم ۖ هذا ذكر من معي وذكر من قبلي ۗ بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق ۖ فهم معرضون
english: Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides him? Say, "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not the Truth, and so turn away.
tafsir: As for those who disbelieve, and obstruct the way of God and the holy Mosque which We have set down for all men, the native and the visitor alike. Whoever puts obstructions in this mischievously will taste of painful punishment.

arabic: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول إلا نوحي إليه أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدون
english: Not a messenger did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.
tafsir: When We chose the site of the House for Abraham (We said:) "Associate no one with Me, and clean My House for those who will circumambulate it, stand (in reverence), and bow in homage.

arabic: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا ۗ سبحانه ۚ بل عباد مكرمون
english: And they say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten offspring." Glory to Him! they are (but) servants raised to honour.
tafsir: Announce the Pilgrimage to the people. They will come to you on foot and riding along distant roads on lean and slender beasts,

arabic: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بأمره يعملون
english: They speak not before He speaks, and they act (in all things) by His Command.
tafsir: In order to reach the place of advantage for them, and to pronounce the name of God on appointed days over cattle He has given them for food; then eat of the meat and feed the needy and the poor.

arabic: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون إلا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون
english: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable, and they stand in awe and reverence of His (Glory).
tafsir: Let them then attend to their persons and complete the rites of pilgrimage, fulfil their vows and circuit round the ancient House.

arabic: ومن يقل منهم إني إله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم ۚ كذلك نجزي الظالمين
english: If any of them should say, "I am a god besides Him", such a one We should reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.
tafsir: Apart from this, whoever respects the sacred ordinances of God, will find a better reward for him with his Lord. You are allowed to eat all cattle except those already mentioned to you. Avoid the repugnance of idols, and false and frivolous talk.

arabic: أولم ير الذين كفروا أن السماوات والأرض كانتا رتقا ففتقناهما ۖ وجعلنا من الماء كل شيء حي ۖ أفلا يؤمنون
english: Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of creation), before we clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
tafsir: Turn uprightly to God without ascribing compeers to Him; for he who associates any one with God is like a thing that falls from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or carried far away by the wind.

arabic: وجعلنا في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون
english: And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with them, and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive Guidance.
tafsir: All this, and honouring the offerings to God, comes from purity of heart.

arabic: وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا ۖ وهم عن آياتها معرضون
english: And We have made the heavens as a canopy well guarded: yet do they turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!
tafsir: , There are advantages for you in these (cattle) up to a time, then their place is the ancient House for sacrifice.

arabic: وهو الذي خلق الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر ۖ كل في فلك يسبحون
english: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.
tafsir: For every community We have ordained certain rites that they may commemorate the name of God by reading it over the cattle We have given them for sacrifice. Your God is one God, so be obedient to Him. Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God,

arabic: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد ۖ أفإن مت فهم الخالدون
english: We granted not to any man before thee permanent life (here): if then thou shouldst die, would they live permanently?
tafsir: Whose hearts are filled with awe when the name of God is mentioned before them, who endure with fortitude what befalls them, and fulfil their moral obligations, and expend of what We have given them.

arabic: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ۗ ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة ۖ وإلينا ترجعون
english: Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil and by good by way of trial. to Us must ye return.
tafsir: We have made the camels signs of God for you. There is good for you in this. So pronounce the name of God over them as they stand with their forefeet in a line. When they have fallen (slaughtered) on their sides, eat of (their meat) and feed those who are content with little, and those who supplicate. That is why We have brought them under your subjugation so that you may be grateful.

arabic: وإذا رآك الذين كفروا إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي يذكر آلهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كافرون
english: When the Unbelievers see thee, they treat thee not except with ridicule. "Is this," (they say), "the one who talks of your gods?" and they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious!
tafsir: It is not their meat or blood that reaches God: It is the fealty of your heart that reaches him. That is why He has subjugated them to you that you may glorify God for having shown you the way. So give glad tidings to those who are doers of good.

arabic: خلق الإنسان من عجل ۚ سأريكم آياتي فلا تستعجلون
english: Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My Signs; then ye will not ask Me to hasten them!
tafsir: God will certainly defend the believers. Surely God does not like the traitors who deny the truth.

arabic: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين
english: They say: "When will this promise come to pass, if ye are telling the truth?"
tafsir: Permission is granted those (to take up arms) who fight because they were oppressed. God is certainly able to give help to those

arabic: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون
english: If only the Unbelievers knew (the time) when they will not be able to ward off the fire from their faces, nor yet from their backs, and (when) no help can reach them!
tafsir: Who were driven away from their homes for no other reason than they said: "Our Lord is God." And if God had not restrained some men through some others, monastries, churches, synagogues and mosques, where the name of God is honoured most, would have been razed. God will surely help those who help Him, -- verily God is all-powerful and all-mighty, --

arabic: بل تأتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون
english: Nay, it may come to them all of a sudden and confound them: no power will they have then to avert it, nor will they (then) get respite.
tafsir: Those who would be firm in devotion, give zakat, and enjoin what is good and forbid what is wrong, if We gave them authority in the land. But the resultance of things rests with God.

arabic: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون
english: Mocked were (many) messenger before thee; But their scoffers were hemmed in by the thing that they mocked.
tafsir: If they accuse you of falsehood, (remember that) the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud had accused (their apostles) before,

arabic: قل من يكلؤكم بالليل والنهار من الرحمن ۗ بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون
english: Say: "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath of) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
tafsir: And the people of Abraham and Lot,

arabic: أم لهم آلهة تمنعهم من دوننا ۚ لا يستطيعون نصر أنفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون
english: Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power to aid themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.
tafsir: And the people of Midian too. Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them. How was My reprobation then!

arabic: بل متعنا هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى طال عليهم العمر ۗ أفلا يرون أنا نأتي الأرض ننقصها من أطرافها ۚ أفهم الغالبون
english: Nay, We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?
tafsir: How many a habitation given to wickedness have We destroyed, whose roofs tumbled down, which fell into ruins. How many a well and fortress reinforced lie abandoned!

arabic: قل إنما أنذركم بالوحي ۚ ولا يسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ما ينذرون
english: Say, "I do but warn you according to revelation": But the deaf will not hear the call, (even) when they are warned!
tafsir: Have they not travelled in the land that they could have the heart to understand, and ears to hear? It is not the eyes alone that do not see, oblivious are the hearts within their breasts.

arabic: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين
english: If but a breath of the Wrath of thy Lord do touch them, they will then say, "Woe to us! we did wrong indeed!"
tafsir: That is how they ask you to hasten the punishment; but God does not go back on His promise. Verily a day with your Lord is equal by your reckoning to a thousand years.

arabic: ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا ۖ وإن كان مثقال حبة من خردل أتينا بها ۗ وكفى بنا حاسبين
english: We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least, and if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
tafsir: To how many habitations did We give respite, though given to wickedness, and then seized them. To Me they had to come back in the end.

arabic: ولقد آتينا موسى وهارون الفرقان وضياء وذكرا للمتقين
english: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-
tafsir: Tell them: "O men, it's my duty to warn you clearly."

arabic: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون
english: Those who fear their Lord in their most secret thoughts, and who hold the Hour (of Judgment) in awe.
tafsir: For those who believe and do the right is forgiveness and gracious provision.

arabic: وهذا ذكر مبارك أنزلناه ۚ أفأنتم له منكرون
english: And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye then reject it?
tafsir: But those who try to defeat Our signs are people of Hell.

arabic: ولقد آتينا إبراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين
english: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.
tafsir: We have sent no messenger or apostle before you with whose recitations Satan did not tamper. Yet God abrogates what Satan interpolates; then He confirms His revelations, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.

arabic: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التي أنتم لها عاكفون
english: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"
tafsir: This is in order to make the interpolations of Satan a test for those whose hearts are diseased and hardened: Surely the sinners have gone far in dissent.

arabic: قالوا وجدنا آباءنا لها عابدين
english: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."
tafsir: At the same time those who have been given knowledge may know that this is the truth from your Lord, and come to believe in it, and their hearts become submissive to Him. Verily God guides those who believe, to the even path.

arabic: قال لقد كنتم أنتم وآباؤكم في ضلال مبين
english: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."
tafsir: The infidels will remain in doubt about it till the Hour overtakes them unawares, or the punishment of the barren day destructive should come upon them.

arabic: قالوا أجئتنا بالحق أم أنت من اللاعبين
english: They said, "Have you brought us the Truth, or are you one of those who jest?"
tafsir: The order will be God's on that Day; He will judge between them. Then those who had come to believe and done the right will be in gardens of delight.

arabic: قال بل ربكم رب السماوات والأرض الذي فطرهن وأنا على ذلكم من الشاهدين
english: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).
tafsir: But those who did not believe and called Our revelations lies, will be given disgraceful punishment.

arabic: وتالله لأكيدن أصنامكم بعد أن تولوا مدبرين
english: "And by Allah, I have a plan for your idols - after ye go away and turn your backs"..
tafsir: Those who left their homes in the way of God, and then were killed or died, will surely be given a better provision by God, for God is surely the best of providers.

arabic: فجعلهم جذاذا إلا كبيرا لهم لعلهم إليه يرجعون
english: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.
tafsir: God will surely lead them to a place with which they will be gratified. Verily God is all-knowing and forbearing.

arabic: قالوا من فعل هذا بآلهتنا إنه لمن الظالمين
english: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
tafsir: Whosoever retaliates to the extent of injury suffered by him, and is wronged again, will certainly be helped by God. Verily God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له إبراهيم
english: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."
tafsir: That is so for God turns night into day and day into night, for God is all-hearing and all-seeing;

arabic: قالوا فأتوا به على أعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون
english: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
tafsir: That is so for God is the undeniable truth, and what they invoke apart from Him is false; yet God is all-high and supreme.

arabic: قالوا أأنت فعلت هذا بآلهتنا يا إبراهيم
english: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"
tafsir: Do you not see how God sends down water from the sky and in the morning the earth turns green? Truly God is benign and well-informed.

arabic: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فاسألوهم إن كانوا ينطقون
english: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
tafsir: Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. Surely God is all-sufficing, worthy of praise.

arabic: فرجعوا إلى أنفسهم فقالوا إنكم أنتم الظالمون
english: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
tafsir: Do you not see God has harnessed all that is in the earth, to your service? And the boats ply in the ocean by His command. He holds the sky in position lest it should fall upon the earth save by His dispensation. Verily God is compassionate and kind to men.

arabic: ثم نكسوا على رءوسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلاء ينطقون
english: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"
tafsir: It is He who gives you life, then makes you die; then He will bring you back to life again. Man is surely most ungrateful.

arabic: قال أفتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيئا ولا يضركم
english: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
tafsir: We have determined for each community a way of worship which they follow. So they should not contend with you in this matter; and you should go on calling them to your Lord. You are surely on the right path.

arabic: أف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله ۖ أفلا تعقلون
english: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..
tafsir: If they argue with you, tell them: "God knows well what you are doing.

arabic: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا آلهتكم إن كنتم فاعلين
english: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
tafsir: God will judge between you on the Day of Judgement in what you are at variance."

arabic: قلنا يا نار كوني بردا وسلاما على إبراهيم
english: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"
tafsir: Do you not know that God knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? This is surely in accordance with the law. This is certainly how (the law of) God works inevitably.

arabic: وأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأخسرين
english: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!
tafsir: Yet they worship in place of God that for which no authority has been sent to them, and of which they have no knowledge. The wicked will have none to help them.

arabic: ونجيناه ولوطا إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها للعالمين
english: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.
tafsir: When Our clear messages are read out to them you can see denial on the faces of unbelievers. They can hardly restrain themselves from attacking those who recite Our revelations. Tell them: "Should I give you news of something worse than this?" -- Hell, which God has promised the infidels. How evil a destination!

arabic: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب نافلة ۖ وكلا جعلنا صالحين
english: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
tafsir: O men, give ear to this parable: Those you worship other than God can never create as much as a fly, even if they get together to do so; and if the fly were to rob them of a thing they would not be able to snatch it away from it. How weak the seeker and how weak the sought!

arabic: وجعلناهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا وأوحينا إليهم فعل الخيرات وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة ۖ وكانوا لنا عابدين
english: And We made them leaders, guiding (men) by Our Command, and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds, to establish regular prayers, and to practise regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only).
tafsir: They do not esteem God with the right estimation. God is surely all-powerful and all-mighty.

arabic: ولوطا آتيناه حكما وعلما ونجيناه من القرية التي كانت تعمل الخبائث ۗ إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فاسقين
english: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.
tafsir: God chooses messengers from the angels and human beings. Verily God is all-hearing and all-seeing.

arabic: وأدخلناه في رحمتنا ۖ إنه من الصالحين
english: And We admitted him to Our Mercy: for he was one of the Righteous.
tafsir: He knows what is before them and what lies behind them, and all things go back to God.

arabic: ونوحا إذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم
english: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.
tafsir: O you who believe, bow in adoration, Worship your Lord and do what is good that you may find success.

arabic: ونصرناه من القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا ۚ إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فأغرقناهم أجمعين
english: We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they were a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood) all together.
tafsir: Strive in the way of God with a service worthy of Him. He has chosen you and laid no hardship on you in the way of faith, the faith of your forbear Abraham. He named you Muslim earlier, and in this (Qur'an), in order that the Prophet be witness over you, and you be witness over mankind. So be firm in devotion, pay the zakat, and hold on firmly to God. He is your friend: How excellent a friend is He, how excellent a helper!

arabic: وداوود وسليمان إذ يحكمان في الحرث إذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين
english: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ففهمناها سليمان ۚ وكلا آتينا حكما وعلما ۚ وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير ۚ وكنا فاعلين
english: To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises, with David: it was We Who did (all these things).

arabic: ولقد كتبنا في الزبور من بعد الذكر أن الأرض يرثها عبادي الصالحون

arabic: فإن تولوا فقل آذنتكم على سواء ۖ وإن أدري أقريب أم بعيد ما توعدون

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إنه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون
