tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإن أدري لعله فتنة لكم ومتاع إلى حين
english: "I know not but that it may be a trial for you, and a grant of (worldly) livelihood (to you) for a time."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال رب احكم بالحق ۗ وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون
english: Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is the One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies ye utter!"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم ۚ إن زلزلة الساعة شيء عظيم
english: O mankind! fear your Lord! for the convulsion of the Hour (of Judgment) will be a thing terrible!
tafsir: Who are humble in their service,

arabic: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما أرضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكارى وما هم بسكارى ولكن عذاب الله شديد
english: The Day ye shall see it, every mother giving suck shall forget her suckling-babe, and every pregnant female shall drop her load (unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot, yet not drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah.
tafsir: Who shun all frivolities,

arabic: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطان مريد
english: And yet among men there are such as dispute about Allah, without knowledge, and follow every evil one obstinate in rebellion!
tafsir: Who strive for betterment;

arabic: كتب عليه أنه من تولاه فأنه يضله ويهديه إلى عذاب السعير
english: About the (Evil One) it is decreed that whoever turns to him for friendship, him will he lead astray, and he will guide him to the Penalty of the Fire.
tafsir: Who guard their sex

arabic: يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في ريب من البعث فإنا خلقناكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ۚ ونقر في الأرحام ما نشاء إلى أجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ۖ ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيئا ۚ وترى الأرض هامدة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت وأنبتت من كل زوج بهيج
english: O mankind! if ye have a doubt about the Resurrection, (consider) that We created you out of dust, then out of sperm, then out of a leech-like clot, then out of a morsel of flesh, partly formed and partly unformed, in order that We may manifest (our power) to you; and We cause whom We will to rest in the wombs for an appointed term, then do We bring you out as babes, then (foster you) that ye may reach your age of full strength; and some of you are called to die, and some are sent back to the feeblest old age, so that they know nothing after having known (much), and (further), thou seest the earth barren and lifeless, but when We pour down rain on it, it is stirred (to life), it swells, and it puts forth every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs).
tafsir: Except from their wives and women slaves of old are free of blame,

arabic: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأنه يحيي الموتى وأنه على كل شيء قدير
english: This is so, because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life to the dead, and it is He Who has power over all things.
tafsir: But those who covet more than this will be transgressors;

arabic: وأن الساعة آتية لا ريب فيها وأن الله يبعث من في القبور
english: And verily the Hour will come: there can be no doubt about it, or about (the fact) that Allah will raise up all who are in the graves.
tafsir: And those who fulfil their trusts and keep their promises;

arabic: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير
english: Yet there is among men such a one as disputes about Allah, without Knowledge, without Guidance, and without a Book of Enlightenment,-
tafsir: And those who are watchful of their acts of prayer.

arabic: ثاني عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله ۖ له في الدنيا خزي ۖ ونذيقه يوم القيامة عذاب الحريق
english: (Disdainfully) bending his side, in order to lead (men) astray from the Path of Allah: for him there is disgrace in this life, and on the Day of Judgment We shall make him taste the Penalty of burning (Fire).
tafsir: These are the real gainers,

arabic: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد
english: (It will be said): "This is because of the deeds which thy hands sent forth, for verily Allah is not unjust to His servants.
tafsir: Who will inherit Paradise, and live in it for ever.

arabic: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف ۖ فإن أصابه خير اطمأن به ۖ وإن أصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والآخرة ۚ ذلك هو الخسران المبين
english: There are among men some who serve Allah, as it were, on the verge: if good befalls them, they are, therewith, well content; but if a trial comes to them, they turn on their faces: they lose both this world and the Hereafter: that is loss for all to see!
tafsir: We created man from the finest extract of clay,

arabic: يدعو من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ۚ ذلك هو الضلال البعيد
english: They call on such deities, besides Allah, as can neither hurt nor profit them: that is straying far indeed (from the Way)!
tafsir: Then We placed him as a sperm in a firmly established lodging;

arabic: يدعو لمن ضره أقرب من نفعه ۚ لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير
english: (Perhaps) they call on one whose hurt is nearer than his profit: evil, indeed, is the patron, and evil the companion (or help)!
tafsir: Then We fashioned the sperm into an embryo, then fashioned the embryo into a shapeless lump of flesh; then from the lump of flesh We fashioned bones, then clothed the bones with flesh. Thus We formed him into a new creation. So blessed be God the best of Creators.

arabic: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ۚ إن الله يفعل ما يريد
english: Verily Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds, to Gardens, beneath which rivers flow: for Allah carries out all that He plans.
tafsir: And then you will certainly die,

arabic: من كان يظن أن لن ينصره الله في الدنيا والآخرة فليمدد بسبب إلى السماء ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ
english: If any think that Allah will not help him (His Messenger) in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages (him)!
tafsir: Then will be raised up on the Day of Resurrection.

arabic: وكذلك أنزلناه آيات بينات وأن الله يهدي من يريد
english: Thus have We sent down Clear Signs; and verily Allah doth guide whom He will!
tafsir: We made several highways one over the other above you. We are not neglectful of creation.

arabic: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئين والنصارى والمجوس والذين أشركوا إن الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة ۚ إن الله على كل شيء شهيد
english: Those who believe (in the Qur'an), those who follow the Jewish (scriptures), and the Sabians, Christians, Magians, and Polytheists,- Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment: for Allah is witness of all things.
tafsir: We send down water from the sky in determined measure, and store it up in the earth; and We have power to drain it away.

arabic: ألم تر أن الله يسجد له من في السماوات ومن في الأرض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس ۖ وكثير حق عليه العذاب ۗ ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم ۚ إن الله يفعل ما يشاء ۩
english: Seest thou not that to Allah bow down in worship all things that are in the heavens and on earth,- the sun, the moon, the stars; the hills, the trees, the animals; and a great number among mankind? But a great number are (also) such as are fit for Punishment: and such as Allah shall disgrace,- None can raise to honour: for Allah carries out all that He wills.
tafsir: We grow orchards of dates and grapes from it for you, Which yield fruits in abundance that you eat.

arabic: هذان خصمان اختصموا في ربهم ۖ فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق رءوسهم الحميم
english: These two antagonists dispute with each other about their Lord: But those who deny (their Lord),- for them will be cut out a garment of Fire: over their heads will be poured out boiling water.
tafsir: The tree that grows on Mount Sinai yields oil and seasoning for those who eat.

arabic: يصهر به ما في بطونهم والجلود
english: With it will be scalded what is within their bodies, as well as (their) skins.
tafsir: There are lessons for you in the cattle from whose bellies We give you milk to drink, and there are other advantages that you derive from them, and some of them you eat;

arabic: ولهم مقامع من حديد
english: In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.
tafsir: And you are carried on them and on boats.

arabic: كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها من غم أعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق
english: Every time they wish to get away therefrom, from anguish, they will be forced back therein, and (it will be said), "Taste ye the Penalty of Burning!"
tafsir: We sent Noah to his people. He said: "O my people, worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"

arabic: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ۖ ولباسهم فيها حرير
english: Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds, to Gardens beneath which rivers flow: they shall be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will be of silk.
tafsir: The chiefs of his people, who did not believe, said: "He is only a man like you. He wishes to acquire ascendancy over you. If God had willed He would have sent down angels. We never heard this from our elders.

arabic: وهدوا إلى الطيب من القول وهدوا إلى صراط الحميد
english: For they have been guided (in this life) to the purest of speeches; they have been guided to the Path of Him Who is Worthy of (all) Praise.
tafsir: He is only a man possessed; so wait and watch him for a time."

arabic: إن الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذي جعلناه للناس سواء العاكف فيه والباد ۚ ومن يرد فيه بإلحاد بظلم نذقه من عذاب أليم
english: As to those who have rejected (Allah), and would keep back (men) from the Way of Allah, and from the Sacred Mosque, which We have made (open) to (all) men - equal is the dweller there and the visitor from the country - and any whose purpose therein is profanity or wrong-doing - them will We cause to taste of a most Grievous Penalty.
tafsir: "O my Lord," prayed (Noah), "help me against them, for they accuse me of lies."

arabic: وإذ بوأنا لإبراهيم مكان البيت أن لا تشرك بي شيئا وطهر بيتي للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود
english: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).
tafsir: So We asked him to build the ark under Our eyes and guidance, (and said): "When Our command is issued and the source of water boils over, put a pair of every species in it, and your family except those for whom Our sentence has been passed already; and do not speak to Me for those who are wicked: They will be drowned.

arabic: وأذن في الناس بالحج يأتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر يأتين من كل فج عميق
english: "And proclaim the Pilgrimage among men: they will come to thee on foot and (mounted) on every kind of camel, lean on account of journeys through deep and distant mountain highways;
tafsir: When you and those with you have boarded the ark, say: 'All praise be to God who has delivered us from the people who were sinful.'

arabic: ليشهدوا منافع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله في أيام معلومات على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام ۖ فكلوا منها وأطعموا البائس الفقير
english: "That they may witness the benefits (provided) for them, and celebrate the name of Allah, through the Days appointed, over the cattle which He has provided for them (for sacrifice): then eat ye thereof and feed the distressed ones in want.
tafsir: And say: 'O Lord, disembark me in a welcome place; You are the best of deliverers.'

arabic: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق
english: "Then let them complete the rites prescribed for them, perform their vows, and (again) circumambulate the Ancient House."
tafsir: There were surely signs in this; We will surely put you to the test.

arabic: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمات الله فهو خير له عند ربه ۗ وأحلت لكم الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم ۖ فاجتنبوا الرجس من الأوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور
english: Such (is the Pilgrimage): whoever honours the sacred rites of Allah, for him it is good in the Sight of his Lord. Lawful to you (for food in Pilgrimage) are cattle, except those mentioned to you (as exception): but shun the abomination of idols, and shun the word that is false,-
tafsir: After them We raised a new generation.

arabic: حنفاء لله غير مشركين به ۚ ومن يشرك بالله فكأنما خر من السماء فتخطفه الطير أو تهوي به الريح في مكان سحيق
english: Being true in faith to Allah, and never assigning partners to Him: if anyone assigns partners to Allah, is as if he had fallen from heaven and been snatched up by birds, or the wind had swooped (like a bird on its prey) and thrown him into a far-distant place.
tafsir: Then We sent to them an apostle from among them (who said): "Worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed and fear God?"

arabic: ذلك ومن يعظم شعائر الله فإنها من تقوى القلوب
english: Such (is his state): and whoever holds in honour the symbols of Allah, (in the sacrifice of animals), such (honour) should come truly from piety of heart.
tafsir: The chiefs of the people who did not believe and denied the life to come, though We had given them good things of this life to enjoy, (said): "He is only a mortal like you. He eats as you do, and drinks as you drink.

arabic: لكم فيها منافع إلى أجل مسمى ثم محلها إلى البيت العتيق
english: In them ye have benefits for a term appointed: in the end their place of sacrifice is near the Ancient House.
tafsir: So if you follow a man like yourself you will certainly be doomed.

arabic: ولكل أمة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام ۗ فإلهكم إله واحد فله أسلموا ۗ وبشر المخبتين
english: To every people did We appoint rites (of sacrifice), that they might celebrate the name of Allah over the sustenance He gave them from animals (fit for food). But your god is One God: submit then your wills to Him (in Islam): and give thou the good news to those who humble themselves,-
tafsir: Does he give you a promise that when you are dead and turned to dust and bones, you will be raised to life again?

arabic: الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصابرين على ما أصابهم والمقيمي الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون
english: To those whose hearts when Allah is mentioned, are filled with fear, who show patient perseverance over their afflictions, keep up regular prayer, and spend (in charity) out of what We have bestowed upon them.
tafsir: How far-fetched what you are promised;

arabic: والبدن جعلناها لكم من شعائر الله لكم فيها خير ۖ فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف ۖ فإذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها وأطعموا القانع والمعتر ۚ كذلك سخرناها لكم لعلكم تشكرون
english: The sacrificial camels we have made for you as among the symbols from Allah: in them is (much) good for you: then pronounce the name of Allah over them as they line up (for sacrifice): when they are down on their sides (after slaughter), eat ye thereof, and feed such as (beg not but) live in contentment, and such as beg with due humility: thus have We made animals subject to you, that ye may be grateful.
tafsir: There is only the life of this world: We die and we live: there is no rising from the dead for us.

arabic: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم ۚ كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هداكم ۗ وبشر المحسنين
english: It is not their meat nor their blood, that reaches Allah: it is your piety that reaches Him: He has thus made them subject to you, that ye may glorify Allah for His Guidance to you and proclaim the good news to all who do right.
tafsir: He is just a man who invents a lie about God; we cannot believe in him."

arabic: إن الله يدافع عن الذين آمنوا ۗ إن الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور
english: Verily Allah will defend (from ill) those who believe: verily, Allah loveth not any that is a traitor to faith, or show ingratitude.
tafsir: (The apostle prayed): "O Lord, deliver me, for they accuse me of lies."

arabic: أذن للذين يقاتلون بأنهم ظلموا ۚ وإن الله على نصرهم لقدير
english: To those against whom war is made, permission is given (to fight), because they are wronged;- and verily, Allah is most powerful for their aid;-
tafsir: Answered (the Lord): "They shall wake up repenting soon."

arabic: الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم بغير حق إلا أن يقولوا ربنا الله ۗ ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صوامع وبيع وصلوات ومساجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ۗ ولينصرن الله من ينصره ۗ إن الله لقوي عزيز
english: (They are) those who have been expelled from their homes in defiance of right,- (for no cause) except that they say, "our Lord is Allah". Did not Allah check one set of people by means of another, there would surely have been pulled down monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques, in which the name of Allah is commemorated in abundant measure. Allah will certainly aid those who aid his (cause);- for verily Allah is full of Strength, Exalted in Might, (able to enforce His Will).
tafsir: So they were rightly seized by a mighty blast; and We turned them into mouldy rubbish: A good riddance of the wicked people!

arabic: الذين إن مكناهم في الأرض أقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأمروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ۗ ولله عاقبة الأمور
english: (They are) those who, if We establish them in the land, establish regular prayer and give regular charity, enjoin the right and forbid wrong: with Allah rests the end (and decision) of (all) affairs.
tafsir: Then after them We raised other generations.

arabic: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود
english: If they treat thy (mission) as false, so did the peoples before them (with their prophets),- the People of Noah, and 'Ad and Thamud;
tafsir: No nation can live beyond its allotted time, or lag behind.

arabic: وقوم إبراهيم وقوم لوط
english: Those of Abraham and Lut;
tafsir: Then We sent Our apostles one after the other. Every time an apostle came to a people they denied him. So We made one follow the other (to its doom), and turned them into bygone tales. Cursed be the people who do not believe!

arabic: وأصحاب مدين ۖ وكذب موسى فأمليت للكافرين ثم أخذتهم ۖ فكيف كان نكير
english: And the Companions of the Madyan People; and Moses was rejected (in the same way). But I granted respite to the Unbelievers, and (only) after that did I punish them: but how (terrible) was my rejection (of them)!
tafsir: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our miracles and clear proofs

arabic: فكأين من قرية أهلكناها وهي ظالمة فهي خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد
english: How many populations have We destroyed, which were given to wrong-doing? They tumbled down on their roofs. And how many wells are lying idle and neglected, and castles lofty and well-built?
tafsir: To Pharaoh and his nobles who behaved with arrogance, for they were a conceited lot,

arabic: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها أو آذان يسمعون بها ۖ فإنها لا تعمى الأبصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور
english: Do they not travel through the land, so that their hearts (and minds) may thus learn wisdom and their ears may thus learn to hear? Truly it is not their eyes that are blind, but their hearts which are in their breasts.
tafsir: And said: "Should we believe in two men like yourselves, whose people are our subjects?"

arabic: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده ۚ وإن يوما عند ربك كألف سنة مما تعدون
english: Yet they ask thee to hasten on the Punishment! But Allah will not fail in His Promise. Verily a Day in the sight of thy Lord is like a thousand years of your reckoning.
tafsir: Then they accused them of lies, and joined the company of those who were destroyed.

arabic: وكأين من قرية أمليت لها وهي ظالمة ثم أخذتها وإلي المصير
english: And to how many populations did I give respite, which were given to wrong-doing? in the end I punished them. To me is the destination (of all).
tafsir: And We gave the Book to Moses so that they may be guided.

arabic: قل يا أيها الناس إنما أنا لكم نذير مبين
english: Say: "O men! I am (sent) to you only to give a Clear Warning:
tafsir: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and gave them shelter on an elevated ground, sequestered, watered by a spring.

arabic: فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
english: "Those who believe and work righteousness, for them is forgiveness and a sustenance most generous.
tafsir: O you apostles, eat things that are clean, and do things that are good. We are surely cognisant of what you do.

arabic: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك أصحاب الجحيم
english: "But those who strive against Our Signs, to frustrate them,- they will be Companions of the Fire."
tafsir: Verily this your order is one order, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.

arabic: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبي إلا إذا تمنى ألقى الشيطان في أمنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقي الشيطان ثم يحكم الله آياته ۗ والله عليم حكيم
english: Never did We send a messenger or a prophet before thee, but, when he framed a desire, Satan threw some (vanity) into his desire: but Allah will cancel anything (vain) that Satan throws in, and Allah will confirm (and establish) His Signs: for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom:
tafsir: But then they divided up their order into different creeds, each section rejoicing in what it had come to have.

arabic: ليجعل ما يلقي الشيطان فتنة للذين في قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم ۗ وإن الظالمين لفي شقاق بعيد
english: That He may make the suggestions thrown in by Satan, but a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease and who are hardened of heart: verily the wrong-doers are in a schism far (from the Truth):
tafsir: So leave them to their ignorance for a time.

arabic: وليعلم الذين أوتوا العلم أنه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم ۗ وإن الله لهاد الذين آمنوا إلى صراط مستقيم
english: And that those on whom knowledge has been bestowed may learn that the (Qur'an) is the Truth from thy Lord, and that they may believe therein, and their hearts may be made humbly (open) to it: for verily Allah is the Guide of those who believe, to the Straight Way.
tafsir: Do they think that by increasing their wealth and children

arabic: ولا يزال الذين كفروا في مرية منه حتى تأتيهم الساعة بغتة أو يأتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم
english: Those who reject Faith will not cease to be in doubt concerning (Revelation) until the Hour (of Judgment) comes suddenly upon them, or there comes to them the Penalty of a Day of Disaster.
tafsir: We are hastening to reward them for good deeds? No. They do not comprehend.

arabic: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم ۚ فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في جنات النعيم
english: On that Day of Dominion will be that of Allah: He will judge between them: so those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in Gardens of Delight.
tafsir: Surely those who live in awe of their Lord,

arabic: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا فأولئك لهم عذاب مهين
english: And for those who reject Faith and deny our Signs, there will be a humiliating Punishment.
tafsir: Who believe in their Lord's revelations,

arabic: والذين هاجروا في سبيل الله ثم قتلوا أو ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا ۚ وإن الله لهو خير الرازقين
english: Those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah, and are then slain or die,- On them will Allah bestow verily a goodly Provision: Truly Allah is He Who bestows the best provision.
tafsir: Who do not associate any one with their Lord,

arabic: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه ۗ وإن الله لعليم حليم
english: Verily He will admit them to a place with which they shall be well pleased: for Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.
tafsir: Who give whatsoever they give (in His way), and their hearts tremble with fear that they have to go back to their Lord,

arabic: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغي عليه لينصرنه الله ۗ إن الله لعفو غفور
english: That (is so). And if one has retaliated to no greater extent than the injury he received, and is again set upon inordinately, Allah will help him: for Allah is One that blots out (sins) and forgives (again and again).
tafsir: Are the ones who hasten to goodness and outpace the others.

arabic: ذلك بأن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وأن الله سميع بصير
english: That is because Allah merges night into day, and He merges day into night, and verily it is Allah Who hears and sees (all things).
tafsir: We do not burden a soul beyond capacity, for We have a record that tells the truth. No wrong will be done to any one.

arabic: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه هو الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير
english: That is because Allah - He is the Reality; and those besides Him whom they invoke,- they are but vain Falsehood: verily Allah is He, Most High, Most Great.
tafsir: Yet their hearts are oblivious of this; and besides, they are busy with other things,

arabic: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فتصبح الأرض مخضرة ۗ إن الله لطيف خبير
english: Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and forthwith the earth becomes clothed with green? for Allah is He Who understands the finest mysteries, and is well-acquainted (with them).
tafsir: So that when We seize the affluent among them with affliction, they will begin to implore for help.

arabic: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ۗ وإن الله لهو الغني الحميد
english: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: for verily Allah,- He is free of all wants, Worthy of all Praise.
tafsir: "Do not supplicate for help today; you will not be rescued by Us;

arabic: ألم تر أن الله سخر لكم ما في الأرض والفلك تجري في البحر بأمره ويمسك السماء أن تقع على الأرض إلا بإذنه ۗ إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم
english: Seest thou not that Allah has made subject to you (men) all that is on the earth, and the ships that sail through the sea by His Command? He withholds the sky (rain) from failing on the earth except by His leave: for Allah is Most Kind and Most Merciful to man.
tafsir: For when My revelations were read out to you, you turned back on your heels and fled

arabic: وهو الذي أحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ۗ إن الإنسان لكفور
english: It is He Who gave you life, will cause you to die, and will again give you life: Truly man is a most ungrateful creature!
tafsir: Insolently, treating them like tales told at night."

arabic: لكل أمة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه ۖ فلا ينازعنك في الأمر ۚ وادع إلى ربك ۖ إنك لعلى هدى مستقيم
english: To every People have We appointed rites and ceremonies which they must follow: let them not then dispute with thee on the matter, but do thou invite (them) to thy Lord: for thou art assuredly on the Right Way.
tafsir: Why did they not think over the message? Or has something come to them which had not come to their fathers?

arabic: وإن جادلوك فقل الله أعلم بما تعملون
english: If they do wrangle with thee, say, "Allah knows best what it is ye are doing."
tafsir: Or did they not recognise their apostle, and rejected him?

arabic: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون
english: "Allah will judge between you on the Day of Judgment concerning the matters in which ye differ."
tafsir: Or do they say that he is possessed? In fact, he has brought the truth to them, but most of them abhor the truth.

arabic: ألم تعلم أن الله يعلم ما في السماء والأرض ۗ إن ذلك في كتاب ۚ إن ذلك على الله يسير
english: Knowest thou not that Allah knows all that is in heaven and on earth? Indeed it is all in a Record, and that is easy for Allah.
tafsir: Had truth been subject to their whims the heavens and the earth and all those within them would have been depraved. In fact We had sent them their reminder, but they turned away from good advice.

arabic: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وما ليس لهم به علم ۗ وما للظالمين من نصير
english: Yet they worship, besides Allah, things for which no authority has been sent down to them, and of which they have (really) no knowledge: for those that do wrong there is no helper.
tafsir: Or do you ask of them any tribute? In that case the tribute of your Lord is better, for He is the best of providers.

arabic: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات تعرف في وجوه الذين كفروا المنكر ۖ يكادون يسطون بالذين يتلون عليهم آياتنا ۗ قل أفأنبئكم بشر من ذلكم ۗ النار وعدها الله الذين كفروا ۖ وبئس المصير
english: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, thou wilt notice a denial on the faces of the Unbelievers! they nearly attack with violence those who rehearse Our Signs to them. Say, "Shall I tell you of something (far) worse than these Signs? It is the Fire (of Hell)! Allah has promised it to the Unbelievers! and evil is that destination!"
tafsir: You are surely calling them to the right path.

arabic: يا أيها الناس ضرب مثل فاستمعوا له ۚ إن الذين تدعون من دون الله لن يخلقوا ذبابا ولو اجتمعوا له ۖ وإن يسلبهم الذباب شيئا لا يستنقذوه منه ۚ ضعف الطالب والمطلوب
english: O men! Here is a parable set forth! listen to it! Those on whom, besides Allah, ye call, cannot create (even) a fly, if they all met together for the purpose! and if the fly should snatch away anything from them, they would have no power to release it from the fly. Feeble are those who petition and those whom they petition!
tafsir: But those who believe not in the Hereafter turn away from the straight path.

arabic: ما قدروا الله حق قدره ۗ إن الله لقوي عزيز
english: No just estimate have they made of Allah: for Allah is He Who is strong and able to Carry out His Will.
tafsir: If We took compassion on them and removed the affliction they are in, they would only wander lost in confusion.

arabic: الله يصطفي من الملائكة رسلا ومن الناس ۚ إن الله سميع بصير
english: Allah chooses messengers from angels and from men for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).
tafsir: We had seized them with the punishment, but they did not bow before their Lord nor turned to Him in humility,

arabic: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ۗ وإلى الله ترجع الأمور
english: He knows what is before them and what is behind them: and to Allah go back all questions (for decision).
tafsir: So that when at last We open up the gate of severe punishment on them they will be overwhelmed with despair.

arabic: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اركعوا واسجدوا واعبدوا ربكم وافعلوا الخير لعلكم تفلحون ۩
english: O ye who believe! bow down, prostrate yourselves, and adore your Lord; and do good; that ye may prosper.
tafsir: It is He who gave you hearing, sight, and hearts, but only few of you give thanks.

arabic: وجاهدوا في الله حق جهاده ۚ هو اجتباكم وما جعل عليكم في الدين من حرج ۚ ملة أبيكم إبراهيم ۚ هو سماكم المسلمين من قبل وفي هذا ليكون الرسول شهيدا عليكم وتكونوا شهداء على الناس ۚ فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واعتصموا بالله هو مولاكم ۖ فنعم المولى ونعم النصير
english: And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive, (with sincerity and under discipline). He has chosen you, and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims, both before and in this (Revelation); that the Messenger may be a witness for you, and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer, give regular Charity, and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector - the Best to protect and the Best to help!
tafsir: It is He who multiplied you on the earth, and it will be before Him that you will be gathered.

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قد أفلح المؤمنون
english: The believers must (eventually) win through,-
tafsir: The adulteress and adulterer should be flogged a hundred lashes each, and no pity for them should deter you from the law of God, if you believe in God and the Last Day; and the punishment should be witnessed by a body of believers.

arabic: الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون
english: Those who humble themselves in their prayers;
tafsir: The adulterer can marry no one but an adulteress or his partner (in the act), and the adulteress cannot marry any but an adulterer or her partner (in the act). This is forbidden the believers,

arabic: والذين هم عن اللغو معرضون
english: Who avoid vain talk;
tafsir: Those who defame chaste women and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes, and their testimony should not be accepted afterwards, for they are profligates,

arabic: والذين هم للزكاة فاعلون
english: Who are active in deeds of charity;
tafsir: Except those who repent after this and reform; and God is surely forgiving and kind.

arabic: والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون
english: Who abstain from sex,
tafsir: Those who accuse their wives and do not have any witnesses except themselves, should swear four times in the name of God, the testimony of each such person being that he is speaking the truth,

arabic: إلا على أزواجهم أو ما ملكت أيمانهم فإنهم غير ملومين
english: Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond, or (the captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (in their case) they are free from blame,
tafsir: And (swear) a fifth time that if he tell a lie the curse of God be on him.

arabic: فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فأولئك هم العادون
english: But those whose desires exceed those limits are transgressors;-
tafsir: The woman's punishment can be averted if she swears four times by God as testimony that her husband is a liar,

arabic: والذين هم لأماناتهم وعهدهم راعون
english: Those who faithfully observe their trusts and their covenants;
tafsir: Her fifth oath being that the curse of God be on her if her husband should be speaking the truth.

arabic: والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون
english: And who (strictly) guard their prayers;-
tafsir: (This would not have been possible) if the grace and benevolence of God were not upon you; but God is compassionate and wise.

arabic: أولئك هم الوارثون
english: These will be the heirs,
tafsir: Those who spread lies were a clique among you. Do not think that it was bad for you: In fact it has been good for you. Each of them will pay for the sin he has committed, and he who had greater share (of guilt) will suffer grievous punishment.

arabic: الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون
english: Who will inherit Paradise: they will dwell therein (for ever).
tafsir: Why did the faithful men and women not think well of their people when they heard this, and said: "This is a clear lie?"

arabic: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من سلالة من طين
english: Man We did create from a quintessence (of clay);
tafsir: Why did they not bring four witnesses (in support of their charge)? And since they did not bring the four witnesses they are themselves liars in the sight of God.

arabic: ثم جعلناه نطفة في قرار مكين
english: Then We placed him as (a drop of) sperm in a place of rest, firmly fixed;
tafsir: Were it not for the grace of God and His mercy upon you in this world and the next, you would have suffered a great affliction for the false accusation.

arabic: ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة فخلقنا العلقة مضغة فخلقنا المضغة عظاما فكسونا العظام لحما ثم أنشأناه خلقا آخر ۚ فتبارك الله أحسن الخالقين
english: Then We made the sperm into a clot of congealed blood; then of that clot We made a (foetus) lump; then we made out of that lump bones and clothed the bones with flesh; then we developed out of it another creature. So blessed be Allah, the best to create!
tafsir: When you talked about it and said what you did not know, and took it lightly -- though in the sight of God it was serious --

arabic: ثم إنكم بعد ذلك لميتون
english: After that, at length ye will die
tafsir: Why did you not say when you heard it: "It is not for us to speak of it? God preserve us, it is a great calumny!"

arabic: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة تبعثون
english: Again, on the Day of Judgment, will ye be raised up.
tafsir: God counsels you not to do a thing like this, if you are believers.

arabic: ولقد خلقنا فوقكم سبع طرائق وما كنا عن الخلق غافلين
english: And We have made, above you, seven tracts; and We are never unmindful of (our) Creation.
tafsir: God explains His commands to you clearly, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.

arabic: وأنزلنا من السماء ماء بقدر فأسكناه في الأرض ۖ وإنا على ذهاب به لقادرون
english: And We send down water from the sky according to (due) measure, and We cause it to soak in the soil; and We certainly are able to drain it off (with ease).
tafsir: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know.

arabic: فأنشأنا لكم به جنات من نخيل وأعناب لكم فيها فواكه كثيرة ومنها تأكلون
english: With it We grow for you gardens of date-palms and vines: in them have ye abundant fruits: and of them ye eat (and have enjoyment),-
tafsir: But for the grace of God and His mercy (much harm would have been done); yet God is compassionate and kind.

arabic: وشجرة تخرج من طور سيناء تنبت بالدهن وصبغ للآكلين
english: Also a tree springing out of Mount Sinai, which produces oil, and relish for those who use it for food.
tafsir: O you who believe, do not follow in the footsteps of Satan, for he who follows in the footsteps of Satan will be induced by him to what is shameful and forbidden. But for the grace of God and His mercy upon you none of you would have escaped undefiled; but God makes whosoever He will grow in goodness, for God is all-hearing and all-knowing.

arabic: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة ۖ نسقيكم مما في بطونها ولكم فيها منافع كثيرة ومنها تأكلون
english: And in cattle (too) ye have an instructive example: from within their bodies We produce (milk) for you to drink; there are, in them, (besides), numerous (other) benefits for you; and of their (meat) ye eat;
tafsir: Let not those who are men of plenty and means among you swear that they will not give to their relatives and the poor and those who leave their homes in the service of God. They should forgive and overlook (their failings). Would you not like God to forgive you? And God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون
english: And on them, as well as in ships, ye ride.
tafsir: Verily those who blaspheme unsuspecting chaste believing women will be cursed in this world and the next; and for them there will be severe punishment.

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره ۖ أفلا تتقون
english: (Further, We sent a long line of prophets for your instruction). We sent Noah to his people: He said, "O my people! worship Allah! Ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"
tafsir: The day their tongues and hands and feet bear witness to what they had done,

arabic: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يريد أن يتفضل عليكم ولو شاء الله لأنزل ملائكة ما سمعنا بهذا في آبائنا الأولين
english: The chiefs of the Unbelievers among his people said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: his wish is to assert his superiority over you: if Allah had wished (to send messengers), He could have sent down angels; never did we hear such a thing (as he says), among our ancestors of old."
tafsir: God will pay them on that day their just due in full, and they will come to know that God is the tangible Reality.

arabic: إن هو إلا رجل به جنة فتربصوا به حتى حين
english: (And some said): "He is only a man possessed: wait (and have patience) with him for a time."
tafsir: Bad women deserve bad men, and bad men are for bad women; but good women are for good men, and good men for good women, for they are innocent of what people say. There is forgiveness for them and a gracious provision.

arabic: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون
english: (Noah) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of falsehood!"
tafsir: O you who believe, do not enter other houses except yours without first asking permission and saluting the inmates. This is better for you: You may haply take heed.

arabic: فأوحينا إليه أن اصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا فإذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور ۙ فاسلك فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول منهم ۖ ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا ۖ إنهم مغرقون
english: So We inspired him (with this message): "Construct the Ark within Our sight and under Our guidance: then when comes Our Command, and the fountains of the earth gush forth, take thou on board pairs of every species, male and female, and thy family- except those of them against whom the Word has already gone forth: And address Me not in favour of the wrong-doers; for they shall be drowned (in the Flood).
tafsir: If you find that no one is in, then do not enter unless you have received permission. If you are asked to go away, turn back. That is proper for you. God is aware of what you do.

arabic: فإذا استويت أنت ومن معك على الفلك فقل الحمد لله الذي نجانا من القوم الظالمين
english: And when thou hast embarked on the Ark - thou and those with thee,- say: "Praise be to Allah, Who has saved us from the people who do wrong."
tafsir: There is no harm in going into uninhabited houses where there is some convenience for you, as God has knowledge of what you hide and what you disclose.

arabic: وقل رب أنزلني منزلا مباركا وأنت خير المنزلين
english: And say: "O my Lord! enable me to disembark with thy blessing: for Thou art the Best to enable (us) to disembark."
tafsir: Tell the believing men to lower their eyes and guard their private parts. There is for them goodness in this. God is aware of what they do.

arabic: إن في ذلك لآيات وإن كنا لمبتلين
english: Verily in this there are Signs (for men to understand); (thus) do We try (men).
tafsir: Tell the believing women to lower their eyes, guard their private parts, and not display their charms except what is apparent outwardly, and cover their bosoms with their veils and not to show their finery except to their husbands or their fathers or fathers-in-law, their sons or step-sons, brothers, or their brothers' and sisters' sons, or their women attendants or captives, or male attendants who do not have any need (for women), or boys not yet aware of sex. They should not walk stamping their feet lest they make known what they hide of their Ornaments. O believers, turn to God, every one of you, so that you may be successful.

arabic: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين
english: Then We raised after them another generation.
tafsir: Marry off those who are single among you, and those of your male and female servants who are righteous. If they are poor, God will enrich them of His grace, for God is bounteous and all-knowing.

arabic: فأرسلنا فيهم رسولا منهم أن اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره ۖ أفلا تتقون
english: And We sent to them a messenger from among themselves, (saying), "Worship Allah! ye have no other god but Him. Will ye not fear (Him)?"
tafsir: Those who cannot afford to marry should abstain from what is unlawful until God enriches them by His grace. And free those slaves you possess who wish to buy their freedom after a written undertaking, if you know they have some goodness, and give them out of the riches God has given you. Do not force your maids to prostitution if they wish to lead married lives, in order to get the benefits of this world. But if someone forces them, surely God (will forgive them) after their forced helplessness, for He is forgiving and kind.

arabic: وقال الملأ من قومه الذين كفروا وكذبوا بلقاء الآخرة وأترفناهم في الحياة الدنيا ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يأكل مما تأكلون منه ويشرب مما تشربون
english: And the chiefs of his people, who disbelieved and denied the Meeting in the Hereafter, and on whom We had bestowed the good things of this life, said: "He is no more than a man like yourselves: he eats of that of which ye eat, and drinks of what ye drink.
tafsir: We have sent down clear instructions to you, and illustrations from (the accounts) of those who have gone before you, and a warning for those who take heed for themselves.

arabic: ولئن أطعتم بشرا مثلكم إنكم إذا لخاسرون
english: "If ye obey a man like yourselves, behold, it is certain ye will be lost.
tafsir: God is the light of the heavens and the earth. The semblance of His light is that of a niche in which is a lamp, the flame within a glass, the glass a glittering star as it were, lit with the oil of a blessed tree, the olive, neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil appears to light up even though fire touches it not, -- light upon light. God guides to His light whom He will. So does God advance precepts of wisdom for men, for God has knowledge of everything.

arabic: أيعدكم أنكم إذا متم وكنتم ترابا وعظاما أنكم مخرجون
english: "Does he promise that when ye die and become dust and bones, ye shall be brought forth (again)?
tafsir: (The light is lit) in houses of worship which God has allowed to be raised, and His name remembered in them. His praises are sung there morning and evening,

arabic: هيهات هيهات لما توعدون
english: "Far, very far is that which ye are promised!
tafsir: By men not distracted from the remembrance of God either by trade and commerce or buying and selling, who stand by their devotional obligations and pay the zakat, who fear the day when hearts and eyes would flutter with trepidation

arabic: إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما نحن بمبعوثين
english: "There is nothing but our life in this world! We shall die and we live! But we shall never be raised up again!
tafsir: That God may reward them for the best of their deeds, and bestow more on them of His bounty, for God gives whom He please without measure.

arabic: إن هو إلا رجل افترى على الله كذبا وما نحن له بمؤمنين
english: "He is only a man who invents a lie against Allah, but we are not the ones to believe in him!"
tafsir: As for those who disbelieve, their deeds are like a mirage in the desert which the thirsty takes for water till he reaches it to find that there was nothing, and finds God with him who settles his account, for God is swift at the reckoning.

arabic: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون
english: (The prophet) said: "O my Lord! help me: for that they accuse me of falsehood."
tafsir: Or like darkness in a wide, wide sea, waves surging upon waves, with clouds overhanging, darkness on darkness. If you stretch your hand, you could hardly see it. For him whom God does not give any light, there is no light.

arabic: قال عما قليل ليصبحن نادمين
english: (Allah) said: "In but a little while, they are sure to be sorry!"
tafsir: Have you not seen that all those who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds on the wing, sing the praises of God. Each one knows its obligations and its duties, and God knows whatever they do.

arabic: فأخذتهم الصيحة بالحق فجعلناهم غثاء ۚ فبعدا للقوم الظالمين
english: Then the Blast overtook them with justice, and We made them as rubbish of dead leaves (floating on the stream of Time)! So away with the people who do wrong!
tafsir: For God's is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and the returning is to God.

arabic: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرونا آخرين
english: Then We raised after them other generations.
tafsir: Have you not seen that God drives the clouds, then joins them together and puts them fold on fold. Then you see the rain fall through them; and He sends down hail from the sky where there are mountains of it, and strikes those with it whom He will, and wards it off from whomsoever He please. His lightning could snatch away their eyes.

arabic: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون
english: No people can hasten their term, nor can they delay (it).
tafsir: It is God who alternates night and day. There is surely a lesson in this for men of sight.

arabic: ثم أرسلنا رسلنا تترى ۖ كل ما جاء أمة رسولها كذبوه ۚ فأتبعنا بعضهم بعضا وجعلناهم أحاديث ۚ فبعدا لقوم لا يؤمنون
english: Then sent We our messengers in succession: every time there came to a people their messenger, they accused him of falsehood: so We made them follow each other (in punishment): We made them as a tale (that is told): So away with a people that will not believe!
tafsir: God created every moving thing from water: One crawls on its belly, one walks on two legs, another moves on four. God creates whatsoever He will. Indeed God has power over everything.

arabic: ثم أرسلنا موسى وأخاه هارون بآياتنا وسلطان مبين
english: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our Signs and authority manifest,
tafsir: We have surely sent down clear signs. It is God who guides whom He will to the path that is straight.

arabic: إلى فرعون وملئه فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما عالين
english: To Pharaoh and his Chiefs: But these behaved insolently: they were an arrogant people.
tafsir: They say they believe in God and the Prophet, and have come to believe, yet a section of them turns back even after this; and these are not believers.

arabic: فقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا وقومهما لنا عابدون
english: They said: "Shall we believe in two men like ourselves? And their people are subject to us!"
tafsir: When they are called to God and His Prophet, that he may judge between them, a section of them turns away.

arabic: فكذبوهما فكانوا من المهلكين
english: So they accused them of falsehood, and they became of those who were destroyed.
tafsir: Had right been on their side they would have come to him submissively.

arabic: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب لعلهم يهتدون
english: And We gave Moses the Book, in order that they might receive guidance.
tafsir: Is there a malady in their hearts, or they are deluded, or afraid that God and His Prophet would be unjust in dealing with them? Not so; they are themselves unjust.

arabic: وجعلنا ابن مريم وأمه آية وآويناهما إلى ربوة ذات قرار ومعين
english: And We made the son of Mary and his mother as a Sign: We gave them both shelter on high ground, affording rest and security and furnished with springs.
tafsir: The answer of the believers when they are called to God and His Apostle that he may judge between them, is: "We hear and obey." And they are the ones who will prosper.

arabic: يا أيها الرسل كلوا من الطيبات واعملوا صالحا ۖ إني بما تعملون عليم
english: O ye messengers! enjoy (all) things good and pure, and work righteousness: for I am well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.
tafsir: Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success.

arabic: وإن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاتقون
english: And verily this Brotherhood of yours is a single Brotherhood, and I am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore fear Me (and no other).
tafsir: They swear solemnly by God: "If you command us we shall go forth." Say: "Do not swear. What is wanted is obedience, as should be. God is certainly aware of what you do."

arabic: فتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم زبرا ۖ كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون
english: But people have cut off their affair (of unity), between them, into sects: each party rejoices in that which is with itself.
tafsir: Say: "Obey God and obey the Apostle. If you turn away, then for him is his duty to fulfil, and for you the burden that you carry; yet if you obey him you will be rightly guided. The duty of the Messenger is to convey the message clearly.

arabic: فذرهم في غمرتهم حتى حين
english: But leave them in their confused ignorance for a time.
tafsir: God has promised to make those of you who believe and do the right, leaders in the land, as He had made those before them, and will establish their faith which He has chosen for them and change their fear into security. They will worship Me and not associate any one with Me. But those who disbelieve after this will be reprobates.

arabic: أيحسبون أنما نمدهم به من مال وبنين
english: Do they think that because We have granted them abundance of wealth and sons,
tafsir: So observe your devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and obey the Apostle so that you may be shown mercy.

arabic: نسارع لهم في الخيرات ۚ بل لا يشعرون
english: We would hasten them on in every good? Nay, they do not understand.
tafsir: Do not think that unbelievers will subvert (the authority of God) on earth. Their abode is Hell; and what an evil destination!

arabic: إن الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون
english: Verily those who live in awe for fear of their Lord;
tafsir: O you who believe, let your dependants and those who have not yet reached the age of puberty, ask permission (to enter your presence) on three occasions: Before the early morning prayer; when you disrobe for the mid-day siesta; and after prayer at night. These are the three occasions of dishabille for you. There is no harm if you or they visit one another at other times (without permission). God thus explains things to you clearly, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.

arabic: والذين هم بآيات ربهم يؤمنون
english: Those who believe in the Signs of their Lord;
tafsir: When your children have reached the age of puberty, they should similarly ask your leave (for entering) as others did before them. God thus clearly explains His commands to you, for God is all-knowing and all-wise.

arabic: والذين هم بربهم لا يشركون
english: Those who join not (in worship) partners with their Lord;
tafsir: As for your women past the age of bearing children, who have no hope of marriage, there is no harm if they take off their outer garments, but in such a way that they do not display their charms; yet if they avoid this it would be better for them. God is all-hearing and all-knowing.

arabic: والذين يؤتون ما آتوا وقلوبهم وجلة أنهم إلى ربهم راجعون
english: And those who dispense their charity with their hearts full of fear, because they will return to their Lord;-
tafsir: There is no harm if the blind, the lame, the sick, or you yourselves, eat in your own houses or the houses of your fathers, mothers, or your brothers' houses, or those of your sisters, or your fathers' brothers' or sisters', or your mothers' brothers' or sisters', or in the houses whose care is entrusted to you, or the houses of your friends.

arabic: أولئك يسارعون في الخيرات وهم لها سابقون
english: It is these who hasten in every good work, and these who are foremost in them.
tafsir: There is no harm in your eating together or separately. But when you enter the houses, salute the inmates with a greeting in the name of God, invoking blessings and good health. That is how God explains things to you clearly so that you may understand. They alone are true believers who believe in God and His Apostle, and when they are with him on a matter of common concern, do not depart without obtaining his leave. Surely those who ask leave of you are the ones who believe in God and His Apostle. Therefore when they ask leave of you for personal business give leave to those you please, and seek God's forgiveness for them. Surely God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: ولا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها ۖ ولدينا كتاب ينطق بالحق ۚ وهم لا يظلمون
english: On no soul do We place a burden greater than it can bear: before Us is a record which clearly shows the truth: they will never be wronged.
tafsir: Do not consider your being summoned by the Apostle to be like your summoning one another. God knows those of you who go away surreptitiously. So let those who act in contravention of his command take heed lest a trial should befall them or a grievous punishment come upon them.

arabic: بل قلوبهم في غمرة من هذا ولهم أعمال من دون ذلك هم لها عاملون
english: But their hearts are in confused ignorance of this; and there are, besides that, deeds of theirs, which they will (continue) to do,-

arabic: الزانية والزاني فاجلدوا كل واحد منهما مائة جلدة ۖ ولا تأخذكم بهما رأفة في دين الله إن كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ۖ وليشهد عذابهما طائفة من المؤمنين
