arabic: الزاني لا ينكح إلا زانية أو مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها إلا زان أو مشرك ۚ وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين
english: Let no man guilty of adultery or fornication marry and but a woman similarly guilty, or an Unbeliever: nor let any but such a man or an Unbeliever marry such a woman: to the Believers such a thing is forbidden.
tafsir: Yet the unbelievers say: "This is nothing but a lie he has concocted in which others have aided him." They have come down to mischief and lies.

arabic: والذين يرمون المحصنات ثم لم يأتوا بأربعة شهداء فاجلدوهم ثمانين جلدة ولا تقبلوا لهم شهادة أبدا ۚ وأولئك هم الفاسقون
english: And those who launch a charge against chaste women, and produce not four witnesses (to support their allegations),- flog them with eighty stripes; and reject their evidence ever after: for such men are wicked transgressors;-
tafsir: And they say: "These are fables of antiquity he has invented, which are dictated to him morning and evening."

arabic: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم
english: Unless they repent thereafter and mend (their conduct); for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: Say: "He who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth has revealed it to me; and He is surely forgiving and kind."

arabic: والذين يرمون أزواجهم ولم يكن لهم شهداء إلا أنفسهم فشهادة أحدهم أربع شهادات بالله ۙ إنه لمن الصادقين
english: And for those who launch a charge against their spouses, and have (in support) no evidence but their own,- their solitary evidence (can be received) if they bear witness four times (with an oath) by Allah that they are solemnly telling the truth;
tafsir: But they say: "What sort of prophet is this who eats food and walks the market places? Why was no angel sent to him to act as admonisher with him?

arabic: والخامسة أن لعنت الله عليه إن كان من الكاذبين
english: And the fifth (oath) (should be) that they solemnly invoke the curse of Allah on themselves if they tell a lie.
tafsir: Or a treasure should have been given to him, or he should have had an orchard from which he could eat." And these wicked people say: "You only follow a man ensorcelled."

arabic: ويدرأ عنها العذاب أن تشهد أربع شهادات بالله ۙ إنه لمن الكاذبين
english: But it would avert the punishment from the wife, if she bears witness four times (with an oath) By Allah, that (her husband) is telling a lie;
tafsir: Just see what comparisons they bring up for you! They are lost and cannot find the way.

arabic: والخامسة أن غضب الله عليها إن كان من الصادقين
english: And the fifth (oath) should be that she solemnly invokes the wrath of Allah on herself if (her accuser) is telling the truth.
tafsir: Blessed be He who, if He pleased, could give you better than that, -- gardens with rivers flowing by; and make palaces for you.

arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله تواب حكيم
english: If it were not for Allah's grace and mercy on you, and that Allah is Oft-Returning, full of Wisdom,- (Ye would be ruined indeed).
tafsir: Yet they reject the Hour as untrue. We have prepared a Fire for those who deny the Resurrection.

arabic: إن الذين جاءوا بالإفك عصبة منكم ۚ لا تحسبوه شرا لكم ۖ بل هو خير لكم ۚ لكل امرئ منهم ما اكتسب من الإثم ۚ والذي تولى كبره منهم له عذاب عظيم
english: Those who brought forward the lie are a body among yourselves: think it not to be an evil to you; On the contrary it is good for you: to every man among them (will come the punishment) of the sin that he earned, and to him who took on himself the lead among them, will be a penalty grievous.
tafsir: When (Hell) appears to them from a distance they will hear it raging and roaring.

arabic: لولا إذ سمعتموه ظن المؤمنون والمؤمنات بأنفسهم خيرا وقالوا هذا إفك مبين
english: Why did not the believers - men and women - when ye heard of the affair,- put the best construction on it in their own minds and say, "This (charge) is an obvious lie"?
tafsir: And when they are cast within a narrow space of it chained together, they would plead for death.

arabic: لولا جاءوا عليه بأربعة شهداء ۚ فإذ لم يأتوا بالشهداء فأولئك عند الله هم الكاذبون
english: Why did they not bring four witnesses to prove it? When they have not brought the witnesses, such men, in the sight of Allah, (stand forth) themselves as liars!
tafsir: "Do not ask for one death but many deaths on this day."

arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته في الدنيا والآخرة لمسكم في ما أفضتم فيه عذاب عظيم
english: Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you, in this world and the Hereafter, a grievous penalty would have seized you in that ye rushed glibly into this affair.
tafsir: Ask them: "Is this better or a garden for everlasting abode which has been promised the pious and devout? It would be their guerdon and their destination.

arabic: إذ تلقونه بألسنتكم وتقولون بأفواهكم ما ليس لكم به علم وتحسبونه هينا وهو عند الله عظيم
english: Behold, ye received it on your tongues, and said out of your mouths things of which ye had no knowledge; and ye thought it to be a light matter, while it was most serious in the sight of Allah.
tafsir: There will they have whatever they wish, and there abide for ever." This is a promise incumbent on your Lord which will certainly be fulfilled.

arabic: ولولا إذ سمعتموه قلتم ما يكون لنا أن نتكلم بهذا سبحانك هذا بهتان عظيم
english: And why did ye not, when ye heard it, say? - "It is not right of us to speak of this: Glory to Allah! this is a most serious slander!"
tafsir: The day He will gather them together along with those they worshipped other than God, He will ask them: "Did you lure these creatures of Mine away, or did they themselves go astray?"

arabic: يعظكم الله أن تعودوا لمثله أبدا إن كنتم مؤمنين
english: Allah doth admonish you, that ye may never repeat such (conduct), if ye are (true) Believers.
tafsir: They will answer: "Glory to You. It was not worthy of us to seek any protector other than You. But You allowed them and their fathers a life of ease until they turned oblivious of the Reminder. They were a people impenitent.

arabic: ويبين الله لكم الآيات ۚ والله عليم حكيم
english: And Allah makes the Signs plain to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
tafsir: (The idolaters will be told): "Your gods have refuted your assertion. You can neither avert (your doom) nor receive any help. We shall make the wicked among you taste of severe punishment."

arabic: إن الذين يحبون أن تشيع الفاحشة في الذين آمنوا لهم عذاب أليم في الدنيا والآخرة ۚ والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون
english: Those who love (to see) scandal published broadcast among the Believers, will have a grievous Penalty in this life and in the Hereafter: Allah knows, and ye know not.
tafsir: We never sent before you apostles who did not eat food and walk the market places. We make some of you the means of trying the others. So will you persevere? Your Lord is always watching.

arabic: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله رءوف رحيم
english: Were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you, and that Allah is full of kindness and mercy, (ye would be ruined indeed).
tafsir: Those who do not hope to meet Us say: "Why are no angels sent down to us, or why do we not see our Lord?" They are full of self-conceit and behave with intense arrogance.

arabic: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان ۚ ومن يتبع خطوات الشيطان فإنه يأمر بالفحشاء والمنكر ۚ ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم من أحد أبدا ولكن الله يزكي من يشاء ۗ والله سميع عليم
english: O ye who believe! follow not Satan's footsteps: if any will follow the footsteps of Satan, he will (but) command what is shameful and wrong: and were it not for the grace and mercy of Allah on you, not one of you would ever have been pure: but Allah doth purify whom He pleases: and Allah is One Who hears and knows (all things).
tafsir: The day they see the angels there will be no happy tidings for the sinners; and they will say: "There is an insurmountable barrier!"

arabic: ولا يأتل أولو الفضل منكم والسعة أن يؤتوا أولي القربى والمساكين والمهاجرين في سبيل الله ۖ وليعفوا وليصفحوا ۗ ألا تحبون أن يغفر الله لكم ۗ والله غفور رحيم
english: Let not those among you who are endued with grace and amplitude of means resolve by oath against helping their kinsmen, those in want, and those who have left their homes in Allah's cause: let them forgive and overlook, do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? For Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: We shall turn to their deeds and scatter them like particles of dust.

arabic: إن الذين يرمون المحصنات الغافلات المؤمنات لعنوا في الدنيا والآخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم
english: Those who slander chaste women, indiscreet but believing, are cursed in this life and in the Hereafter: for them is a grievous Penalty,-
tafsir: The inmates of Paradise will have a better abode that day, and a better resting place.

arabic: يوم تشهد عليهم ألسنتهم وأيديهم وأرجلهم بما كانوا يعملون
english: On the Day when their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them as to their actions.
tafsir: The day the heavens splits asunder with a dazzling white cloud gathering and the angels descend in a continuous stream,

arabic: يومئذ يوفيهم الله دينهم الحق ويعلمون أن الله هو الحق المبين
english: On that Day Allah will pay them back (all) their just dues, and they will realise that Allah is the (very) Truth, that makes all things manifest.
tafsir: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!

arabic: الخبيثات للخبيثين والخبيثون للخبيثات ۖ والطيبات للطيبين والطيبون للطيبات ۚ أولئك مبرءون مما يقولون ۖ لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
english: Women impure are for men impure, and men impure for women impure and women of purity are for men of purity, and men of purity are for women of purity: these are not affected by what people say: for them there is forgiveness, and a provision honourable.
tafsir: The sinner will then bite his hand and say: "Would that I had taken the road with the Prophet.

arabic: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها ۚ ذلكم خير لكم لعلكم تذكرون
english: O ye who believe! enter not houses other than your own, until ye have asked permission and saluted those in them: that is best for you, in order that ye may heed (what is seemly).
tafsir: Woe alas, ah would I had not taken so-and-so as friend!

arabic: فإن لم تجدوا فيها أحدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم ۖ وإن قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا ۖ هو أزكى لكم ۚ والله بما تعملون عليم
english: If ye find no one in the house, enter not until permission is given to you: if ye are asked to go back, go back: that makes for greater purity for yourselves: and Allah knows well all that ye do.
tafsir: He led me astray from the Warning after it had come to me. Satan always betrays man.

arabic: ليس عليكم جناح أن تدخلوا بيوتا غير مسكونة فيها متاع لكم ۚ والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون
english: It is no fault on your part to enter houses not used for living in, which serve some (other) use for you: And Allah has knowledge of what ye reveal and what ye conceal.
tafsir: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."

arabic: قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من أبصارهم ويحفظوا فروجهم ۚ ذلك أزكى لهم ۗ إن الله خبير بما يصنعون
english: Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty: that will make for greater purity for them: And Allah is well acquainted with all that they do.
tafsir: Thus do We keep opponents among the sinners for every apostle; yet your Lord is sufficient as a guide and helper.

arabic: وقل للمؤمنات يغضضن من أبصارهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا ما ظهر منها ۖ وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ۖ ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا لبعولتهن أو آبائهن أو آباء بعولتهن أو أبنائهن أو أبناء بعولتهن أو إخوانهن أو بني إخوانهن أو بني أخواتهن أو نسائهن أو ما ملكت أيمانهن أو التابعين غير أولي الإربة من الرجال أو الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورات النساء ۖ ولا يضربن بأرجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن ۚ وتوبوا إلى الله جميعا أيه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون
english: And say to the believing women that they should lower their gaze and guard their modesty; that they should not display their beauty and ornaments except what (must ordinarily) appear thereof; that they should draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their beauty except to their husbands, their fathers, their husband's fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers or their brothers' sons, or their sisters' sons, or their women, or the slaves whom their right hands possess, or male servants free of physical needs, or small children who have no sense of the shame of sex; and that they should not strike their feet in order to draw attention to their hidden ornaments. And O ye Believers! turn ye all together towards Allah, that ye may attain Bliss.
tafsir: The unbelievers say: "Why was the whole Qur'an not sent down all at once to him?" It was sent thus that We may keep your heart resolute. So We enunciated it by steps and distinctly.

arabic: وأنكحوا الأيامى منكم والصالحين من عبادكم وإمائكم ۚ إن يكونوا فقراء يغنهم الله من فضله ۗ والله واسع عليم
english: Marry those among you who are single, or the virtuous ones among yourselves, male or female: if they are in poverty, Allah will give them means out of His grace: for Allah encompasseth all, and he knoweth all things.
tafsir: There is not an example they advance to which We do not give you a right answer and a better explanation.

arabic: وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله ۗ والذين يبتغون الكتاب مما ملكت أيمانكم فكاتبوهم إن علمتم فيهم خيرا ۖ وآتوهم من مال الله الذي آتاكم ۚ ولا تكرهوا فتياتكم على البغاء إن أردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحياة الدنيا ۚ ومن يكرههن فإن الله من بعد إكراههن غفور رحيم
english: Let those who find not the wherewithal for marriage keep themselves chaste, until Allah gives them means out of His grace. And if any of your slaves ask for a deed in writing (to enable them to earn their freedom for a certain sum), give them such a deed if ye know any good in them: yea, give them something yourselves out of the means which Allah has given to you. But force not your maids to prostitution when they desire chastity, in order that ye may make a gain in the goods of this life. But if anyone compels them, yet, after such compulsion, is Allah, Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful (to them),
tafsir: Those who will be pushed faces forward into Hell will be in a worse position, farther away from the path.

arabic: ولقد أنزلنا إليكم آيات مبينات ومثلا من الذين خلوا من قبلكم وموعظة للمتقين
english: We have already sent down to you verses making things clear, an illustration from (the story of) people who passed away before you, and an admonition for those who fear (Allah).
tafsir: We gave Moses the Book, and made his brother Aaron his minister,

arabic: الله نور السماوات والأرض ۚ مثل نوره كمشكاة فيها مصباح ۖ المصباح في زجاجة ۖ الزجاجة كأنها كوكب دري يوقد من شجرة مباركة زيتونة لا شرقية ولا غربية يكاد زيتها يضيء ولو لم تمسسه نار ۚ نور على نور ۗ يهدي الله لنوره من يشاء ۚ ويضرب الله الأمثال للناس ۗ والله بكل شيء عليم
english: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The Parable of His Light is as if there were a Niche and within it a Lamp: the Lamp enclosed in Glass: the glass as it were a brilliant star: Lit from a blessed Tree, an Olive, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil is well-nigh luminous, though fire scarce touched it: Light upon Light! Allah doth guide whom He will to His Light: Allah doth set forth Parables for men: and Allah doth know all things.
tafsir: Then We told them: "Go to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We annihilated them completely.

arabic: في بيوت أذن الله أن ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والآصال
english: (Lit is such a Light) in houses, which Allah hath permitted to be raised to honour; for the celebration, in them, of His name: In them is He glorified in the mornings and in the evenings, (again and again),-
tafsir: We had drowned the people of Noah when they had accused the apostles of lies, and turned them into an example for men. We have prepared a painful punishment for the wicked.

arabic: رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة ۙ يخافون يوما تتقلب فيه القلوب والأبصار
english: By men whom neither traffic nor merchandise can divert from the Remembrance of Allah, nor from regular Prayer, nor from the practice of regular Charity: Their (only) fear is for the Day when hearts and eyes will be transformed (in a world wholly new),-
tafsir: (As for) 'Ad, Thamud and the people of ar-Rass, and many generations in between them,

arabic: ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله ۗ والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب
english: That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His Grace: for Allah doth provide for those whom He will, without measure.
tafsir: We administered warnings to each of them, and then destroyed them completely.

arabic: والذين كفروا أعمالهم كسراب بقيعة يحسبه الظمآن ماء حتى إذا جاءه لم يجده شيئا ووجد الله عنده فوفاه حسابه ۗ والله سريع الحساب
english: But the Unbelievers,- their deeds are like a mirage in sandy deserts, which the man parched with thirst mistakes for water; until when he comes up to it, he finds it to be nothing: But he finds Allah (ever) with him, and Allah will pay him his account: and Allah is swift in taking account.
tafsir: They must have surely passed by the town on which We had rained the terrible rain of ruin. How could they not have seen it? Still they do not dread the Resurrection.

arabic: أو كظلمات في بحر لجي يغشاه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ۚ ظلمات بعضها فوق بعض إذا أخرج يده لم يكد يراها ۗ ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور
english: Or (the Unbelievers' state) is like the depths of darkness in a vast deep ocean, overwhelmed with billow topped by billow, topped by (dark) clouds: depths of darkness, one above another: if a man stretches out his hands, he can hardly see it! for any to whom Allah giveth not light, there is no light!
tafsir: When they see you they take you only in jest: "Is this the one whom God has sent as messenger?

arabic: ألم تر أن الله يسبح له من في السماوات والأرض والطير صافات ۖ كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه ۗ والله عليم بما يفعلون
english: Seest thou not that it is Allah Whose praises all beings in the heavens and on earth do celebrate, and the birds (of the air) with wings outspread? Each one knows its own (mode of) prayer and praise. And Allah knows well all that they do.
tafsir: He would have surely turned us away from our gods if we had not adhered to them." They will know soon who is farther away from the path when they see the punishment!

arabic: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض ۖ وإلى الله المصير
english: Yea, to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; and to Allah is the final goal (of all).
tafsir: Have you considered him who takes his own lust for his god? Can you stand a surety for him?

arabic: ألم تر أن الله يزجي سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله وينزل من السماء من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشاء ويصرفه عن من يشاء ۖ يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالأبصار
english: Seest thou not that Allah makes the clouds move gently, then joins them together, then makes them into a heap? - then wilt thou see rain issue forth from their midst. And He sends down from the sky mountain masses (of clouds) wherein is hail: He strikes therewith whom He pleases and He turns it away from whom He pleases, the vivid flash of His lightning well-nigh blinds the sight.
tafsir: Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are no better than cattle; in fact they are farther astray from the path.

arabic: يقلب الله الليل والنهار ۚ إن في ذلك لعبرة لأولي الأبصار
english: It is Allah Who alternates the Night and the Day: verily in these things is an instructive example for those who have vision!
tafsir: Have you not seen how your Lord lengthens out the shadow? He could have kept it motionless if He liked. Yet We make the sun its pilot to show the way.

arabic: والله خلق كل دابة من ماء ۖ فمنهم من يمشي على بطنه ومنهم من يمشي على رجلين ومنهم من يمشي على أربع ۚ يخلق الله ما يشاء ۚ إن الله على كل شيء قدير
english: And Allah has created every animal from water: of them there are some that creep on their bellies; some that walk on two legs; and some that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills for verily Allah has power over all things.
tafsir: Then We draw it back to Us, withdrawing it little by little.

arabic: لقد أنزلنا آيات مبينات ۚ والله يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم
english: We have indeed sent down signs that make things manifest: and Allah guides whom He wills to a way that is straight.
tafsir: It is He who made the night a covering for you; and made sleep for rest, the day for rising.

arabic: ويقولون آمنا بالله وبالرسول وأطعنا ثم يتولى فريق منهم من بعد ذلك ۚ وما أولئك بالمؤمنين
english: They say, "We believe in Allah and in the messenger, and we obey": but even after that, some of them turn away: they are not (really) Believers.
tafsir: It is He who sends the winds with auspicious news in advance of His benevolence; and We send pure water down from the sky

arabic: وإذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم إذا فريق منهم معرضون
english: When they are summoned to Allah and His messenger, in order that He may judge between them, behold some of them decline (to come).
tafsir: To quicken a region that was dead, and to give it as drink to animals We have created and to men in plenty.

arabic: وإن يكن لهم الحق يأتوا إليه مذعنين
english: But if the right is on their side, they come to him with all submission.
tafsir: And We distribute it among them in various ways that they may ponder and reflect; yet most men disdain everything but denial and thanklessness.

arabic: أفي قلوبهم مرض أم ارتابوا أم يخافون أن يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله ۚ بل أولئك هم الظالمون
english: Is it that there is a disease in their hearts? or do they doubt, or are they in fear, that Allah and His Messenger will deal unjustly with them? Nay, it is they themselves who do wrong.
tafsir: Had We pleased We could have raised a warner in every town.

arabic: إنما كان قول المؤمنين إذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم أن يقولوا سمعنا وأطعنا ۚ وأولئك هم المفلحون
english: The answer of the Believers, when summoned to Allah and His Messenger, in order that He may judge between them, is no other than this: they say, "We hear and we obey": it is such as these that will attain felicity.
tafsir: So do not listen to unbelievers, and strive against them with greater effort.

arabic: ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فأولئك هم الفائزون
english: It is such as obey Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah and do right, that will win (in the end),
tafsir: It is He who made two bodies of water flow side by side, one fresh (and) sweet, the other brine (and) bitter, and has placed an interstice, a barrier between them.

arabic: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن أمرتهم ليخرجن ۖ قل لا تقسموا ۖ طاعة معروفة ۚ إن الله خبير بما تعملون
english: They swear their strongest oaths by Allah that, if only thou wouldst command them, they would leave (their homes). Say: "Swear ye not; Obedience is (more) reasonable; verily, Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do."
tafsir: It is He who created man from water, then gave him consanguinity and affinity. Your Lord is omnipotent.

arabic: قل أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول ۖ فإن تولوا فإنما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم ۖ وإن تطيعوه تهتدوا ۚ وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين
english: Say: "Obey Allah, and obey the Messenger: but if ye turn away, he is only responsible for the duty placed on him and ye for that placed on you. If ye obey him, ye shall be on right guidance. The Messenger's duty is only to preach the clear (Message).
tafsir: And yet they worship besides God what cannot bring them gain or do them harm. The unbeliever has always been an auxiliary against his Lord.

arabic: وعد الله الذين آمنوا منكم وعملوا الصالحات ليستخلفنهم في الأرض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذي ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم أمنا ۚ يعبدونني لا يشركون بي شيئا ۚ ومن كفر بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون
english: Allah has promised, to those among you who believe and work righteous deeds, that He will, of a surety, grant them in the land, inheritance (of power), as He granted it to those before them; that He will establish in authority their religion - the one which He has chosen for them; and that He will change (their state), after the fear in which they (lived), to one of security and peace: 'They will worship Me (alone) and not associate aught with Me. 'If any do reject Faith after this, they are rebellious and wicked.
tafsir: Yet We have not sent you but to give good tidings and to warn.

arabic: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون
english: So establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and obey the Messenger; that ye may receive mercy.
tafsir: Tell them: "I do not ask any recompense of you for this other than (urging) whoever likes may take the way to his Lord."

arabic: لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين في الأرض ۚ ومأواهم النار ۖ ولبئس المصير
english: Never think thou that the Unbelievers are going to frustrate (Allah's Plan) on earth: their abode is the Fire,- and it is indeed an evil refuge!
tafsir: Have trust in God the Living, who will never die, and sing His hallelujas; for He is well aware of the sins of His creatures.

arabic: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ليستأذنكم الذين ملكت أيمانكم والذين لم يبلغوا الحلم منكم ثلاث مرات ۚ من قبل صلاة الفجر وحين تضعون ثيابكم من الظهيرة ومن بعد صلاة العشاء ۚ ثلاث عورات لكم ۚ ليس عليكم ولا عليهم جناح بعدهن ۚ طوافون عليكم بعضكم على بعض ۚ كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات ۗ والله عليم حكيم
english: O ye who believe! let those whom your right hands possess, and the (children) among you who have not come of age ask your permission (before they come to your presence), on three occasions: before morning prayer; the while ye doff your clothes for the noonday heat; and after the late-night prayer: these are your three times of undress: outside those times it is not wrong for you or for them to move about attending to each other: Thus does Allah make clear the Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
tafsir: He created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them in six spans then assumed His authority. He is the benevolent: Ask those who are well-informed.

arabic: وإذا بلغ الأطفال منكم الحلم فليستأذنوا كما استأذن الذين من قبلهم ۚ كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته ۗ والله عليم حكيم
english: But when the children among you come of age, let them (also) ask for permission, as do those senior to them (in age): Thus does Allah make clear His Signs to you: for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom.
tafsir: When you say to them: "Bow before Ar-Rahman," they say: "What is Ar-Rahman? Should we adore whoever you ask us to?" And their aversion increases further.

arabic: والقواعد من النساء اللاتي لا يرجون نكاحا فليس عليهن جناح أن يضعن ثيابهن غير متبرجات بزينة ۖ وأن يستعففن خير لهن ۗ والله سميع عليم
english: Such elderly women as are past the prospect of marriage,- there is no blame on them if they lay aside their (outer) garments, provided they make not a wanton display of their beauty: but it is best for them to be modest: and Allah is One Who sees and knows all things.
tafsir: Blessed is He who placed in the heavens constellations of stars, and placed a burning lamp in it and the luminous moon.

arabic: ليس على الأعمى حرج ولا على الأعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ولا على أنفسكم أن تأكلوا من بيوتكم أو بيوت آبائكم أو بيوت أمهاتكم أو بيوت إخوانكم أو بيوت أخواتكم أو بيوت أعمامكم أو بيوت عماتكم أو بيوت أخوالكم أو بيوت خالاتكم أو ما ملكتم مفاتحه أو صديقكم ۚ ليس عليكم جناح أن تأكلوا جميعا أو أشتاتا ۚ فإذا دخلتم بيوتا فسلموا على أنفسكم تحية من عند الله مباركة طيبة ۚ كذلك يبين الله لكم الآيات لعلكم تعقلون
english: It is no fault in the blind nor in one born lame, nor in one afflicted with illness, nor in yourselves, that ye should eat in your own houses, or those of your fathers, or your mothers, or your brothers, or your sisters, or your father's brothers or your father's sisters, or your mother's brothers, or your mother's sisters, or in houses of which the keys are in your possession, or in the house of a sincere friend of yours: there is no blame on you, whether ye eat in company or separately. But if ye enter houses, salute each other - a greeting of blessing and purity as from Allah. Thus does Allah make clear the signs to you: that ye may understand.
tafsir: It is He who made the night and day an alternation for him who cares to reflect and be grateful.

arabic: إنما المؤمنون الذين آمنوا بالله ورسوله وإذا كانوا معه على أمر جامع لم يذهبوا حتى يستأذنوه ۚ إن الذين يستأذنونك أولئك الذين يؤمنون بالله ورسوله ۚ فإذا استأذنوك لبعض شأنهم فأذن لمن شئت منهم واستغفر لهم الله ۚ إن الله غفور رحيم
english: Only those are believers, who believe in Allah and His Messenger: when they are with him on a matter requiring collective action, they do not depart until they have asked for his leave; those who ask for thy leave are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger; so when they ask for thy leave, for some business of theirs, give leave to those of them whom thou wilt, and ask Allah for their forgiveness: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: Devotees of Ar-Rahman are those who walk with humility on the earth, and when they are addressed by the ignorant, say: 'Peace;"

arabic: لا تجعلوا دعاء الرسول بينكم كدعاء بعضكم بعضا ۚ قد يعلم الله الذين يتسللون منكم لواذا ۚ فليحذر الذين يخالفون عن أمره أن تصيبهم فتنة أو يصيبهم عذاب أليم
english: Deem not the summons of the Messenger among yourselves like the summons of one of you to another: Allah doth know those of you who slip away under shelter of some excuse: then let those beware who withstand the Messenger's order, lest some trial befall them, or a grievous penalty be inflicted on them.
tafsir: And those who spend their nights bowed and standing before their Lord;

arabic: ألا إن لله ما في السماوات والأرض ۖ قد يعلم ما أنتم عليه ويوم يرجعون إليه فينبئهم بما عملوا ۗ والله بكل شيء عليم
english: Be quite sure that to Allah doth belong whatever is in the heavens and on earth. Well doth He know what ye are intent upon: and one day they will be brought back to Him, and He will tell them the truth of what they did: for Allah doth know all things.
tafsir: Who say: "O our Lord, avert from us the torment of Hell: Its punishment is surely continuous.

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم تبارك الذي نزل الفرقان على عبده ليكون للعالمين نذيرا
english: Blessed is He who sent down the criterion to His servant, that it may be an admonition to all creatures;-
tafsir: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.

arabic: الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض ولم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك وخلق كل شيء فقدره تقديرا
english: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: no son has He begotten, nor has He a partner in His dominion: it is He who created all things, and ordered them in due proportions.
tafsir: You may perhaps wear out your heart because they do not come to belief.

arabic: واتخذوا من دونه آلهة لا يخلقون شيئا وهم يخلقون ولا يملكون لأنفسهم ضرا ولا نفعا ولا يملكون موتا ولا حياة ولا نشورا
english: Yet have they taken, besides him, gods that can create nothing but are themselves created; that have no control of hurt or good to themselves; nor can they control death nor life nor resurrection.
tafsir: We could send down from the heavens a sign to them if We pleased, before which their heads would remain bowed.

arabic: وقال الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا إفك افتراه وأعانه عليه قوم آخرون ۖ فقد جاءوا ظلما وزورا
english: But the misbelievers say: "Naught is this but a lie which he has forged, and others have helped him at it." In truth it is they who have put forward an iniquity and a falsehood.
tafsir: Never does a new reminder come to them from Ar-Rahman but they turn away from it.

arabic: وقالوا أساطير الأولين اكتتبها فهي تملى عليه بكرة وأصيلا
english: And they say: "Tales of the ancients, which he has caused to be written: and they are dictated before him morning and evening."
tafsir: Surely they have done with denying; soon will come to them the news of what they were laughing at.

arabic: قل أنزله الذي يعلم السر في السماوات والأرض ۚ إنه كان غفورا رحيما
english: Say: "The (Qur'an) was sent down by Him who knows the mystery (that is) in the heavens and the earth: verily He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
tafsir: Do they not see the earth, how We grow all kinds of noble things upon it?

arabic: وقالوا مال هذا الرسول يأكل الطعام ويمشي في الأسواق ۙ لولا أنزل إليه ملك فيكون معه نذيرا
english: And they say: "What sort of a messenger is this, who eats food, and walks through the streets? Why has not an angel been sent down to him to give admonition with him?
tafsir: Verily there are signs in this; yet many of them do not believe.

arabic: أو يلقى إليه كنز أو تكون له جنة يأكل منها ۚ وقال الظالمون إن تتبعون إلا رجلا مسحورا
english: "Or (Why) has not a treasure been bestowed on him, or why has he (not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "Ye follow none other than a man bewitched."
tafsir: Your Lord is surely mighty and merciful.

arabic: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الأمثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا
english: See what kinds of comparisons they make for thee! But they have gone astray, and never a way will they be able to find!
tafsir: When your Lord called upon Moses: "Go to the wicked people,

arabic: تبارك الذي إن شاء جعل لك خيرا من ذلك جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ويجعل لك قصورا
english: Blessed is He who, if that were His will, could give thee better (things) than those,- Gardens beneath which rivers flow; and He could give thee palaces (secure to dwell in).
tafsir: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear and take heed?"

arabic: بل كذبوا بالساعة ۖ وأعتدنا لمن كذب بالساعة سعيرا
english: Nay they deny the hour (of the judgment to come): but We have prepared a blazing fire for such as deny the hour:
tafsir: : He said: "O Lord, I fear that they will deny me.

arabic: إذا رأتهم من مكان بعيد سمعوا لها تغيظا وزفيرا
english: When it sees them from a place far off, they will hear its fury and its ranging sigh.
tafsir: My heart is constrained, my tongue falters, so delegate Aaron;

arabic: وإذا ألقوا منها مكانا ضيقا مقرنين دعوا هنالك ثبورا
english: And when they are cast, bound together into a constricted place therein, they will plead for destruction there and then!
tafsir: And they have a charge (of murder) against me. So I fear that they will kill me."

arabic: لا تدعوا اليوم ثبورا واحدا وادعوا ثبورا كثيرا
english: "This day plead not for a single destruction: plead for destruction oft-repeated!"
tafsir: (It was) said: "By no means. Go with My signs, both of you. I am verily with you and I hear.

arabic: قل أذلك خير أم جنة الخلد التي وعد المتقون ۚ كانت لهم جزاء ومصيرا
english: Say: "Is that best, or the eternal garden, promised to the righteous? for them, that is a reward as well as a goal (of attainment).
tafsir: Go to the Pharaoh and tell him: 'We bring a message from the Lord of all the worlds

arabic: لهم فيها ما يشاءون خالدين ۚ كان على ربك وعدا مسئولا
english: "For them there will be therein all that they wish for: they will dwell (there) for aye: A promise to be prayed for from thy Lord."
tafsir: That you should send the children of Israel with us.'

arabic: ويوم يحشرهم وما يعبدون من دون الله فيقول أأنتم أضللتم عبادي هؤلاء أم هم ضلوا السبيل
english: The day He will gather them together as well as those whom they worship besides Allah, He will ask: "Was it ye who let these My servants astray, or did they stray from the Path themselves?"
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said: "Did we not bring you up as a child? And you lived a number of years of your life with us.

arabic: قالوا سبحانك ما كان ينبغي لنا أن نتخذ من دونك من أولياء ولكن متعتهم وآباءهم حتى نسوا الذكر وكانوا قوما بورا
english: They will say: "Glory to Thee! not meet was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides Thee: But Thou didst bestow, on them and their fathers, good things (in life), until they forgot the Message: for they were a people (worthless and) lost."
tafsir: And you commited what you did, and you are ungrateful!"

arabic: فقد كذبوكم بما تقولون فما تستطيعون صرفا ولا نصرا ۚ ومن يظلم منكم نذقه عذابا كبيرا
english: (Allah will say): "Now have they proved you liars in what ye say: so ye cannot avert (your penalty) nor (get) help." And whoever among you does wrong, him shall We cause to taste of a grievous Penalty.
tafsir: (Moses) replied: "I did do that and I was in the wrong,

arabic: وما أرسلنا قبلك من المرسلين إلا إنهم ليأكلون الطعام ويمشون في الأسواق ۗ وجعلنا بعضكم لبعض فتنة أتصبرون ۗ وكان ربك بصيرا
english: And the messengers whom We sent before thee were all (men) who ate food and walked through the streets: We have made some of you as a trial for others: will ye have patience? for Allah is One Who sees (all things).
tafsir: So I ran away from you out of fear. But my Lord has given me wisdom, and made me an apostle.

arabic: وقال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا لولا أنزل علينا الملائكة أو نرى ربنا ۗ لقد استكبروا في أنفسهم وعتوا عتوا كبيرا
english: Such as fear not the meeting with Us (for Judgment) say: "Why are not the angels sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?" Indeed they have an arrogant conceit of themselves, and mighty is the insolence of their impiety!
tafsir: But the favour you oblige me with is that you have enslaved the children of Israel."

arabic: يوم يرون الملائكة لا بشرى يومئذ للمجرمين ويقولون حجرا محجورا
english: The Day they see the angels,- no joy will there be to the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a barrier forbidden (to you) altogether!"
tafsir: The Pharaoh asked: "And what is the Lord of all the worlds?"

arabic: وقدمنا إلى ما عملوا من عمل فجعلناه هباء منثورا
english: And We shall turn to whatever deeds they did (in this life), and We shall make such deeds as floating dust scattered about.
tafsir: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, if you can believe."

arabic: أصحاب الجنة يومئذ خير مستقرا وأحسن مقيلا
english: The Companions of the Garden will be well, that Day, in their abode, and have the fairest of places for repose.
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said to those around him: "Do you hear?"

arabic: ويوم تشقق السماء بالغمام ونزل الملائكة تنزيلا
english: The Day the heaven shall be rent asunder with clouds, and angels shall be sent down, descending (in ranks),-
tafsir: (Moses continued): "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers before you."

arabic: الملك يومئذ الحق للرحمن ۚ وكان يوما على الكافرين عسيرا
english: That Day, the dominion as of right and truth, shall be (wholly) for (Allah) Most Merciful: it will be a Day of dire difficulty for the misbelievers.
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said (to his nobles): "Your apostle who has been sent to you, is certainly mad."

arabic: ويوم يعض الظالم على يديه يقول يا ليتني اتخذت مع الرسول سبيلا
english: The Day that the wrong-doer will bite at his hands, he will say, "Oh! would that I had taken a (straight) path with the Messenger!
tafsir: (Moses) said: "The Lord of the East and the Lord of the West and all that lies between them, if you have sense."

arabic: يا ويلتى ليتني لم أتخذ فلانا خليلا
english: "Ah! woe is me! Would that I had never taken such a one for a friend!
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said: "If you took another god apart from me I will have you incarcerated."

arabic: لقد أضلني عن الذكر بعد إذ جاءني ۗ وكان الشيطان للإنسان خذولا
english: "He did lead me astray from the Message (of Allah) after it had come to me! Ah! the Evil One is but a traitor to man!"
tafsir: (Moses) said: "Even though I have brought to you something convincing?"

arabic: وقال الرسول يا رب إن قومي اتخذوا هذا القرآن مهجورا
english: Then the Messenger will say: "O my Lord! Truly my people took this Qur'an for just foolish nonsense."
tafsir: (The Pharaoh) said: "Then bring it, if you speak the truth."

arabic: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا من المجرمين ۗ وكفى بربك هاديا ونصيرا
english: Thus have We made for every prophet an enemy among the sinners: but enough is thy Lord to guide and to help.
tafsir: So (Moses) cast his staff, and lo, it turned into a living serpent.

arabic: وقال الذين كفروا لولا نزل عليه القرآن جملة واحدة ۚ كذلك لنثبت به فؤادك ۖ ورتلناه ترتيلا
english: Those who reject Faith say: "Why is not the Qur'an revealed to him all at once? Thus (is it revealed), that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have rehearsed it to thee in slow, well-arranged stages, gradually.
tafsir: And he drew forth his hand, and lo, it looked white to the beholders.

arabic: ولا يأتونك بمثل إلا جئناك بالحق وأحسن تفسيرا
english: And no question do they bring to thee but We reveal to thee the truth and the best explanation (thereof).
tafsir: The Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him: "He is certainly a clever magician.

arabic: الذين يحشرون على وجوههم إلى جهنم أولئك شر مكانا وأضل سبيلا
english: Those who will be gathered to Hell (prone) on their faces,- they will be in an evil plight, and, as to Path, most astray.
tafsir: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic. So, what do you bid?"

arabic: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلنا معه أخاه هارون وزيرا
english: (Before this,) We sent Moses The Book, and appointed his brother Aaron with him as minister;
tafsir: They said: "Put him and his brother off awhile, and send summoners to the cities to gather

arabic: فقلنا اذهبا إلى القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فدمرناهم تدميرا
english: And We command: "Go ye both, to the people who have rejected our Signs:" And those (people) We destroyed with utter destruction.
tafsir: And bring the ablest magicians to you."

arabic: وقوم نوح لما كذبوا الرسل أغرقناهم وجعلناهم للناس آية ۖ وأعتدنا للظالمين عذابا أليما
english: And the people of Noah,- when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them as a Sign for mankind; and We have prepared for (all) wrong-doers a grievous Penalty;-
tafsir: So the magicians were assembled at a stated time and place on an appointed day.

arabic: وعادا وثمود وأصحاب الرس وقرونا بين ذلك كثيرا
english: As also 'Ad and Thamud, and the Companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them.
tafsir: And the people were also asked to assemble.

arabic: وكلا ضربنا له الأمثال ۖ وكلا تبرنا تتبيرا
english: To each one We set forth Parables and examples; and each one We broke to utter annihilation (for their sins).
tafsir: (They said): "We may haply follow the magicians if they are victorious."

arabic: ولقد أتوا على القرية التي أمطرت مطر السوء ۚ أفلم يكونوا يرونها ۚ بل كانوا لا يرجون نشورا
english: And the (Unbelievers) must indeed have passed by the town on which was rained a shower of evil: did they not then see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection.
tafsir: When the magicians arrived, they said to the Pharaoh: "Is there a reward for us if we are victorious?" --

arabic: وإذا رأوك إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي بعث الله رسولا
english: When they see thee, they treat thee no otherwise than in mockery: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?"
tafsir: "Yes," he replied. "You 'will be among the honoured."

arabic: إن كاد ليضلنا عن آلهتنا لولا أن صبرنا عليها ۚ وسوف يعلمون حين يرون العذاب من أضل سبيلا
english: "He indeed would well-nigh have misled us from our gods, had it not been that we were constant to them!" - Soon will they know, when they see the Penalty, who it is that is most misled in Path!
tafsir: Moses said to them: "Cast what you have to cast."

arabic: أرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه أفأنت تكون عليه وكيلا
english: Seest thou such a one as taketh for his god his own passion (or impulse)? Couldst thou be a disposer of affairs for him?
tafsir: So they cast their ropes and rods, and said: "By the glory of Pharaoh, we shall be victorious."

arabic: أم تحسب أن أكثرهم يسمعون أو يعقلون ۚ إن هم إلا كالأنعام ۖ بل هم أضل سبيلا
english: Or thinkest thou that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle;- nay, they are worse astray in Path.
tafsir: Then Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it swallowed up their conjurations.

arabic: ألم تر إلى ربك كيف مد الظل ولو شاء لجعله ساكنا ثم جعلنا الشمس عليه دليلا
english: Hast thou not turned thy vision to thy Lord?- How He doth prolong the shadow! If He willed, He could make it stationary! then do We make the sun its guide;
tafsir: Then the magicians fell prostrating in adoration,

arabic: ثم قبضناه إلينا قبضا يسيرا
english: Then We draw it in towards Ourselves,- a contraction by easy stages.
tafsir: And said: "We (affirm and) believe in the Lord of all the worlds,

arabic: وهو الذي جعل لكم الليل لباسا والنوم سباتا وجعل النهار نشورا
english: And He it is Who makes the Night as a Robe for you, and Sleep as Repose, and makes the Day (as it were) a Resurrection.
tafsir: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

arabic: وهو الذي أرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته ۚ وأنزلنا من السماء ماء طهورا
english: And He it is Who sends the winds as heralds of glad tidings, going before His mercy, and We send down pure water from the sky,-
tafsir: Said (the Pharaoh): "You have come to believe in him before I gave you leave. He is surely your chief, who taught you magic. You will soon come to know: I will have your hands and feet cut off on alternate sides, and have every one of you crucified."

arabic: لنحيي به بلدة ميتا ونسقيه مما خلقنا أنعاما وأناسي كثيرا
english: That with it We may give life to a dead land, and slake the thirst of things We have created,- cattle and men in great numbers.
tafsir: They said: "There will be no harm. We shall return to our Lord.

arabic: ولقد صرفناه بينهم ليذكروا فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا
english: And We have distributed the (water) amongst them, in order that they may celebrate (our) praises, but most men are averse (to aught) but (rank) ingratitude.
tafsir: We certainly hope our Lord will forgive our sins as we are the first to believe."

arabic: ولو شئنا لبعثنا في كل قرية نذيرا
english: Had it been Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every centre of population.
tafsir: We said to Moses: "Travel by night with My creatures. You will surely be pursued."

arabic: فلا تطع الكافرين وجاهدهم به جهادا كبيرا
english: Therefore listen not to the Unbelievers, but strive against them with the utmost strenuousness, with the (Qur'an).
tafsir: Then the Pharaoh sent announcers to the cities,

arabic: وهو الذي مرج البحرين هذا عذب فرات وهذا ملح أجاج وجعل بينهما برزخا وحجرا محجورا
english: It is He Who has let free the two bodies of flowing water: One palatable and sweet, and the other salt and bitter; yet has He made a barrier between them, a partition that is forbidden to be passed.
tafsir: (Proclaiming): "Surely they are a small band (of fugitives).

arabic: وهو الذي خلق من الماء بشرا فجعله نسبا وصهرا ۗ وكان ربك قديرا
english: It is He Who has created man from water: then has He established relationships of lineage and marriage: for thy Lord has power (over all things).
tafsir: They are always harassing us.

arabic: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعهم ولا يضرهم ۗ وكان الكافر على ربه ظهيرا
english: Yet do they worship, besides Allah, things that can neither profit them nor harm them: and the Misbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord!
tafsir: But we are a fully accounted army."

arabic: وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا
english: But thee We only sent to give glad tidings and admonition.
tafsir: So We made them leave the gardens and springs of water,

arabic: قل ما أسألكم عليه من أجر إلا من شاء أن يتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا
english: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for it but this: that each one who will may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."
tafsir: And treasures and agreeable mansions.

arabic: وتوكل على الحي الذي لا يموت وسبح بحمده ۚ وكفى به بذنوب عباده خبيرا
english: And put thy trust in Him Who lives and dies not; and celebrate his praise; and enough is He to be acquainted with the faults of His servants;-
tafsir: Thus it was; and We made the children of Israel possess them.

arabic: الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وما بينهما في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش ۚ الرحمن فاسأل به خبيرا
english: He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between, in six days, and is firmly established on the Throne (of Authority): Allah Most Gracious: ask thou, then, about Him of any acquainted (with such things).
tafsir: But they pursued them at sunrise.

arabic: وإذا قيل لهم اسجدوا للرحمن قالوا وما الرحمن أنسجد لما تأمرنا وزادهم نفورا ۩
english: When it is said to them, "Prostrate to (Allah) Most Gracious!", they say, "And what is (Allah) Most Gracious? Shall we prostrate to that which thou commandest us?" And it increases their flight (from the Truth).
tafsir: When the two forces drew within seeing distance of each other, the people of Moses said: "We shall certainly be overtaken."

arabic: تبارك الذي جعل في السماء بروجا وجعل فيها سراجا وقمرا منيرا
english: Blessed is He Who made constellations in the skies, and placed therein a Lamp and a Moon giving light;
tafsir: Moses replied: "By no means. My Lord is with me. He will show me the way."

arabic: وهو الذي جعل الليل والنهار خلفة لمن أراد أن يذكر أو أراد شكورا
english: And it is He Who made the Night and the Day to follow each other: for such as have the will to celebrate His praises or to show their gratitude.
tafsir: We commanded Moses: "Smite the sea with your staff." And it parted, and every parting was like a lofty mountain.

arabic: وعباد الرحمن الذين يمشون على الأرض هونا وإذا خاطبهم الجاهلون قالوا سلاما
english: And the servants of (Allah) Most Gracious are those who walk on the earth in humility, and when the ignorant address them, they say, "Peace!";
tafsir: Then We brought the others to that place.

arabic: والذين يبيتون لربهم سجدا وقياما
english: Those who spend the night in adoration of their Lord prostrate and standing;
tafsir: We delivered Moses and every one with him,

arabic: والذين يقولون ربنا اصرف عنا عذاب جهنم ۖ إن عذابها كان غراما
english: Those who say, "Our Lord! avert from us the Wrath of Hell, for its Wrath is indeed an affliction grievous,-
tafsir: And We drowned the others.

arabic: إنها ساءت مستقرا ومقاما
english: "Evil indeed is it as an abode, and as a place to rest in";
tafsir: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.

arabic: والذين إذا أنفقوا لم يسرفوا ولم يقتروا وكان بين ذلك قواما
english: Those who, when they spend, are not extravagant and not niggardly, but hold a just (balance) between those (extremes);
tafsir: Indeed your Lord is mighty and merciful.

arabic: والذين لا يدعون مع الله إلها آخر ولا يقتلون النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ولا يزنون ۚ ومن يفعل ذلك يلق أثاما
english: Those who invoke not, with Allah, any other god, nor slay such life as Allah has made sacred except for just cause, nor commit fornication; - and any that does this (not only) meets punishment.
tafsir: Relate the news of Abraham to them.

arabic: يضاعف له العذاب يوم القيامة ويخلد فيه مهانا
english: (But) the Penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will dwell therein in ignominy,-
tafsir: When he asked his father and his people: "What do you worship?"

arabic: إلا من تاب وآمن وعمل عملا صالحا فأولئك يبدل الله سيئاتهم حسنات ۗ وكان الله غفورا رحيما
english: Unless he repents, believes, and works righteous deeds, for Allah will change the evil of such persons into good, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful,
tafsir: They replied: "We worship idols and are devoted to them."

arabic: ومن تاب وعمل صالحا فإنه يتوب إلى الله متابا
english: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with an (acceptable) conversion;-
tafsir: (Abraham) asked: "Do they hear when you call them?

arabic: والذين لا يشهدون الزور وإذا مروا باللغو مروا كراما
english: Those who witness no falsehood, and, if they pass by futility, they pass by it with honourable (avoidance);
tafsir: Or do they benefit you, or do you harm?"

arabic: والذين إذا ذكروا بآيات ربهم لم يخروا عليها صما وعميانا
english: Those who, when they are admonished with the Signs of their Lord, droop not down at them as if they were deaf or blind;
tafsir: They said: "No. But we found our fathers doing so."

arabic: والذين يقولون ربنا هب لنا من أزواجنا وذرياتنا قرة أعين واجعلنا للمتقين إماما
english: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Grant unto us wives and offspring who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous."
tafsir: He said: "Have you considered what you have been worshipping,

arabic: أولئك يجزون الغرفة بما صبروا ويلقون فيها تحية وسلاما
english: Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place in heaven, because of their patient constancy: therein shall they be met with salutations and peace,
tafsir: You and your fathers?

arabic: خالدين فيها ۚ حسنت مستقرا ومقاما
english: Dwelling therein;- how beautiful an abode and place of rest!
tafsir: Yet they are my enemies except the Lord of all the worlds

arabic: قل ما يعبأ بكم ربي لولا دعاؤكم ۖ فقد كذبتم فسوف يكون لزاما
english: Say (to the Rejecters): "My Lord is not uneasy because of you if ye call not on Him: But ye have indeed rejected (Him), and soon will come the inevitable (punishment)!"
tafsir: Who created me and showed me the way,

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم طسم
english: Ta. Sin. Mim.
tafsir: A guidance and good tidings for the believers,

arabic: تلك آيات الكتاب المبين
english: These are verses of the Book that makes (things) clear.
tafsir: Who fulfil their devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and believe with certainty in the life to come.

arabic: لعلك باخع نفسك ألا يكونوا مؤمنين
english: It may be thou frettest thy soul with grief, that they do not become Believers.
tafsir: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity.

arabic: إن نشأ ننزل عليهم من السماء آية فظلت أعناقهم لها خاضعين
english: If (such) were Our Will, We could send down to them from the sky a Sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
tafsir: They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life, and will be the greatest losers in the life to come.

arabic: وما يأتيهم من ذكر من الرحمن محدث إلا كانوا عنه معرضين
english: But there comes not to them a newly-revealed Message from (Allah) Most Gracious, but they turn away therefrom.
tafsir: You have been conveyed the Qur'an from One all-wise and all-knowing.

arabic: فقد كذبوا فسيأتيهم أنباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون
english: They have indeed rejected (the Message): so they will know soon (enough) the truth of what they mocked at!
tafsir: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."

arabic: أولم يروا إلى الأرض كم أنبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم
english: Do they not look at the earth,- how many noble things of all kinds We have produced therein?
tafsir: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.

arabic: إن في ذلك لآية ۖ وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين
english: Verily, in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
tafsir: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise.

arabic: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
english: And verily, thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
tafsir: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence,

arabic: وإذ نادى ربك موسى أن ائت القوم الظالمين
english: Behold, thy Lord called Moses: "Go to the people of iniquity,-
tafsir: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful.

arabic: قوم فرعون ۚ ألا يتقون
english: "The people of the Pharaoh: will they not fear Allah?"
tafsir: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."

arabic: قال رب إني أخاف أن يكذبون
english: He said: "O my Lord! I do fear that they will charge me with falsehood:
tafsir: And when Our signs came as distinct proofs, they said: "This is only magic."

arabic: ويضيق صدري ولا ينطلق لساني فأرسل إلى هارون
english: "My breast will be straitened. And my speech may not go (smoothly): so send unto Aaron.
tafsir: And they denied them out of malice and pride, though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers!

arabic: ولهم علي ذنب فأخاف أن يقتلون
english: "And (further), they have a charge of crime against me; and I fear they may slay me."
tafsir: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."

arabic: قال كلا ۖ فاذهبا بآياتنا ۖ إنا معكم مستمعون
english: Allah said: "By no means! proceed then, both of you, with Our Signs; We are with you, and will listen (to your call).
tafsir: Solomon was heir to David, and he said: "O people, we have been taught the language of Tair, and have been given of everything. This is a clear favour indeed."

arabic: فأتيا فرعون فقولا إنا رسول رب العالمين
english: "So go forth, both of you, to Pharaoh, and say: 'We have been sent by the Lord and Cherisher of the worlds;
tafsir: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)

arabic: أن أرسل معنا بني إسرائيل
english: "'Send thou with us the Children of Israel.'"
tafsir: Till they reached the Valley of Naml. Said the lady of Naml: "O Naml, go into your dwellings lest Solomon and his hordes should crush you unawares."

arabic: قال ألم نربك فينا وليدا ولبثت فينا من عمرك سنين
english: (Pharaoh) said: "Did we not cherish thee as a child among us, and didst thou not stay in our midst many years of thy life?
tafsir: (Solomon) smiled, amused at her speech, and said: "O Lord grant me that I should be grateful for the favours You have bestowed on me and my parents, and do good things of Your pleasing; and admit me among Your righteous devotees by Your grace."

arabic: وفعلت فعلتك التي فعلت وأنت من الكافرين
english: "And thou didst a deed of thine which (thou knowest) thou didst, and thou art an ungrateful (wretch)!"
tafsir: When he reviewed the Tair, he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent?

arabic: قال فعلتها إذا وأنا من الضالين
english: Moses said: "I did it then, when I was in error.
tafsir: I will punish him severely, or cut his throat, unless he bring a valid excuse."

arabic: ففررت منكم لما خفتكم فوهب لي ربي حكما وجعلني من المرسلين
english: "So I fled from you (all) when I feared you; but my Lord has (since) invested me with judgment (and wisdom) and appointed me as one of the messengers.
tafsir: But he was not long in coming, and reported: "I have been around where you have not been. I come from Saba with positive news.

arabic: وتلك نعمة تمنها علي أن عبدت بني إسرائيل
english: "And this is the favour with which thou dost reproach me,- that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel!"
tafsir: I found a woman reigning over them, and she has been favoured with everything; and she has a throne that is magnificent.

arabic: قال فرعون وما رب العالمين
english: Pharaoh said: "And what is the 'Lord and Cherisher of the worlds'?"
tafsir: I found that she and her people worship the sun in place of God, for Satan has made their deeds look attractive to them and has turned them away from the Path, so they do not find the way

arabic: قال رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما ۖ إن كنتم موقنين
english: (Moses) said: "The Lord and Cherisher of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- if ye want to be quite sure."
tafsir: To worship God who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and is cognisant of what you hide and what you disclose.

arabic: قال لمن حوله ألا تستمعون
english: (Pharaoh) said to those around: "Did ye not listen (to what he says)?"
tafsir: God: There is no god but He, the Lord of the glorious throne."

arabic: قال ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين
english: (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning!"
tafsir: (Solomon) said: 'We shall see if you speak the truth or you are a liar.

arabic: قال إن رسولكم الذي أرسل إليكم لمجنون
english: (Pharaoh) said: "Truly your messenger who has been sent to you is a veritable madman!"
tafsir: Take this letter from me, and deliver it to them and withdraw, then see what reply they give in return."

arabic: قال رب المشرق والمغرب وما بينهما ۖ إن كنتم تعقلون
english: (Moses) said: "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! if ye only had sense!"
tafsir: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.

arabic: قال لئن اتخذت إلها غيري لأجعلنك من المسجونين
english: (Pharaoh) said: "If thou dost put forward any god other than me, I will certainly put thee in prison!"
tafsir: It is from Solomon, and (says): 'In the name of Allah, Ar-Rahman, Ar-Rahim.

arabic: قال أولو جئتك بشيء مبين
english: (Moses) said: "Even if I showed you something clear (and) convincing?"
tafsir: Do not rise against me, but come to me in submission.'

arabic: قال فأت به إن كنت من الصادقين
english: (Pharaoh) said: "Show it then, if thou tellest the truth!"
tafsir: ." Advise me, O nobles," she said "in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."

arabic: فألقى عصاه فإذا هي ثعبان مبين
english: So (Moses) threw his rod, and behold, it was a serpent, plain (for all to see)!
tafsir: They said: "We are men of valour, and brave fighters. It is for you to decide. So consider what you should command."

arabic: ونزع يده فإذا هي بيضاء للناظرين
english: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
tafsir: She said: "Surely when kings enter a city they destroy it and despoil the honour of its nobility. So will they do (to us).

arabic: قال للملإ حوله إن هذا لساحر عليم
english: (Pharaoh) said to the Chiefs around him: "This is indeed a sorcerer well-versed:
tafsir: But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."

arabic: يريد أن يخرجكم من أرضكم بسحره فماذا تأمرون
english: "His plan is to get you out of your land by his sorcery; then what is it ye counsel?"
tafsir: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth? Yet what God has given me is better than what He has given you. No. Be gratified in your present.

arabic: قالوا أرجه وأخاه وابعث في المدائن حاشرين
english: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense (for a while), and dispatch to the Cities heralds to collect-
tafsir: Go back to them. We shall soon come with our armies which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them out of (the land) with ignominy, and they will be humbled."

arabic: يأتوك بكل سحار عليم
english: "And bring up to thee all (our) sorcerers well-versed."
tafsir: He (then) said (to his courtiers): "O you nobles, is there any one who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

arabic: فجمع السحرة لميقات يوم معلوم
english: So the sorcerers were got together for the appointment of a day well-known,
tafsir: A crafty jinn said: "I will bring it before you rise from your seat, for I am strong and trustworthy."

arabic: وقيل للناس هل أنتم مجتمعون
english: And the people were told: "Are ye (now) assembled?-
tafsir: But one who had knowledge of the letter, said: "I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye." When Solomon saw it before him, (he said): "This is by the grace of my Lord that He may test me whether I am grateful or I am thankless. Yet if one is grateful, he is grateful for himself, and if one is thankless, then surely my Lord is unconcerned and magnanimous."

arabic: لعلنا نتبع السحرة إن كانوا هم الغالبين
english: "That we may follow the sorcerers (in religion) if they win?"
tafsir: (Turning to his nobles) he said: "Change the appearance of her throne. Let us see if she is rightly guided, or is not guided at all."

arabic: فلما جاء السحرة قالوا لفرعون أئن لنا لأجرا إن كنا نحن الغالبين
english: So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Pharaoh: "Of course - shall we have a (suitable) reward if we win?
tafsir: When she arrived, they asked her: "Is your throne like this?" She said: "As though this is it. We had come to have knowledge and already submitted."

arabic: قال نعم وإنكم إذا لمن المقربين
english: He said: "Yea, (and more),- for ye shall in that case be (raised to posts) nearest (to my person)."
tafsir: She was (in fact) turned away by what she worshipped other than God, for she came of an unbelieving people.

arabic: قال لهم موسى ألقوا ما أنتم ملقون
english: Moses said to them: "Throw ye - that which ye are about to throw!"
tafsir: She was invited to enter the court. When she saw it, she took it for a sheet of water, and (pulling up her skirts) uncovered her legs. (Solomon) told her: "This is paved with tiles of glass." "O Lord," she said, "I have wronged myself, and I submit to the Lord of all the worlds with Solomon."

arabic: فألقوا حبالهم وعصيهم وقالوا بعزة فرعون إنا لنحن الغالبون
english: So they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Pharaoh, it is we who will certainly win!"
tafsir: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh (who said): "Worship God." But they were divided into two groups disputing with one another.

arabic: فألقى موسى عصاه فإذا هي تلقف ما يأفكون
english: Then Moses threw his rod, when, behold, it straightway swallows up all the falsehoods which they fake!
tafsir: (Saleh) said: "O people, why do you wish to hasten evil rather than good? Why not ask for God's forgiveness? You may well be forgiven."

arabic: فألقي السحرة ساجدين
english: Then did the sorcerers fall down, prostrate in adoration,
tafsir: They said: "You betoken evil, and those with you." (Saleh) replied: "The evil you presage can only come from God. In reality you are a people under trial (for your own inauspiciousness)."

arabic: قالوا آمنا برب العالمين
english: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,
tafsir: There were in that city nine persons who spread disorder in the land, and did not reform.

arabic: رب موسى وهارون
english: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
tafsir: They said: "Let us swear by God that we will attack Saleh and his family at night, and later tell his heirs: 'We did not see his family destroyed, and we speak the truth.'"

arabic: قال آمنتم له قبل أن آذن لكم ۖ إنه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلسوف تعلمون ۚ لأقطعن أيديكم وأرجلكم من خلاف ولأصلبنكم أجمعين
english: Said (Pharaoh): "Believe ye in Him before I give you permission? surely he is your leader, who has taught you sorcery! but soon shall ye know! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"
tafsir: They hatched up the plot; We also planned without their knowledge.

arabic: قالوا لا ضير ۖ إنا إلى ربنا منقلبون
english: They said: "No matter! for us, we shall but return to our Lord!
tafsir: Now see the end of their machinations: We destroyed them and their entire people.

arabic: إنا نطمع أن يغفر لنا ربنا خطايانا أن كنا أول المؤمنين
english: "Only, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us our faults, that we may become foremost among the believers!"
tafsir: So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand.

arabic: وأوحينا إلى موسى أن أسر بعبادي إنكم متبعون
english: By inspiration we told Moses: "Travel by night with my servants; for surely ye shall be pursued."
tafsir: We deliver those who believe and take heed for themselves.

arabic: فأرسل فرعون في المدائن حاشرين
english: Then Pharaoh sent heralds to (all) the Cities,
tafsir: (Remember) Lot, when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)?

arabic: إن هؤلاء لشرذمة قليلون
english: (Saying): "These (Israelites) are but a small band,
tafsir: You lust after men in place of women. You are indeed a stolid people."

arabic: وإنهم لنا لغائظون
english: "And they are raging furiously against us;
tafsir: His people had no answer except saying: "Expel the family of Lot from your city. They are a people who would (rather) be pure!"

arabic: وإنا لجميع حاذرون
english: "But we are a multitude amply fore-warned."
tafsir: So We saved him and his family except his wife who was destined to stay behind.

arabic: فأخرجناهم من جنات وعيون
english: So We expelled them from gardens, springs,
tafsir: And We rained down on them a shower (of stones). How ruinous was the rain that fell on those who had been warned (but warned in vain)!

arabic: وكنوز ومقام كريم
english: Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;
tafsir: Say: "All praise be to God, and peace on those of His creatures whom He has chosen." Is God better or those they associate with Him --

arabic: كذلك وأورثناها بني إسرائيل
english: Thus it was, but We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things.
tafsir: Who created the heavens and the earth, who sends down water from the sky for you, with which He causes graceful gardens to grow? It was not in your power to make trees germinate. Is there any other god along with God. In fact they are a people who turn away (from the truth).

arabic: فأتبعوهم مشرقين
english: So they pursued them at sunrise.
tafsir: Who then made the earth a habitable place, and made the rivers (flow) in its valleys and dales, and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and kept a barrier between two bodies of water? Is there any other god along with God? In reality most of them do not know.

arabic: فلما تراءى الجمعان قال أصحاب موسى إنا لمدركون
english: And when the two bodies saw each other, the people of Moses said: "We are sure to be overtaken."
tafsir: Who hears the cry of the anguished (soul) when it calls to Him, and relieves its suffering? And who made you trustees on the earth? Is there any other god along with God? How little it is that you reflect!

arabic: قال كلا ۖ إن معي ربي سيهدين
english: (Moses) said: "By no means! my Lord is with me! Soon will He guide me!"
tafsir: Who then really shows you the way in the darkness of the desert and the sea? And who sends breezes bringing news of His benevolence? Is there any other god along with God? He is far too exalted for what they associate with Him!

arabic: فأوحينا إلى موسى أن اضرب بعصاك البحر ۖ فانفلق فكان كل فرق كالطود العظيم
english: Then We told Moses by inspiration: "Strike the sea with thy rod." So it divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm mass of a mountain.
tafsir: Who creates first then reverts it? And who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth? Is there any other god along with God? Tell them: "Bring your proof, if you are truthful."

arabic: وأزلفنا ثم الآخرين
english: And We made the other party approach thither.
tafsir: Say: "No one in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unknown except God, nor can they know when they will be raised again.

arabic: وأنجينا موسى ومن معه أجمعين
english: We delivered Moses and all who were with him;
tafsir: Still less do they comprehend the life to come. In fact they are in doubt about it. Still more, they are blind to it."

arabic: ثم أغرقنا الآخرين
english: But We drowned the others.
tafsir: Those who do not believe, say: "When we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again?

arabic: إن في ذلك لآية ۖ وما كان أكثرهم مؤمنين
english: Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
tafsir: Indeed we and our fathers had been promised this before. It is nothing but the earlier people's lore."

arabic: وإن ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
english: And verily thy Lord is He, the Exalted in Might, Most Merciful.
tafsir: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (bad) was the end of sinners."

arabic: واتل عليهم نبأ إبراهيم
english: And rehearse to them (something of) Abraham's story.
tafsir: Do not grieve over them, and do not be distressed by what they contrive.

arabic: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما تعبدون
english: Behold, he said to his father and his people: "What worship ye?"
tafsir: Yet they say: "When will this promise come to pass? (Tell Us) if you speak the truth."

arabic: قالوا نعبد أصناما فنظل لها عاكفين
english: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain constantly in attendance on them."
tafsir: Say: "Perhaps some of what you wish to hasten is right behind you."

arabic: قال هل يسمعونكم إذ تدعون
english: He said: "Do they listen to you when ye call (on them)?"
tafsir: Verily your Lord is gracious to men, though most men are ungrateful.

arabic: أو ينفعونكم أو يضرون
english: "Or do you good or harm?"
tafsir: Verily your Lord knows what lies hidden in their breasts and what they disclose.

arabic: قالوا بل وجدنا آباءنا كذلك يفعلون
english: They said: "Nay, but we found our fathers doing thus (what we do)."
tafsir: There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book.

arabic: قال أفرأيتم ما كنتم تعبدون
english: He said: "Do ye then see whom ye have been worshipping,-
tafsir: Indeed this Qur'an explains to the children of Israel much of what they are at variance.

arabic: أنتم وآباؤكم الأقدمون
english: "Ye and your fathers before you?-
tafsir: It is a guidance and grace for those who believe.

arabic: فإنهم عدو لي إلا رب العالمين
english: "For they are enemies to me; not so the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds;
tafsir: Surely your Lord in His wisdom will decide between them. He is all-mighty and all-knowing.

arabic: الذي خلقني فهو يهدين
english: "Who created me, and it is He Who guides me;
tafsir: So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth.

arabic: والذي هو يطعمني ويسقين
english: "Who gives me food and drink,
tafsir: You cannot make the dead to listen, or the deaf to hear the call, when they have turned their backs,

arabic: وإذا مرضت فهو يشفين
english: "And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me;
tafsir: Nor can you lead the blind when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe in Our signs and have come to peace and submission.

arabic: والذي يميتني ثم يحيين
english: "Who will cause me to die, and then to life (again);
tafsir: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs.

arabic: والذي أطمع أن يغفر لي خطيئتي يوم الدين
english: "And who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the day of Judgment.
tafsir: The day We shall gather from every community a section of those who denied Our signs, and they will be brought (in separate groups),

arabic: رب هب لي حكما وألحقني بالصالحين
english: "O my Lord! bestow wisdom on me, and join me with the righteous;
tafsir: So that when they come (before the Lord) He will say: "Did you deny My signs without having understood them? Or what was it that you were doing?"

arabic: واجعل لي لسان صدق في الآخرين
english: "Grant me honourable mention on the tongue of truth among the latest (generations);
tafsir: When the sentence will have been passed upon them for their wickedness, they will not be able to say a word.

arabic: واجعلني من ورثة جنة النعيم
english: "Make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of Bliss;
tafsir: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest, the day to make things clear? Indeed there are signs in this for people who believe.

arabic: واغفر لأبي إنه كان من الضالين
english: "Forgive my father, for that he is among those astray;
tafsir: The day the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified, save those whom God please, and all will appear before Him in abjectness.

arabic: ولا تخزني يوم يبعثون
english: "And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;-
tafsir: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything. He is indeed fully aware of what you do.

arabic: يوم لا ينفع مال ولا بنون
english: "The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
tafsir: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.

arabic: إلا من أتى الله بقلب سليم
english: "But only he (will prosper) that brings to Allah a sound heart;
tafsir: But whosoever comes with evil will be flung face forward into the Fire. Can you expect reward for any thing but what you do?

arabic: وأزلفت الجنة للمتقين

tafsir: And to recite the Qur'an." Whoever comes to guidance does so for himself; as for him who stays astray, tell him: "I am only a warner."

arabic: إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وذكروا الله كثيرا وانتصروا من بعد ما ظلموا ۗ وسيعلم الذين ظلموا أي منقلب ينقلبون
