english: If it were Our Will, We could drown them: then would there be no helper (to hear their cry), nor could they be delivered,
tafsir: (Sitting) on couches, face to face,

arabic: إلا رحمة منا ومتاعا إلى حين
english: Except by way of Mercy from Us, and by way of (world) convenience (to serve them) for a time.
tafsir: With cups from a flowing stream being passed around,

arabic: وإذا قيل لهم اتقوا ما بين أيديكم وما خلفكم لعلكم ترحمون
english: When they are told, "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you, in order that ye may receive Mercy," (they turn back).
tafsir: Clear, delicious to drink,

arabic: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين
english: Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord, but they turn away therefrom.
tafsir: Neither dulling the senses nor intoxicating,

arabic: وإذا قيل لهم أنفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أنطعم من لو يشاء الله أطعمه إن أنتم إلا في ضلال مبين
english: And when they are told, "Spend ye of (the bounties) with which Allah has provided you," the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we then feed those whom, if Allah had so willed, He would have fed, (Himself)?- Ye are in nothing but manifest error."
tafsir: And with them maidens of modest look and large lustrous eyes,

arabic: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين
english: Further, they say, "When will this promise (come to pass), if what ye say is true?"
tafsir: Like sheltered eggs in a nest.

arabic: ما ينظرون إلا صيحة واحدة تأخذهم وهم يخصمون
english: They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it will seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
tafsir: Then one turned to the other in an enquiry.

arabic: فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا إلى أهلهم يرجعون
english: No (chance) will they then have, by will, to dispose (of their affairs), nor to return to their own people!
tafsir: Said one of the speakers: "I had a friend

arabic: ونفخ في الصور فإذا هم من الأجداث إلى ربهم ينسلون
english: The trumpet shall be sounded, when behold! from the sepulchres (men) will rush forth to their Lord!
tafsir: Who used to say: 'Are you one of those who can testify to the truth?

arabic: قالوا يا ويلنا من بعثنا من مرقدنا ۜ ۗ هذا ما وعد الرحمن وصدق المرسلون
english: They will say: "Ah! Woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose?"... (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most Gracious had promised. And true was the word of the messengers!"
tafsir: (Do you think) we would be paid back our due when we are dead and reduced to dust and bones?'

arabic: إن كانت إلا صيحة واحدة فإذا هم جميع لدينا محضرون
english: It will be no more than a single Blast, when lo! they will all be brought up before Us!
tafsir: He said: 'Will you look down?'

arabic: فاليوم لا تظلم نفس شيئا ولا تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون
english: Then, on that Day, not a soul will be wronged in the least, and ye shall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds.
tafsir: He looked down and saw (his friend) in the midst of Hell.

arabic: إن أصحاب الجنة اليوم في شغل فاكهون
english: Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in all that they do;
tafsir: 'By God', he said, 'you had almost ruined me.

arabic: هم وأزواجهم في ظلال على الأرائك متكئون
english: They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade, reclining on Thrones (of dignity);
tafsir: Had it not been for the grace of my Lord I too would have been there (in Hell).

arabic: لهم فيها فاكهة ولهم ما يدعون
english: (Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have whatever they call for;
tafsir: (Another will say:)"Is it true, we are not going to die

arabic: سلام قولا من رب رحيم
english: "Peace!" - a word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!
tafsir: Other than our first death, and we shall not be punished?

arabic: وامتازوا اليوم أيها المجرمون
english: "And O ye in sin! Get ye apart this Day!
tafsir: This will indeed be great happiness.

arabic: ألم أعهد إليكم يا بني آدم أن لا تعبدوا الشيطان ۖ إنه لكم عدو مبين
english: "Did I not enjoin on you, O ye Children of Adam, that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?-
tafsir: For this the toilers should strive."

arabic: وأن اعبدوني ۚ هذا صراط مستقيم
english: "And that ye should worship Me, (for that) this was the Straight Way?
tafsir: Is this better or the tree of Zaqqum

arabic: ولقد أضل منكم جبلا كثيرا ۖ أفلم تكونوا تعقلون
english: "But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not, then, understand?
tafsir: Which We have reserved as punishment for evil-doers?

arabic: هذه جهنم التي كنتم توعدون
english: "This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned!
tafsir: It is a tree that grows at the bottom of Hell.

arabic: اصلوها اليوم بما كنتم تكفرون
english: "Embrace ye the (fire) this Day, for that ye (persistently) rejected (Truth)."
tafsir: Its spathes are like the prickly pear.

arabic: اليوم نختم على أفواههم وتكلمنا أيديهم وتشهد أرجلهم بما كانوا يكسبون
english: That Day shall We set a seal on their mouths. But their hands will speak to us, and their feet bear witness, to all that they did.
tafsir: They will eat and fill their bellies with it,

arabic: ولو نشاء لطمسنا على أعينهم فاستبقوا الصراط فأنى يبصرون
english: If it had been our Will, We could surely have blotted out their eyes; then should they have run about groping for the Path, but how could they have seen?
tafsir: Washing it down with boiling water.

arabic: ولو نشاء لمسخناهم على مكانتهم فما استطاعوا مضيا ولا يرجعون
english: And if it had been Our Will, We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places; then should they have been unable to move about, nor could they have returned (after error).
tafsir: Then to Hell they will surely be returned.

arabic: ومن نعمره ننكسه في الخلق ۖ أفلا يعقلون
english: If We grant long life to any, We cause him to be reversed in nature: Will they not then understand?
tafsir: They had found their fathers astray,

arabic: وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له ۚ إن هو إلا ذكر وقرآن مبين
english: We have not instructed the (Prophet) in Poetry, nor is it meet for him: this is no less than a Message and a Qur'an making things clear:
tafsir: Yet they hasten to follow in their footsteps.

arabic: لينذر من كان حيا ويحق القول على الكافرين
english: That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive, and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).
tafsir: So had many an earlier people gone astray,

arabic: أولم يروا أنا خلقنا لهم مما عملت أيدينا أنعاما فهم لها مالكون
english: See they not that it is We Who have created for them - among the things which Our hands have fashioned - cattle, which are under their dominion?-
tafsir: And We had sent admonishers to them.

arabic: وذللناها لهم فمنها ركوبهم ومنها يأكلون
english: And that We have subjected them to their (use)? of them some do carry them and some they eat:
tafsir: Look, then how was the end of those who had been warned,

arabic: ولهم فيها منافع ومشارب ۖ أفلا يشكرون
english: And they have (other) profits from them (besides), and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful?
tafsir: Other than the chosen creatures of God.

arabic: واتخذوا من دون الله آلهة لعلهم ينصرون
english: Yet they take (for worship) gods other than Allah, (hoping) that they might be helped!
tafsir: Noah had verily called to Us. And how gracious was He who answered (him).

arabic: لا يستطيعون نصرهم وهم لهم جند محضرون
english: They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).
tafsir: We saved him and his family from the great affliction,

arabic: فلا يحزنك قولهم ۘ إنا نعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون
english: Let not their speech, then, grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose.
tafsir: And made his progeny survive,

arabic: أولم ير الإنسان أنا خلقناه من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين
english: Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!
tafsir: And left (his name) for posterity.

arabic: وضرب لنا مثلا ونسي خلقه ۖ قال من يحيي العظام وهي رميم
english: And he makes comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (origin and) Creation: He says, "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?"
tafsir: Peace on Noah among all men.

arabic: قل يحييها الذي أنشأها أول مرة ۖ وهو بكل خلق عليم
english: Say, "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-
tafsir: That is how We reward those who do good.

arabic: الذي جعل لكم من الشجر الأخضر نارا فإذا أنتم منه توقدون
english: "The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, when behold! ye kindle therewith (your own fires)!
tafsir: Surely he was among Our faithful creatures.

arabic: أوليس الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بقادر على أن يخلق مثلهم ۚ بلى وهو الخلاق العليم
english: "Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" - Yea, indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme, of skill and knowledge (infinite)!
tafsir: Afterwards We drowned the others.

arabic: إنما أمره إذا أراد شيئا أن يقول له كن فيكون
english: Verily, when He intends a thing, His Command is, "be", and it is!
tafsir: And Abraham indeed was of his inducement,

arabic: فسبحان الذي بيده ملكوت كل شيء وإليه ترجعون
english: So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.
tafsir: When he came to his Lord with a heart compliant,

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم والصافات صفا
english: By those who range themselves in ranks,
tafsir: But the unbelievers are still full of pride and hostility.

arabic: فالزاجرات زجرا
english: And so are strong in repelling (evil),
tafsir: How many generations have We destroyed before them who cried (for mercy) when it was too late for escape.

arabic: فالتاليات ذكرا
english: And thus proclaim the Message (of Allah)!
tafsir: They were surprised that one of them had come to them as warner; and the unbelievers said: "He is a deceiving sorcerer.

arabic: إن إلهكم لواحد
english: Verily, verily, your Allah is one!-
tafsir: Has he turned so many gods into one deity? This is indeed a strange thing!"

arabic: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما ورب المشارق
english: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all between them, and Lord of every point at the rising of the sun!
tafsir: And their leading chiefs said: "Remain attached to your gods. There is surely some motive behind it.

arabic: إنا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب
english: We have indeed decked the lower heaven with beauty (in) the stars,-
tafsir: We never heard of it in the former faith. It is surely a fabrication.

arabic: وحفظا من كل شيطان مارد
english: (For beauty) and for guard against all obstinate rebellious evil spirits,
tafsir: To him of all of us has the Reminder been sent down?" They are still in doubt about My admonition; but they have not tasted My punishment yet!

arabic: لا يسمعون إلى الملإ الأعلى ويقذفون من كل جانب
english: (So) they should not strain their ears in the direction of the Exalted Assembly but be cast away from every side,
tafsir: Do they have the stores of the mercy of your Lord, the mighty and munificent?

arabic: دحورا ۖ ولهم عذاب واصب
english: Repulsed, for they are under a perpetual penalty,
tafsir: Or is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, theirs? Then let them climb up the ladders (to the heavens).

arabic: إلا من خطف الخطفة فأتبعه شهاب ثاقب
english: Except such as snatch away something by stealth, and they are pursued by a flaming fire, of piercing brightness.
tafsir: They will be one more army vanquished among the many routed hordes.

arabic: فاستفتهم أهم أشد خلقا أم من خلقنا ۚ إنا خلقناهم من طين لازب
english: Just ask their opinion: are they the more difficult to create, or the (other) beings We have created? Them have We created out of a sticky clay!
tafsir: Even before them the people of Noah, 'Ad, the mighty Pharoah,

arabic: بل عجبت ويسخرون
english: Truly dost thou marvel, while they ridicule,
tafsir: And the Thamud, the people of Lot, as well as the dwellers of the Wood, had denied. These were the hordes.

arabic: وإذا ذكروا لا يذكرون
english: And, when they are admonished, pay no heed,-
tafsir: Of all these there was not one who did not deny the messengers. So My retribution was justified.

arabic: وإذا رأوا آية يستسخرون
english: And, when they see a Sign, turn it to mockery,
tafsir: They await but a single blast which will not be repeated.

arabic: وقالوا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين
english: And say, "This is nothing but evident sorcery!
tafsir: Still they say: "O Lord, give us our share before the Day of Reckoning."

arabic: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون
english: "What! when we die, and become dust and bones, shall we (then) be raised up (again)
tafsir: Bear with patience what they say, and remember Our votary David, man of strength. He surely turned to Us in penitence.

arabic: أوآباؤنا الأولون
english: "And also our fathers of old?"
tafsir: We subjugated the chiefs (of tribes) to struggle day and night with him,

arabic: قل نعم وأنتم داخرون
english: Say thou: "Yea, and ye shall then be humiliated (on account of your evil)."
tafsir: And the levied Tair. They were all obedient to him.

arabic: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة فإذا هم ينظرون
english: Then it will be a single (compelling) cry; and behold, they will begin to see!
tafsir: So We further strengthened his kingdom, and bestowed wisdom on him, and judgement in legal matters.

arabic: وقالوا يا ويلنا هذا يوم الدين
english: They will say, "Ah! Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"
tafsir: Have you heard of the litigants who jumped over the wall into his chamber?

arabic: هذا يوم الفصل الذي كنتم به تكذبون
english: (A voice will say,) "This is the Day of Sorting Out, whose truth ye (once) denied!"
tafsir: When they came before David, he was frightened of them. "Do not be afraid," they said. "The two of us are disputing the wrong one has done the other. So judge between us with equity, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the right path.

arabic: احشروا الذين ظلموا وأزواجهم وما كانوا يعبدون
english: "Bring ye up", it shall be said, "The wrong-doers and their wives, and the things they worshipped-
tafsir: This man here is my brother. He has ninety and nine ewes while I have only one. He demands that I should give him my ewe, and wants to get the better of me in argument."

arabic: من دون الله فاهدوهم إلى صراط الجحيم
english: "Besides Allah, and lead them to the Way to the (Fierce) Fire!
tafsir: (David) said: "He is unjust in demanding your ewe to add to his (many) ewes. Many partners are surely -- unjust to one another, except those who believe and do the right; but there are only a few of them." It occurred to David that he was being tried by Us, and he begged his Lord to forgive him, and fell down in homage and repented.

arabic: وقفوهم ۖ إنهم مسئولون
english: "But stop them, for they must be asked:
tafsir: So We forgave him. He has surely a high rank with Us and an excellent place of return.

arabic: ما لكم لا تناصرون
english: "'What is the matter with you that ye help not each other?'"
tafsir: "O David, We have made you trustee on the earth. So judge between men equitably, and do not follow your lust lest it should lead you astray from the way of God. Surely for those who go astray from the way of God, is severe punishment, for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning.

arabic: بل هم اليوم مستسلمون
english: Nay, but that day they shall submit (to Judgment);
tafsir: We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all for nothing. Only those who deny imagine so. So for the unbelievers there is woe from the fire.

arabic: وأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون
english: And they will turn to one another, and question one another.
tafsir: Should We equate those who do the right with those who spread corruption in the land? Should We make those who are morally integrated equal to those who seek disintegration?

arabic: قالوا إنكم كنتم تأتوننا عن اليمين
english: They will say: "It was ye who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"
tafsir: We have sent down a Book to you which is blessed, so that people may apply their minds to its revelations, and the men of wisdom may reflect.

arabic: قالوا بل لم تكونوا مؤمنين
english: They will reply: "Nay, ye yourselves had no Faith!
tafsir: We bestowed Solomon on David who was an excellent devotee, for he turned to God in penitence.

arabic: وما كان لنا عليكم من سلطان ۖ بل كنتم قوما طاغين
english: "Nor had we any authority over you. Nay, it was ye who were a people in obstinate rebellion!
tafsir: When they brought fleet-footed chargers in the evening to show him,

arabic: فحق علينا قول ربنا ۖ إنا لذائقون
english: "So now has been proved true, against us, the word of our Lord that we shall indeed (have to) taste (the punishment of our sins).
tafsir: He said: "The love of horses is worthy of desire to me for the remembrance of my Lord;" and when they were out of sight, (he said):

arabic: فأغويناكم إنا كنا غاوين
english: "We led you astray: for truly we were ourselves astray."
tafsir: "Bring them back to me," and he began to rub and stroke their shanks and necks.

arabic: فإنهم يومئذ في العذاب مشتركون
english: Truly, that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty.
tafsir: We surely tried Solomon, and placed another body on his throne. So he turned to God

arabic: إنا كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين
english: Verily that is how We shall deal with Sinners.
tafsir: Saying: "O Lord, forgive me, and give me such a dominion as none will merit after me. You are the great bestower."

arabic: إنهم كانوا إذا قيل لهم لا إله إلا الله يستكبرون
english: For they, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, would puff themselves up with Pride,
tafsir: So we subjugated the wind to his service which carried his merchandise wheresoever he wished;

arabic: ويقولون أئنا لتاركو آلهتنا لشاعر مجنون
english: And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"
tafsir: And the devils -- the builders and divers of all kinds,

arabic: بل جاء بالحق وصدق المرسلين
english: Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth, and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).
tafsir: And many others bound in bond.

arabic: إنكم لذائقو العذاب الأليم
english: Ye shall indeed taste of the Grievous Penalty;-
tafsir: "This is Our gift," (We said to him), "so bestow freely or withhold without reckoning."

arabic: وما تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون
english: But it will be no more than the retribution of (the Evil) that ye have wrought;-
tafsir: He has a high position with Us and an excellent abode.

arabic: إلا عباد الله المخلصين
english: But the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah,-
tafsir: Remember Our votary Job because he called to his Lord: "Satan has afflicted me with disease and distress."

arabic: أولئك لهم رزق معلوم
english: For them is a Sustenance determined,
tafsir: "Go swiftly to the spring," (We said). "This cold water is for bathing and for drinking."

arabic: فواكه ۖ وهم مكرمون
english: Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity,
tafsir: We restored his family to him with others similar to them, as a blessing from Us and a reminder for men of wisdom. --

arabic: في جنات النعيم
english: In Gardens of Felicity,
tafsir: "Take a handful of herbs," (We said to him), and apply and rub them, and do not make a mistake." We found him patient in adversity, an excellent devotee, always turning in repentance.

arabic: على سرر متقابلين
english: Facing each other on Thrones (of Dignity):
tafsir: Remember Our votaries Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of power and insight.

arabic: يطاف عليهم بكأس من معين
english: Round will be passed to them a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain,
tafsir: We distinguished them for the distinct remembrance of the abode (of the Hereafter).

arabic: بيضاء لذة للشاربين
english: Crystal-white, of a taste delicious to those who drink (thereof),
tafsir: They are the chosen ones, the excellent in Our sight.

arabic: لا فيها غول ولا هم عنها ينزفون
english: Free from headiness; nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.
tafsir: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl. Every one of them is among the best.

arabic: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف عين
english: And besides them will be chaste women, restraining their glances, with big eyes (of wonder and beauty).
tafsir: This is a commemoration. Surely for those who take heed for themselves is an excellent place of return --

arabic: كأنهن بيض مكنون
english: As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded.
tafsir: Gardens of Eden with gates open wide to them,

arabic: فأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون
english: Then they will turn to one another and question one another.
tafsir: Where they will take their ease, calling for fruits in plenty, and for wine,

arabic: قال قائل منهم إني كان لي قرين
english: One of them will start the talk and say: "I had an intimate companion (on the earth),
tafsir: With companions of modest look, the same in age, by their side.

arabic: يقول أإنك لمن المصدقين
english: "Who used to say, 'what! art thou amongst those who bear witness to the Truth (of the Message)?
tafsir: This is what is promised you for the Day of Reckoning.

arabic: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمدينون
english: "'When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed receive rewards and punishments?'"
tafsir: This is surely Our provision never-ending.

arabic: قال هل أنتم مطلعون
english: (A voice) said: "Would ye like to look down?"
tafsir: This (for the virtuous); but for the transgressors the evil destination,

arabic: فاطلع فرآه في سواء الجحيم
english: He looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.
tafsir: Hell, in which they will burn. How vile a resting place!

arabic: قال تالله إن كدت لتردين
english: He said: "By Allah! thou wast little short of bringing me to perdition!
tafsir: There will be boiling water for them and cold, clammy, fetid drink to taste,

arabic: ولولا نعمة ربي لكنت من المحضرين
english: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I should certainly have been among those brought (there)!
tafsir: And other similar torments.

arabic: أفما نحن بميتين
english: "Is it (the case) that we shall not die,
tafsir: Here is a multitude rushing headlong with you. There is no welcome for them. They will roast in the fire.

arabic: إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمعذبين
english: "Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"
tafsir: They will say: "In fact, it is you who will have no welcome. It is you who brought this upon us. What an evil place of rest!"

arabic: إن هذا لهو الفوز العظيم
english: Verily this is the supreme achievement!
tafsir: They will say: "O Lord, give him who has brought this upon us two times more the torment of Hell;"

arabic: لمثل هذا فليعمل العاملون
english: For the like of this let all strive, who wish to strive.
tafsir: And will add: "O what has happened to us that we do not see the men we counted among the wicked.

arabic: أذلك خير نزلا أم شجرة الزقوم
english: Is that the better entertainment or the Tree of Zaqqum?
tafsir: Did we laugh at them (for nothing), or our eyes fail to pick them out?"

arabic: إنا جعلناها فتنة للظالمين
english: For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.
tafsir: This contending of the inmates of Hell will surely be real.

arabic: إنها شجرة تخرج في أصل الجحيم
english: For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-Fire:
tafsir: Say: "I am only a warner, and there is no other god but God, the one, the omnipotent,

arabic: طلعها كأنه رءوس الشياطين
english: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils:
tafsir: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that lies between them, all-mighty, all-forgiving."

arabic: فإنهم لآكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون
english: Truly they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.
tafsir: Say: "This is a momentous message,

arabic: ثم إن لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم
english: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water.
tafsir: To which you pay no heed.

arabic: ثم إن مرجعهم لإلى الجحيم
english: Then shall their return be to the (Blazing) Fire.
tafsir: I had no knowledge of the higher Assembly when they discussed it among themselves.

arabic: إنهم ألفوا آباءهم ضالين
english: Truly they found their fathers on the wrong Path;
tafsir: Only this has been revealed to me that I am a distinct warner.

arabic: فهم على آثارهم يهرعون
english: So they (too) were rushed down on their footsteps!
tafsir: When your Lord said to the angels: "I am going to create a man from clay;

arabic: ولقد ضل قبلهم أكثر الأولين
english: And truly before them, many of the ancients went astray;-
tafsir: And when I have made him and have breathed into him of My spirit. Fall down in homage before him."

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا فيهم منذرين
english: But We sent aforetime, among them, (messengers) to admonish them;-
tafsir: Then the angels bowed before him in a body,

arabic: فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين
english: Then see what was the end of those who were admonished (but heeded not),-
tafsir: Except Iblis. He was filled with pride and turned an unbeliever.

arabic: إلا عباد الله المخلصين
english: Except the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah.
tafsir: Said (God): "O Iblis, what hindered you from adoring what I created by My own authority? Are you too proud, or too high and mighty?"

arabic: ولقد نادانا نوح فلنعم المجيبون
english: (In the days of old), Noah cried to Us, and We are the best to hear prayer.
tafsir: He said: "I am better than he. You created me from fire, and him from clay."

arabic: ونجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم
english: And We delivered him and his people from the Great Calamity,
tafsir: (God) said: "Then go hence, ostracised.

arabic: وجعلنا ذريته هم الباقين
english: And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);
tafsir: Upon you will be My damnation till the Day of Doom."

arabic: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين
english: And We left (this blessing) for him among generations to come in later times:
tafsir: He said: "O Lord, give me respite till the day the dead rise from their graves."

arabic: سلام على نوح في العالمين
english: "Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations!"
tafsir: (God) said: "You have the respite

arabic: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
english: Thus indeed do we reward those who do right.
tafsir: Till the appointed day."

arabic: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين
english: For he was one of our believing Servants.
tafsir: He said: "By Your authority, I will lead them astray,

arabic: ثم أغرقنا الآخرين
english: Then the rest we overwhelmed in the Flood.
tafsir: Other than the chosen ones among Your creatures."

arabic: وإن من شيعته لإبراهيم
english: Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.
tafsir: (God) said: "This is right by Me, and what I say is right.

arabic: إذ جاء ربه بقلب سليم
english: Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.
tafsir: I will fill up Hell with you together with those who follow you."

arabic: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ماذا تعبدون
english: Behold! he said to his father and to his people, "What is that which ye worship?
tafsir: Say: "I do not ask any compensation of you for it, nor am I a specious pretender.

arabic: أئفكا آلهة دون الله تريدون
english: "Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?
tafsir: This is only a warning for mankind.

arabic: فما ظنكم برب العالمين

arabic: وعجبوا أن جاءهم منذر منهم ۖ وقال الكافرون هذا ساحر كذاب

arabic: أجعل الآلهة إلها واحدا ۖ إن هذا لشيء عجاب
english: "Has he made the gods (all) into one Allah? Truly this is a wonderful thing!"

He formed you in the mother's womb, formation after formation in three (veils of) darkness. He is God your Lord. His is the kingdom. There is no god other than He. How then can you turn away?

arabic: وانطلق الملأ منهم أن امشوا واصبروا على آلهتكم ۖ إن هذا لشيء يراد
english: And the leader among them go away (impatiently), (saying), "Walk ye away, and remain constant to your gods! For this is truly a thing designed (against you)!
tafsir: If you are ungrateful, then remember! God is independent of you, and He does not favour ingratitude on the part of His creatures. If you are grateful He will be pleased with you. For no one who carries a burden bears another's load; and your returning is to your Lord, when He will tell you what you used to do. Surely He knows what is in the hearts.

arabic: ما سمعنا بهذا في الملة الآخرة إن هذا إلا اختلاق
english: "We never heard (the like) of this among the people of these latter days: this is nothing but a made-up tale!"
tafsir: When man is afflicted with adversity he turns to his Lord, and prays to Him. But when He bestows His favour on him, he forgets what he prayed for before, and sets up others as compeers of God to mislead (people) from His way. Say: "Take advantage of your denying for a while: You will be among the inmates of Hell."

arabic: أأنزل عليه الذكر من بيننا ۚ بل هم في شك من ذكري ۖ بل لما يذوقوا عذاب
english: "What! has the Message been sent to him - (Of all persons) among us?"... but they are in doubt concerning My (Own) Message! Nay, they have not yet tasted My Punishment!
tafsir: Can one who prays in the watches of the night, bowing in homage or standing attentive, fearful of the life to come, and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (be like one who does not)? Say: "Can those who know, and those who do not know, be equal? Only they think who are wise."

arabic: أم عندهم خزائن رحمة ربك العزيز الوهاب
english: Or have they the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord,- the Exalted in Power, the Grantor of Bounties without measure?
tafsir: Tell them: "O my creatures who have come to belief, have fear of displeasing your Lord. There is good for those who do good in this world, and productive is God's earth. Only those who persevere will get their reward measureless."

arabic: أم لهم ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما ۖ فليرتقوا في الأسباب
english: Or have they the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all between? If so, let them mount up with the ropes and means (to reach that end)!
tafsir: Say: "I am commanded to worship God with obedience all-exclusive for Him;

arabic: جند ما هنالك مهزوم من الأحزاب
english: But there - will be put to flight even a host of confederates.
tafsir: And I am commanded to be the first of those who submit."

arabic: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وفرعون ذو الأوتاد
english: Before them (were many who) rejected messengers,- the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes,
tafsir: Say: "If I disobey my Lord, I fear the punishment of an evil Day."

arabic: وثمود وقوم لوط وأصحاب الأيكة ۚ أولئك الأحزاب
english: And Thamud, and the people of Lut, and the Companions of the Wood; - such were the Confederates.
tafsir: Say: "I worship God with devotion all-exclusive for Him.

arabic: إن كل إلا كذب الرسل فحق عقاب
english: Not one (of them) but rejected the messengers, but My punishment came justly and inevitably (on them).
tafsir: You may worship what you will apart from Him." Say: "Surely the greatest losers will be those who will lose their own selves and their people on the Day of Resurrection." Remember, this will be an all-too-evident loss.

arabic: وما ينظر هؤلاء إلا صيحة واحدة ما لها من فواق
english: These (today) only wait for a single mighty Blast, which (when it comes) will brook no delay.
tafsir: Above them will be a covering of fire, below them a cloud (of flames). With this does God warn His creatures: "O My creatures, fear Me."

arabic: وقالوا ربنا عجل لنا قطنا قبل يوم الحساب
english: They say: "Our Lord! hasten to us our sentence (even) before the Day of Account!"
tafsir: There are happy tidings for those who keep away from the worship of false gods and turn to God in repentance. Give glad tidings to My creatures.

arabic: اصبر على ما يقولون واذكر عبدنا داوود ذا الأيد ۖ إنه أواب
english: Have patience at what they say, and remember our servant David, the man of strength: for he ever turned (to Allah).
tafsir: Those who listen to the Word and then follow the best it contains, are the ones who have been guided by God, and are men of wisdom.

arabic: إنا سخرنا الجبال معه يسبحن بالعشي والإشراق
english: It was We that made the hills declare, in unison with him, Our Praises, at eventide and at break of day,
tafsir: Can he against whom the sentence of punishment has been justified (be rescued)? Can you save him who is in the Fire?

arabic: والطير محشورة ۖ كل له أواب
english: And the birds gathered (in assemblies): all with him did turn (to Allah).
tafsir: But for those who fear displeasing their Lord there are lofty mansions built above mansions, with rivers rippling past below them: A promise of God; (and) God does not go back on His promise.

arabic: وشددنا ملكه وآتيناه الحكمة وفصل الخطاب
english: We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and sound judgment in speech and decision.
tafsir: Do you not see that God sends down water from the sky, then makes it flow in rills on the earth, and brings forth corn from it which, having passed through changes of shade and colour, comes to ripen, and you see it autumnal yellow; then He reduces it to chaff. There are indeed lessons in this for those who are wise.

arabic: وهل أتاك نبأ الخصم إذ تسوروا المحراب
english: Has the Story of the Disputants reached thee? Behold, they climbed over the wall of the private chamber;
tafsir: Will he whose breast has been opened up to peace (not be) in luminescence from his Lord? Alas for those whose hearts have been hardened to God's remembrance! They wander (astray) in clear error.

arabic: إذ دخلوا على داوود ففزع منهم ۖ قالوا لا تخف ۖ خصمان بغى بعضنا على بعض فاحكم بيننا بالحق ولا تشطط واهدنا إلى سواء الصراط
english: When they entered the presence of David, and he was terrified of them, they said: "Fear not: we are two disputants, one of whom has wronged the other: Decide now between us with truth, and treat us not with injustice, but guide us to the even Path..
tafsir: God has sent down the very best discourse, the Book conformable in its juxtapositions, which makes all of those who fear their Lord, shudder. So their hearts and bodies become receptive to the remembrance of God. This is the guidance of God with which He guides whosoever He will; but whosoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.

arabic: إن هذا أخي له تسع وتسعون نعجة ولي نعجة واحدة فقال أكفلنيها وعزني في الخطاب
english: "This man is my brother: He has nine and ninety ewes, and I have (but) one: Yet he says, 'commit her to my care,' and is (moreover) harsh to me in speech."
tafsir: Can he who will have to shield himself against the torment of the Day of Resurrection (be the same as one at peace)? The evil-doers will be told: "So taste what you earned."

arabic: قال لقد ظلمك بسؤال نعجتك إلى نعاجه ۖ وإن كثيرا من الخلطاء ليبغي بعضهم على بعض إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وقليل ما هم ۗ وظن داوود أنما فتناه فاستغفر ربه وخر راكعا وأناب ۩
english: (David) said: "He has undoubtedly wronged thee in demanding thy (single) ewe to be added to his (flock of) ewes: truly many are the partners (in business) who wrong each other: Not so do those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, and how few are they?"... and David gathered that We had tried him: he asked forgiveness of his Lord, fell down, bowing (in prostration), and turned (to Allah in repentance).
tafsir: Those before them had denied, then punishment had overtaken them is from a quarter they did not suspect.

arabic: فغفرنا له ذلك ۖ وإن له عندنا لزلفى وحسن مآب
english: So We forgave him this (lapse): he enjoyed, indeed, a Near Approach to Us, and a beautiful place of (Final) Return.
tafsir: Then God made them taste of disgrace in this life; and the torment of the life to come is greater, if they understand.

arabic: يا داوود إنا جعلناك خليفة في الأرض فاحكم بين الناس بالحق ولا تتبع الهوى فيضلك عن سبيل الله ۚ إن الذين يضلون عن سبيل الله لهم عذاب شديد بما نسوا يوم الحساب
english: O David! We did indeed make thee a vicegerent on earth: so judge thou between men in truth (and justice): Nor follow thou the lusts (of thy heart), for they will mislead thee from the Path of Allah: for those who wander astray from the Path of Allah, is a Penalty Grievous, for that they forget the Day of Account.
tafsir: We have given examples of every kind for men in this Qur'an so that they may contemplate:

arabic: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما باطلا ۚ ذلك ظن الذين كفروا ۚ فويل للذين كفروا من النار
english: Not without purpose did We create heaven and earth and all between! that were the thought of Unbelievers! but woe to the Unbelievers because of the Fire (of Hell)!
tafsir: A clear discourse which expounds all things without any obliquity, so that they may take heed for themselves.

arabic: أم نجعل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات كالمفسدين في الأرض أم نجعل المتقين كالفجار
english: Shall We treat those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, the same as those who do mischief on earth? Shall We treat those who guard against evil, the same as those who turn aside from the right?
tafsir: God advances the example of a man who is owned (as slave in common) by a number of men at loggerheads, and another man who is owned by only one. Are these two alike in attribute? God be praised; yet many of them do not know.

arabic: كتاب أنزلناه إليك مبارك ليدبروا آياته وليتذكر أولو الألباب
english: (Here is) a Book which We have sent down unto thee, full of blessings, that they may mediate on its Signs, and that men of understanding may receive admonition.
tafsir: Verily you will die, and so will they.

arabic: ووهبنا لداوود سليمان ۚ نعم العبد ۖ إنه أواب
english: To David We gave Solomon (for a son),- How excellent in Our service! Ever did he turn (to Us)!
tafsir: Then on the Day of Resurrection you will dispute before your Lord.

arabic: إذ عرض عليه بالعشي الصافنات الجياد
english: Behold, there were brought before him, at eventide coursers of the highest breeding, and swift of foot;
tafsir: Who does greater wrong than he who tells a lie against God, and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there no place for unbelievers in Hell?

arabic: فقال إني أحببت حب الخير عن ذكر ربي حتى توارت بالحجاب
english: And he said, "Truly do I love the love of good, with a view to the glory of my Lord,"- until (the sun) was hidden in the veil (of night):
tafsir: He who brings the truth and verifies it, -- such are the people who are God-fearing.

arabic: ردوها علي ۖ فطفق مسحا بالسوق والأعناق
english: "Bring them back to me." then began he to pass his hand over (their) legs and their necks.
tafsir: They shall have what they wish from their Lord. This is the recompense for the good,

arabic: ولقد فتنا سليمان وألقينا على كرسيه جسدا ثم أناب
english: And We did try Solomon: We placed on his throne a body (without life); but he did turn (to Us in true devotion):
tafsir: That God may absolve them of their sins and reward them for the best that they had done.

arabic: قال رب اغفر لي وهب لي ملكا لا ينبغي لأحد من بعدي ۖ إنك أنت الوهاب
english: He said, "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which, (it may be), suits not another after me: for Thou art the Grantor of Bounties (without measure).
tafsir: Is not God sufficient for His devotee? Still they frighten you with others apart from Him. Whoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.

arabic: فسخرنا له الريح تجري بأمره رخاء حيث أصاب
english: Then We subjected the wind to his power, to flow gently to his order, Whithersoever he willed,-
tafsir: And none can lead him astray who has been guided by God. Is not God all-mighty, the lord of retribution?

arabic: والشياطين كل بناء وغواص
english: As also the evil ones, (including) every kind of builder and diver,-
tafsir: If you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they will answer: "God." Say: "Then just think. Can those whom you worship apart from God remove the distress God is pleased to visit upon me, or withhold a blessing God is pleased to favour me with?' Say: "God is all-sufficient for me. The trusting place their trust in Him."

arabic: وآخرين مقرنين في الأصفاد
english: As also others bound together in fetters.
tafsir: Say: "O people, act as best you can on your part, I am acting too. You will come to know in time

arabic: هذا عطاؤنا فامنن أو أمسك بغير حساب
english: "Such are Our Bounties: whether thou bestow them (on others) or withhold them, no account will be asked."
tafsir: Who suffers the shameful punishment, and on whom falls the everlasting torment.

arabic: وإن له عندنا لزلفى وحسن مآب
english: And he enjoyed, indeed, a Near Approach to Us, and a beautiful Place of (Final) Return.
tafsir: We have Sent down this Book to you with the truth for all mankind. So, he who comes to guidance does so for himself, and he who goes astray does so for his own loss; on you does not lie their guardianship.

arabic: واذكر عبدنا أيوب إذ نادى ربه أني مسني الشيطان بنصب وعذاب
english: Commemorate Our Servant Job. Behold he cried to his Lord: "The Evil One has afflicted me with distress and suffering!"
tafsir: God gathers up the souls of those who die, and of those who do not die, in their sleep; then He keeps back those ordained for death, and sends the others back for an appointed term. Surely there are signs in this for those who reflect.

arabic: اركض برجلك ۖ هذا مغتسل بارد وشراب
english: (The command was given:) "Strike with thy foot: here is (water) wherein to wash, cool and refreshing, and (water) to drink."
tafsir: Have they appointed intercessors other than God? Say: "Even though they have no power in the least, nor do they understand?"

arabic: ووهبنا له أهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة منا وذكرى لأولي الألباب
english: And We gave him (back) his people, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who have Understanding.
tafsir: Say: "God's is the intercession entirely; His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth; then to Him you will return."

arabic: وخذ بيدك ضغثا فاضرب به ولا تحنث ۗ إنا وجدناه صابرا ۚ نعم العبد ۖ إنه أواب
english: "And take in thy hand a little grass, and strike therewith: and break not (thy oath)." Truly We found him full of patience and constancy. How excellent in Our service! ever did he turn (to Us)!
tafsir: When God alone is mentioned the hearts of those who do not believe in the life to come, are filled with resentment. But when others are mentioned apart from God, they begin to rejoice.

arabic: واذكر عبادنا إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب أولي الأيدي والأبصار
english: And commemorate Our Servants Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, possessors of Power and Vision.
tafsir: Say: "O God, the originator of the heavens and the earth, the knower of the unknown and the known, You alone will judge between Your creatures for things they differed about."

arabic: إنا أخلصناهم بخالصة ذكرى الدار
english: Verily We did choose them for a special (purpose)- proclaiming the Message of the Hereafter.
tafsir: Even if the sinners possessed whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and as much more, they would offer it to ransom themselves from the torment of the Day of Resurrection; yet what they did not even imagine would appear to them from God;

arabic: وإنهم عندنا لمن المصطفين الأخيار
english: They were, in Our sight, truly, of the company of the Elect and the Good.
tafsir: And the evil of what they had earned would become visible to them; and what they used to mock would surround them from all sides.

arabic: واذكر إسماعيل واليسع وذا الكفل ۖ وكل من الأخيار
english: And commemorate Isma'il, Elisha, and Zul-Kifl: Each of them was of the Company of the Good.
tafsir: When a man is in trouble, he prays to God; but when We bestow a favour on him he says: "It has come to me through my acumen." In fact, this is an illusion, but most men do not know.

arabic: هذا ذكر ۚ وإن للمتقين لحسن مآب
english: This is a Message (of admonition): and verily, for the righteous, is a beautiful Place of (Final) Return,-
tafsir: Those before them had also said so, and yet nothing of what they did availed them in the least.

arabic: جنات عدن مفتحة لهم الأبواب
english: Gardens of Eternity, whose doors will (ever) be open to them;
tafsir: Then the worst of what they had done overtook them. So will the evil deeds of those who are sinners among them recoil back on them. They cannot get the better (of Us).

arabic: متكئين فيها يدعون فيها بفاكهة كثيرة وشراب
english: Therein will they recline (at ease): Therein can they call (at pleasure) for fruit in abundance, and (delicious) drink;
tafsir: Do they not know that God enhances or restricts the provision of any one He will. Surely there are signs in this for people who believe.

arabic: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف أتراب
english: And beside them will be chaste women restraining their glances, (companions) of equal age.
tafsir: Say: "O creatures of God, those of you who have acted against your own interests should not be disheartened of the mercy of God. Surely God forgives all sins. He is all-forgiving and all-merciful.

arabic: هذا ما توعدون ليوم الحساب
english: Such is the Promise made, to you for the Day of Account!
tafsir: Turn towards your Lord and obey Him before the punishment comes upon you when you will not be helped.

arabic: إن هذا لرزقنا ما له من نفاد
english: Truly such will be Our Bounty (to you); it will never fail;-
tafsir: Follow the best of what has been revealed to you by your Lord before the punishment overtakes you suddenly and you are caught unawares,

arabic: هذا ۚ وإن للطاغين لشر مآب
english: Yea, such! but - for the wrong-doers will be an evil place of (Final) Return!-
tafsir: Lest a soul should say: "Alas, I was heedless of God and only laughed;"

arabic: جهنم يصلونها فبئس المهاد
english: Hell!- they will burn therein, - an evil bed (indeed, to lie on)!-
tafsir: Or say: "If only God had guided me I would have been a man of fear and piety;"

arabic: هذا فليذوقوه حميم وغساق
english: Yea, such! - then shall they taste it,- a boiling fluid, and a fluid dark, murky, intensely cold!-
tafsir: Or say on seeing the punishment: "If I could only return I would be among the good."

arabic: وآخر من شكله أزواج
english: And other Penalties of a similar kind, to match them!
tafsir: Why, My revelations had come to you, but you denied them and were filled with pride, and were among the disbelievers.

arabic: هذا فوج مقتحم معكم ۖ لا مرحبا بهم ۚ إنهم صالو النار
english: Here is a troop rushing headlong with you! No welcome for them! truly, they shall burn in the Fire!
tafsir: If you see those who had imputed lies to God on the Day of Resurrection, black would be their faces (with disgrace). Is there not a place in Hell for the arrogant?

arabic: قالوا بل أنتم لا مرحبا بكم ۖ أنتم قدمتموه لنا ۖ فبئس القرار
english: (The followers shall cry to the misleaders:) "Nay, ye (too)! No welcome for you! It is ye who have brought this upon us! Now evil is (this) place to stay in!"
tafsir: God would rescue those who fear Him (and guide them) to places of safety. Neither will evil touch them nor regret.

arabic: قالوا ربنا من قدم لنا هذا فزده عذابا ضعفا في النار
english: They will say: "Our Lord! whoever brought this upon us,- Add to him a double Penalty in the Fire!"
tafsir: God is the creator of all things, and He is the guarantor of all things.

arabic: وقالوا ما لنا لا نرى رجالا كنا نعدهم من الأشرار
english: And they will say: "What has happened to us that we see not men whom we used to number among the bad ones?
tafsir: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers.

arabic: أتخذناهم سخريا أم زاغت عنهم الأبصار
english: "Did we treat them (as such) in ridicule, or have (our) eyes failed to perceive them?"
tafsir: Say: "O you ignorant people, do you bid me to worship someone other than God?

arabic: إن ذلك لحق تخاصم أهل النار
english: Truly that is just and fitting,- the mutual recriminations of the People of the Fire!
tafsir: Surely you have been commanded, as those before you were: "If you associate (any one with God), wasted will be all your deeds, arid you will perish."

arabic: قل إنما أنا منذر ۖ وما من إله إلا الله الواحد القهار
english: Say: "Truly am I a Warner: no god is there but the one Allah, Supreme and Irresistible,-
tafsir: So, you should worship only God, arid be among the grateful.

arabic: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما العزيز الغفار
english: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between,- Exalted in Might, able to enforce His Will, forgiving again and again."
tafsir: They do not esteem God as is rightly due to Him. The whole earth would be a fistful of His on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens would be rolled up in His right hand. Too immaculate is He and too high for what they associate with Him!

arabic: قل هو نبأ عظيم
english: Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all),-
tafsir: When the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will swoon away, except those God please. When the blast is sounded the second time, they will stand up all expectant.

arabic: أنتم عنه معرضون
english: "From which ye do turn away!
tafsir: The earth will light up with the effulgence of her Lord; and the ledger (of account) will be placed (in each man's hand), and the apostles and the witnesses will be called, and judgement passed between them equitably, and no wrong will be done to them.

arabic: ما كان لي من علم بالملإ الأعلى إذ يختصمون
english: "No knowledge have I of the Chiefs on high, when they discuss (matters) among themselves.
tafsir: Each soul will be paid in full for what it had done. He is cognisant of what you do.

arabic: إن يوحى إلي إلا أنما أنا نذير مبين
english: 'Only this has been revealed to me: that I am to give warning plainly and publicly."
tafsir: The unbelievers will be driven into Hell in groups till, when they reach it and its doors are opened up, its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles of your own come to you reciting your Lord's revelations, warning you of this your day of Doom?" They will answer: "Yes;" but the sentence of punishment was justified against the unbelievers.

arabic: إذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من طين
english: Behold, thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay:
tafsir: "Enter the gates of Hell," they will be told, "and there abide for ever." How grievous a destination for the haughty!

arabic: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين
english: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
tafsir: Those who were mindful of their duty to their Lord will be driven in groups to Paradise, till they reach it and its gates are opened, and its keepers say to them: "Peace be on you; you are the joyous. So enter here to live for ever."

arabic: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون
english: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
tafsir: They will say: "All praise be to God Who has fulfilled the promise He had made to us, and bequeathed to us this land for dwelling in the garden wheresoever we like." How excellent the recompense for those who act!

arabic: إلا إبليس استكبر وكان من الكافرين
english: Not so Iblis: he was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith.
tafsir: You will see the angels hover round the Throne, singing the praises of their Lord; and justice will be done between them equitably, and it would be said: "All praise to God the Lord of all the worlds."

arabic: قال يا إبليس ما منعك أن تسجد لما خلقت بيدي ۖ أستكبرت أم كنت من العالين
english: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! What prevents thee from prostrating thyself to one whom I have created with my hands? Art thou haughty? Or art thou one of the high (and mighty) ones?"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال أنا خير منه ۖ خلقتني من نار وخلقته من طين
english: (Iblis) said: "I am better than he: thou createdst me from fire, and him thou createdst from clay."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم
english: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here: for thou art rejected, accursed.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإن عليك لعنتي إلى يوم الدين
english: "And My curse shall be on thee till the Day of Judgment."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون
english: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! Give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال فإنك من المنظرين
english: (Allah) said: "Respite then is granted thee-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم
english: "Till the Day of the Time Appointed."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال فبعزتك لأغوينهم أجمعين
english: (Iblis) said: "Then, by Thy power, I will put them all in the wrong,-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين
english: "Except Thy Servants amongst them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قال فالحق والحق أقول
english: (Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting- and I say what is just and fitting-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لأملأن جهنم منك وممن تبعك منهم أجمعين
english: "That I will certainly fill Hell with thee and those that follow thee,- every one."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل ما أسألكم عليه من أجر وما أنا من المتكلفين
english: Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this (Qur'an), nor am I a pretender.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إن هو إلا ذكر للعالمين
english: "This is no less than a Message to (all) the Worlds.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولتعلمن نبأه بعد حين
english: "And ye shall certainly know the truth of it (all) after a while."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم
english: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Power, full of Wisdom.
tafsir: The revelation of this Book is from God the all-mighty and all-knowing,

arabic: إنا أنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق فاعبد الله مخلصا له الدين
english: Verily it is We Who have revealed the Book to thee in Truth: so serve Allah, offering Him sincere devotion.
tafsir: Forgiver of trespasses, acceptor of repentance, severe of retribution, lord of power. There is no god but He. Towards Him is your destination.

arabic: ألا لله الدين الخالص ۚ والذين اتخذوا من دونه أولياء ما نعبدهم إلا ليقربونا إلى الله زلفى إن الله يحكم بينهم في ما هم فيه يختلفون ۗ إن الله لا يهدي من هو كاذب كفار
english: Is it not to Allah that sincere devotion is due? But those who take for protectors other than Allah (say): "We only serve them in order that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Truly Allah will judge between them in that wherein they differ. But Allah guides not such as are false and ungrateful.
tafsir: Only the unbelievers dispute the revelations of God. So do not let their activities in the land deceive you.

arabic: لو أراد الله أن يتخذ ولدا لاصطفى مما يخلق ما يشاء ۚ سبحانه ۖ هو الله الواحد القهار
english: Had Allah wished to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whom He pleased out of those whom He doth create: but Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah, the One, the Irresistible.
tafsir: The people of Noah had denied before them, and many factions after them. Every nation has intrigued against its apostle and afflicted him, and argued with false arguments to condemn the truth. Then I seized them. How was then My retribution!

arabic: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق ۖ يكور الليل على النهار ويكور النهار على الليل ۖ وسخر الشمس والقمر ۖ كل يجري لأجل مسمى ۗ ألا هو العزيز الغفار
english: He created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): He makes the Night overlap the Day, and the Day overlap the Night: He has subjected the sun and the moon (to His law): Each one follows a course for a time appointed. Is not He the Exalted in Power - He Who forgives again and again?
tafsir: In this way the sentence of your Lord against the infidels that they would be the inmates of Hell, was justified.

arabic: خلقكم من نفس واحدة ثم جعل منها زوجها وأنزل لكم من الأنعام ثمانية أزواج ۚ يخلقكم في بطون أمهاتكم خلقا من بعد خلق في ظلمات ثلاث ۚ ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك ۖ لا إله إلا هو ۖ فأنى تصرفون
english: He created you (all) from a single person: then created, of like nature, his mate; and he sent down for you eight head of cattle in pairs: He makes you, in the wombs of your mothers, in stages, one after another, in three veils of darkness. such is Allah, your Lord and Cherisher: to Him belongs (all) dominion. There is no god but He: then how are ye turned away (from your true Centre)?
tafsir: The bearers of the Throne, and those around it, sing the praises of their Lord and believe in Him, and seek forgiveness for those who believe: "O our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge embrace everything; so forgive those who turn to You in repentance and follow Your path; and preserve them from the torment of Hell.

arabic: إن تكفروا فإن الله غني عنكم ۖ ولا يرضى لعباده الكفر ۖ وإن تشكروا يرضه لكم ۗ ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ۗ ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون ۚ إنه عليم بذات الصدور
english: If ye reject (Allah), Truly Allah hath no need of you; but He liketh not ingratitude from His servants: if ye are grateful, He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another. In the end, to your Lord is your Return, when He will tell you the truth of all that ye did (in this life). for He knoweth well all that is in (men's) hearts.
tafsir: Admit them, O Lord, to the garden of Eden which You promised them, and those of their fathers, spouses and progeny who are upright. You are truly all-mighty and all-wise.

arabic: وإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعا ربه منيبا إليه ثم إذا خوله نعمة منه نسي ما كان يدعو إليه من قبل وجعل لله أندادا ليضل عن سبيله ۚ قل تمتع بكفرك قليلا ۖ إنك من أصحاب النار
english: When some trouble toucheth man, he crieth unto his Lord, turning to Him in repentance: but when He bestoweth a favour upon him as from Himself, (man) doth forget what he cried and prayed for before, and he doth set up rivals unto Allah, thus misleading others from Allah's Path. Say, "Enjoy thy blasphemy for a little while: verily thou art (one) of the Companions of the Fire!"
tafsir: Protect them from evil; and whosoever You preserve from evil on that Day shall have surely received Your mercy. This will be the great triumph."

arabic: أمن هو قانت آناء الليل ساجدا وقائما يحذر الآخرة ويرجو رحمة ربه ۗ قل هل يستوي الذين يعلمون والذين لا يعلمون ۗ إنما يتذكر أولو الألباب
english: Is one who worships devoutly during the hour of the night prostrating himself or standing (in adoration), who takes heed of the Hereafter, and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord - (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal, those who know and those who do not know? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition.
tafsir: Those who disbelieve will certainly be told: "God's displeasure was greater than your disgust of your selves when you were called to belief and refused to believe."

arabic: قل يا عباد الذين آمنوا اتقوا ربكم ۚ للذين أحسنوا في هذه الدنيا حسنة ۗ وأرض الله واسعة ۗ إنما يوفى الصابرون أجرهم بغير حساب
english: Say: "O ye my servants who believe! Fear your Lord, good is (the reward) for those who do good in this world. Spacious is Allah's earth! those who patiently persevere will truly receive a reward without measure!"
tafsir: They say: "O Lord, twice You made us die, and twice You made us live. We admit our sins. Is there still a way out for us?"

arabic: قل إني أمرت أن أعبد الله مخلصا له الدين
english: Say: "Verily, I am commanded to serve Allah with sincere devotion;
tafsir: This has come upon you because when God alone was invoked you disbelieved; but when partners were associated with Him, you believed. But judgement belongs to God, the all-high and supreme.

arabic: وأمرت لأن أكون أول المسلمين
english: "And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in Islam."
tafsir: It is He who shows you His signs, and sends you food from the heavens. Yet none takes a warning except him who turns to Him.

arabic: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم
english: Say: "I would, if I disobeyed my Lord, indeed have fear of the Penalty of a Mighty Day."
tafsir: So call on God with exclusive obedience, howsoever the unbelievers may dislike it.

arabic: قل الله أعبد مخلصا له ديني
english: Say: "It is Allah I serve, with my sincere (and exclusive) devotion:
tafsir: Most exalted of position, Lord of power, He directs inspiration by His command to any of His creatures as He will, to warn (men) of the Day of Meeting,

arabic: فاعبدوا ما شئتم من دونه ۗ قل إن الخاسرين الذين خسروا أنفسهم وأهليهم يوم القيامة ۗ ألا ذلك هو الخسران المبين
english: "Serve ye what ye will besides him." Say: "Truly, those in loss are those who lose their own souls and their People on the Day of Judgment: Ah! that is indeed the (real and) evident Loss!
tafsir: The day when they will come out (of their graves), with nothing of them hidden from God. Whose then will be the kingdom? -- God's, the one, the omnipotent.

arabic: لهم من فوقهم ظلل من النار ومن تحتهم ظلل ۚ ذلك يخوف الله به عباده ۚ يا عباد فاتقون
english: They shall have Layers of Fire above them, and Layers (of Fire) below them: with this doth Allah warn off his servants: "O My Servants! then fear ye Me!"
tafsir: Each soul will be recompensed that Day for what it had earned. There will be no depriving on that Day. Surely God is swift at reckoning.

arabic: والذين اجتنبوا الطاغوت أن يعبدوها وأنابوا إلى الله لهم البشرى ۚ فبشر عباد
english: Those who eschew Evil,- and fall not into its worship,- and turn to Allah (in repentance),- for them is Good News: so announce the Good News to My Servants,-
tafsir: Warn them of the coming day inevitable, when hearts would jump to the throats, filling them with anguish. The sinners will have neither friend nor intercessor whose (word) will be heeded.

arabic: الذين يستمعون القول فيتبعون أحسنه ۚ أولئك الذين هداهم الله ۖ وأولئك هم أولو الألباب
english: Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best (meaning) in it: those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones endued with understanding.
tafsir: Known to Him is the treachery of the eye, and what the breasts conceal.

arabic: أفمن حق عليه كلمة العذاب أفأنت تنقذ من في النار
english: Is, then, one against whom the decree of Punishment is justly due (equal to one who eschews Evil)? Wouldst thou, then, deliver one (who is) in the Fire?
tafsir: God decides with justice. But those they call apart from Him can not adjudge in the least. Verily God is all-hearing, all-perceiving.

arabic: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم غرف من فوقها غرف مبنية تجري من تحتها الأنهار ۖ وعد الله ۖ لا يخلف الله الميعاد
english: But it is for those who fear their Lord. That lofty mansions, one above another, have been built: beneath them flow rivers (of delight): (such is) the Promise of Allah: never doth Allah fail in (His) promise.
tafsir: Have they not travelled on the earth that they could see what happened to those before them? They were greater in strength than they, and have left behind them traces on the earth. Yet they were seized by God for their sins, and had none to protect them against God.

arabic: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فسلكه ينابيع في الأرض ثم يخرج به زرعا مختلفا ألوانه ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يجعله حطاما ۚ إن في ذلك لذكرى لأولي الألباب
english: Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and leads it through springs in the earth? Then He causes to grow, therewith, produce of various colours: then it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then He makes it dry up and crumble away. Truly, in this, is a Message of remembrance to men of understanding.
tafsir: This was so because their apostles came with clear proofs to them, but they refused to believe. So they were seized by God. Surely God is powerful, unrelenting in retribution.

arabic: أفمن شرح الله صدره للإسلام فهو على نور من ربه ۚ فويل للقاسية قلوبهم من ذكر الله ۚ أولئك في ضلال مبين
english: Is one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam, so that he has received Enlightenment from Allah, (no better than one hard-hearted)? Woe to those whose hearts are hardened against celebrating the praises of Allah! they are manifestly wandering (in error)!
tafsir: We sent Moses with Our signs and clear authority

arabic: الله نزل أحسن الحديث كتابا متشابها مثاني تقشعر منه جلود الذين يخشون ربهم ثم تلين جلودهم وقلوبهم إلى ذكر الله ۚ ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء ۚ ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد
english: Allah has revealed (from time to time) the most beautiful Message in the form of a Book, consistent with itself, (yet) repeating (its teaching in various aspects): the skins of those who fear their Lord tremble thereat; then their skins and their hearts do soften to the celebration of Allah's praises. Such is the guidance of Allah: He guides therewith whom He pleases, but such as Allah leaves to stray, can have none to guide.
tafsir: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun. But they said: "He is only a deceiving sorcerer."

arabic: أفمن يتقي بوجهه سوء العذاب يوم القيامة ۚ وقيل للظالمين ذوقوا ما كنتم تكسبون
english: Is, then, one who has to fear the brunt of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment (and receive it) on his face, (like one guarded therefrom)? It will be said to the wrong-doers: "Taste ye (the fruits of) what ye earned!"
tafsir: And when he brought the truth to them from Us, they said: "Slay the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women." But the unbelievers' stratagem is bound to fail.

arabic: كذب الذين من قبلهم فأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون
english: Those before them (also) rejected (revelation), and so the Punishment came to them from directions they did not perceive.
tafsir: "Let me kill Moses," the Pharaoh said, "and let him call to his Lord. I fear that he will change your faith and spread corruption in the land."

arabic: فأذاقهم الله الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ۖ ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر ۚ لو كانوا يعلمون
english: So Allah gave them a taste of humiliation in the present life, but greater is the punishment of the Hereafter, if they only knew!
tafsir: Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every insolent imposter who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

arabic: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل لعلهم يتذكرون
english: We have put forth for men, in this Qur'an every kind of Parable, in order that they may receive admonition.
tafsir: A believer from the House of Pharaoh who had kept his faith to himself, said: "Will you kill a man because he says: 'My Lord is God,' when he has brought clear signs from his Lord to you? If he is a liar his lie will recoil back on him; but in case he speaks the truth, then what he predicts will befall you. Surely God does not show the way to the shameful liar.

arabic: قرآنا عربيا غير ذي عوج لعلهم يتقون
english: (It is) a Qur'an in Arabic, without any crookedness (therein): in order that they may guard against Evil.
tafsir: O my people, authority is yours today being the most powerful in the land; but who will save us from the scourge of God if it fall upon us?" "I show you," said the Pharaoh, "only what I see (is right), and guide you but to the right path."

arabic: ضرب الله مثلا رجلا فيه شركاء متشاكسون ورجلا سلما لرجل هل يستويان مثلا ۚ الحمد لله ۚ بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون
english: Allah puts forth a Parable a man belonging to many partners at variance with each other, and a man belonging entirely to one master: are those two equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! but most of them have no knowledge.
tafsir: But the man of belief said: "O my people, what I fear for you is the like of what befell the communities (of old).

arabic: إنك ميت وإنهم ميتون
english: Truly thou wilt die (one day), and truly they (too) will die (one day).
tafsir: Like the people of Noah, 'Ad and Thamud, and those that came after them. God does not want to be unjust to His creatures.

arabic: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة عند ربكم تختصمون
english: In the end will ye (all), on the Day of Judgment, settle your disputes in the presence of your Lord.
tafsir: O my people, what I fear for you is the day of gathering, crying and calling,

arabic: فمن أظلم ممن كذب على الله وكذب بالصدق إذ جاءه ۚ أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين
english: Who, then, doth more wrong than one who utters a lie concerning Allah, and rejects the Truth when it comes to him; is there not in Hell an abode for blasphemers?
tafsir: The day you will turn your backs and flee, with none to defend you against God. Whoever God allows to go astray has none to show him the way.

arabic: والذي جاء بالصدق وصدق به ۙ أولئك هم المتقون
english: And he who brings the Truth and he who confirms (and supports) it - such are the men who do right.
tafsir: Joseph had indeed come to you before with clear proofs, but you did not cease to doubt what he had brought until he died, when you said: 'God will not send a prophet after him.' That is how God leads the waster, the sceptic astray.

arabic: لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ۚ ذلك جزاء المحسنين
english: They shall have all that they wish for, in the presence of their Lord: such is the reward of those who do good:
tafsir: Those who dispute God's revelations, with no authority having come to them, (are) greatly odious in the sight of God, and the sight of those who believe. That is how God seals every proud and perverse heart."

arabic: ليكفر الله عنهم أسوأ الذي عملوا ويجزيهم أجرهم بأحسن الذي كانوا يعملون
english: So that Allah will turn off from them (even) the worst in their deeds and give them their reward according to the best of what they have done.
tafsir: The Pharaoh said: "O Haman, build me a lofty tower that I may perhaps find the means

arabic: أليس الله بكاف عبده ۖ ويخوفونك بالذين من دونه ۚ ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد
english: Is not Allah enough for his Servant? But they try to frighten thee with other (gods) besides Him! for such as Allah leaves to stray, there can be no guide.
tafsir: Of reaching the tracts of heaven and look at the god of Moses, though I think that he is a liar." Thus were the evil deeds of Pharaoh made to look attractive to him, and he was hindered from the path. So the stratagem of Pharaoh was bound to perish.

arabic: ومن يهد الله فما له من مضل ۗ أليس الله بعزيز ذي انتقام
english: And such as Allah doth guide there can be none to lead astray. Is not Allah Exalted in Power, (Able to enforce His Will), Lord of Retribution?
tafsir: The man who believed said: "O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the right path.

arabic: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله ۚ قل أفرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله إن أرادني الله بضر هل هن كاشفات ضره أو أرادني برحمة هل هن ممسكات رحمته ۚ قل حسبي الله ۖ عليه يتوكل المتوكلون
english: If indeed thou ask them who it is that created the heavens and the earth, they would be sure to say, "Allah". Say: "See ye then? the things that ye invoke besides Allah,- can they, if Allah wills some Penalty for me, remove His Penalty?- Or if He wills some Grace for me, can they keep back his Grace?" Say: "Sufficient is Allah for me! In Him trust those who put their trust."
tafsir: O people, the life of this world is ephemeral; but enduring is the abode of the Hereafter.

arabic: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل ۖ فسوف تعلمون
english: Say: "O my People! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): but soon will ye know-
tafsir: Whoever does evil will be requited in accordance with it; but whoever does right, whether man or woman, and is a believer, will enter Paradise, where they will have provision in abundance.

arabic: من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم
english: "Who it is to whom comes a Penalty of ignominy, and on whom descends a Penalty that abides."
tafsir: O my people, what is wrong with me that I am calling you to preservation, while you invite me to the Fire!

arabic: إنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب للناس بالحق ۖ فمن اهتدى فلنفسه ۖ ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها ۖ وما أنت عليهم بوكيل
english: Verily We have revealed the Book to thee in Truth, for (instructing) mankind. He, then, that receives guidance benefits his own soul: but he that strays injures his own soul. Nor art thou set over them to dispose of their affairs.
tafsir: You are asking me to disbelieve in God, and to associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, yet I invite you to the all-mighty, all-forgiving.

arabic: الله يتوفى الأنفس حين موتها والتي لم تمت في منامها ۖ فيمسك التي قضى عليها الموت ويرسل الأخرى إلى أجل مسمى ۚ إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون
english: It is Allah that takes the souls (of men) at death; and those that die not (He takes) during their sleep: those on whom He has passed the decree of death, He keeps back (from returning to life), but the rest He sends (to their bodies) for a term appointed verily in this are Signs for those who reflect.
tafsir: What you are calling me to is surely not worth the calling in this world or in the next, because our returning is to God; and because the transgressors will be inmates of Hell.

arabic: أم اتخذوا من دون الله شفعاء ۚ قل أولو كانوا لا يملكون شيئا ولا يعقلون
english: What! Do they take for intercessors others besides Allah? Say: "Even if they have no power whatever and no intelligence?"
tafsir: You will remember what I say in time to come; I submit my case to the judgement of God. Surely God keeps an eye on His creatures."

arabic: قل لله الشفاعة جميعا ۖ له ملك السماوات والأرض ۖ ثم إليه ترجعون
english: Say: "To Allah belongs exclusively (the right to grant) intercession: to Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: In the End, it is to Him that ye shall be brought back."
tafsir: So God preserved him from the evil they were planning; and a dreadful doom encompassed the people of Pharaoh:

arabic: وإذا ذكر الله وحده اشمأزت قلوب الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة ۖ وإذا ذكر الذين من دونه إذا هم يستبشرون
english: When Allah, the One and Only, is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the Hereafter are filled with disgust and horror; but when (gods) other than He are mentioned, behold, they are filled with joy!
tafsir: Fire, to which they are exposed morning and evening. The day the Hour is proclaimed (it will be said:) "Admit the people of Pharaoh to the severest punishment,"

arabic: قل اللهم فاطر السماوات والأرض عالم الغيب والشهادة أنت تحكم بين عبادك في ما كانوا فيه يختلفون
english: Say: "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is hidden and open! it is Thou that wilt judge between Thy Servants in those matters about which they have differed."
tafsir: As they will noisily argue in the Fire, the weaker ones will say to the arrogant: "We were your followers, so will you take over some of our share of the fire?"

arabic: ولو أن للذين ظلموا ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به من سوء العذاب يوم القيامة ۚ وبدا لهم من الله ما لم يكونوا يحتسبون
english: Even if the wrong-doers had all that there is on earth, and as much more, (in vain) would they offer it for ransom from the pain of the Penalty on the Day of Judgment: but something will confront them from Allah, which they could never have counted upon!
tafsir: The arrogant will answer: "All of us are in it. Surely God has judged between His creatures."

arabic: وبدا لهم سيئات ما كسبوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون
english: For the evils of their Deeds will confront them, and they will be (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!
tafsir: Those in the Fire will say to the warders of Hell: "Ask your Lord to reduce the punishment by a day for us."

arabic: فإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعانا ثم إذا خولناه نعمة منا قال إنما أوتيته على علم ۚ بل هي فتنة ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون
english: Now, when trouble touches man, he cries to Us: But when We bestow a favour upon him as from Ourselves, he says, "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" Nay, but this is but a trial, but most of them understand not!
tafsir: They will say: "Did not your apostles come to you with clear proofs?" They will answer: "Indeed, they did." "Then pray," will (the warders) say. But the praying of unbelievers will be all in vain.

arabic: قد قالها الذين من قبلهم فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون
english: Thus did the (generations) before them say! But all that they did was of no profit to them.
tafsir: We will certainly help Our messengers and those who believe, in this world, and on the day the witnesses take their stand,

arabic: فأصابهم سيئات ما كسبوا ۚ والذين ظلموا من هؤلاء سيصيبهم سيئات ما كسبوا وما هم بمعجزين
english: Nay, the evil results of their Deeds overtook them. And the wrong-doers of this (generation)- the evil results of their Deeds will soon overtake them (too), and they will never be able to frustrate (Our Plan)!
tafsir: The day upon which their excuses will not benefit the evil-doers, and the condemnation and evil abode will be theirs.

arabic: أولم يعلموا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر ۚ إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون
english: Know they not that Allah enlarges the provision or restricts it, for any He pleases? Verily, in this are Signs for those who believe!
tafsir: Verily We showed Moses the way, and bequeathed the Book to the children of Israel,

arabic: قل يا عبادي الذين أسرفوا على أنفسهم لا تقنطوا من رحمة الله ۚ إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعا ۚ إنه هو الغفور الرحيم
english: Say: "O my Servants who have transgressed against their souls! Despair not of the Mercy of Allah: for Allah forgives all sins: for He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: A guidance and reminder for men of wisdom.

arabic: وأنيبوا إلى ربكم وأسلموا له من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب ثم لا تنصرون
english: "Turn ye to our Lord (in repentance) and bow to His (Will), before the Penalty comes on you: after that ye shall not be helped.
tafsir: So persevere; the promise of God is true; and seek forgiveness for your sins, and chant the praises of your Lord evening and morning.

arabic: واتبعوا أحسن ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب بغتة وأنتم لا تشعرون
english: "And follow the best of (the courses) revealed to you from your Lord, before the Penalty comes on you - of a sudden while ye perceive not!-
tafsir: Verily those who argue in the matter of God's revelations, without authority having reached them, have nothing but pride in their hearts, and they will not achieve their end. So take refuge in God: Surely He is all-hearing and all-seeing.

arabic: أن تقول نفس يا حسرتى على ما فرطت في جنب الله وإن كنت لمن الساخرين
english: "Lest the soul should (then) say: 'Ah! Woe is me!- In that I neglected (my duty) towards Allah, and was but among those who mocked!'-
tafsir: The creation of the heavens and the earth is indeed of greater magnitude than the creation of mankind; but most men do not understand.

arabic: أو تقول لو أن الله هداني لكنت من المتقين
english: "Or (lest) it should say: 'If only Allah had guided me, I should certainly have been among the righteous!'-
tafsir: The blind and the seeing are surely not alike, nor those who believe and act rightly and those who do evil. Little do you reflect!

arabic: أو تقول حين ترى العذاب لو أن لي كرة فأكون من المحسنين
english: "Or (lest) it should say when it (actually) sees the penalty: 'If only I had another chance, I should certainly be among those who do good!'
tafsir: The Hour will certainly come; there is no mystery about it; but most men do not believe.

arabic: بلى قد جاءتك آياتي فكذبت بها واستكبرت وكنت من الكافرين
english: "(The reply will be:) 'Nay, but there came to thee my Signs, and thou didst reject them: thou wast Haughty, and became one of those who reject faith!'"
tafsir: Your Lord has said: "Call to Me that I may answer your call. Surely those who disdain worshipping Me will enter Hell, disgraced."

arabic: ويوم القيامة ترى الذين كذبوا على الله وجوههم مسودة ۚ أليس في جهنم مثوى للمتكبرين
english: On the Day of Judgment wilt thou see those who told lies against Allah;- their faces will be turned black; Is there not in Hell an abode for the Haughty?
tafsir: It is God who made the night for you to rest, the day to make things visible. Indeed God is gracious to men, but most men are not grateful.

arabic: وينجي الله الذين اتقوا بمفازتهم لا يمسهم السوء ولا هم يحزنون
english: But Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of salvation: no evil shall touch them, nor shall they grieve.
