tafsir: They would recline on couches set in rows, paired with fair companions (clean of thought and) bright of eye.

arabic: وفي الأرض آيات للموقنين
english: On the earth are signs for those of assured Faith,
tafsir: And those who believed, and whose progeny also followed them in their faith, will be united with their offspring. We will not deprive them of their labour in the least. Every man is bound to what he does.

arabic: وفي أنفسكم ۚ أفلا تبصرون
english: As also in your own selves: Will ye not then see?
tafsir: We shall give them fruits and meats, and what they desire.

arabic: وفي السماء رزقكم وما توعدون
english: And in heaven is your Sustenance, as (also) that which ye are promised.
tafsir: They will exchange cups of wine free of (incitement to) pleasantry or sin.

arabic: فورب السماء والأرض إنه لحق مثل ما أنكم تنطقون
english: Then, by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that ye can speak intelligently to each other.
tafsir: And young attendants like pearls within their shells, will go round.

arabic: هل أتاك حديث ضيف إبراهيم المكرمين
english: Has the story reached thee, of the honoured guests of Abraham?
tafsir: They will ask each other questions,

arabic: إذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلاما ۖ قال سلام قوم منكرون
english: Behold, they entered his presence, and said: "Peace!" He said, "Peace!" (and thought, "These seem) unusual people."
tafsir: Saying: "We were also once full of fear at home.

arabic: فراغ إلى أهله فجاء بعجل سمين
english: Then he turned quickly to his household, brought out a fatted calf,
tafsir: But God has been gracious to us, and has saved us from the torment of scorching wind.

arabic: فقربه إليهم قال ألا تأكلون
english: And placed it before them.. he said, "Will ye not eat?"
tafsir: We used to pray to Him erstwhile; He is the just and merciful.

arabic: فأوجس منهم خيفة ۖ قالوا لا تخف ۖ وبشروه بغلام عليم
english: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.
tafsir: Remind them, therefore, that by the grace of your Lord you are neither a soothsayer nor possessed.

arabic: فأقبلت امرأته في صرة فصكت وجهها وقالت عجوز عقيم
english: But his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: she smote her forehead and said: "A barren old woman!"
tafsir: Do they say: "He is a poet for whom we expect an adverse turn of fortune?"

arabic: قالوا كذلك قال ربك ۖ إنه هو الحكيم العليم
english: They said, "Even so has thy Lord spoken: and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge."
tafsir: Tell them: "Keep on expecting, I am expecting with you."

arabic: قال فما خطبكم أيها المرسلون
english: (Abraham) said: "And what, O ye Messengers, is your errand (now)?"
tafsir: Does their reasoning prompt them to this, or they are a people rebellious?

arabic: قالوا إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم مجرمين
english: They said, "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin;-
tafsir: Or do they say: "He has fabricated it?" In fact, they will never believe.

arabic: لنرسل عليهم حجارة من طين
english: "To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstone),
tafsir: So let them bring a discourse like it, if they are truthful

arabic: مسومة عند ربك للمسرفين
english: "Marked as from thy Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."
tafsir: Or were they created of themselves? Or are they the creators?

arabic: فأخرجنا من كان فيها من المؤمنين
english: Then We evacuated those of the Believers who were there,
tafsir: Or have they created the heavens and the earth? In fact they are certain of nothing.

arabic: فما وجدنا فيها غير بيت من المسلمين
english: But We found not there any just (Muslim) persons except in one house:
tafsir: Do they possess the treasures of your Lord? Or are they the treasurers?

arabic: وتركنا فيها آية للذين يخافون العذاب الأليم
english: And We left there a Sign for such as fear the Grievous Penalty.
tafsir: Or do they have a ladder (climbing which) they can hear (the secrets of heaven)? Let one who has heard then bring a clear proof.

arabic: وفي موسى إذ أرسلناه إلى فرعون بسلطان مبين
english: And in Moses (was another Sign): Behold, We sent him to Pharaoh, with authority manifest.
tafsir: Has (God) daughters and they sons?

arabic: فتولى بركنه وقال ساحر أو مجنون
english: But (Pharaoh) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "A sorcerer, or one possessed!"
tafsir: Or do you demand any wages from them so that they are burdened with expense?

arabic: فأخذناه وجنوده فنبذناهم في اليم وهو مليم
english: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; and his was the blame.
tafsir: Or do they have knowledge of the Unknown which they write down?

arabic: وفي عاد إذ أرسلنا عليهم الريح العقيم
english: And in the 'Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:
tafsir: Or do they want to stage a deception? -- Then only those who do not believe will be the ones who will be tricked.

arabic: ما تذر من شيء أتت عليه إلا جعلته كالرميم
english: It left nothing whatever that it came up against, but reduced it to ruin and rottenness.
tafsir: Or do they have a god apart from God? He is too exalted for what they associate with Him!

arabic: وفي ثمود إذ قيل لهم تمتعوا حتى حين
english: And in the Thamud (was another Sign): Behold, they were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"
tafsir: If they should see a segment falling from the sky, they would say: "It is only a massive cloud."

arabic: فعتوا عن أمر ربهم فأخذتهم الصاعقة وهم ينظرون
english: But they insolently defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning noise (of an earthquake) seized them, even while they were looking on.
tafsir: So, leave them until they face their day (of doom) when they will be stunned.

arabic: فما استطاعوا من قيام وما كانوا منتصرين
english: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves.
tafsir: Their deception will not avail them in the least on that day, nor will they be helped.

arabic: وقوم نوح من قبل ۖ إنهم كانوا قوما فاسقين
english: So were the People of Noah before them for they wickedly transgressed.
tafsir: Surely there are other torments besides this for those who are wicked, though most of them do not know.

arabic: والسماء بنيناها بأيد وإنا لموسعون
english: With power and skill did We construct the Firmament: for it is We Who create the vastness of pace.
tafsir: Await the judgement of your Lord, for you are always before Our eyes, and glorify your Lord with praises when you rise,

arabic: والأرض فرشناها فنعم الماهدون
english: And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out!
tafsir: And glorify Him in the night and when the stars begin to wane.

arabic: ومن كل شيء خلقنا زوجين لعلكم تذكرون
english: And of every thing We have created pairs: That ye may receive instruction.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ففروا إلى الله ۖ إني لكم منه نذير مبين
english: Hasten ye then (at once) to Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولا تجعلوا مع الله إلها آخر ۖ إني لكم منه نذير مبين
english: And make not another an object of worship with Allah: I am from Him a Warner to you, clear and open!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كذلك ما أتى الذين من قبلهم من رسول إلا قالوا ساحر أو مجنون
english: Similarly, no messenger came to the Peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, "A sorcerer, or one possessed"!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أتواصوا به ۚ بل هم قوم طاغون
english: Is this the legacy they have transmitted, one to another? Nay, they are themselves a people transgressing beyond bounds!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فتول عنهم فما أنت بملوم
english: So turn away from them: not thine is the blame.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وذكر فإن الذكرى تنفع المؤمنين
english: But teach (thy Message) for teaching benefits the Believers.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وما خلقت الجن والإنس إلا ليعبدون
english: I have only created Jinns and men, that they may serve Me.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ما أريد منهم من رزق وما أريد أن يطعمون
english: No Sustenance do I require of them, nor do I require that they should feed Me.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إن الله هو الرزاق ذو القوة المتين
english: For Allah is He Who gives (all) Sustenance,- Lord of Power,- Steadfast (for ever).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فإن للذين ظلموا ذنوبا مثل ذنوب أصحابهم فلا يستعجلون
english: For the Wrong-doers, their portion is like unto the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فويل للذين كفروا من يومهم الذي يوعدون
english: Woe, then, to the Unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم والطور
english: By the Mount (of Revelation);
tafsir: That your companion is not confused, nor has he gone astray,

arabic: وكتاب مسطور
english: By a Decree inscribed
tafsir: Neither does he speak of his own will.

arabic: في رق منشور
english: In a Scroll unfolded;
tafsir: This is only revelation communicated,

arabic: والبيت المعمور
english: By the much-frequented Fane;
tafsir: Bestowed on him by the Supreme Intellect,

arabic: والسقف المرفوع
english: By the Canopy Raised High;
tafsir: Lord of power and wisdom. So he acquired poise and balance,

arabic: والبحر المسجور
english: And by the Ocean filled with Swell;-
tafsir: And reached the highest pinnacle.

arabic: إن عذاب ربك لواقع
english: Verily, the Doom of thy Lord will indeed come to pass;-
tafsir: Then he drew near and drew closer

arabic: ما له من دافع
english: There is none can avert it;-
tafsir: Until a space of two bow (arcs) or even less remained,

arabic: يوم تمور السماء مورا
english: On the Day when the firmament will be in dreadful commotion.
tafsir: When He revealed to His votary what He revealed.

arabic: وتسير الجبال سيرا
english: And the mountains will fly hither and thither.
tafsir: His heart did not falsify what he perceived.

arabic: فويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Then woe that Day to those that treat (Truth) as Falsehood;-
tafsir: Will you dispute with him what he saw?

arabic: الذين هم في خوض يلعبون
english: That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
tafsir: He saw Him indeed another time

arabic: يوم يدعون إلى نار جهنم دعا
english: That Day shall they be thrust down to the Fire of Hell, irresistibly.
tafsir: By the Lote-tree beyond which none can pass,

arabic: هذه النار التي كنتم بها تكذبون
english: "This:, it will be said, "Is the Fire,- which ye were wont to deny!
tafsir: Close to which is the Garden of Tranquility,

arabic: أفسحر هذا أم أنتم لا تبصرون
english: "Is this then a fake, or is it ye that do not see?
tafsir: When the Lote-tree was covered over with what it was covered over;

arabic: اصلوها فاصبروا أو لا تصبروا سواء عليكم ۖ إنما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون
english: "Burn ye therein: the same is it to you whether ye bear it with patience, or not: Ye but receive the recompense of your (own) deeds."
tafsir: Neither did sight falter nor exceed the bounds.

arabic: إن المتقين في جنات ونعيم
english: As to the Righteous, they will be in Gardens, and in Happiness,-
tafsir: Indeed he saw some of the greatest signs of His Lord.

arabic: فاكهين بما آتاهم ربهم ووقاهم ربهم عذاب الجحيم
english: Enjoying the (Bliss) which their Lord hath bestowed on them, and their Lord shall deliver them from the Penalty of the Fire.
tafsir: Have you considered Lat and 'Uzza,

arabic: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما كنتم تعملون
english: (To them will be said:) "Eat and drink ye, with profit and health, because of your (good) deeds."
tafsir: And Manat, the other third (of the pagan deities)?

arabic: متكئين على سرر مصفوفة ۖ وزوجناهم بحور عين
english: They will recline (with ease) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; and We shall join them to Companions, with beautiful big and lustrous eyes.
tafsir: Are there sons for you, and daughters for Him?

arabic: والذين آمنوا واتبعتهم ذريتهم بإيمان ألحقنا بهم ذريتهم وما ألتناهم من عملهم من شيء ۚ كل امرئ بما كسب رهين
english: And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith,- to them shall We join their families: Nor shall We deprive them (of the fruit) of aught of their works: (Yet) is each individual in pledge for his deeds.
tafsir: This is certainly an unjust apportioning.

arabic: وأمددناهم بفاكهة ولحم مما يشتهون
english: And We shall bestow on them, of fruit and meat, anything they shall desire.
tafsir: These are only names which you and your fathers have invented. No authority was sent down by God for them. They only follow conjecture and wish-fulfilment, even though guidance had come to them already from their Lord.

arabic: يتنازعون فيها كأسا لا لغو فيها ولا تأثيم
english: They shall there exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup free of frivolity, free of all taint of ill.
tafsir: Can ever man get what he desires?

arabic: ويطوف عليهم غلمان لهم كأنهم لؤلؤ مكنون
english: Round about them will serve, (devoted) to them, young male servants (handsome) as Pearls well-guarded.
tafsir: To God belong the End and the Beginning.

arabic: وأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون
english: They will advance to each other, engaging in mutual enquiry.
tafsir: Many as the angels be in heaven their intercession will not avail in the least without God's permission for whomsoever He please and approve.

arabic: قالوا إنا كنا قبل في أهلنا مشفقين
english: They will say: "Aforetime, we were not without fear for the sake of our people.
tafsir: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels names of females.

arabic: فمن الله علينا ووقانا عذاب السموم
english: "But Allah has been good to us, and has delivered us from the Penalty of the Scorching Wind.
tafsir: Yet they have no knowledge of this, and follow nothing but conjecture, but conjecture cannot replace the truth.

arabic: إنا كنا من قبل ندعوه ۖ إنه هو البر الرحيم
english: "Truly, we did call unto Him from of old: truly it is He, the Beneficent, the Merciful!"
tafsir: So you turn away from him who turns away from Our rememberance and wants nothing but the life of this world:

arabic: فذكر فما أنت بنعمت ربك بكاهن ولا مجنون
english: Therefore proclaim thou the praises (of thy Lord): for by the Grace of thy Lord, thou art no (vulgar) soothsayer, nor art thou one possessed.
tafsir: This is the farthest limit of their knowledge. Surely your Lord alone knows best who has strayed away from the path and who has come to guidance.

arabic: أم يقولون شاعر نتربص به ريب المنون
english: Or do they say:- "A Poet! we await for him some calamity (hatched) by Time!"
tafsir: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, that He may requite those who do evil, in accordance with their deeds, and those who do good with good.

arabic: قل تربصوا فإني معكم من المتربصين
english: Say thou: "Await ye!- I too will wait along with you!"
tafsir: As for those who avoid the greater sins and shameful acts, except minor trespasses, your Lord's forgiveness surely has great amplitude. He is fully knowledgeable of you as He produced you from the earth, and since you were a foetus in your mother's womb. So do not assert your goodness; he is better who takes heed and preserves himself.

arabic: أم تأمرهم أحلامهم بهذا ۚ أم هم قوم طاغون
english: Is it that their faculties of understanding urge them to this, or are they but a people transgressing beyond bounds?
tafsir: Have you seen him who turns his back,

arabic: أم يقولون تقوله ۚ بل لا يؤمنون
english: Or do they say, "He fabricated the (Message)"? Nay, they have no faith!
tafsir: Who gives but little, and is niggardly?

arabic: فليأتوا بحديث مثله إن كانوا صادقين
english: Let them then produce a recital like unto it,- If (it be) they speak the truth!
tafsir: Has he knowledge of the Unknown that he perceives everything?

arabic: أم خلقوا من غير شيء أم هم الخالقون
english: Were they created of nothing, or were they themselves the creators?
tafsir: Has he not heard what is contained in the Book of Moses,

arabic: أم خلقوا السماوات والأرض ۚ بل لا يوقنون
english: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay, they have no firm belief.
tafsir: And of Abraham who fulfilled his trust? --

arabic: أم عندهم خزائن ربك أم هم المصيطرون
english: Or are the Treasures of thy Lord with them, or are they the managers (of affairs)?
tafsir: That no one who carries a burden bears another's load;

arabic: أم لهم سلم يستمعون فيه ۖ فليأت مستمعهم بسلطان مبين
english: Or have they a ladder, by which they can (climb up to heaven and) listen (to its secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs produce a manifest proof.
tafsir: That a man receives but only that for which he strives;

arabic: أم له البنات ولكم البنون
english: Or has He only daughters and ye have sons?
tafsir: That his endeavours will be judged,

arabic: أم تسألهم أجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون
english: Or is it that thou dost ask for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
tafsir: And only then will he receive his recompense in full;

arabic: أم عندهم الغيب فهم يكتبون
english: Or that the Unseen in it their hands, and they write it down?
tafsir: And that to your Lord is your returning;

arabic: أم يريدون كيدا ۖ فالذين كفروا هم المكيدون
english: Or do they intend a plot (against thee)? But those who defy Allah are themselves involved in a Plot!
tafsir: That it is He who makes you happy and morose,

arabic: أم لهم إله غير الله ۚ سبحان الله عما يشركون
english: Or have they a god other than Allah? Exalted is Allah far above the things they associate with Him!
tafsir: And He who ordains death and life;

arabic: وإن يروا كسفا من السماء ساقطا يقولوا سحاب مركوم
english: Were they to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would (only) say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"
tafsir: That He created pairs, male and female,

arabic: فذرهم حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي فيه يصعقون
english: So leave them alone until they encounter that Day of theirs, wherein they shall (perforce) swoon (with terror),-
tafsir: From a drop of semen when emitted;

arabic: يوم لا يغني عنهم كيدهم شيئا ولا هم ينصرون
english: The Day when their plotting will avail them nothing and no help shall be given them.
tafsir: That the second creation is incumbent on Him;

arabic: وإن للذين ظلموا عذابا دون ذلك ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون
english: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment besides this: But most of them understand not.
tafsir: That it is He who makes you rich and contented;

arabic: واصبر لحكم ربك فإنك بأعيننا ۖ وسبح بحمد ربك حين تقوم
english: Now await in patience the command of thy Lord: for verily thou art in Our eyes: and celebrate the praises of thy Lord the while thou standest forth,
tafsir: That He is the Lord of Sirius;

arabic: ومن الليل فسبحه وإدبار النجوم
english: And for part of the night also praise thou Him,- and at the retreat of the stars!
tafsir: That it was He who destroyed the 'Ad of old,

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم والنجم إذا هوى
english: By the Star when it goes down,-
tafsir: But if they see a sign they turn away, and say: "This is the same old lie continuing,"

arabic: ما ضل صاحبكم وما غوى
english: Your Companion is neither astray nor being misled.
tafsir: And deny, and follow their own vain desires; but every matter is determined at its time.

arabic: وما ينطق عن الهوى
english: Nor does he say (aught) of (his own) Desire.
tafsir: Messages deterring them from evil had come to them,

arabic: إن هو إلا وحي يوحى
english: It is no less than inspiration sent down to him:
tafsir: Containing consummate wisdom; yet warnings were of no avail.

arabic: علمه شديد القوى
english: He was taught by one Mighty in Power,
tafsir: So turn away from them. When on the Day the crier calls to the painful business,

arabic: ذو مرة فاستوى
english: Endued with Wisdom: for he appeared (in stately form);
tafsir: They will come out of the graves with downcast eyes like an expanding swarm of locusts.

arabic: وهو بالأفق الأعلى
english: While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
tafsir: They will hasten forward to the caller, gazes fixed. And the unbelievers will say: "This is the day of untold woe."

arabic: ثم دنا فتدلى
english: Then he approached and came closer,
tafsir: The people of Noah had denied before them, and had called Our votary a liar, and said: "He is possessed," and repulsed him.

arabic: فكان قاب قوسين أو أدنى
english: And was at a distance of but two bow-lengths or (even) nearer;
tafsir: So he prayed to his Lord: "I am helpless, deliver me."

arabic: فأوحى إلى عبده ما أوحى
english: So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.
tafsir: And We opened up the flood gates of the sky with water pouring down in torrents,

arabic: ما كذب الفؤاد ما رأى
english: The (Prophet's) (mind and) heart in no way falsified that which he saw.
tafsir: And We opened up the springs of the earth; and the waters met for a decreed end.

arabic: أفتمارونه على ما يرى
english: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he saw?
tafsir: But We bore him on a (vessel made) of planks and oakum,

arabic: ولقد رآه نزلة أخرى
english: For indeed he saw him at a second descent,
tafsir: Which sailed right under Our eyes: A recompense for him who had been denied.

arabic: عند سدرة المنتهى
english: Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:
tafsir: And We left it as a sign. Is there anyone who will be warned?

arabic: عندها جنة المأوى
english: Near it is the Garden of Abode.
tafsir: How was then My punishment and My commination!

arabic: إذ يغشى السدرة ما يغشى
english: Behold, the Lote-tree was shrouded (in mystery unspeakable!)
tafsir: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?

arabic: ما زاغ البصر وما طغى
english: (His) sight never swerved, nor did it go wrong!
tafsir: The 'Ad had also disavowed. How was then My punishment and My commination!

arabic: لقد رأى من آيات ربه الكبرى
english: For truly did he see, of the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest!
tafsir: We let loose against them a violent roaring wind on a day of ill omen, continuous,

arabic: أفرأيتم اللات والعزى
english: Have ye seen Lat. and 'Uzza,
tafsir: Which snatched away men as though they were palm trees pulled out by the roots.

arabic: ومناة الثالثة الأخرى
english: And another, the third (goddess), Manat?
tafsir: How was then My punishment and My commination!

arabic: ألكم الذكر وله الأنثى
english: What! for you the male sex, and for Him, the female?
tafsir: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will pay heed?

arabic: تلك إذا قسمة ضيزى
english: Behold, such would be indeed a division most unfair!
tafsir: The Thamud rejected the warnings,

arabic: إن هي إلا أسماء سميتموها أنتم وآباؤكم ما أنزل الله بها من سلطان ۚ إن يتبعون إلا الظن وما تهوى الأنفس ۖ ولقد جاءهم من ربهم الهدى
english: These are nothing but names which ye have devised,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah has sent down no authority (whatever). They follow nothing but conjecture and what their own souls desire!- Even though there has already come to them Guidance from their Lord!
tafsir: And said: "Should we follow only one man among us? In that case we shall he in error and insane.

arabic: أم للإنسان ما تمنى
english: Nay, shall man have (just) anything he hankers after?
tafsir: Was he the one of all of us to have been given the exposition? He is surely an impudent liar."

arabic: فلله الآخرة والأولى
english: But it is to Allah that the End and the Beginning (of all things) belong.
tafsir: "Tomorrow they will know who is the impudent liar!

arabic: وكم من ملك في السماوات لا تغني شفاعتهم شيئا إلا من بعد أن يأذن الله لمن يشاء ويرضى
english: How many-so-ever be the angels in the heavens, their intercession will avail nothing except after Allah has given leave for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him.
tafsir: We shall send the she-camel to try them. So watch them, and be constant.

arabic: إن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة ليسمون الملائكة تسمية الأنثى
english: Those who believe not in the Hereafter, name the angels with female names.
tafsir: Tell them that the water is to be apportioned between them (and her); and every turn of drinking will be fixed (for each)."

arabic: وما لهم به من علم ۖ إن يتبعون إلا الظن ۖ وإن الظن لا يغني من الحق شيئا
english: But they have no knowledge therein. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails nothing against Truth.
tafsir: But they called their commander, who seized and hamstrung her.

arabic: فأعرض عن من تولى عن ذكرنا ولم يرد إلا الحياة الدنيا
english: Therefore shun those who turn away from Our Message and desire nothing but the life of this world.
tafsir: How was then My punishment of which they had been warned?

arabic: ذلك مبلغهم من العلم ۚ إن ربك هو أعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بمن اهتدى
english: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Verily thy Lord knoweth best those who stray from His Path, and He knoweth best those who receive guidance.
tafsir: We sent a single blast against them, and they were reduced to husks of a decayed fence.

arabic: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ليجزي الذين أساءوا بما عملوا ويجزي الذين أحسنوا بالحسنى
english: Yea, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil, according to their deeds, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best.
tafsir: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?

arabic: الذين يجتنبون كبائر الإثم والفواحش إلا اللمم ۚ إن ربك واسع المغفرة ۚ هو أعلم بكم إذ أنشأكم من الأرض وإذ أنتم أجنة في بطون أمهاتكم ۖ فلا تزكوا أنفسكم ۖ هو أعلم بمن اتقى
english: Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds, only (falling into) small faults,- verily thy Lord is ample in forgiveness. He knows you well when He brings you out of the earth, And when ye are hidden in your mothers' wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.
tafsir: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.

arabic: أفرأيت الذي تولى
english: Seest thou one who turns back,
tafsir: We sent a stone-hurtling storm against them, except the family of Lot whom We saved in the early hours of the morning

arabic: وأعطى قليلا وأكدى
english: Gives a little, then hardens (his heart)?
tafsir: As a favour from Us. That is how We reward the grateful.

arabic: أعنده علم الغيب فهو يرى
english: What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?
tafsir: He had warned them of Our might, but they passed over the warnings.

arabic: أم لم ينبأ بما في صحف موسى
english: Nay, is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-
tafsir: They lusted after his guests, so We put out their eyes (and said): "Taste My punishment and My commination."

arabic: وإبراهيم الذي وفى
english: And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-
tafsir: And early in the morning the decreed punishment came upon them.

arabic: ألا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى
english: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;
tafsir: So now taste My punishment and My commination!

arabic: وأن ليس للإنسان إلا ما سعى
english: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
tafsir: Easy have We made the Qur'an to understand: So is there any one who will be warned?

arabic: وأن سعيه سوف يرى
english: That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
tafsir: The warnings came to the people of Pharaoh.

arabic: ثم يجزاه الجزاء الأوفى
english: Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
tafsir: They rejected each one of Our signs. So We seized them with the grip of one mighty and powerful.

arabic: وأن إلى ربك المنتهى
english: That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
tafsir: Are the unbelievers among you any better than they? Or is there immunity for you in the Scriptures?

arabic: وأنه هو أضحك وأبكى
english: That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
tafsir: Or do they say: "We are a well-accoutred army?"

arabic: وأنه هو أمات وأحيا
english: That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;
tafsir: The army will be routed and put to flight.

arabic: وأنه خلق الزوجين الذكر والأنثى
english: That He did create in pairs,- male and female,
tafsir: Surely the Hour will be the moment of their promise, and that moment will be calamitous and distressing.

arabic: من نطفة إذا تمنى
english: From a seed when lodged (in its place);
tafsir: Surely the sinners are misguided and insane.

arabic: وأن عليه النشأة الأخرى
english: That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);
tafsir: On that Day they will be dragged into the fire faces foremost, (and told:) "Taste the feel of Hell."

arabic: وأنه هو أغنى وأقنى
english: That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
tafsir: We have indeed created all things by measure;

arabic: وأنه هو رب الشعرى
english: That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
tafsir: And Our command is but one (word) swift as the winking of an eye.

arabic: وأنه أهلك عادا الأولى
english: And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient 'Ad (people),
tafsir: We have destroyed the likes of you in the past: So is there any one who will be warned?

arabic: وثمود فما أبقى
english: And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.
tafsir: All things they do are (recorded) in the books;

arabic: وقوم نوح من قبل ۖ إنهم كانوا هم أظلم وأطغى
english: And before them, the people of Noah, for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors,
tafsir: All things small or great have been written down.

arabic: والمؤتفكة أهوى
english: And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
tafsir: Surely those who fear God and follow the straight path will be amidst gardens and light,

arabic: فغشاها ما غشى
english: So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
tafsir: At the still centre in the proximity of the King all-powerful.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربك تتمارى
english: Then which of the gifts of thy Lord, (O man,) wilt thou dispute about?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: هذا نذير من النذر الأولى
english: This is a Warner, of the (series of) Warners of old!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أزفت الآزفة
english: The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ليس لها من دون الله كاشفة
english: No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أفمن هذا الحديث تعجبون
english: Do ye then wonder at this recital?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وتضحكون ولا تبكون
english: And will ye laugh and not weep,-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وأنتم سامدون
english: Wasting your time in vanities?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فاسجدوا لله واعبدوا ۩
english: But fall ye down in prostration to Allah, and adore (Him)!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم اقتربت الساعة وانشق القمر
english: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.
tafsir: Bestowed the Qur'an,

arabic: وإن يروا آية يعرضوا ويقولوا سحر مستمر
english: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
tafsir: Created man,

arabic: وكذبوا واتبعوا أهواءهم ۚ وكل أمر مستقر
english: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.
tafsir: And taught him to express clearly.

arabic: ولقد جاءهم من الأنباء ما فيه مزدجر
english: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),
tafsir: The sun and moon revolve to a computation;

arabic: حكمة بالغة ۖ فما تغن النذر
english: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
tafsir: And the grasses and the trees bow (to Him) in adoration.

arabic: فتول عنهم ۘ يوم يدع الداع إلى شيء نكر
english: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,
tafsir: He raised the sky and set the Balance

arabic: خشعا أبصارهم يخرجون من الأجداث كأنهم جراد منتشر
english: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
tafsir: So that none may err against the scales,

arabic: مهطعين إلى الداع ۖ يقول الكافرون هذا يوم عسر
english: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
tafsir: And observe correct measure, weigh with justice, and not cheat the balance.

arabic: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح فكذبوا عبدنا وقالوا مجنون وازدجر
english: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.
tafsir: He positioned the earth for all the creatures:

arabic: فدعا ربه أني مغلوب فانتصر
english: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"
tafsir: There are fruits of all kinds on it, and date-palms with their clusters sheathed,

arabic: ففتحنا أبواب السماء بماء منهمر
english: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.
tafsir: Grain with husk, and fragrant grasses.

arabic: وفجرنا الأرض عيونا فالتقى الماء على أمر قد قدر
english: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: وحملناه على ذات ألواح ودسر
english: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
tafsir: He created man of fermented clay dried tinkling hard like earthen ware,

arabic: تجري بأعيننا جزاء لمن كان كفر
english: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
tafsir: And created jinns from the white-hot flame of fire.

arabic: ولقد تركناها آية فهل من مدكر
english: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر
english: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
tafsir: Lord of the two Easts, Lord of the two Wests.

arabic: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر
english: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: كذبت عاد فكيف كان عذابي ونذر
english: The 'Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
tafsir: He has set two seas in motion that flow side by side together,

arabic: إنا أرسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا في يوم نحس مستمر
english: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
tafsir: With an interstice between them which they cannot cross.

arabic: تنزع الناس كأنهم أعجاز نخل منقعر
english: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --

arabic: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر
english: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
tafsir: Out of them come pearls and coral.

arabic: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر
english: But We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: كذبت ثمود بالنذر
english: The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.
tafsir: His are the high-sailed vessels in deep ocean like the mountains.

arabic: فقالوا أبشرا منا واحدا نتبعه إنا إذا لفي ضلال وسعر
english: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: أألقي الذكر عليه من بيننا بل هو كذاب أشر
english: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
tafsir: All that is on the earth is passing,

arabic: سيعلمون غدا من الكذاب الأشر
english: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!
tafsir: But abiding is the glory of your Lord, full of majesty and beneficence.

arabic: إنا مرسلو الناقة فتنة لهم فارتقبهم واصطبر
english: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: ونبئهم أن الماء قسمة بينهم ۖ كل شرب محتضر
english: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one's right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
tafsir: All those there are in the heavens and the earth turn to Him with solicitation, intent on His purpose all the time.

arabic: فنادوا صاحبهم فتعاطى فعقر
english: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: فكيف كان عذابي ونذر
english: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
tafsir: We shall soon be free to turn to you, O weary caravans,

arabic: إنا أرسلنا عليهم صيحة واحدة فكانوا كهشيم المحتظر
english: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر
english: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: O society of jinns and men, cross the bounds of the heavens and the earth if you have the ability, then pass beyond them; but you cannot unless you acquire the law.

arabic: كذبت قوم لوط بالنذر
english: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: إنا أرسلنا عليهم حاصبا إلا آل لوط ۖ نجيناهم بسحر
english: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
tafsir: Let loose at you will be smokeless flames of fire so that you will not be able to defend yourselves.

arabic: نعمة من عندنا ۚ كذلك نجزي من شكر
english: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: ولقد أنذرهم بطشتنا فتماروا بالنذر
english: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.
tafsir: When the sky will split asunder, and turn rosy like the dregs of annointing oil,

arabic: ولقد راودوه عن ضيفه فطمسنا أعينهم فذوقوا عذابي ونذر
english: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: ولقد صبحهم بكرة عذاب مستقر
english: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
tafsir: Neither man nor jinn will be questioned on that day about his sin.

arabic: فذوقوا عذابي ونذر
english: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: ولقد يسرنا القرآن للذكر فهل من مدكر
english: And We have indeed made the Qur'an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: The sinners will be recognised by their marks, and seized by the forelock and their feet.

arabic: ولقد جاء آل فرعون النذر
english: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from Allah).
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: كذبوا بآياتنا كلها فأخذناهم أخذ عزيز مقتدر
english: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.
tafsir: This is Hell the sinners called a lie.

arabic: أكفاركم خير من أولئكم أم لكم براءة في الزبر
english: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
tafsir: They will go round and around between it and boiling water.

arabic: أم يقولون نحن جميع منتصر
english: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny?

arabic: سيهزم الجمع ويولون الدبر
english: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
tafsir: But for him who lived in awe of the sublimity of his Lord, there will be two gardens --

arabic: بل الساعة موعدهم والساعة أدهى وأمر
english: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --

arabic: إن المجرمين في ضلال وسعر
english: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
tafsir: Full of overhanging branches --

arabic: يوم يسحبون في النار على وجوههم ذوقوا مس سقر
english: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will you then deny? --

arabic: إنا كل شيء خلقناه بقدر
english: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
tafsir: With two springs of water flowing through them both. --

arabic: وما أمرنا إلا واحدة كلمح بالبصر
english: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: ولقد أهلكنا أشياعكم فهل من مدكر
english: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?
tafsir: In both of them there will be every kind of fruits in pairs. --

arabic: وكل شيء فعلوه في الزبر
english: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
tafsir: Which of the favours of your Lord will then both of you deny? --

arabic: وكل صغير وكبير مستطر
english: Every matter, small and great, is on record.
tafsir: Reclining there on carpets lined with brocade, fruits of the garden hanging low within reach.

arabic: إن المتقين في جنات ونهر
english: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
tafsir: How many favours of your Lord will then both of you deny?

arabic: في مقعد صدق عند مليك مقتدر
english: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.
tafsir: In them maidens with averted glances, undeflowered by man or by jinn before them, --

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الرحمن
english: (Allah) Most Gracious!
tafsir: Which is bound to happen undoubtedly --

arabic: علم القرآن
english: It is He Who has taught the Qur'an.
tafsir: Degrading (some) and exalting (others);

arabic: خلق الإنسان
english: He has created man:
tafsir: When the earth is shaken up convulsively,

arabic: علمه البيان
english: He has taught him speech (and intelligence).
tafsir: The mountains bruised and crushed,

arabic: الشمس والقمر بحسبان
english: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
tafsir: Turned to dust, floating in the air,

arabic: والنجم والشجر يسجدان
english: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.
tafsir: You will become three categories:

arabic: والسماء رفعها ووضع الميزان
english: And the Firmament has He raised high, and He has set up the Balance (of Justice),
tafsir: Those of the right hand -- how (happy) will be those of the right hand!

arabic: ألا تطغوا في الميزان
english: In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.
tafsir: Then those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) will be those of the left hand!

arabic: وأقيموا الوزن بالقسط ولا تخسروا الميزان
english: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
tafsir: Then the foremost, how pre-excellent,

arabic: والأرض وضعها للأنام
english: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:
tafsir: Who will be honoured

arabic: فيها فاكهة والنخل ذات الأكمام
english: Therein is fruit and date-palms, producing spathes (enclosing dates);
tafsir: In gardens of tranquility;

arabic: والحب ذو العصف والريحان
english: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants.
tafsir: A number of the earlier peoples,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: And a few of later ages,

arabic: خلق الإنسان من صلصال كالفخار
english: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,
tafsir: On couches wrought of gold,

arabic: وخلق الجان من مارج من نار
english: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:
tafsir: Reclining face to face.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Youths of never-ending bloom will pass round to them

arabic: رب المشرقين ورب المغربين
english: (He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:
tafsir: Cups and decanters, beakers full of sparkling wine,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Unheady, uninebriating;

arabic: مرج البحرين يلتقيان
english: He has let free the two bodies of flowing water, meeting together:
tafsir: And such fruits as they fancy,

arabic: بينهما برزخ لا يبغيان
english: Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:
tafsir: Bird meats that they relish,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: And companions with big beautiful eyes

arabic: يخرج منهما اللؤلؤ والمرجان
english: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
tafsir: Like pearls within their shells,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: As recompense for all they had done.

arabic: وله الجوار المنشآت في البحر كالأعلام
english: And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas, lofty as mountains:
tafsir: They will hear no nonsense there or talk of sin,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Other than "Peace, peace" the salutation.

arabic: كل من عليها فان
english: All that is on earth will perish:
tafsir: As for those of the right hand -- how (happy) those of the right hand --

arabic: ويبقى وجه ربك ذو الجلال والإكرام
english: But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord,- full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
tafsir: They will be in (the shade) of thornless lote

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: And acacia covered with heaps of bloom,

arabic: يسأله من في السماوات والأرض ۚ كل يوم هو في شأن
english: Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!
tafsir: Lengthened shadows,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Gushing water,

arabic: سنفرغ لكم أيه الثقلان
english: Soon shall We settle your affairs, O both ye worlds!
tafsir: And fruits numberless,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Unending, unforbidden,

arabic: يا معشر الجن والإنس إن استطعتم أن تنفذوا من أقطار السماوات والأرض فانفذوا ۚ لا تنفذون إلا بسلطان
english: O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!
tafsir: And maidens incomparable.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: We have formed them in a distinctive fashion,

arabic: يرسل عليكما شواظ من نار ونحاس فلا تنتصران
english: On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:
tafsir: And made them virginal,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Loving companions matched in age,

arabic: فإذا انشقت السماء فكانت وردة كالدهان
english: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:
tafsir: For those of the right hand.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: A crowd of earlier generations

arabic: فيومئذ لا يسأل عن ذنبه إنس ولا جان
english: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
tafsir: And a crowd of the later.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: But those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) those of the left hand --

arabic: يعرف المجرمون بسيماهم فيؤخذ بالنواصي والأقدام
english: (For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
tafsir: Will be in the scorching wind and boiling water,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Under the shadow of thick black smoke

arabic: هذه جهنم التي يكذب بها المجرمون
english: This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:
tafsir: Neither cool nor agreeable.

arabic: يطوفون بينها وبين حميم آن
english: In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!
tafsir: They were endowed with good things

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: But persisted in that greater sin,

arabic: ولمن خاف مقام ربه جنتان
english: But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens-
tafsir: And said: "What! When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again?

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: And so will our fathers?"

arabic: ذواتا أفنان
english: Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-
tafsir: Say: "Indeed, the earlier and the later generations

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: Will be gathered together on a certain day which is predetermined.

arabic: فيهما عينان تجريان
english: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);
tafsir: Then you, the erring and the deniers,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: Will eat of the tree of Zaqqum,

arabic: فيهما من كل فاكهة زوجان
english: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
tafsir: Fill your bellies with it,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: And drink over it scalding water,

arabic: متكئين على فرش بطائنها من إستبرق ۚ وجنى الجنتين دان
english: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).
tafsir: Lapping it up like female camels raging of thirst with disease."

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Such will be their welcome on the Day of Judgement.

arabic: فيهن قاصرات الطرف لم يطمثهن إنس قبلهم ولا جان
english: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
tafsir: It is He who created you, then why do you not affirm the truth?

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: Just consider (the semen) that you emit,

arabic: كأنهن الياقوت والمرجان
english: Like unto Rubies and coral.
tafsir: Do you create it, or We are its creator?

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: We have incorporated death in your constitution, and We shall not be hindered

arabic: هل جزاء الإحسان إلا الإحسان
english: Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?
tafsir: From replacing you with others or raising you in a way you do not know.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: You have known the first creation, then why do you not reflect?

arabic: ومن دونهما جنتان
english: And besides these two, there are two other Gardens,-
tafsir: Just ponder over what you sow:

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: Do you give it its increase, or are We the giver?

arabic: مدهامتان
english: Dark-green in colour (from plentiful watering).
tafsir: We could turn it, if We pleased, into straw; then you would rue the day,

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: (And say:) "We have fallen into debt;

arabic: فيهما عينان نضاختان
english: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:
tafsir: Indeed, we have been deprived of the fruits of our labour."

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: Consider the water that you drink.

arabic: فيهما فاكهة ونخل ورمان
english: In them will be Fruits, and dates and pomegranates:
tafsir: Do you send it down from the clouds, or We send it down?

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: We could make it brackish, if We pleased; so why do you not acknowledge thanks?

arabic: فيهن خيرات حسان
english: In them will be fair (Companions), good, beautiful;-
tafsir: Consider the fire that you strike (and get by friction).

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: Have you raised its tree, or We have raised it?

arabic: حور مقصورات في الخيام
english: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
tafsir: We have made it as a reminder and convenience for the needy.

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.

arabic: لم يطمثهن إنس قبلهم ولا جان
english: Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
tafsir: So I call the placement of the stars to witness --

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
tafsir: And this surely is great evidence if you can understand --

arabic: متكئين على رفرف خضر وعبقري حسان
english: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
tafsir: That this is indeed the glorious Qur'an

arabic: فبأي آلاء ربكما تكذبان
english: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
tafsir: (Inscribed) in the well-kept Book.

arabic: تبارك اسم ربك ذي الجلال والإكرام
english: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
tafsir: Only they can reach it who are clean (of mind).

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم إذا وقعت الواقعة
english: When the Event inevitable cometh to pass,
tafsir: His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, He is the giver of life and death, and He has power over everything.

arabic: ليس لوقعتها كاذبة
english: Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
tafsir: He is the first and He the last, the transcendent and the immanent; and He has knowledge of everything.

arabic: خافضة رافعة
english: (Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;
tafsir: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six stages, then assumed the throne. He knows whatsoever enters the earth, and whatsoever comes out of it, and what comes down from the sky and what goes up to it; and He is with you wheresoever you may be, and He perceives whatsoever you do.

arabic: إذا رجت الأرض رجا
english: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths,
tafsir: His is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and all things will go back to Him.

arabic: وبست الجبال بسا
english: And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms,
tafsir: He turns night into day, and turns day into night; and He knows whatsoever is in your hearts.

arabic: فكانت هباء منبثا
english: Becoming dust scattered abroad,
tafsir: Believe in God and His Apostle, and spend of what He has given you as His trustee. And those of you who believe and spend in charity will have a great reward.

arabic: وكنتم أزواجا ثلاثة
english: And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.
tafsir: What has come upon you that you believe not in God, though the Prophet is calling you to believe in your Lord? And He has already taken your pledge, if you are believers.

arabic: فأصحاب الميمنة ما أصحاب الميمنة
english: Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
tafsir: It is He who sends down splendent revelations to His votary that he may take you out of darkness into light; for surely God is gracious and kind to you.

arabic: وأصحاب المشأمة ما أصحاب المشأمة
english: And the Companions of the Left Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Left Hand?
tafsir: What has come upon you that you do not spend in the way of God, when the heritage of the heavens and the earth belongs to God? Those of you who spent before the victory and fought, are not equal (to those who did not). They are higher in position than those who spent after (the victory) and fought. To each one God has made the promise of excellence, for God is aware of all you do.

arabic: والسابقون السابقون
english: And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).
tafsir: Who will give a goodly loan to God which He will double for him, and be for him a splendid reward?

arabic: أولئك المقربون
english: These will be those Nearest to Allah:
tafsir: The day you see the believers, men and women, with their light advancing ahead and to the right of them, (they will be told:) "There is good news for you this day, of gardens with rivers flowing by where you will live for ever." This will be the great attainment.

arabic: في جنات النعيم
english: In Gardens of Bliss:
tafsir: The day the hypocrites, men and women, will say to the believers: "Wait for us that we may borrow a little light from your light," they will be told: "Go back, and look for your light." A wall shall be raised between them in which there will be a door. Within it will be benevolence and retribution without.

arabic: ثلة من الأولين
english: A number of people from those of old,
tafsir: They will call to them: "Were we not with you?" They will answer: "Certainly; but then you let yourselves be tempted, and waited in expectation but were suspicious and were deceived by vain desires, till the decree of God came to pass, and the deceiver duped you in respect of God.

arabic: وقليل من الآخرين
english: And a few from those of later times.
tafsir: So no ransom will be accepted of you on this day, or of those who refused to believe. Hell will be your refuge and the only friend -- and how evil a destination!"

arabic: على سرر موضونة
english: (They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones),
tafsir: Has the moment not yet come when the hearts of believers should be moved by the thought of God and the truth that has been sent down, so that they should not be like those who received the Book before them but whose hearts were hardened after a lapse of time, and many of them turned disobedient?

arabic: متكئين عليها متقابلين
english: Reclining on them, facing each other.
tafsir: Know that God enlivens the earth even after it has died. We have explained to you clearly Our signs that you may understand.

arabic: يطوف عليهم ولدان مخلدون
english: Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness),
tafsir: Surely the men and women who spend in charity and give a goodly loan to God, will have it doubled for them and will receive a generous reward.

arabic: بأكواب وأباريق وكأس من معين
english: With goblets, (shining) beakers, and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:
tafsir: Those who believe in God and His apostles are true of word and deed; and by their Lord are considered testifiers of the truth. They have their guerdon and their light. As for those who do not believe and reject Our revelations, are the people of Hell.

arabic: لا يصدعون عنها ولا ينزفون
english: No after-ache will they receive therefrom, nor will they suffer intoxication:
tafsir: Know that the life of this world is only a frolic and mummery, an ornamentation, boasting and bragging among yourselves, and lust for multiplying wealth and children. It is like rain so pleasing to the cultivator for his vegetation which sprouts and swells, and then begins to wither, and you see it turn to yellow and reduced to chaff. There is severe punishment in the Hereafter, but also forgiveness from God, and acceptance. As for the life of this world, it is no more than merchandise of vanity.

arabic: وفاكهة مما يتخيرون
english: And with fruits, any that they may select:
tafsir: Hasten for the forgiveness of your Lord and Paradise whose expanse is as wide as that of the heavens and the earth, which has been prepared for those who believe in God and His apostles. This is the bounty of God which He bestows on whosoever He please; and the bounty of God is infinite.

arabic: ولحم طير مما يشتهون
english: And the flesh of fowls, any that they may desire.
tafsir: There is no calamity that befalls the earth or your own selves but in accordance with the law (of causation) before We make it evident. This is indeed how the law of God works inevitably.

arabic: وحور عين
english: And (there will be) Companions with beautiful, big, and lustrous eyes,-
tafsir: Lest you grieve for what you missed, or rejoice at what you received. God does not love the egoist and the braggart,

arabic: كأمثال اللؤلؤ المكنون
english: Like unto Pearls well-guarded.
tafsir: Who hold back what they possess and enjoin stinginess on others. Whoever turns away (from God, should remember) that God is self-sufficient, worthy of praise.

arabic: جزاء بما كانوا يعملون
english: A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
tafsir: We have surely sent apostles with clear signs, and sent with them the Book and the Balance, so that men may stand by justice; and We sent down iron which causes much distress but also has advantages for men, so that God may know who helps Him and His apostles in secret. Verily God is all-powerful and all-mighty.

arabic: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا تأثيما
english: Not frivolity will they hear therein, nor any taint of ill,-
tafsir: We sent Noah and Abraham, and gave prophethood to their progeny and the Book, and some of them are well-directed, but many of them are disobedient.

arabic: إلا قيلا سلاما سلاما
english: Only the saying, "Peace! Peace".
tafsir: Then in their train We sent Our apostles, and succeeding them Jesus, son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel, and put into the hearts of his followers compassion and kindness. But they created monasticism which had not been prescribed for them by Us except for seeking the pleasure of God; yet they did not observe it as it should have been rightly observed. So We gave those among them who were believers their reward; but most of them are disobedient.

arabic: وأصحاب اليمين ما أصحاب اليمين
english: The Companions of the Right Hand,- what will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
tafsir: O you who believe, have fear of displeasing God, and believe in His Prophet. He will give you twice as much of His bounty and place a light for you to walk in, and forgive you, for God is forgiving and kind;

arabic: في سدر مخضود
english: (They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns,
tafsir: So that the people of the Book may know that they have not the least power over the bounty of God, and that the bounty is wholly in the hands of God to give whosoever He please, for God is the master of infinite bounty.

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم سبح لله ما في السماوات والأرض ۖ وهو العزيز الحكيم
english: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth,- let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
tafsir: Those of you who divorce your wives by calling them 'mothers,' cannot (make them) their mothers. Their mothers are only those who gave birth to them. They surely utter what is unseemly and a lie. But God is forbearing and forgiving.

arabic: له ملك السماوات والأرض ۖ يحيي ويميت ۖ وهو على كل شيء قدير
english: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.
tafsir: Those who call their wives their mothers then revoke what they had said, should free a slave before having physical contact (with them). This is to warn you, as God is aware of what you do.

arabic: هو الأول والآخر والظاهر والباطن ۖ وهو بكل شيء عليم
english: He is the First and the Last, the Evident and the Immanent: and He has full knowledge of all things.
tafsir: If one does not have the means (of doing so) then he should fast for two months continuously before he has physical contact; but any one who is unable to do so, should feed sixty needy persons. This (is enjoined) so that you may be faithful to God and His Apostle. These are the limits set by God. As for the unbelievers, there is painful punishment for them.

arabic: هو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش ۚ يعلم ما يلج في الأرض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها ۖ وهو معكم أين ما كنتم ۚ والله بما تعملون بصير
english: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days, and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it, what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.
tafsir: Those who oppose God will be disgraced, as those before them were. We have sent down very clear signs. For unbelievers there is a shameful punishment.

arabic: له ملك السماوات والأرض ۚ وإلى الله ترجع الأمور
english: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: and all affairs are referred back to Allah.
tafsir: On the day when God will raise them up together, He will tell them what they did. God takes account of it although they forget, for all things are evident to God.

arabic: يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل ۚ وهو عليم بذات الصدور
english: He merges Night into Day, and He merges Day into Night; and He has full knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.
tafsir: Have you not considered that God knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? No three persons confer secretly but He is the fourth among them, and no five but He is the sixth; and neither fewer nor more but He is with them wheresoever they be. And on the Day of Judgement He will announce their deeds to them. Verily God has knowledge of everything.

arabic: آمنوا بالله ورسوله وأنفقوا مما جعلكم مستخلفين فيه ۖ فالذين آمنوا منكم وأنفقوا لهم أجر كبير
english: Believe in Allah and His messenger, and spend (in charity) out of the (substance) whereof He has made you heirs. For, those of you who believe and spend (in charity),- for them is a great Reward.
tafsir: Have you not considered those who were forbidden to conspire, but reverted after a time to what was forbidden them, and conspired evil, rebellion and disobedience to the Prophet? Yet when they come to you they greet you with a greeting even God does not greet you with; and say to themselves, "Why doesn't God punish us for what we say?" Hell is sufficient for them, in which they will be burnt: And what an evil consequence!

arabic: وما لكم لا تؤمنون بالله ۙ والرسول يدعوكم لتؤمنوا بربكم وقد أخذ ميثاقكم إن كنتم مؤمنين
english: What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord, and has indeed taken your Covenant, if ye are men of Faith.
tafsir: O you who believe, when you converse privately, do not talk of iniquity, rebellion, and disobedience to the Prophet, but talk of goodness and piety, and fear God before whom you will be gathered.

arabic: هو الذي ينزل على عبده آيات بينات ليخرجكم من الظلمات إلى النور ۚ وإن الله بكم لرءوف رحيم
english: He is the One Who sends to His Servant Manifest Signs, that He may lead you from the depths of Darkness into the Light and verily Allah is to you most kind and Merciful.
tafsir: Surely scheming is the work of Satan that he may cause the faithful grief; but he cannot harm them unless God dispense. So in God should the believers place their trust.

arabic: وما لكم ألا تنفقوا في سبيل الله ولله ميراث السماوات والأرض ۚ لا يستوي منكم من أنفق من قبل الفتح وقاتل ۚ أولئك أعظم درجة من الذين أنفقوا من بعد وقاتلوا ۚ وكلا وعد الله الحسنى ۚ والله بما تعملون خبير
english: And what cause have ye why ye should not spend in the cause of Allah?- For to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought, before the Victory, (with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought afterwards. But to all has Allah promised a goodly (reward). And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.
tafsir: O you who believe, when you are told to make room in the assemblies, then make room; God will give you more room to spread. When you are told to rise, then rise; God will raise those of you who believe, and those who have knowledge, in position. God is aware of what you do.

arabic: من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا فيضاعفه له وله أجر كريم
english: Who is he that will Loan to Allah a beautiful loan? for (Allah) will increase it manifold to his credit, and he will have (besides) a liberal Reward.
tafsir: O you who believe, if you confer with the Prophet in private, give alms in the name of God before you go to confer. This is better for you and becoming. If you do not have the means, then surely God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: يوم ترى المؤمنين والمؤمنات يسعى نورهم بين أيديهم وبأيمانهم بشراكم اليوم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ۚ ذلك هو الفوز العظيم
english: One Day shalt thou see the believing men and the believing women- how their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens beneath which flow rivers! to dwell therein for aye! This is indeed the highest Achievement!"
tafsir: Are you afraid of giving alms before confering? Then, if you cannot do this, and God forgives you, be constant in your devotional obligations and pay the due share of your wealth for the welfare of others, and obey God and His Prophet. God is aware of all you do.

arabic: يوم يقول المنافقون والمنافقات للذين آمنوا انظرونا نقتبس من نوركم قيل ارجعوا وراءكم فالتمسوا نورا فضرب بينهم بسور له باب باطنه فيه الرحمة وظاهره من قبله العذاب
english: One Day will the Hypocrites- men and women - say to the Believers: "Wait for us! Let us borrow (a Light) from your Light!" It will be said: "Turn ye back to your rear! then seek a Light (where ye can)!" So a wall will be put up betwixt them, with a gate therein. Within it will be Mercy throughout, and without it, all alongside, will be (Wrath and) Punishment!
tafsir: Have you not seen those who have taken a people who have roused the wrath of God, as friends? They are neither of you nor of them, and swear to a lie, and knowingly.

arabic: ينادونهم ألم نكن معكم ۖ قالوا بلى ولكنكم فتنتم أنفسكم وتربصتم وارتبتم وغرتكم الأماني حتى جاء أمر الله وغركم بالله الغرور
english: (Those without) will call out, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! but ye led yourselves into temptation; ye looked forward (to our ruin); ye doubted (Allah's Promise); and (your false) desires deceived you; until there issued the Command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you in respect of Allah.
tafsir: God has reserved a severe punishment for them. Evil indeed are the things they do!

arabic: فاليوم لا يؤخذ منكم فدية ولا من الذين كفروا ۚ مأواكم النار ۖ هي مولاكم ۖ وبئس المصير
english: "This Day shall no ransom be accepted of you, nor of those who rejected Allah." Your abode is the Fire: that is the proper place to claim you: and an evil refuge it is!"
tafsir: They have made their oaths a shield, and obstruct people from the way of God. There is shameful punishment for them.

arabic: ألم يأن للذين آمنوا أن تخشع قلوبهم لذكر الله وما نزل من الحق ولا يكونوا كالذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبل فطال عليهم الأمد فقست قلوبهم ۖ وكثير منهم فاسقون
english: Has not the Time arrived for the Believers that their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been revealed (to them), and that they should not become like those to whom was given Revelation aforetime, but long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard? For many among them are rebellious transgressors.
tafsir: Neither their wealth nor children will avail them against God. They are the people of Hell, and there will abide for ever.

arabic: اعلموا أن الله يحيي الأرض بعد موتها ۚ قد بينا لكم الآيات لعلكم تعقلون
english: Know ye (all) that Allah giveth life to the earth after its death! already have We shown the Signs plainly to you, that ye may learn wisdom.
tafsir: On the day that God will raise them together, they will swear before Him as they swear before you, and imagine they are on the right path. Is it not they who are liars?

arabic: إن المصدقين والمصدقات وأقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعف لهم ولهم أجر كريم
english: For those who give in Charity, men and women, and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan, it shall be increased manifold (to their credit), and they shall have (besides) a liberal reward.
tafsir: Satan has got the better of them. and made them forget to remember God. Indeed they belong to Satan's faction. Will not Satan's faction perish?

arabic: والذين آمنوا بالله ورسله أولئك هم الصديقون ۖ والشهداء عند ربهم لهم أجرهم ونورهم ۖ والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم
english: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers- they are the Sincere (lovers of Truth), and the witnesses (who testify), in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their Reward and their Light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs,- they are the Companions of Hell-Fire.
tafsir: Surely those who oppose God and His Prophet will be among the vilest.

arabic: اعلموا أنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر في الأموال والأولاد ۖ كمثل غيث أعجب الكفار نباته ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يكون حطاما ۖ وفي الآخرة عذاب شديد ومغفرة من الله ورضوان ۚ وما الحياة الدنيا إلا متاع الغرور
english: Know ye (all), that the life of this world is but play and amusement, pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similitude: How rain and the growth which it brings forth, delight (the hearts of) the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then it becomes dry and crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong). And Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah). And what is the life of this world, but goods and chattels of deception?
tafsir: God has decreed: "I will prevail, I and My apostles." Verily God is powerful and all-mighty.

arabic: سابقوا إلى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها كعرض السماء والأرض أعدت للذين آمنوا بالله ورسله ۚ ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء ۚ والله ذو الفضل العظيم
english: Be ye foremost (in seeking) Forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden (of Bliss), the width whereof is as the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers: that is the Grace of Allah, which He bestows on whom he pleases: and Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.
tafsir: You will not find those who believe in God and the Day of Resurrection, loving those who oppose God and His Prophet, even though they be their fathers, sons, or brothers or their kin. God has inscribed on their hearts belief, and has succoured them with His own grace, and will admit them to gardens with rivers flowing by, where they will abide for ever, God accepting them, and they, happy in the pleasure of God. They are verily the army of God. Will not the army of God be victorious?

arabic: ما أصاب من مصيبة في الأرض ولا في أنفسكم إلا في كتاب من قبل أن نبرأها ۚ إن ذلك على الله يسير
english: No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls but is recorded in a decree before We bring it into existence: That is truly easy for Allah:
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لكيلا تأسوا على ما فاتكم ولا تفرحوا بما آتاكم ۗ والله لا يحب كل مختال فخور
english: In order that ye may not despair over matters that pass you by, nor exult over favours bestowed upon you. For Allah loveth not any vainglorious boaster,-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: الذين يبخلون ويأمرون الناس بالبخل ۗ ومن يتول فإن الله هو الغني الحميد
english: Such persons as are covetous and commend covetousness to men. And if any turn back (from Allah's Way), verily Allah is Free of all Needs, Worthy of all Praise.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لقد أرسلنا رسلنا بالبينات وأنزلنا معهم الكتاب والميزان ليقوم الناس بالقسط ۖ وأنزلنا الحديد فيه بأس شديد ومنافع للناس وليعلم الله من ينصره ورسله بالغيب ۚ إن الله قوي عزيز
english: We sent aforetime our messengers with Clear Signs and sent down with them the Book and the Balance (of Right and Wrong), that men may stand forth in justice; and We sent down Iron, in which is (material for) mighty war, as well as many benefits for mankind, that Allah may test who it is that will help, Unseen, Him and His messengers: For Allah is Full of Strength, Exalted in Might (and able to enforce His Will).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا وإبراهيم وجعلنا في ذريتهما النبوة والكتاب ۖ فمنهم مهتد ۖ وكثير منهم فاسقون
english: And We sent Noah and Abraham, and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ثم قفينا على آثارهم برسلنا وقفينا بعيسى ابن مريم وآتيناه الإنجيل وجعلنا في قلوب الذين اتبعوه رأفة ورحمة ورهبانية ابتدعوها ما كتبناها عليهم إلا ابتغاء رضوان الله فما رعوها حق رعايتها ۖ فآتينا الذين آمنوا منهم أجرهم ۖ وكثير منهم فاسقون
english: Then, in their wake, We followed them up with (others of) Our messengers: We sent after them Jesus the son of Mary, and bestowed on him the Gospel; and We ordained in the hearts of those who followed him Compassion and Mercy. But the Monasticism which they invented for themselves, We did not prescribe for them: (We commanded) only the seeking for the Good Pleasure of Allah; but that they did not foster as they should have done. Yet We bestowed, on those among them who believed, their (due) reward, but many of them are rebellious transgressors.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وآمنوا برسوله يؤتكم كفلين من رحمته ويجعل لكم نورا تمشون به ويغفر لكم ۚ والله غفور رحيم
english: O ye that believe! Fear Allah, and believe in His Messenger, and He will bestow on you a double portion of His Mercy: He will provide for you a Light by which ye shall walk (straight in your path), and He will forgive you (your past): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لئلا يعلم أهل الكتاب ألا يقدرون على شيء من فضل الله ۙ وأن الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء ۚ والله ذو الفضل العظيم
english: That the People of the Book may know that they have no power whatever over the Grace of Allah, that (His) Grace is (entirely) in His Hand, to bestow it on whomsoever He wills. For Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قد سمع الله قول التي تجادلك في زوجها وتشتكي إلى الله والله يسمع تحاوركما ۚ إن الله سميع بصير
english: Allah has indeed heard (and accepted) the statement of the woman who pleads with thee concerning her husband and carries her complaint (in prayer) to Allah: and Allah (always) hears the arguments between both sides among you: for Allah hears and sees (all things).
tafsir: It is He who drove those among the people of the Book who refused to believe, from their homes for the first confrontation. You did not think that they would go away, and they imagined that their forts would protect them against God. But God came upon them from where they did not suspect, and filled their hearts with terror, so that they destroyed their homes with their own hands (or were destroyed) by the hands of believers. So take heed, O men of sight!

arabic: الذين يظاهرون منكم من نسائهم ما هن أمهاتهم ۖ إن أمهاتهم إلا اللائي ولدنهم ۚ وإنهم ليقولون منكرا من القول وزورا ۚ وإن الله لعفو غفور
english: If any men among you divorce their wives by Zihar (calling them mothers), they cannot be their mothers: None can be their mothers except those who gave them birth.
