tafsir: On that Day will come what is to come.

arabic: إذا تتلى عليه آياتنا قال أساطير الأولين
english: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!
tafsir: The sky will cleave asunder on that day and fall to pieces.

arabic: سنسمه على الخرطوم
english: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!
tafsir: On its fringes will be angels, eight of them, bearing their Lord's throne aloft.

arabic: إنا بلوناهم كما بلونا أصحاب الجنة إذ أقسموا ليصرمنها مصبحين
english: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.
tafsir: You will then be set before Him, and not one of you will remain unexposed.

arabic: ولا يستثنون
english: But made no reservation, ("If it be Allah's Will").
tafsir: He who is given his ledger in his right hand, will say: "Here, read my ledger.

arabic: فطاف عليها طائف من ربك وهم نائمون
english: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.
tafsir: I was certain I'll be given my account."

arabic: فأصبحت كالصريم
english: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
tafsir: So he shall have an agreeable life

arabic: فتنادوا مصبحين
english: As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-
tafsir: In high empyrean

arabic: أن اغدوا على حرثكم إن كنتم صارمين
english: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."
tafsir: With fruits hanging low within reach,

arabic: فانطلقوا وهم يتخافتون
english: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-
tafsir: (And told:) "Eat and drink to your fill as reward for (good) deeds you had done in days of yore."

arabic: أن لا يدخلنها اليوم عليكم مسكين
english: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
tafsir: But whosoever gets his ledger in his left hand, will say: "Would that I were never given my ledger,

arabic: وغدوا على حرد قادرين
english: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.
tafsir: And not known my account!

arabic: فلما رأوها قالوا إنا لضالون
english: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:
tafsir: I wish death had put an end to me.

arabic: بل نحن محرومون
english: "Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"
tafsir: Of no use was even my wealth.

arabic: قال أوسطهم ألم أقل لكم لولا تسبحون
english: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, 'Why not glorify (Allah)?'"
tafsir: Vanished has my power from me."

arabic: قالوا سبحان ربنا إنا كنا ظالمين
english: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
tafsir: "Seize him and manacle him,

arabic: فأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتلاومون
english: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.
tafsir: Then cast him to be burnt in Hell;

arabic: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا طاغين
english: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
tafsir: And string him to a chain seventy cubits long.

arabic: عسى ربنا أن يبدلنا خيرا منها إنا إلى ربنا راغبون
english: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
tafsir: He did not believe in God the supreme,

arabic: كذلك العذاب ۖ ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر ۚ لو كانوا يعلمون
english: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!
tafsir: Nor urged others to feed the poor.

arabic: إن للمتقين عند ربهم جنات النعيم
english: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.
tafsir: That is why he has no friend today,

arabic: أفنجعل المسلمين كالمجرمين
english: Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
tafsir: Nor food other than suppuration (filth)

arabic: ما لكم كيف تحكمون
english: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
tafsir: Which none but the hellish eat."

arabic: أم لكم كتاب فيه تدرسون
english: Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
tafsir: So, I call to witness what you see

arabic: إن لكم فيه لما تخيرون
english: That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?
tafsir: And what you do not see,

arabic: أم لكم أيمان علينا بالغة إلى يوم القيامة ۙ إن لكم لما تحكمون
english: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?
tafsir: That this is indeed the word of the noble Messenger,

arabic: سلهم أيهم بذلك زعيم
english: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!
tafsir: And not the word of a poet. How little is it that you believe!

arabic: أم لهم شركاء فليأتوا بشركائهم إن كانوا صادقين
english: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!
tafsir: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer. Little is it that you reflect!

arabic: يوم يكشف عن ساق ويدعون إلى السجود فلا يستطيعون
english: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-
tafsir: It has been sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.

arabic: خاشعة أبصارهم ترهقهم ذلة ۖ وقد كانوا يدعون إلى السجود وهم سالمون
english: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).
tafsir: Had he attributed falsely any words to Us,

arabic: فذرني ومن يكذب بهذا الحديث ۖ سنستدرجهم من حيث لا يعلمون
english: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
tafsir: We would have seized him by his right hand,

arabic: وأملي لهم ۚ إن كيدي متين
english: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.
tafsir: Then cut off his aorta,

arabic: أم تسألهم أجرا فهم من مغرم مثقلون
english: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-
tafsir: And not one of you would have been able to stop (Us).

arabic: أم عندهم الغيب فهم يكتبون
english: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?
tafsir: It is really a reminder for those who fear God and follow the straight path.

arabic: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تكن كصاحب الحوت إذ نادى وهو مكظوم
english: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.
tafsir: We certainly know that some among you do deny it.

arabic: لولا أن تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم
english: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.
tafsir: It is surely the nemesis of unbelievers.

arabic: فاجتباه ربه فجعله من الصالحين
english: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.
tafsir: And He, He is indeed the ultimate Reality.

arabic: وإن يكاد الذين كفروا ليزلقونك بأبصارهم لما سمعوا الذكر ويقولون إنه لمجنون
english: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
tafsir: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.

arabic: وما هو إلا ذكر للعالمين
english: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الحاقة
english: The Sure Reality!
tafsir: Upon the infidels -- which none would be able to repel --

arabic: ما الحاقة
english: What is the Sure Reality?
tafsir: From God, the Lord of the steps (of progression),

arabic: وما أدراك ما الحاقة
english: And what will make thee realise what the Sure Reality is?
tafsir: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.

arabic: كذبت ثمود وعاد بالقارعة
english: The Thamud and the 'Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
tafsir: So persevere with becoming patience.

arabic: فأما ثمود فأهلكوا بالطاغية
english: But the Thamud,- they were destroyed by a terrible Storm of thunder and lightning!
tafsir: They surely take it to be far away,

arabic: وأما عاد فأهلكوا بريح صرصر عاتية
english: And the 'Ad, they were destroyed by a furious Wind, exceedingly violent;
tafsir: But We see it very near.

arabic: سخرها عليهم سبع ليال وثمانية أيام حسوما فترى القوم فيها صرعى كأنهم أعجاز نخل خاوية
english: He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path), as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!
tafsir: The day the sky becomes like molten brass,

arabic: فهل ترى لهم من باقية
english: Then seest thou any of them left surviving?
tafsir: The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool,

arabic: وجاء فرعون ومن قبله والمؤتفكات بالخاطئة
english: And Pharaoh, and those before him, and the Cities Overthrown, committed habitual Sin.
tafsir: And no friend inquires after friend

arabic: فعصوا رسول ربهم فأخذهم أخذة رابية
english: And disobeyed (each) the messenger of their Lord; so He punished them with an abundant Penalty.
tafsir: Though within sight of one another. The sinner would like to ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his sons,

arabic: إنا لما طغى الماء حملناكم في الجارية
english: We, when the water (of Noah's Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, carried you (mankind), in the floating (Ark),
tafsir: His wife and his brother,

arabic: لنجعلها لكم تذكرة وتعيها أذن واعية
english: That We might make it a Message unto you, and that ears (that should hear the tale and) retain its memory should bear its (lessons) in remembrance.
tafsir: And his family who had stood by him,

arabic: فإذا نفخ في الصور نفخة واحدة
english: Then, when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet,
tafsir: And all those who are on the earth, to save himself.

arabic: وحملت الأرض والجبال فدكتا دكة واحدة
english: And the earth is moved, and its mountains, and they are crushed to powder at one stroke,-
tafsir: But never. It is pure white flame

arabic: فيومئذ وقعت الواقعة
english: On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.
tafsir: That would skin the scalp.

arabic: وانشقت السماء فهي يومئذ واهية
english: And the sky will be rent asunder, for it will that Day be flimsy,
tafsir: It will summon whoever turns his back and flees,

arabic: والملك على أرجائها ۚ ويحمل عرش ربك فوقهم يومئذ ثمانية
english: And the angels will be on its sides, and eight will, that Day, bear the Throne of thy Lord above them.
tafsir: Who amasses and then hoards.

arabic: يومئذ تعرضون لا تخفى منكم خافية
english: That Day shall ye be brought to Judgment: not an act of yours that ye hide will be hidden.
tafsir: Surely man is greedy by nature.

arabic: فأما من أوتي كتابه بيمينه فيقول هاؤم اقرءوا كتابيه
english: Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!
tafsir: If evil befalls him he is perturbed;

arabic: إني ظننت أني ملاق حسابيه
english: "I did really understand that my Account would (One Day) reach me!"
tafsir: If good comes to him he holds back his hand,

arabic: فهو في عيشة راضية
english: And he will be in a life of Bliss,
tafsir: Except those who closely follow (the Book of God),

arabic: في جنة عالية
english: In a Garden on high,
tafsir: Who persevere in devotion,

arabic: قطوفها دانية
english: The Fruits whereof (will hang in bunches) low and near.
tafsir: In whose wealth a due share is included

arabic: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما أسلفتم في الأيام الخالية
english: "Eat ye and drink ye, with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you, in the days that are gone!"
tafsir: For the needy and those dispossessed,

arabic: وأما من أوتي كتابه بشماله فيقول يا ليتني لم أوت كتابيه
english: And he that will be given his Record in his left hand, will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!
tafsir: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement,

arabic: ولم أدر ما حسابيه
english: "And that I had never realised how my account (stood)!
tafsir: And those who fear the punishment of their Lord, --

arabic: يا ليتها كانت القاضية
english: "Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!
tafsir: Surely no one can be secure from the punishment of his Lord, --

arabic: ما أغنى عني ماليه ۜ
english: "Of no profit to me has been my wealth!
tafsir: And those who guard their sex except from their wives and women slaves of old

arabic: هلك عني سلطانيه
english: "My power has perished from me!"...
tafsir: Are free of blame,

arabic: خذوه فغلوه
english: (The stern command will say): "Seize ye him, and bind ye him,
tafsir: But those who seek more than this will be transgressors;

arabic: ثم الجحيم صلوه
english: "And burn ye him in the Blazing Fire.
tafsir: And those who fulfil their trusts and covenants,

arabic: ثم في سلسلة ذرعها سبعون ذراعا فاسلكوه
english: "Further, make him march in a chain, whereof the length is seventy cubits!
tafsir: Who uphold their testimonies,

arabic: إنه كان لا يؤمن بالله العظيم
english: "This was he that would not believe in Allah Most High.
tafsir: And those who are mindful of their moral obligations.

arabic: ولا يحض على طعام المسكين
english: "And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!
tafsir: They will live in gardens with honour.

arabic: فليس له اليوم هاهنا حميم
english: "So no friend hath he here this Day.
tafsir: What is the matter with unbelievers that they stare at you with fixed gazes and hasten towards you

arabic: ولا طعام إلا من غسلين
english: "Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds,
tafsir: In crowds, right and left?

arabic: لا يأكله إلا الخاطئون
english: "Which none do eat but those in sin."
tafsir: Does every one of them wish to enter the garden of tranquility?

arabic: فلا أقسم بما تبصرون
english: So I do call to witness what ye see,
tafsir: Never so. We have created them from what they know.

arabic: وما لا تبصرون
english: And what ye see not,
tafsir: So I swear by the Lord of the Easts and the Wests that We are certainly able

arabic: إنه لقول رسول كريم
english: That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;
tafsir: To bring better people than they in their place; and they will not be able to thwart Us.

arabic: وما هو بقول شاعر ۚ قليلا ما تؤمنون
english: It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!
tafsir: So leave them to their vain disputes and amusement till they meet their day (of reckoning) promised them,

arabic: ولا بقول كاهن ۚ قليلا ما تذكرون
english: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.
tafsir: The day when they will come out of their graves in all haste as though rushing to their altars,

arabic: تنزيل من رب العالمين
english: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.
tafsir: Eyes lowered, shame attending. That is the day they have been promised!

arabic: ولو تقول علينا بعض الأقاويل
english: And if the messenger were to invent any sayings in Our name,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: لأخذنا منه باليمين
english: We should certainly seize him by his right hand,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ثم لقطعنا منه الوتين
english: And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فما منكم من أحد عنه حاجزين
english: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإنه لتذكرة للمتقين
english: But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإنا لنعلم أن منكم مكذبين
english: And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإنه لحسرة على الكافرين
english: But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإنه لحق اليقين
english: But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فسبح باسم ربك العظيم
english: So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم سأل سائل بعذاب واقع
english: A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-
tafsir: He said: "O my people, I warn you clearly

arabic: للكافرين ليس له دافع
english: The Unbelievers, the which there is none to ward off,-
tafsir: That you should worship God and fear Him, and follow me

arabic: من الله ذي المعارج
english: (A Penalty) from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent.
tafsir: That He may forgive some of your sins and prolong your term till an appointed time. Surely when God's appointed time is come it will not be put off, if only you knew!

arabic: تعرج الملائكة والروح إليه في يوم كان مقداره خمسين ألف سنة
english: The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:
tafsir: He said: "O Lord, I called my people night and day,

arabic: فاصبر صبرا جميلا
english: Therefore do thou hold Patience,- a Patience of beautiful (contentment).
tafsir: But the more I called, they only ran the farther away.

arabic: إنهم يرونه بعيدا
english: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):
tafsir: And every time I called them that You may forgive them, they thrust their fingers into their ears, and covered themselves with their garments, and became wayward, and behaved with downright insolence.

arabic: ونراه قريبا
english: But We see it (quite) near.
tafsir: Then I called them loudly and more openly,

arabic: يوم تكون السماء كالمهل
english: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass,
tafsir: And declared to them in public and in private,

arabic: وتكون الجبال كالعهن
english: And the mountains will be like wool,
tafsir: And I told them: 'Ask your Lord to forgive you. He is verily forgiving.

arabic: ولا يسأل حميم حميما
english: And no friend will ask after a friend,
tafsir: He will send you abundant rain from the sky,

arabic: يبصرونهم ۚ يود المجرم لو يفتدي من عذاب يومئذ ببنيه
english: Though they will be put in sight of each other,- the sinner's desire will be: Would that he could redeem himself from the Penalty of that Day by (sacrificing) his children,
tafsir: And will give you increase of wealth and sons, and give you gardens and springs of water.

arabic: وصاحبته وأخيه
english: His wife and his brother,
tafsir: What has come upon you that you do not fear the majesty of God,

arabic: وفصيلته التي تؤويه
english: His kindred who sheltered him,
tafsir: Knowing that He has created you by various stages?

arabic: ومن في الأرض جميعا ثم ينجيه
english: And all, all that is on earth,- so it could deliver him:
tafsir: Do you not see how God has fashioned seven skies one above the other,

arabic: كلا ۖ إنها لظى
english: By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-
tafsir: And has placed the moon therein, an illumination, and has placed the sun, a lighted lamp?

arabic: نزاعة للشوى
english: Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-
tafsir: God produced you from the earth like a vegetable growth;

arabic: تدعو من أدبر وتولى
english: Inviting (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the Right).
tafsir: He will then return you back to it, and bring you out again.

arabic: وجمع فأوعى
english: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use)!
tafsir: God has made the earth for you a spreading,

arabic: إن الإنسان خلق هلوعا
english: Truly man was created very impatient;-
tafsir: So that you may walk upon its spacious paths.'

arabic: إذا مسه الشر جزوعا
english: Fretful when evil touches him;
tafsir: But they did not listen to me," Noah said, "and followed him whose wealth and children only added to his ruin.

arabic: وإذا مسه الخير منوعا
english: And niggardly when good reaches him;-
tafsir: And they contrived a plot of great magnitude,

arabic: إلا المصلين
english: Not so those devoted to Prayer;-
tafsir: And said: 'Do not abandon your gods, and do not abandon Wadda or Suwa', or Yaghuth, Ya'uq or Nasr.'

arabic: الذين هم على صلاتهم دائمون
english: Those who remain steadfast to their prayer;
tafsir: And they misled many. So do not give the evil-doers increase but in error.

arabic: والذين في أموالهم حق معلوم
english: And those in whose wealth is a recognised right.
tafsir: They were drowned because of their habitual sinfulness, and sent to Hell, and did not find any helper other than God.

arabic: للسائل والمحروم
english: For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);
tafsir: Noah said: "O Lord, do not leave a single habitation of unbelievers on the earth.

arabic: والذين يصدقون بيوم الدين
english: And those who hold to the truth of the Day of Judgment;
tafsir: If you leave them, they will lead Your creatures astray, and beget but iniquitous and ungrateful offspring.

arabic: والذين هم من عذاب ربهم مشفقون

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم إنا أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه أن أنذر قومك من قبل أن يأتيهم عذاب أليم
english: We sent Noah to his People (with the Command): "Do thou warn thy People before there comes to them a grievous Penalty."
tafsir: Which guides to the right path; and we have come to believe in it, and will not associate any one with our Lord.

arabic: قال يا قوم إني لكم نذير مبين
english: He said: "O my People! I am to you a Warner, clear and open:
tafsir: Exalted is the glory of our Lord; He has neither wife nor son.

arabic: أن اعبدوا الله واتقوه وأطيعون
english: "That ye should worship Allah, fear Him and obey me:
tafsir: Certainly the foolish among us say preposterous things of God.

arabic: يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويؤخركم إلى أجل مسمى ۚ إن أجل الله إذا جاء لا يؤخر ۖ لو كنتم تعلمون
english: "So He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a stated Term: for when the Term given by Allah is accomplished, it cannot be put forward: if ye only knew."
tafsir: We had in fact thought that men and jinns would never speak a lie about God,

arabic: قال رب إني دعوت قومي ليلا ونهارا
english: He said: "O my Lord! I have called to my People night and day:
tafsir: But some men used to seek refuge with some jinns, and this increased their waywardness;

arabic: فلم يزدهم دعائي إلا فرارا
english: "But my call only increases (their) flight (from the Right).
tafsir: So they began to think, even as you do, that God would not resurrect any one.

arabic: وإني كلما دعوتهم لتغفر لهم جعلوا أصابعهم في آذانهم واستغشوا ثيابهم وأصروا واستكبروا استكبارا
english: "And every time I have called to them, that Thou mightest forgive them, they have (only) thrust their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, grown obstinate, and given themselves up to arrogance.
tafsir: We sought to pry into the secrets of the heavens, but found it full of fierce guards and shooting flames.

arabic: ثم إني دعوتهم جهارا
english: "So I have called to them aloud;
tafsir: We sat in observatories to listen; but any one who listened found a shooting star in wait for him.

arabic: ثم إني أعلنت لهم وأسررت لهم إسرارا
english: "Further I have spoken to them in public and secretly in private,
tafsir: We do not know if this means ill for the dwellers of the earth, or their Lord wishes guidance for them.

arabic: فقلت استغفروا ربكم إنه كان غفارا
english: "Saying, 'Ask forgiveness from your Lord; for He is Oft-Forgiving;
tafsir: For some of us are upright and some otherwise: Surely we follow different ways.

arabic: يرسل السماء عليكم مدرارا
english: "'He will send rain to you in abundance;
tafsir: We realised that we could not weaken the power of God on earth, nor outpace Him by running away.

arabic: ويمددكم بأموال وبنين ويجعل لكم جنات ويجعل لكم أنهارا
english: "'Give you increase in wealth and sons; and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers (of flowing water).
tafsir: So when we heard the guidance we believed in it; and he who believes in his Lord will neither fear loss nor force.

arabic: ما لكم لا ترجون لله وقارا
english: "'What is the matter with you, that ye place not your hope for kindness and long-suffering in Allah,-
tafsir: Some of us have come to submission, and some of us are iniquitous.'" Those who have submitted have taken the right course;

arabic: وقد خلقكم أطوارا
english: "'Seeing that it is He that has created you in diverse stages?
tafsir: But those who are iniquitous will be fuel for Hell.

arabic: ألم تروا كيف خلق الله سبع سماوات طباقا
english: "'See ye not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another,
tafsir: (Say): "If they keep to the right path We shall give them water in abundance to drink

arabic: وجعل القمر فيهن نورا وجعل الشمس سراجا
english: "'And made the moon a light in their midst, and made the sun as a (Glorious) Lamp?
tafsir: In order to try them through it. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, will be given increasing torment by Him."

arabic: والله أنبتكم من الأرض نباتا
english: "'And Allah has produced you from the earth growing (gradually),
tafsir: All places of worship are for God; so do not invoke any one with God.

arabic: ثم يعيدكم فيها ويخرجكم إخراجا
english: "'And in the End He will return you into the (earth), and raise you forth (again at the Resurrection)?
tafsir: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).

arabic: والله جعل لكم الأرض بساطا
english: "'And Allah has made the earth for you as a carpet (spread out),
tafsir: Say: "I call on my Lord alone and I do not associate any one with Him."

arabic: لتسلكوا منها سبلا فجاجا
english: "'That ye may go about therein, in spacious roads.'"
tafsir: Say: "Neither is your loss within my power nor bringing you to guidance."

arabic: قال نوح رب إنهم عصوني واتبعوا من لم يزده ماله وولده إلا خسارا
english: Noah said: "O my Lord! They have disobeyed me, but they follow (men) whose wealth and children give them no increase but only Loss.
tafsir: Say: "No one can save me from God, nor can I find a place of refuge apart from Him,

arabic: ومكروا مكرا كبارا
english: "And they have devised a tremendous Plot.
tafsir: Unless I convey from God and deliver His message." For those who disobey God and His Apostle is the fire of Hell, where they will abide for ever;

arabic: وقالوا لا تذرن آلهتكم ولا تذرن ودا ولا سواعا ولا يغوث ويعوق ونسرا
english: "And they have said (to each other), 'Abandon not your gods: Abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa', neither Yaguth nor Ya'uq, nor Nasr';-
tafsir: Until they see what they are promised, when they will understand who is weaker in aid and poorer in numbers.

arabic: وقد أضلوا كثيرا ۖ ولا تزد الظالمين إلا ضلالا
english: "They have already misled many; and grant Thou no increase to the wrong-doers but in straying (from their mark)."
tafsir: Say: "I do not know if what is promised you is near, or if my Lord prolongs its term.

arabic: مما خطيئاتهم أغرقوا فأدخلوا نارا فلم يجدوا لهم من دون الله أنصارا
english: Because of their sins they were drowned (in the flood), and were made to enter the Fire (of Punishment): and they found- in lieu of Allah- none to help them.
tafsir: He is the knower of the Unknown, and He does not divulge His secret to any one

arabic: وقال نوح رب لا تذر على الأرض من الكافرين ديارا
english: And Noah, said: "O my Lord! Leave not of the Unbelievers, a single one on earth!
tafsir: Other than an apostle He has chosen, when He makes a sentinel walk in front of him and a sentinel behind,

arabic: إنك إن تذرهم يضلوا عبادك ولا يلدوا إلا فاجرا كفارا
english: "For, if Thou dost leave (any of) them, they will but mislead Thy devotees, and they will breed none but wicked ungrateful ones.
tafsir: So that He may know if they have delivered their Lord's messages. He comprehends all that has been given them, and keeps count of everything.

arabic: رب اغفر لي ولوالدي ولمن دخل بيتي مؤمنا وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات ولا تزد الظالمين إلا تبارا
english: "O my Lord! Forgive me, my parents, all who enter my house in Faith, and (all) believing men and believing women: and to the wrong-doers grant Thou no increase but in perdition!"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم قل أوحي إلي أنه استمع نفر من الجن فقالوا إنا سمعنا قرآنا عجبا
english: Say: It has been revealed to me that a company of Jinns listened (to the Qur'an). They said, 'We have really heard a wonderful Recital!
tafsir: Keep watch all the night except some,

arabic: يهدي إلى الرشد فآمنا به ۖ ولن نشرك بربنا أحدا
english: 'It gives guidance to the Right, and we have believed therein: we shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord.
tafsir: A half of it or a little less

arabic: وأنه تعالى جد ربنا ما اتخذ صاحبة ولا ولدا
english: 'And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
tafsir: Or a little more, and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.

arabic: وأنه كان يقول سفيهنا على الله شططا
english: 'There were some foolish ones among us, who used to utter extravagant lies against Allah;
tafsir: We shall soon entrust to you a message heavy (with solemnity).

arabic: وأنا ظننا أن لن تقول الإنس والجن على الله كذبا
english: 'But we do think that no man or spirit should say aught that untrue against Allah.
tafsir: Surely in the watches of the night the soul is most receptive and words more telling.

arabic: وأنه كان رجال من الإنس يعوذون برجال من الجن فزادوهم رهقا
english: 'True, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns, but they increased them in folly.
tafsir: Indeed during the day you have a long schedule of occupations.

arabic: وأنهم ظنوا كما ظننتم أن لن يبعث الله أحدا
english: 'And they (came to) think as ye thought, that Allah would not raise up any one (to Judgment).
tafsir: But recite the name of your Lord withdrawing yourself from everything, devoting yourself exclusively to Him.

arabic: وأنا لمسنا السماء فوجدناها ملئت حرسا شديدا وشهبا
english: 'And we pried into the secrets of heaven; but we found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.
tafsir: He is the Lord of the East and the West. There is no god but He. So take Him alone as your protector.

arabic: وأنا كنا نقعد منها مقاعد للسمع ۖ فمن يستمع الآن يجد له شهابا رصدا
english: 'We used, indeed, to sit there in (hidden) stations, to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.
tafsir: Bear with patience what they say, and gracefully come away from them.

arabic: وأنا لا ندري أشر أريد بمن في الأرض أم أراد بهم ربهم رشدا
english: 'And we understand not whether ill is intended to those on earth, or whether their Lord (really) intends to guide them to right conduct.
tafsir: Leave those to Me who deny, the lovers of ease and comfort; and bear with them for a while.

arabic: وأنا منا الصالحون ومنا دون ذلك ۖ كنا طرائق قددا
english: 'There are among us some that are righteous, and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.
tafsir: Verily We shall have fetters with Us, and a roaring furnace,

arabic: وأنا ظننا أن لن نعجز الله في الأرض ولن نعجزه هربا
english: 'But we think that we can by no means frustrate Allah throughout the earth, nor can we frustrate Him by flight.
tafsir: And food that will stick in the throat, and painful torment

arabic: وأنا لما سمعنا الهدى آمنا به ۖ فمن يؤمن بربه فلا يخاف بخسا ولا رهقا
english: 'And as for us, since we have listened to the Guidance, we have accepted it: and any who believes in his Lord has no fear, either of a short (account) or of any injustice.
tafsir: On the day the earth and mountains will rock violently, and the mountains turn to a heap of poured-out sand.

arabic: وأنا منا المسلمون ومنا القاسطون ۖ فمن أسلم فأولئك تحروا رشدا
english: 'Amongst us are some that submit their wills (to Allah), and some that swerve from justice. Now those who submit their wills - they have sought out (the path) of right conduct:
tafsir: We have sent an Apostle to you as a witness against you, as We had sent an apostle to the Pharaoh.

arabic: وأما القاسطون فكانوا لجهنم حطبا
english: 'But those who swerve,- they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire'-
tafsir: But the Pharaoh disobeyed the apostle; so We seized him with a grievous punishment.

arabic: وأن لو استقاموا على الطريقة لأسقيناهم ماء غدقا
english: (And Allah's Message is): "If they (the Pagans) had (only) remained on the (right) Way, We should certainly have bestowed on them Rain in abundance.
tafsir: How then, if you disbelieve, will you preserve yourselves on the day which will even turn the children hoary?

arabic: لنفتنهم فيه ۚ ومن يعرض عن ذكر ربه يسلكه عذابا صعدا
english: "That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.
tafsir: The heavens itself will be rent asunder (on that day). His promise is bound to be fulfilled.

arabic: وأن المساجد لله فلا تدعوا مع الله أحدا
english: "And the places of worship are for Allah (alone): So invoke not any one along with Allah;
tafsir: Verily this is a reminder. So let him who desires take the way to his Lord.

arabic: وأنه لما قام عبد الله يدعوه كادوا يكونون عليه لبدا
english: "Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him, they just make round him a dense crowd."
tafsir: Your Lord surely knows that you are occupied with your devotions for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or one-third of it, as do many others with you. Yet God prescribes the measure of night and day. He knows you cannot calculate it, and so turns to you in benevolence. So recite as much of the Qur'an as you can easily. He knows some among you will be sick, and some will be travelling over the earth in search of the bounty of God, and some fighting in the way of God. So read as much from it as you can easily, and be firm in devotion, pay the zakat, and lend a goodly loan to God. And what you send for yourself of the good, you will find it with God better and greater in reward. So ask for God's forgiveness. Indeed God is forgiving and kind.

arabic: قل إنما أدعو ربي ولا أشرك به أحدا
english: Say: "I do no more than invoke my Lord, and I join not with Him any (false god)."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل إني لا أملك لكم ضرا ولا رشدا
english: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, or to bring you to right conduct."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قل إني لن يجيرني من الله أحد ولن أجد من دونه ملتحدا
english: Say: "No one can deliver me from Allah (If I were to disobey Him), nor should I find refuge except in Him,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إلا بلاغا من الله ورسالاته ۚ ومن يعص الله ورسوله فإن له نار جهنم خالدين فيها أبدا

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

english: "That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم يا أيها المزمل
english: O thou folded in garments!
tafsir: Arise and warn,

arabic: قم الليل إلا قليلا
english: Stand (to prayer) by night, but not all night,-
tafsir: Glorify your Lord,

arabic: نصفه أو انقص منه قليلا
english: Half of it,- or a little less,
tafsir: Purify your inner self,

arabic: أو زد عليه ورتل القرآن ترتيلا
english: Or a little more; and recite the Qur'an in slow, measured rhythmic tones.
tafsir: And banish all trepidation.

arabic: إنا سنلقي عليك قولا ثقيلا
english: Soon shall We send down to thee a weighty Message.
tafsir: Do not bestow favours in expectation of return,

arabic: إن ناشئة الليل هي أشد وطئا وأقوم قيلا
english: Truly the rising by night is most potent for governing (the soul), and most suitable for (framing) the Word (of Prayer and Praise).
tafsir: And persevere in the way of your Lord.

arabic: إن لك في النهار سبحا طويلا
english: True, there is for thee by day prolonged occupation with ordinary duties:
tafsir: For when the trumpet blows

arabic: واذكر اسم ربك وتبتل إليه تبتيلا
english: But keep in remembrance the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to Him whole-heartedly.
tafsir: It will be a day of distress,

arabic: رب المشرق والمغرب لا إله إلا هو فاتخذه وكيلا
english: (He is) Lord of the East and the West: there is no god but He: take Him therefore for (thy) Disposer of Affairs.
tafsir: Dolorous for the unbelievers.

arabic: واصبر على ما يقولون واهجرهم هجرا جميلا
english: And have patience with what they say, and leave them with noble (dignity).
tafsir: Leave him to Me whom I created alone,

arabic: وذرني والمكذبين أولي النعمة ومهلهم قليلا
english: And leave Me (alone to deal with) those in possession of the good things of life, who (yet) deny the Truth; and bear with them for a little while.
tafsir: And gave him abundant wealth

arabic: إن لدينا أنكالا وجحيما
english: With Us are Fetters (to bind them), and a Fire (to burn them),
tafsir: And sons always present by his side,

arabic: وطعاما ذا غصة وعذابا أليما
english: And a Food that chokes, and a Penalty Grievous.
tafsir: And made things easy for them.

arabic: يوم ترجف الأرض والجبال وكانت الجبال كثيبا مهيلا
english: One Day the earth and the mountains will be in violent commotion. And the mountains will be as a heap of sand poured out and flowing down.
tafsir: Yet he wants that I should give him more.

arabic: إنا أرسلنا إليكم رسولا شاهدا عليكم كما أرسلنا إلى فرعون رسولا
english: We have sent to you, (O men!) a messenger, to be a witness concerning you, even as We sent a messenger to Pharaoh.
tafsir: Never. He is refractory of Our signs.

arabic: فعصى فرعون الرسول فأخذناه أخذا وبيلا
english: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger; so We seized him with a heavy Punishment.
tafsir: I shall inflict on him hardship,

arabic: فكيف تتقون إن كفرتم يوما يجعل الولدان شيبا
english: Then how shall ye, if ye deny (Allah), guard yourselves against a Day that will make children hoary-headed?-
tafsir: For he had thought and calculated.

arabic: السماء منفطر به ۚ كان وعده مفعولا
english: Whereon the sky will be cleft asunder? His Promise needs must be accomplished.
tafsir: May he be accursed, how he planned!

arabic: إن هذه تذكرة ۖ فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا
english: Verily this is an Admonition: therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) path to his Lord!
tafsir: May be then be accursed, how he plotted!

arabic: إن ربك يعلم أنك تقوم أدنى من ثلثي الليل ونصفه وثلثه وطائفة من الذين معك ۚ والله يقدر الليل والنهار ۚ علم أن لن تحصوه فتاب عليكم ۖ فاقرءوا ما تيسر من القرآن ۚ علم أن سيكون منكم مرضى ۙ وآخرون يضربون في الأرض يبتغون من فضل الله ۙ وآخرون يقاتلون في سبيل الله ۖ فاقرءوا ما تيسر منه ۚ وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا ۚ وما تقدموا لأنفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله هو خيرا وأعظم أجرا ۚ واستغفروا الله ۖ إن الله غفور رحيم
english: Thy Lord doth know that thou standest forth (to prayer) nigh two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so doth a party of those with thee. But Allah doth appoint night and day in due measure He knoweth that ye are unable to keep count thereof. So He hath turned to you (in mercy): read ye, therefore, of the Qur'an as much as may be easy for you. He knoweth that there may be (some) among you in ill-health; others travelling through the land, seeking of Allah's bounty; yet others fighting in Allah's Cause, read ye, therefore, as much of the Qur'an as may be easy (for you); and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan. And whatever good ye send forth for your souls ye shall find it in Allah's Presence,- yea, better and greater, in Reward and seek ye the Grace of Allah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
tafsir: Then he looked around,

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم يا أيها المدثر
english: O thou wrapped up (in the mantle)!
tafsir: And I call the reprehensive soul to witness:

arabic: قم فأنذر
english: Arise and deliver thy warning!
tafsir: Does man think We shall not put his bones together?

arabic: وربك فكبر
english: And thy Lord do thou magnify!
tafsir: Surely We are able to reform even his finger-tips.

arabic: وثيابك فطهر
english: And thy garments keep free from stain!
tafsir: Yet man is sceptical of what is right before him.

arabic: والرجز فاهجر
english: And all abomination shun!
tafsir: He asks: "When will the Day of Resurrection be?"

arabic: ولا تمنن تستكثر
english: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!
tafsir: Yet when the eyes are dazzled,

arabic: ولربك فاصبر
english: But, for thy Lord's (Cause), be patient and constant!
tafsir: The moon eclipsed,

arabic: فإذا نقر في الناقور
english: Finally, when the Trumpet is sounded,
tafsir: And the sun and moon are conjoined,

arabic: فذلك يومئذ يوم عسير
english: That will be- that Day - a Day of Distress,-
tafsir: That day man will say: "Where can I find escape?"

arabic: على الكافرين غير يسير
english: Far from easy for those without Faith.
tafsir: Never so, for there will be no escape.

arabic: ذرني ومن خلقت وحيدا
english: Leave Me alone, (to deal) with the (creature) whom I created (bare and) alone!-
tafsir: With your Lord alone will be the retreat on that day.

arabic: وجعلت له مالا ممدودا
english: To whom I granted resources in abundance,
tafsir: Then man will be told what he had sent ahead (of good) and what he had left behind.

arabic: وبنين شهودا
english: And sons to be by his side!-
tafsir: In fact man is a witness against himself,

arabic: ومهدت له تمهيدا
english: To whom I made (life) smooth and comfortable!
tafsir: Whatever the excuses he may offer.

arabic: ثم يطمع أن أزيد
english: Yet is he greedy-that I should add (yet more);-
tafsir: Do not forestall (the revelation before its completion) by acting in haste.

arabic: كلا ۖ إنه كان لآياتنا عنيدا
english: By no means! For to Our Signs he has been refractory!
tafsir: Surely its collection and recitation are Our responsibility.

arabic: سأرهقه صعودا
english: Soon will I visit him with a mount of calamities!
tafsir: So, as We recite it, follow its reading.

arabic: إنه فكر وقدر
english: For he thought and he plotted;-
tafsir: The exposition of its meaning surely rests on Us.

arabic: فقتل كيف قدر
english: And woe to him! How he plotted!-
tafsir: But no. You love this transient life,

arabic: ثم قتل كيف قدر
english: Yea, Woe to him; How he plotted!-
tafsir: And neglect the Hereafter.

arabic: ثم نظر
english: Then he looked round;
tafsir: How many faces will be refulgent on that Day,

arabic: ثم عبس وبسر
english: Then he frowned and he scowled;
tafsir: Waiting for their Lord.

arabic: ثم أدبر واستكبر
english: Then he turned back and was haughty;
tafsir: And how many faces on that Day will be woe-begone

arabic: فقال إن هذا إلا سحر يؤثر
english: Then said he: "This is nothing but magic, derived from of old;
tafsir: Fearing that a great disaster is going to befall them.

arabic: إن هذا إلا قول البشر
english: "This is nothing but the word of a mortal!"
tafsir: Never so, for when life withdraws into the clavicula,

arabic: سأصليه سقر
english: Soon will I cast him into Hell-Fire!
tafsir: And it is asked: "Is there any reciter of charms and amulets?"

arabic: وما أدراك ما سقر
english: And what will explain to thee what Hell-Fire is?
tafsir: He will then realise it is the parting,

arabic: لا تبقي ولا تذر
english: Naught doth it permit to endure, and naught doth it leave alone!-
tafsir: And anguish will be heaped upon anguish:

arabic: لواحة للبشر
english: Darkening and changing the colour of man!
tafsir: To your Lord then will be the driving.

arabic: عليها تسعة عشر
english: Over it are Nineteen.
tafsir: For he neither believed nor prayed,

arabic: وما جعلنا أصحاب النار إلا ملائكة ۙ وما جعلنا عدتهم إلا فتنة للذين كفروا ليستيقن الذين أوتوا الكتاب ويزداد الذين آمنوا إيمانا ۙ ولا يرتاب الذين أوتوا الكتاب والمؤمنون ۙ وليقول الذين في قلوبهم مرض والكافرون ماذا أراد الله بهذا مثلا ۚ كذلك يضل الله من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء ۚ وما يعلم جنود ربك إلا هو ۚ وما هي إلا ذكرى للبشر
english: And We have set none but angels as Guardians of the Fire; and We have fixed their number only as a trial for Unbelievers,- in order that the People of the Book may arrive at certainty, and the Believers may increase in Faith,- and that no doubts may be left for the People of the Book and the Believers, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and the Unbelievers may say, "What symbol doth Allah intend by this?" Thus doth Allah leave to stray whom He pleaseth, and guide whom He pleaseth: and none can know the forces of thy Lord, except He and this is no other than a warning to mankind.
tafsir: But only disavowed and turned away;

arabic: كلا والقمر
english: Nay, verily: By the Moon,
tafsir: Then he strutted back to his people.

arabic: والليل إذ أدبر
english: And by the Night as it retreateth,
tafsir: Alas the woe for you, alas!

arabic: والصبح إذا أسفر
english: And by the Dawn as it shineth forth,-
tafsir: Alas, the woe for you!

arabic: إنها لإحدى الكبر
english: This is but one of the mighty (portents),
tafsir: Does man think that he will be left alone to himself, free?

arabic: نذيرا للبشر
english: A warning to mankind,-
tafsir: Was he not an emitted drop of semen,

arabic: لمن شاء منكم أن يتقدم أو يتأخر
english: To any of you that chooses to press forward, or to follow behind;-
tafsir: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned

arabic: كل نفس بما كسبت رهينة
english: Every soul will be (held) in pledge for its deeds.
tafsir: And assigned it sexes, male and female.

arabic: إلا أصحاب اليمين
english: Except the Companions of the Right Hand.
tafsir: Cannot such as He bring the dead to life?

arabic: في جنات يتساءلون
english: (They will be) in Gardens (of Delight): they will question each other,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: عن المجرمين
english: And (ask) of the Sinners:
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ما سلككم في سقر
english: "What led you into Hell Fire?"
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: قالوا لم نك من المصلين
english: They will say: "We were not of those who prayed;
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولم نك نطعم المسكين
english: "Nor were we of those who fed the indigent;
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وكنا نخوض مع الخائضين
english: "But we used to talk vanities with vain talkers;
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وكنا نكذب بيوم الدين
english: "And we used to deny the Day of Judgment,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: حتى أتانا اليقين
english: "Until there came to us (the Hour) that is certain."
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فما تنفعهم شفاعة الشافعين
english: Then will no intercession of (any) intercessors profit them.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فما لهم عن التذكرة معرضين
english: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from admonition?-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كأنهم حمر مستنفرة
english: As if they were affrighted asses,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فرت من قسورة
english: Fleeing from a lion!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بل يريد كل امرئ منهم أن يؤتى صحفا منشرة
english: Forsooth, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of revelation) spread out!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كلا ۖ بل لا يخافون الآخرة
english: By no means! But they fear not the Hereafter,
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كلا إنه تذكرة
english: Nay, this surely is an admonition:
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فمن شاء ذكره
english: Let any who will, keep it in remembrance!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وما يذكرون إلا أن يشاء الله ۚ هو أهل التقوى وأهل المغفرة
english: But none will keep it in remembrance except as Allah wills: He is the Lord of Righteousness, and the Lord of Forgiveness.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم لا أقسم بيوم القيامة
english: I do call to witness the Resurrection Day;
tafsir: Verily We created man from a sperm yoked (to the ovum) to bring out his real substance, then gave him hearing and sight.

arabic: ولا أقسم بالنفس اللوامة
english: And I do call to witness the self-reproaching spirit: (Eschew Evil).
tafsir: We surely showed him the way that he may either be grateful or deny.

arabic: أيحسب الإنسان ألن نجمع عظامه
english: Does man think that We cannot assemble his bones?
tafsir: We have prepared for unbelievers chains and collars and a blazing fire.

arabic: بلى قادرين على أن نسوي بنانه
english: Nay, We are able to put together in perfect order the very tips of his fingers.
tafsir: Surely the devotees will drink cups flavoured with palm blossoms

arabic: بل يريد الإنسان ليفجر أمامه
english: But man wishes to do wrong (even) in the time in front of him.
tafsir: From a spring of which the votaries of God will drink and make it flow in abundance.

arabic: يسأل أيان يوم القيامة
english: He questions: "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
tafsir: Those who fulfil their vows and fear the Day whose evil shall be diffused far and wide,

arabic: فإذا برق البصر
english: At length, when the sight is dazed,
tafsir: And feed the needy for the love of Him, and the orphans and the captives,

arabic: وخسف القمر
english: And the moon is buried in darkness.
tafsir: (Saying): "We feed you for the sake of God, desiring neither recompense nor thanks.

arabic: وجمع الشمس والقمر
english: And the sun and moon are joined together,-
tafsir: We fear the dismal day calamitous from our Lord."

arabic: يقول الإنسان يومئذ أين المفر
english: That Day will Man say: "Where is the refuge?"
tafsir: So God will protect them from the evil of that day, and grant them happiness and joy,

arabic: كلا لا وزر
english: By no means! No place of safety!
tafsir: And reward them for their perseverence Paradise and silken robes,

arabic: إلى ربك يومئذ المستقر
english: Before thy Lord (alone), that Day will be the place of rest.
tafsir: Where they will recline on couches feeling neither heat of the sun nor intense cold.

arabic: ينبأ الإنسان يومئذ بما قدم وأخر
english: That Day will Man be told (all) that he put forward, and all that he put back.
tafsir: The shadows will bend over them, and low will hang the clusters of grapes.

arabic: بل الإنسان على نفسه بصيرة
english: Nay, man will be evidence against himself,
tafsir: Passed round will be silver flagons and goblets made of glass,

arabic: ولو ألقى معاذيره
english: Even though he were to put up his excuses.
tafsir: And crystal clear bottles of silver, of which they will determine the measure themselves.

arabic: لا تحرك به لسانك لتعجل به
english: Move not thy tongue concerning the (Qur'an) to make haste therewith.
tafsir: There will they drink a cup flavoured with ginger

arabic: إن علينا جمعه وقرآنه
english: It is for Us to collect it and to promulgate it:
tafsir: From a spring by the name of Ever-flowing-Salsabil.

arabic: فإذا قرأناه فاتبع قرآنه
english: But when We have promulgated it, follow thou its recital (as promulgated):
tafsir: And boys of everlasting youth will go about attending them. Looking at them you would think that they were pearls dispersed.

arabic: ثم إن علينا بيانه
english: Nay more, it is for Us to explain it (and make it clear):
tafsir: When you look around, you will see delights and great dominion.

arabic: كلا بل تحبون العاجلة
english: Nay, (ye men!) but ye love the fleeting life,
tafsir: On their bodies will be garments of the finest green silk and brocade, and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give them a purest draught to drink.

arabic: وتذرون الآخرة
english: And leave alone the Hereafter.
tafsir: "This in truth is your recompense, and acceptance of your endeavours."

arabic: وجوه يومئذ ناضرة
english: Some faces, that Day, will beam (in brightness and beauty);-
tafsir: We have revealed the Qur'an to you gradually;

arabic: إلى ربها ناظرة
english: Looking towards their Lord;
tafsir: So wait for your Lord's command, and do not follow any sinner or disbeliever among them.

arabic: ووجوه يومئذ باسرة
english: And some faces, that Day, will be sad and dismal,
tafsir: Meditate upon the name of your Lord morning and evening;

arabic: تظن أن يفعل بها فاقرة
english: In the thought that some back-breaking calamity was about to be inflicted on them;
tafsir: And bow in homage part of the night, and glorify Him far into the night.

arabic: كلا إذا بلغت التراقي
english: Yea, when (the soul) reaches to the collar-bone (in its exit),
tafsir: Surely men love what hastes away and forget the grievous day (ahead).

arabic: وقيل من ۜ راق
english: And there will be a cry, "Who is a magician (to restore him)?"
tafsir: We created them and fixed their bones and joints; and We could replace them when We like with others like them.

arabic: وظن أنه الفراق
english: And he will conclude that it was (the Time) of Parting;
tafsir: This surely is a reminder: Therefore whosoever desires may take the way to his Lord.

arabic: والتفت الساق بالساق
english: And one leg will be joined with another:
tafsir: But you will not desire except as God wills. Verily He is all-knowing and all-wise.

arabic: إلى ربك يومئذ المساق
english: That Day the Drive will be (all) to thy Lord!
tafsir: He admits whosoever He will to His benevolence. But for the evil-doers He has prepared a painful punishment.

arabic: فلا صدق ولا صلى
english: So he gave nothing in charity, nor did he pray!-
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ولكن كذب وتولى
english: But on the contrary, he rejected Truth and turned away!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ثم ذهب إلى أهله يتمطى
english: Then did he stalk to his family in full conceit!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أولى لك فأولى
english: Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ثم أولى لك فأولى
english: Again, Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أيحسب الإنسان أن يترك سدى
english: Does man think that he will be left uncontrolled, (without purpose)?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ألم يك نطفة من مني يمنى
english: Was he not a drop of sperm emitted (in lowly form)?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى
english: Then did he become a leech-like clot; then did (Allah) make and fashion (him) in due proportion.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والأنثى
english: And of him He made two sexes, male and female.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: أليس ذلك بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى
english: Has not He, (the same), the power to give life to the dead?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم هل أتى على الإنسان حين من الدهر لم يكن شيئا مذكورا
english: Has there not been over Man a long period of Time, when he was nothing - (not even) mentioned?
tafsir: And those that strike violently,

arabic: إنا خلقنا الإنسان من نطفة أمشاج نبتليه فجعلناه سميعا بصيرا
english: Verily We created Man from a drop of mingled sperm, in order to try him: So We gave him (the gifts), of Hearing and Sight.
tafsir: And those that revive by quickening,

arabic: إنا هديناه السبيل إما شاكرا وإما كفورا
english: We showed him the Way: whether he be grateful or ungrateful (rests on his will).
tafsir: And those that distinguish distinctly,

arabic: إنا أعتدنا للكافرين سلاسل وأغلالا وسعيرا
english: For the Rejecters we have prepared chains, yokes, and a blazing Fire.
tafsir: And those that bring down the Reminder

arabic: إن الأبرار يشربون من كأس كان مزاجها كافورا
english: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-
tafsir: To end all argument or to warn.

arabic: عينا يشرب بها عباد الله يفجرونها تفجيرا
english: A Fountain where the Devotees of Allah do drink, making it flow in unstinted abundance.
tafsir: What is promised will surely come to pass.

arabic: يوفون بالنذر ويخافون يوما كان شره مستطيرا
english: They perform (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil flies far and wide.
tafsir: When the stars are obliterated,

arabic: ويطعمون الطعام على حبه مسكينا ويتيما وأسيرا
english: And they feed, for the love of Allah, the indigent, the orphan, and the captive,-
tafsir: The heavens split asunder,

arabic: إنما نطعمكم لوجه الله لا نريد منكم جزاء ولا شكورا
english: (Saying),"We feed you for the sake of Allah alone: no reward do we desire from you, nor thanks.
tafsir: The mountains reduced to dust and blown away,

arabic: إنا نخاف من ربنا يوما عبوسا قمطريرا
english: "We only fear a Day of distressful Wrath from the side of our Lord."
tafsir: And when the time comes for raising the little girls (buried alive) --

arabic: فوقاهم الله شر ذلك اليوم ولقاهم نضرة وسرورا
english: But Allah will deliver them from the evil of that Day, and will shed over them a Light of Beauty and (blissful) Joy.
tafsir: For what day is that time fixed?

arabic: وجزاهم بما صبروا جنة وحريرا
english: And because they were patient and constant, He will reward them with a Garden and (garments of) silk.
tafsir: The Day of Judgement.

arabic: متكئين فيها على الأرائك ۖ لا يرون فيها شمسا ولا زمهريرا
english: Reclining in the (Garden) on raised thrones, they will see there neither the sun's (excessive heat) nor (the moon's) excessive cold.
tafsir: How will you comprehend what the Day of Judgement is?

arabic: ودانية عليهم ظلالها وذللت قطوفها تذليلا
english: And the shades of the (Garden) will come low over them, and the bunches (of fruit), there, will hang low in humility.
tafsir: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!

arabic: ويطاف عليهم بآنية من فضة وأكواب كانت قواريرا
english: And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,-
tafsir: Have We not destroyed the earlier generations?

arabic: قوارير من فضة قدروها تقديرا
english: Crystal-clear, made of silver: they will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).
tafsir: So shall We make the later ones to follow them.

arabic: ويسقون فيها كأسا كان مزاجها زنجبيلا
english: And they will be given to drink there of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Zanjabil,-
tafsir: That is what We shall do to those who are guilty of crime.

arabic: عينا فيها تسمى سلسبيلا
english: A fountain there, called Salsabil.
tafsir: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!

arabic: ويطوف عليهم ولدان مخلدون إذا رأيتهم حسبتهم لؤلؤا منثورا
english: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If thou seest them, thou wouldst think them scattered Pearls.
tafsir: Did We not create you from contemptible water?

arabic: وإذا رأيت ثم رأيت نعيما وملكا كبيرا
english: And when thou lookest, it is there thou wilt see a Bliss and a Realm Magnificent.
tafsir: Then We lodged you in a secure place (the womb)

arabic: عاليهم ثياب سندس خضر وإستبرق ۖ وحلوا أساور من فضة وسقاهم ربهم شرابا طهورا
english: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.
tafsir: For a certain appointed time,

arabic: إن هذا كان لكم جزاء وكان سعيكم مشكورا
english: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."
tafsir: Then We facilitated (your birth). How well do We calculate!

arabic: إنا نحن نزلنا عليك القرآن تنزيلا
english: It is We Who have sent down the Qur'an to thee by stages.
tafsir: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!

arabic: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تطع منهم آثما أو كفورا
english: Therefore be patient with constancy to the Command of thy Lord, and hearken not to the sinner or the ingrate among them.
tafsir: Have We not made the earth a repository

arabic: واذكر اسم ربك بكرة وأصيلا
english: And celebrate the name of thy Lord morning and evening,
tafsir: For the living and the dead,

arabic: ومن الليل فاسجد له وسبحه ليلا طويلا
english: And part of the night, prostrate thyself to Him; and glorify Him a long night through.
tafsir: And placed in it lofty and broad stablisers, and gave you sweet water to drink?

arabic: إن هؤلاء يحبون العاجلة ويذرون وراءهم يوما ثقيلا
english: As to these, they love the fleeting life, and put away behind them a Day (that will be) hard.
tafsir: Alas the woe that day for those who deny!

arabic: نحن خلقناهم وشددنا أسرهم ۖ وإذا شئنا بدلنا أمثالهم تبديلا
english: It is We Who created them, and We have made their joints strong; but, when We will, We can substitute the like of them by a complete change.
tafsir: "Go to what you used to deny;

arabic: إن هذه تذكرة ۖ فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا
english: This is an admonition: Whosoever will, let him take a (straight) Path to his Lord.
tafsir: Go to the shadow with three ramifications,

arabic: وما تشاءون إلا أن يشاء الله ۚ إن الله كان عليما حكيما
english: But ye will not, except as Allah wills; for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
tafsir: Neither shady nor protecting against the blazing Fire.

arabic: يدخل من يشاء في رحمته ۚ والظالمين أعد لهم عذابا أليما
english: He will admit to His Mercy whom He will; But the wrong-doers,- for them has He prepared a grievous Penalty.
tafsir: It will throw out sparks as logs of wood

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم والمرسلات عرفا
english: By the (Winds) sent forth one after another (to man's profit);
tafsir: (Is it) of the great announcement

arabic: فالعاصفات عصفا
english: Which then blow violently in tempestuous Gusts,
tafsir: About which they have been differing?

arabic: والناشرات نشرا
english: And scatter (things) far and wide;
tafsir: Indeed they will come to know soon;

arabic: فالفارقات فرقا
english: Then separate them, one from another,
tafsir: They will indeed come to know soon.

arabic: فالملقيات ذكرا
english: Then spread abroad a Message,
tafsir: Did We not make the earth a spreading,

arabic: عذرا أو نذرا
english: Whether of Justification or of Warning;-
tafsir: The mountains tent-pins?

arabic: إنما توعدون لواقع
english: Assuredly, what ye are promised must come to pass.
tafsir: We created you in pairs,

arabic: فإذا النجوم طمست
english: Then when the stars become dim;
tafsir: And made sleep for you to rest,

arabic: وإذا السماء فرجت
english: When the heaven is cleft asunder;
tafsir: The night a covering,

arabic: وإذا الجبال نسفت
english: When the mountains are scattered (to the winds) as dust;
tafsir: And the day for seeking livelihood.

arabic: وإذا الرسل أقتت
english: And when the messengers are (all) appointed a time (to collect);-
tafsir: We raised over you several secure (skies),

arabic: لأي يوم أجلت
english: For what Day are these (portents) deferred?
tafsir: And placed a lamp therein brightly burning.

arabic: ليوم الفصل
english: For the Day of Sorting out.
tafsir: And We sent down rain from water-laden clouds pouring in torrents

arabic: وما أدراك ما يوم الفصل
english: And what will explain to thee what is the Day of Sorting out?
tafsir: That We may produce from it grain and vegetation,

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: And orchards full of trees and interlacing boughs.

arabic: ألم نهلك الأولين
english: Did We not destroy the men of old (for their evil)?
tafsir: Surely a time is fixed for the Day of Judgement.

arabic: ثم نتبعهم الآخرين
english: So shall We make later (generations) follow them.
tafsir: The day the trumpet blast is sounded you will come in hordes;

arabic: كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين
english: Thus do We deal with men of sin.
tafsir: The heavens will be opened wide and turn into so many doors,

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: The mountains put in motion turning into a mirage.

arabic: ألم نخلقكم من ماء مهين
english: Have We not created you from a fluid (held) despicable?-
tafsir: Certainly Hell lies in wait,

arabic: فجعلناه في قرار مكين
english: The which We placed in a place of rest, firmly fixed,
tafsir: The rebels' abode,

arabic: إلى قدر معلوم
english: For a period (of gestation), determined (according to need)?
tafsir: Where they will remain for aeons,

arabic: فقدرنا فنعم القادرون
english: For We do determine (according to need); for We are the best to determine (things).
tafsir: Finding neither sleep nor any thing to drink

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day! to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: Except boiling water and benumbing cold:

arabic: ألم نجعل الأرض كفاتا
english: Have We not made the earth (as a place) to draw together.
tafsir: , A fitting reward.

arabic: أحياء وأمواتا
english: The living and the dead,
tafsir: They were those who did not expect a reckoning,

arabic: وجعلنا فيها رواسي شامخات وأسقيناكم ماء فراتا
english: And made therein mountains standing firm, lofty (in stature); and provided for you water sweet (and wholesome)?
tafsir: And rejected Our signs as lies.

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: We have kept account of everything in a book.

arabic: انطلقوا إلى ما كنتم به تكذبون
english: (It will be said:) "Depart ye to that which ye used to reject as false!
tafsir: So taste (the fruit of what you sowed), for We shall add nothing but torment,

arabic: انطلقوا إلى ظل ذي ثلاث شعب
english: "Depart ye to a Shadow (of smoke ascending) in three columns,
tafsir: As for those who preserve themselves from evil and follow the straight path, there is attainment for them:

arabic: لا ظليل ولا يغني من اللهب
english: "(Which yields) no shade of coolness, and is of no use against the fierce Blaze.
tafsir: Orchards and vineyards,

arabic: إنها ترمي بشرر كالقصر
english: "Indeed it throws about sparks (huge) as Forts,
tafsir: And graceful maidens of the same age,

arabic: كأنه جمالت صفر
english: "As if there were (a string of) yellow camels (marching swiftly)."
tafsir: And flasks full and flowing.

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: They will hear no blasphemies there or disavowals:

arabic: هذا يوم لا ينطقون
english: That will be a Day when they shall not be able to speak.
tafsir: A recompense from your Lord, a sufficient gift,

arabic: ولا يؤذن لهم فيعتذرون
english: Nor will it be open to them to put forth pleas.
tafsir: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, most benevolent, to whom none may dare address a word.

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: The day the Spirit takes its stand, with the angels ranged in rows. None will speak except who is permitted by Ar-Rahman and says what is right.

arabic: هذا يوم الفصل ۖ جمعناكم والأولين
english: That will be a Day of Sorting out! We shall gather you together and those before (you)!
tafsir: That day is certain. So whosoever likes may prepare a way to his Lord.

arabic: فإن كان لكم كيد فكيدون
english: Now, if ye have a trick (or plot), use it against Me!
tafsir: We have indeed warned you of a calamity near at hand, a day when man will see what he had sent (of his deeds) ahead, and the unbeliever will say: "Woe alas. Ah would that I were dust!"

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إن المتقين في ظلال وعيون
english: As to the Righteous, they shall be amidst (cool) shades and springs (of water).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وفواكه مما يشتهون
english: And (they shall have) fruits,- all they desire.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما كنتم تعملون
english: "Eat ye and drink ye to your heart's content: for that ye worked (Righteousness).
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين
english: Thus do We certainly reward the Doers of Good.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: كلوا وتمتعوا قليلا إنكم مجرمون
english: (O ye unjust!) Eat ye and enjoy yourselves (but) a little while, for that ye are Sinners.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: وإذا قيل لهم اركعوا لا يركعون
english: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate yourselves!" they do not so.
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين
english: Ah woe, that Day, to the Rejecters of Truth!
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: فبأي حديث بعده يؤمنون
english: Then what Message, after that, will they believe in?
tafsir: ❌ Tafsir not found

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم عم يتساءلون
english: Concerning what are they disputing?
tafsir: And those who undo the bonds gently,

arabic: عن النبإ العظيم
english: Concerning the Great News,
tafsir: And those who glide swimmingly,

arabic: الذي هم فيه مختلفون
english: About which they cannot agree.
tafsir: Then outpace the others swiftly

arabic: كلا سيعلمون
english: Verily, they shall soon (come to) know!
tafsir: And direct affairs by command,

arabic: ثم كلا سيعلمون
english: Verily, verily they shall soon (come to) know!
tafsir: The day the convulsive (first blast) shatters convulsively

arabic: ألم نجعل الأرض مهادا
english: Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse,
tafsir: Followed by the second blast,

arabic: والجبال أوتادا
english: And the mountains as pegs?
tafsir: Hearts will pound loudly on that day,

arabic: وخلقناكم أزواجا
english: And (have We not) created you in pairs,
tafsir: Eyes be lowered in submission.

arabic: وجعلنا نومكم سباتا
english: And made your sleep for rest,
tafsir: They say: "Shall we go back to our original state

arabic: وجعلنا الليل لباسا
english: And made the night as a covering,
tafsir: After having turned to carious bones?"

arabic: وجعلنا النهار معاشا
english: And made the day as a means of subsistence?
tafsir: They say: "Then this returning will be a dead loss."

arabic: وبنينا فوقكم سبعا شدادا
english: And (have We not) built over you the seven firmaments,
tafsir: It will only be a single blast,

arabic: وجعلنا سراجا وهاجا
english: And placed (therein) a Light of Splendour?
tafsir: And they will wake up suddenly.

arabic: وأنزلنا من المعصرات ماء ثجاجا
english: And do We not send down from the clouds water in abundance,
tafsir: Has the story of Moses come to you

arabic: لنخرج به حبا ونباتا
english: That We may produce therewith corn and vegetables,
tafsir: When his Lord called to him in Tuwa's holy vale?

arabic: وجنات ألفافا
english: And gardens of luxurious growth?
tafsir: "Go to the Pharaoh who has become refractory,

arabic: إن يوم الفصل كان ميقاتا
english: Verily the Day of Sorting out is a thing appointed,
tafsir: And say: 'Would you like to grow (in virtue)?

arabic: يوم ينفخ في الصور فتأتون أفواجا
english: The Day that the Trumpet shall be sounded, and ye shall come forth in crowds;
tafsir: Then I will guide you to your Lord that you may come to fear Him.'"

arabic: وفتحت السماء فكانت أبوابا
english: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors,
tafsir: So he showed him the greater sign;

arabic: وسيرت الجبال فكانت سرابا
english: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage.
tafsir: But (the Pharaoh) disavowed and disobeyed.

arabic: إن جهنم كانت مرصادا
english: Truly Hell is as a place of ambush,
tafsir: Then he turned away, deliberating,

arabic: للطاغين مآبا
english: For the transgressors a place of destination:
tafsir: And assembled (his council) and proclaimed,

arabic: لابثين فيها أحقابا
english: They will dwell therein for ages.
tafsir: Saying: "I am alone your lord, the highest of them all."

arabic: لا يذوقون فيها بردا ولا شرابا
english: Nothing cool shall they taste therein, nor any drink,
tafsir: So God seized him for the punishment of the Hereafter and this world.

arabic: إلا حميما وغساقا
english: Save a boiling fluid and a fluid, dark, murky, intensely cold,
tafsir: Truly there is a lesson in this for those who fear (the consequences).

arabic: جزاء وفاقا
english: A fitting recompense (for them).
tafsir: Are you more difficult to create or the heavens? He built it,

arabic: إنهم كانوا لا يرجون حسابا
english: For that they used not to fear any account (for their deeds),
tafsir: Raised it high, proportioned it,

arabic: وكذبوا بآياتنا كذابا
english: But they (impudently) treated Our Signs as false.
tafsir: Gave darkness to its night, and brightness to its day;

arabic: وكل شيء أحصيناه كتابا
english: And all things have We preserved on record.
tafsir: And afterwards spread out the earth.

arabic: فذوقوا فلن نزيدكم إلا عذابا
english: "So taste ye (the fruits of your deeds); for no increase shall We grant you, except in Punishment."
tafsir: He brought out its water and its pastures from it,

arabic: إن للمتقين مفازا
english: Verily for the Righteous there will be a fulfilment of (the heart's) desires;
tafsir: And stabilized the mountains

arabic: حدائق وأعنابا
english: Gardens enclosed, and grapevines;
tafsir: As convenience for you and your cattle.

arabic: وكواعب أترابا
english: And voluptuous women of equal age;
tafsir: When the great calamity comes,

arabic: وكأسا دهاقا
english: And a cup full (to the brim).
tafsir: The day when man remembers all that he had done,

arabic: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا كذابا
english: No vanity shall they hear therein, nor Untruth:-
tafsir: And Hell made visible to him who can see,

arabic: جزاء من ربك عطاء حسابا
english: Recompense from thy Lord, a gift, (amply) sufficient,
tafsir: Then he who had been rebellious

arabic: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما الرحمن ۖ لا يملكون منه خطابا
english: (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between, (Allah) Most Gracious: None shall have power to argue with Him.
tafsir: And who preferred the life of the world,

arabic: يوم يقوم الروح والملائكة صفا ۖ لا يتكلمون إلا من أذن له الرحمن وقال صوابا
english: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand forth in ranks, none shall speak except any who is permitted by (Allah) Most Gracious, and He will say what is right.
tafsir: Will surely have Hell for his abode.

arabic: ذلك اليوم الحق ۖ فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه مآبا
english: That Day will be the sure Reality: Therefore, whoso will, let him take a (straight) return to his Lord!
tafsir: But he who feared standing before his Lord, and restrained his self from vain desires,

arabic: إنا أنذرناكم عذابا قريبا يوم ينظر المرء ما قدمت يداه ويقول الكافر يا ليتني كنت ترابا
english: Verily, We have warned you of a Penalty near, the Day when man will see (the deeds) which his hands have sent forth, and the Unbeliever will say, "Woe unto me! Would that I were (metre) dust!"
tafsir: Will surely have Paradise for abode.

arabic: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم والنازعات غرقا
english: By the (angels) who tear out (the souls of the wicked) with violence;
tafsir: Because a blind man came to him.

arabic: والناشطات نشطا
english: By those who gently draw out (the souls of the blessed);
tafsir: What made you think that he will not grow in virtue,

arabic: والسابحات سبحا
english: And by those who glide along (on errands of mercy),
tafsir: Or be admonished, and the admonition profit him?

arabic: فالسابقات سبقا
english: Then press forward as in a race,
tafsir: As for him who is not in want of any thing,

arabic: فالمدبرات أمرا
english: Then arrange to do (the Commands of their Lord),
tafsir: You pay full attention,

arabic: يوم ترجف الراجفة
english: One Day everything that can be in commotion will be in violent commotion,
tafsir: Though it is not your concern if he should not grow (in fulness).

arabic: تتبعها الرادفة
english: Followed by oft-repeated (commotions):
tafsir: As for him who comes to you striving (after goodness),

arabic: قلوب يومئذ واجفة
english: Hearts that Day will be in agitation;
tafsir: And is also fearful (of God),

arabic: أبصارها خاشعة
english: Cast down will be (their owners') eyes.
tafsir: You neglect.

arabic: يقولون أإنا لمردودون في الحافرة
english: They say (now): "What! shall we indeed be returned to (our) former state?
tafsir: Assuredly this is a reminder

arabic: أإذا كنا عظاما نخرة
english: "What! - when we shall have become rotten bones?"
tafsir: For any one who desires to bear it in mind,

arabic: قالوا تلك إذا كرة خاسرة
english: They say: "It would, in that case, be a return with loss!"
tafsir: (Contained) in honoured pages,

arabic: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة
english: But verily, it will be but a single (Compelling) Cry,
tafsir: Exalted and holy,

arabic: فإذا هم بالساهرة
english: When, behold, they will be in the (full) awakening (to Judgment).
tafsir: In the hands of scribes

arabic: هل أتاك حديث موسى
english: Has the story of Moses reached thee?
tafsir: Noble and pious.

arabic: إذ ناداه ربه بالواد المقدس طوى
english: Behold, thy Lord did call to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:-
tafsir: Accursed is man. How ungrateful is he!

arabic: اذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى
english: "Go thou to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all bounds:
tafsir: Of what substance God created him?

arabic: فقل هل لك إلى أن تزكى
english: "And say to him, 'Wouldst thou that thou shouldst be purified (from sin)?-
tafsir: From a single sperm He created, then proportioned him,

arabic: وأهديك إلى ربك فتخشى
english: "'And that I guide thee to thy Lord, so thou shouldst fear Him?'"
tafsir: Then made his passage easy (at birth);

arabic: فأراه الآية الكبرى
english: Then did (Moses) show him the Great Sign.
tafsir: He will then send him to death and have him laid in the grave.

arabic: فكذب وعصى
english: But (Pharaoh) rejected it and disobeyed (guidance);
tafsir: Then He will raise him up again when He please.

arabic: ثم أدبر يسعى
english: Further, he turned his back, striving hard (against Allah).
tafsir: But no. He has not fulfilled what was enjoined on him.

arabic: فحشر فنادى
english: Then he collected (his men) and made a proclamation,
tafsir: Let man therefore consider (the sources of) his food.

arabic: فقال أنا ربكم الأعلى
english: Saying, "I am your Lord, Most High".
tafsir: We poured down rain abundantly,

arabic: فأخذه الله نكال الآخرة والأولى
english: But Allah did punish him, (and made an) example of him, - in the Hereafter, as in this life.
tafsir: Then We cracked the earth open under pressure (of germination)

arabic: إن في ذلك لعبرة لمن يخشى
english: Verily in this is an instructive warning for whosoever feareth (Allah).
tafsir: And We made corn grow,

arabic: أأنتم أشد خلقا أم السماء ۚ بناها
english: What! Are ye the more difficult to create or the heaven (above)? (Allah) hath constructed it:
tafsir: And grapes and herbage,

arabic: رفع سمكها فسواها
english: On high hath He raised its canopy, and He hath given it order and perfection.
tafsir: Olives and dates,

arabic: وأغطش ليلها وأخرج ضحاها
english: Its night doth He endow with darkness, and its splendour doth He bring out (with light).
tafsir: Orchards thick with trees,

arabic: والأرض بعد ذلك دحاها
english: And the earth, moreover, hath He extended (to a wide expanse);
tafsir: And fruits and fodder:

arabic: أخرج منها ماءها ومرعاها
english: He draweth out therefrom its moisture and its pasture;
tafsir: A provision for you and your cattle.

arabic: والجبال أرساها
english: And the mountains hath He firmly fixed;-
tafsir: But when the great calamity comes

arabic: متاعا لكم ولأنعامكم

arabic: فسوف يحاسب حسابا يسيرا

arabic: وينقلب إلى أهله مسرورا

arabic: وأما من أوتي كتابه وراء ظهره

arabic: فسوف يدعو ثبورا

arabic: بلى إن ربه كان به بصيرا

arabic: فلا أقسم بالشفق

arabic: قد أفلح من تزكى

arabic: وذكر اسم ربه فصلى

arabic: والآخرة خير وأبقى

arabic: إن هذا لفي الصحف الأولى

arabic: تصلى نارا حامية

arabic: لا يسمن ولا يغني من جوع

arabic: وجوه يومئذ ناعمة

tafsir: And with Thamud who carved rocks in the valley;

arabic: لسعيها راضية
